text: Food is delicious, price is kinda high for breakfast place but the service is excellent & the ambiance gives an uplifting mood.

One of my favorite breakfast spots the have pot of bread that you can get instead of toast get it ! So amazing it's like a cinnamon bun without the frosting soft melts in your mouth. My family enjoys the red velvet pancakes intense chocolate flavor almost don't even need syrup. The omelets are so fluffy and packed with flavor and the crispy hash browns will knock your socks off. I would recommend anyone to come here bring the family and a plus the service is wonderful Amanda I believe is her name pretty girl with green eyes very attentive our drinks where always full

We came here for Sunday brunch and had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated, but it was well worth the wait. The French press coffee is AH-MAZING!  The chicken and waffles, Chilaquiles, and bacon wrapped filet with eggs were so good!  Service was great too. We will definitely be back!

Love this place!!  BUT, what happened to the pot of bread?!?  The last FOUR times I've been in they've been "out" of them.  If you keep running out of them over and over, wouldn't that be a sign to start ordering more?  The food is great, but for the price you pay, they should have it more together.
Came in with a party of 8, our waitress Kris was extremely friendly and very helpful with menu options. Food was great, and I highly recommend for big groups. Ask for Kris if she's available!
Great place. One of my favorite breakfast places in Vegas! Extremely reasonable, great food, and great service
Man i love coming here the staff are friendly and make it a priority to get to know you. The food is amazing and the prices are fair.....

Their service absolutely stinks.. Food is always brought out cold. The Biscuits that come with gravy were HARD as a rock. I didn't enjoy the breakfast because the entire time everyone else was eating and I was waiting for something that shouldn't of been hard and cold in the first place. Really not the best breakfast and its false advertising to say so. Two thumbs down...

I had to give at least one star,,,  deserves a quarter of a star!

Apparently you can just seat yourself if you don't want to wait...  Service already is stressful.  Our service was extremely slow.....our server actually walked away in the middle of ordering and then came back.... WHO DOES THAT!???  Had to flag waitress down for more coffee and creamer.  Took forever - 30 minutes to get our food... Eggs, pancakes and waffles should not take that long!  After I received my waffle I realized it tasted just like bisquik... So did the pancakes.  Food was below average ... Service sucked!!! But the syrup was good. That's it... Good syrup! 

This restaurant's management needs to step up and manage... Total chaos..will not be back here!

Great food and great service! Will be coming back before we leave Vegas. 
The iced mocha was yum! Waffle platter and French toast platter were also very yummy and filling! They give you fresh whip cream, sweet butter, and warm maple syrup that just melts in your mouth!! If you want to try something off the strip then check out this place. 

Our server Amber was very friendly, fast but not pushy, and she just made the experience that much better!

Too good! I tryed the bacon wraped steak medalions the steak was top notch and I must admit so were the eggs and potatoes..the only bummer is that this place did not serve beer...I love steak eggs and beer!...MUST TRY THIS PLACE PPL..DO IT!
Food is good. Location can be busy and staff seems overwhelmed at times. Not sure why they have to wear the pajamas...

What a great find for breakfast!  All four of us enjoyed our choices of pancakes, waffles, salad and homemade cornbeef hash.  The only thing that topped the food was the excellent service from our waitress Lisa, kitchen and staff.    We'll be back to try more of the menu.

Great hidden gem. My first time here. This place is great. I had the small 8oz ribeye steak eggs and hash browns. The steak was seasoned perfectly and the hash browns were great. Service was quick and this place was busy, constant traffic of people. I was 100% satisfied. 
I will return for breakfast here again and again. My only issue even though I gave them 5 stars is that they didn't have any of their signature "pot o bread" ,gives me a reason to come back. Enjoy your meal.
I'm so glad my boyfriend is a yelp junkie he found this hidden gem. We hate eating on the strip!! Amazing food!!

This was an excellent brunch place. Good portions of hashbrowns, eggs, and ribeye steak. I asked for the eggs over medium and the ribeye steak medium rare and they came out perfectly. The biscuits were good and the coffee was refilled often.

Took my wife here for Mother's day brunch. We didnt have a reservation, but the wait wasn't too long(considering it was mothers day). The food was really good too. I had the ham steak and eggs with hash browns and my wife had the Texas French toast. Prices were reasonable and the staff was very friendly and attentive.

I so want to love this place. The decor is whimsical and colorful, and the servers being in their pajamas is a fun touch, but after eating there twice, the food and the service just aren't worth the price. My first trip, about a month ago, I ordered the Ham-N-Eggs Benedict, and it was just OK. The entire dish was barely warm, the english muffin was barely toasted, the hash browns were really nothing special, and the overall dish was just mediocre. I took my friend there for her birthday today, and I was so disappointed in the food and the service that I probably won't be giving this place another chance. I figured that since they call themselves a "steak and egg place," I should probably try their steak, so I ordered the Bacon Wrapped Tenderloin Steak. The description on the menu on their website says it comes with "dijon brown butter onions atop a swiss cheese open-faced omelet & hash brown potatoes" for $13.50.  The waitress asked me how I wanted my steak cooked, and I ordered "medium." The dish had not one onion on it, so I politely asked the waitress if it came with brown butter onions, and she said no. I asked her to get the menu, we looked at it together, we could both see the word onions in the description, yet she pointed to the little yellow squiggle of sauce on the omelette and said, "that is the dijon brown butter there on the omelette." She then asked me if I wanted a side of onions, and I said no, and I reiterated that the description said it came with onions, yet she flat out ignored that fact. I felt like I was in Bizzaro land. I wasn't rude in any way, I just wanted what the menu described, and she acted like we were reading two different things. Seeing that I took my friend there for her birthday, I was trying to be very nice and low keyed and not draw attention, so I moved on. Next comes the bacon wrapped tenderloins. They were cooked "well done" and dry, even though I ordered them "medium."  The potatoes were the same as before, really nothing special. They're like thick flat potato shreds with not much tasty crust, so I consider them undercooked and just not my style. So I ate a couple of bites of everything, decided it needed help, so I put some ketchup on the potatoes, hot sauce on the omelette, and A1 on the steak, but nothing helped. It just was not a good breakfast, certainly not a $13.50 breakfast, so I stopped eating at about 1/3 of the way into it. Again, not wanting to draw attention, I figured perhaps the waitress might put two and two together, see that I didn't eat much of it, and ask for some feedback, or see if I wanted anything else, but no such luck. The best thing about this place is the decor and the hope of having a delicious breakfast, but alas, 'tis not enough for me to give them yet another chance.

When someone doesn't care how far they have to drive to eat your food, you know you have a FAN! This place Rocks! From the moment you step in the door, it looks cool, it smells awesome, the staff is wonderful and the food.. OMG. Rise & Shine Chilaquiles and the Steak and Eggs Benedict are about as IT as IT's gonna get! As far as a breakfast/lunch spot goes, they just nailed it! I can't possibly imagine how it can get any better! (Unless of course, they build one in Summerlin.)
A little overpriced but the food is definitely good. I had the hams teak and eggs with hash browns. Nothing left on the plate but the gam bone.
This is a great place, I've been there many times. The Crunchy Cinnamon Raisin French Toast is my favorite.

I would give zero stars if I could! Horrible service! Food came out in 5 minutes or less???! Eggs Benedict was raw and smothered in hollandaise (soogy and uneatable) My Granddaughter's eggs and pancakes which where served on top of each other?! had a long black hair under her food...GROSSSS!!! Will never go back
The 25 minute wait was so worth it! The food was amazing and we will make stopping here on our way out of Vegas a tradition;)

Cute breakfast spot.  The food quality and taste here is excellent.  The chicken and waffle is awesome, fried chicken - juicy on the inside and perfectly crispy outside.  Can't go wrong with anything here.  The potted bread is so also a must, so yummy.  Wish they have a place like this in LA.  Definitely a must stop when I'm in Vegas.

Great costumer service!. The servers looked cute on their pajamas hehe. The food is great! I had the chilaquiles with steak and it was delicious!!!. OJ is fresh squeezed. I also try the cinnamon French toast, which had real pieces of cinnamon french toast!. Overall this place has really good breakfast. I would definitely stop by again. Until next time!
This is my new favorite breakfast spot been coming here atleast 2x a month i can honestly say the best PANCAKES in las vegas  !

I really wanted to like this place but after 3 times I'm done. There is no sense of urgency at all as far as being seated or getting your food. They would rather have you wait 15 min while they wipe down every dirty table instead of have a busser to clean up the mess. Because of the nonchalant service and the fact that they just don't seem to care my family won't ever be back
Just in Vegas for vacation and found the place on Yelp and was pleased with the food and service. I would definitely recommend and come back.

Perfect friendly service, ideal breakfast spot with easy parking and an oasis for the steak and eggs crowd. Worth visiting to get away from the strip and casino crowd. Great coffee. Work of art ceiling. Five stars at this price point. Oh, get at least one buscuit to share.

This place is my favorite restaurant in all of Nevada. If you want sweet, get their cinnamon French toast. If you want savory, get their crispy fried chicken wrap. You won't regret it! My mouth is watering just thinking of this place.

Food was good.  We shared the chicken and waffles with a side of the sausages.  The pot of bread is like a soft cinnamon roll and is tasty. 

Our server was a bit slow and the server at the table next to us started taking care of us.  

There seemed to be a lot of screaming children and crying babies.  So if you are trying to socialize your children it may be a good place to hang out as the food is quite good and I mostly just knocked it down for our server and the noise.

We love to go to the Rise and Shine on Southern Highlands Pkwy. The restaurant has delicious food and great coffee and juices. The price is not super inexpensive but not too pricey either. There is coffee cake that comes in a little cup and it's really cute and very yummy. The restaurant has a nice, laid back atmosphere as well!

This is hands down my favorite place to go for breakfast. Everything is flawless. From the adorable bright, comfy, clean decor to the friendly staff and you guessed it amazing food! 

I am an eggs benedict fan - and they most certainly take the cake with their selections of eggs benedict and NY steak. 

I have dined at Rise and Shine about 3 times, usually after the morning rush and was always pleased with the service. 

Did I mention the fresh homemade lemonade!? GO!

waitresses in pj's, attentive management, and damn fine food.  the only thing disappointing about rise and shine is that it's not closer to where i live.  the perfect solution to a hangover morning or a lazy sunday.

What can I say great breakfast. Good lunch options.  Large portions and good coffee.
Don't skip the pot o bread it is yummy.  Steak chiliquilles (sp?) Is very good. Breakfast burritos are large and tasty.

Why only four stars you ask.  
Well the salsa looks feels and tastes like pace brand salsa
The chicken fried steak.  Well this is hard for me because I am from Texas and have grown accustomed to good chicken fried steak.  The one served here looks like a chicken fried steak. The cream gravy is good but every time I've had it here they didn't trim the fat.  Nothing worse than cutting a piece off and the first bite bieng oddly chewie.
All in all if you live nearby you must try the rise and shine.  Just stay aeay from the chicken fried steak.... unless you just don't know any better.

Great food, a little pricey for breakfast but the food is truly amazing. Have had everything from chicken & waffles to simple eggs over easy with a pancake. Let me tell you their waffles are to die for, and they bring you warm syrup with cinnamon sticks in it. YUMMY!!! Plus they have French pressed coffee. If you want to treat yourself to an amazing meal for breakfast and don't mind a little higher price tag- go here! Also be prepared for a wait when you head here in the morning, they are usually packed.

I had the same experience as someone who posted here 7 days ago.  Asked for eggs a certain way and was told "no" especially since it was a Sunday.  Got me thinking is this not cooked to order restaurant?  We didn't wait to find out.
Wow this place was perfect for my family. The food was great. The pot of bread was so good. The service was top notch. Lisa our waitress was probably the best waitress I've ever had.

Good food, fun atmosphere. The servers wear pajamas. And people are constantly checking to make sure everything is OK. If it were cheaper, I'd be there all the time. But I don't suppose quality is cheap. You've got to try the 'pot of bread'. Just sayin'.

As soon as you walk in the staff greets you and is very friendly, I LOVE that the servers wear Pj's for their uniforms, it makes you feel comfortable and welcome!
I ordered a Ham & Cheese omelet, very yummy and a very large portion!
Service has gone down hill I used to love going there but now they suck they there popularity has gone to there head. Probably won't be back
Amazing food!  The service was top notch and the food was great!  Loved the pot bread among everything else we tried.  We loved this place so much that we had to repeat!

Horrible service by the hostess my party as well as another just stormed out. There was a large party of 7 in front of us and it took a while to get that set up which is fine. The problem came after that when all the parties that waited for the 7top to be seated were completely ignored so the hostess could go bag up a to go order who just walked in. We brought it to her attention (there are empty tables and people waiting to be seated for a very long time maybe you could sit us then help the to go order) her respinse was ummmmm yeah uhhhh. We wont be back
Consistently good food and friendly service.  Slightly pricey for your average breakfast, but we keep going back because it's good, and close by.

I spend a week each summer in Las Vegas.  This year, I googled "best breakfast in Las Vegas" and discovered this gem which was only about two miles from my hotel (South Point Resort and Casino).  All the superlatives you've read in the other reviews are absolutely on the spot true.  The d√©cor is cheerful, the service is absolutely wonderful, and the food is very, very good.  I agree with Google that this is one of the best breakfast (and lunch) places in Las Vegas.  Twice I had the rib eye steak and eggs plus the "pot of bread".  Once I tried the chicken fried steak and eggs.  Both were great but I liked the rib eye even better.  I always order my steak medium rare and I was pleasantly surprised to find it was perfectly cooked to my liking.  

Playing on the name of the restaurant, all the waitresses wear (modest) pajamas and each one is cheerful, knowledgeable, and attentive to your morning repast needs.  My friend and I ate here three mornings in a row and each time we were seated in Callie's section.  Waitress Callie is a sweet young darling who knows how to keep all her customers content.  Each time I visit Las Vegas, I will make a point to start my day at Rise & Shine - A steak & egg place.

Happened along this restaurant and was pleasantly surprised. The food was excellent,  service was awesome, location ehh a little far from home but its all worth it in the end.. we had the bacon wrappped steak and the ham steak both were cooked perfectly.. the little pot of bread was cool and a great twist on a cinnamon roll.. this place is great can't wait to visit again and try more items from the menu..
First time visit and the food was great!!biscuits and gravy were so great! Hostess Jessica made sure everything was wonderful. She is very customer oriented. The waitress Cari was energetic & fun!
Went here on a Saturday around 930 ish had like a 10 mins wait for a table...had good service ...the food was good but a pricey ..57 bucks for a 3 person breakfast

I live right off of Valle Verde, so on my morning drive to get Starbucks, I noticed that this place had opened up. I decided to take the time out to stop in since I'm always on the lookout for good places close by. 

As I walked in I immediately noticed the decor, which is very bright and colorful, with pretty patterned umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, which I found to be a nice atmosphere to start my day in.

The two women at the front counter greeted me warmly and sat me immediately, and told me my server would be Maria. 

Maria asked if I'd been there before, then explained the menu to me when I said I had not. I decided to go with a ham steak breakfast with a pot of French press and some OJ.

Maria brought me my cup of bread, which comes with the breakfast and is apparently a specialty of theirs. I was a bit skeptical as to whether it would be any good, but it was basically like an extremely fluffy cinnamon roll inside of a cup, with the sauce/icing on the side, and I enjoyed it a lot. 

When the ham steak came out I was also surprised, as I was expecting a normal sized, 6-8 inch around, half an inch thick steak. The steak they brought out was at least an inch thick, and probably a foot or so around, a good pound or more of meat. I wasn't sure if I'd even be able to finish it, but it was so juicy, tender, and smoky that I managed to eventually, although I sat there for a good hour or so. 

The eggs and hashbrowns were a bit above average, tasty with a kick of seasoning that isn't usually included, and added some extra interest to the dish. 

The French press is touted as Lavazza, which I've had before at other restaurants. Although as a coffee snob I'll say it isn't the best cup of coffee I've ever had, it is better than the coffee at 90% of other restaurants in Las Vegas, and having a good cup of French press to go with the steak made it much easier to digest. 

The OJ tasted fresh squeezed and had a slice of orange as a garnish, which I was happy about as concentrate at restaurants bothers me. 

The entire time I was there Maria was very attentive to me, always making sure my water was full, if I needed anything else, asking if I liked everything, and joking about being proud of me being able to finish the ham steak. 

As I left I asked for the manager, Gilberto, who I met just so I could tell him that Maria and the front and back end staff were all great. He was very polite to me, asked me what I had, introduced himself, and made me feel like a valued customer.

All in all this seems like it will be my new favorite local breakfast place, and I'm glad they opened up right across the street. The one qualm I have is they need beds in the back, because after you finish one of their steaks you really feel like rolling back into bed and not getting out till after 12 or 1.

The food is excellent and the staff is friendly. My wife and I  enjoy eating here. However, I have two issues eating here. The first is that they do not have pancakes as a side.  I could never eat just pancakes for breakfast. I normally like to get two pancakes to eat with my breakfast,  but that is not offered here. I did, however, find out from our server that you can substitute toast for a pancake. Note that this information is not on the menu. A compromise I suppose,  but I like my eggs runny, and everyone knows that requires toast. The only other option is to order 4 or 5 pancakes. 

But the biggest issue is that many employees touch the areas of dishes and silverware that you put in your mouth. For instance I've seen an employee prepare silverware settings by touching the knives on the blade part,  with bare hands. I've seen many,  many instances of a server ring up an order on the wall mounted IPad and then bring your drink to the table by holding the glass at the top where your lips go.  I have also seen servers grab toast out of the toaster and put it on the plate with bare hands. This is all done without hand washing. I would like the staff to be more aware of where their hands have been before they touch my silverware or glass and more aware of where to touch the dishes.

We just love this place. For us it's a neighborhood gem-a short walk from home. The consistently friendly and good service, the great food and colorful relaxed decor make this well worth a drive to get here. I've enjoyed every breakfast I've had. But only go for the chicken and waffles if you're seriously hungry. Kids and Senior options too -which is nice.

I was sooo impressed with this place. I hate that it closes so early but I will make sure I get to go there at least once while I am in town. Everyone got something different at the table and everything was great! Can't wait to go back and get a biscuit

Was passing through town, looked this place up on yelp. Much better than one of the buffets on the strip. A little out of the way in a drip mall set in a sleeping area , but work it. Service was good as was the food, will definitely stop again if given the chance

Sadly what was once one of my favorite spots for breakfast and lunch has declined in service and food quality to the point where I'm unlikely to return. Since their expansion I have been in 3 times and each time the service was slow, our servers seemed distracted and sometimes downright rude in pushing us to order something from the new juice bar. The food portions have been reduced and the quality of ingredients seems to have declined as well. My last visit was not at a particularly busy time but multiple tables were left uncleared and dirty. All in all the charm of this place has gone and it's a shame because this was once a true gem of the southwest valley.
Outstanding omelet, hash browns, coffee and service.  One of the best breakfasts I have had.

Went here yesterday for breakfast after looking on Yelp for a breakfast place away from the strip.  What a pleasant surprise!!
Great variety on the menu.  I had an omelet but the Red Velvet pancakes looked interesting.  But I did try the pot of bread.  Imagine a cinnamon roll baked in a small flower pot.  It was delicious and very unique.
Service was great.  Got seated immediately and servers were quick to refill coffee and water.  It was excellent.  
Best part, the servers were wearing pajamas!!!

First time at rise and shine, first review I've bothered to write for a restaurant.  Had the chicken fried steak and it was delicious.  Will be back again, I only fear writing this review will make it slightly more crowded

Ate there 4 times with only one good experience.  We ordered eggs benedict on a visit and the eggs were runny and gross.  The waitress agreed.  The Chef at that place reminds me of the Soup Nazi guy on Seinfeld.  He began to argue out loud where customers could hear with the waitress about our order. She handled it very professionally and told him that she is not there to argue with him.  This does not serve the restaurant well and made us feel that the food he prepares is his way or tough shit.  Today, we went there to give them another chance.  We ordered a Cobb Salad.  The Salad came back with FRIED chicken strips on it and should have been grilled chicken strips.  We thought, here we go again.  The Cobb salad comes back and now there are diced pieces of chicken on it (not strips as before) and much less.  We questioned why the salad did not have hard boiled egg and blue chees crumbles on it as is stated in plain english on the menu that the restaurant hands out to customers to order from.  I showed it to the waitress and she said we were right. At that point, we had been there about 1/2 hour and decided we had to leave to get back to work on time.  The waitress then takes the salad back to the Chef and the Chef says IT IS A COBB SALAD.  I told the waitress that perhaps the Chef SHOULD READ THE MENU that customers order their food from before he prepares meals.  I gave this restaurant the benefit of the doubt and hoped the next time we went there to eat they would get it right.  Well, no such luck, this place sucks due to the Chef's attitude.  I will never go there again because of it.  I recommend that if you go there, read the menu and see if they get your order right and that you receive what you paid for.  They can't seem to for us.  A complete waste of tiime which should otherwise be a nice and enjoyable experience.  Note to Management:  GET ANOTHER CHEF.  Your currfent chef is not doing you any favors. In Fact it is because of him, we will not recommend your restaurant to others.  We will not be back.

We come to rise and shine every Sunday most servers know us by name. After today I don't think we will be back. The server forgot to put the order in for one of the people in my party. We got lousy sorry from the waitress no manager approached our table and no one even offered to take it off the check we had to tell the cashier to take it off cause we never relieved it. Not the way to treat loyal customers we had to go to Ikea so my husband could get something to eat 

Update: 
We returned to our usual schedule and had breakfast this morning.  The welcome when we first walked in was enough for us to know they made a mistake last time and they were glad we have them a second chance.  We love Annalisa the manager and our server Sara as well.   They made us feel welcome again and gave impeccable service.  Food was amazing.  Thank you for having us back again.  We will be back next Sunday.
Best steak and eggs ever! It's fairly busy on a Sunday but they generally do a great job with getting you in. You will leave this place feeling more than satisfied. Seriously, best breakfast EVER!!!

Yelp pays off again!!!! A 15-20 minute wait is nothing on a Sat afternoon! Well worth it, delicious coffee, the pot of bread to die for and fab service!!! I had the eggs Benedict, one of the best I've ever had!! My husband had the rib eye (have to try the steak when it's in the title). It did not disappoint! Love the Sunflower decor and the waitresses in pjs!!! Service is 5 star and fast!!!
Great food. Not a fast-paced dining experience, so plan on a hour. Highly recommend the French press coffee!

Very good food and fast! Kids menu is very good sized for a 7 year old and 2 year old to share (they both don't eat a lot). Very polite staff. Would definitely recommend it if ur looking for a quick service breakfast. Can't wait to come back to try their tomato soup with grilled cheese for lunch.

Came here with my family for a nice sit-down breakfast, and the experience was so pleasant! When you walk in, the ceiling is covered in upside-down spinning umbrellas, immediately creating a light and whimsical atmosphere.

The service was excellent! Our servers were attentive, quick, very happy, and everyone was dressed in pajamas -- if the staff dressed in pajamas isn't awesome, I don't know what is.

I went simple and had some oatmeal with pecans, brown sugar, milk, and raisins; the portions here are HUGE! I swear there was about 3 servings of oatmeal in my dish. My fam had the chicken and waffles, red velvet pancakes, and benedict, which they all enjoyed.

Even after my family stayed a little longer talking at the table after having paid, they still brought us fresh coffee every couple minutes. Major thumbs up to Rise & Shine!
Food was very good but kind of pricy for a small strip mall restaurant. Portions were big, service was excellent and the place was very clean. I would highly recommend but warn about the $$$.

Just got done eating breakfast here with my boyfriend and must I say we are so obsessed with this place and will definitely be coming here for breakfast every time we visit Las Vegas. Our server was Ashley, whom was so friendly and accommodating. We ordered the ny steak with spinach eggs Benedict, and the buffalo chicken breast w/ eggs. And you must try their fresh juices!! It was so good I had to take one to go.

I have been to this breakfast place when I am in the area and I have enjoyed every visit. Sometimes, it can take a minute to get seated because I have seen the host also bus tables. Other than that, the food and service have been great. The first time I got the Cinnamon Toast Crunch French Toast with real maple syrup. It was delicous. The second time I got the Chicken Fried Steak. Now, they are known for their steak and eggs so I would stick with that. My sister got the omelette which just seemed like any average omelette. My mother got the waffle which was soft and tasty.But the Chicken Fried Steak was THE BEST and the gravy was amazing. I was in heaven.They also serve illy and French Press coffee. I loved the French Press myself. If you're in the mood for steak and eggs, I would come here. :)

I wanted some breakfast but woke up late today, and I had bookmarked Rise and Shine in my Yelp. Bruh! This is an excellent breakfast spot. The portions, The pot of bread , the staff was very nice. served till 3:00pm...I don't always do breakfast but when I do I prefer Rise & Shine first time in here but it won't be my last.

I never leave reviews on Yelp.... But this place was AMAZING!!! From the moment we walked in the door there were two very nice ladies who greeted us and didn't waste any time to seat us!! My breakfast was everything I hoped for. Your classic American egg cheese ham bacon and sausage bagel with a side of hash browns! My boyfriend went big and got the country fried steak and I had to steal a bite! This place seriously so good. And our server was amazing! I wish I remembered her name. She made a joke that I couldn't take my leftovers home and that I was held hostage till I finished everything on my plate. I honestly believed her hahahah great food and great morning spent here!! Thank you!!

Ate here this morning! I can't believe some of the negative reviews! The food was delish, the French press coffee was so good! I was super happy that my oatmeal came out with pecans & raisins & brown sugar! The bacon was delish..... Our server was a sweetheart & I loved that they wore jammies!

Thought I'd check out the "New Place" in our neighborhood. Always anxious to find a good Breakfast Place especially one so close. Being close was the only Good thing about Rise & Shine, Valle Verde Location.  I realize flavor is a personal thing, so I shouldn't complain about how things tasted. I had ordered the Two Eggs, over medium, Hash browns, Sausage, and the 'Cup of Bread'. The two eggs were perfect. The Hash Browns were more than the normal hash browns. They had "spruced" them up with spices and the texture felt like they were "Freeze Dried-'just add water' and heat". There wasn't any "skillet type"  items on the menu so I created my own. I also asked for a side of Gravy, noticing they had 'Biscuits & Gravy' was on the menu. The 'Banger" sausage had a good flavor, but it is not a breakfast sausage, in my opinion. The Gravy was flavorless, except for the black pepper. The 'Cup of Bread" was too doughy and the "dipping sauce" wasn't very tasty.  I usually eat less than half of my meal, taking leftovers home for a future meal or snack. So, I realize that the waitress may have thought I wasn't quite done, but it took her a very long time to see if I was done, and if there'd be anything else.  She  dropped off the bill and said "I can take that up for you, but take your time". Placing my credit card on the bill, I feel, indicates I'm ready to pay. I waited at least 15 more minutes, with different wait staff passing me by  numerous times. I was NEVER asked if I needed a "BOX to GO" and if there may be something I didn't like about the meal, due to the amount I hadn't finished. Like I said previously, taste is a personal thing,and I wasn't going to take this breakfast home for later. So, I just got up and went to the front reception desk, and paid my bill. One good thing I noticed was that the Wait Staff was dressed in Pajamas. I thought that was very clever. But, I won't be going back, just to see the pajamas.
just had the rib eye steak and chilaquiles....it was a religious experience!!!!! I will be back every weekend!!!

Rise & Shine is one of my staple breakfast places, if I had to guess how many times I've been here I'd say 50+. Unfortunately, I have recently had to start eating gluten free and when I went to Rise & Shine yesterday I was super disappointed to learn that the chips they use in the chilaquiles are not gluten free! This would be a very easy fix for them. And as they do not have anything else gluten free friendly if you want a "bread product" with your meal it would expand their menu a bit. Also, the beans they use are not vegetarian (they have lard in them) another easy fix but not something I would complain about alone, I could just leave them off, but since I can't even eat the chips.... 

I will update my rating if they ever decide to update their menu with chips that are gluten free!

This place is wonderful. All the servers are friendly and so accommodating. I have a hard time deciding between breakfast and lunch items, everything is just so good. I'm a regular and the food is always perfect. Great with kids too!
Attendant is very unfriendly.  Her demeanor and attitude she showed when we walked in made us walked out and choose another place to eat.

This place was good not bad but not great I will still go to one of my favorite spots for breakfast on my days off which is MIMI'S. I live in Southern Highlands and I was hoping this place was going to be my spot when I don't feel like going to MIMI'S, but no I'll go to Rise in Shine if I don't want to drive far.When I got there it was busy and we had to wait about 45 mins. It was a Sunday so it was expected didn't mind... we waited outside because there is no place to wait inside, what I think they need to do is get some chairs outside or put a bench so people can sit while they wait. When they called us to be seated the hostess was very friendly and so was the server. But what I didn't like is that when I ordered my glass of orange juice it SUCKED and that's what the customers are looking for,especially if your eating breakfast!!!! The orange sucked because it was diluted with water to save money. It tasted just like water and the color was not even orange it looked yellow. From the moment I saw it when the server brought it to us I knew something was up. I wasn't the only person who notice that it was others too. Then what I ordered to eat was chilaquillas, I was expecting the traditional way but I was wrong, the server explained to me what it was and she explained what I thought it was going to be the traditional way. But NO it was more tortilla chip than anything else very little sauce, very very little eggs, and two slice of avocado, overal it sucked. If you never had the original chilaquillas before u wouldn't know the difference then I guess.... But I think the owner should not call it chilaquillas and call it Chips and Egg; and yes I said egg because it was only one egg.So overall to conclude my review it was OK I had better before. I hope they read this and hopefully change what I wrote just so I and others can go there for breakfast!

We live about 4 blocks from this restaurant. Over the last 3 months this place has fallen a part! We waited about 25 min to be seated, the fat boy seating people appeared to be more interested in making sure his friends sat down before the customers.

We are huge small business supporters but in this case we spoke to the ladies at the register, expressed our frustration and walked out.  The attitude at this place really sucks! We weren't even acknowledged , no apology, no can we fix it for you.  The only thing they had was a dumb look on their face.

To the business owner: your poor trained, unprofessional  staff is driving out your local client! You will need to hire a professional to manage the staff.  While at the restaurant about 6 tables where dirty with dishes and about 3 parties waiting for a table! Finally people started leaving. We did the same and went to the M casino hash house a go go. This restaurant is now our replacement.

I've been to this restaurant on a couple of occasions and it's never disappointed me. It has a neat decor and the staff all wear their pajamas. 

I ordered the Country Fried Steak and eggs and it's amazing! The steak is cooked perfectly and has a great tasty crunch. I got the hashbrowns on the side along with the "pot of bread". The hashbrowns were good, but nothing too special. The pot of bread was awesome though! It was incredibly fluffy with cinnamon baked in. They put some butter on top and it's perfect!

This is the best breakfast place I've been to in Las Vegas and I will definitely be returning!

A great breakfast place with friendly service and well trained cooks.  Omelets are fantastic, and they have nice touches like a mound of cinnamon bread served in a tiny planters pot (pot of bread).  I had a spinach, bacon, and cheese omelet which was delicious.  Very well prepared and the portion was a good size.  The hash browns are well prepared and tasty.  Menu is a little on the  small side, and $2.50 for a cup of coffee is a little steep.  Expect to pay $17-$20 per person for breakfast which is a little steep.  I tried the banger sausage and found it just okay - the bacon was better.  Seems to be a hickory bacon that's well seasoned.

I can't give it 5 stars because of the price.  A limited menu is okay for me.  It's impossible to make 200 things very well, so focusing on making 20-30 things increases the quality.  Definitely worth a trip to check it out, but for my family and I, the total bill was $62.  This is a little pricey for 3 adults and a child.

This place has jacked their prices up to where they are now just as expensive as the Peppermill. Unfortunately they don't even come close to the Peppermill in any area, from the quality of the food to the waitstaff to the overall ambiance. I hate driving to the strip but I hate being charged tourist prices when I'm off-strip even more. Bye-bye, little overpriced breakfast joint.

I don't even know where to begin. The decor is whimsical and fresh. The staff is friendly and there uniform is pajamas- freaking brilliant. The menu is reasonably priced, and the food is incredible. I had the chicken and waffles, season perfectly and very filling. It also came with the bread in a pot I thoroughly enjoyed. This dish also reheated well when I decided to finish it for a late lunch. My friend had the blueberry peanut butter pancakes, also delicious. I will be revisiting, just haven't decided if it will be every weekend or make a once a month thing so I don't over indulge.
One of my favorite breakfast spots in Vegas! Love the chilaquiles and the atmosphere!

Love this place!! Absolutely amazing food and service! Always a good experience and a great time for my family and I to come have a delicious meal together. Place is deforested sooo cute also, looks like they put a lot of time and effort in to making it the way it is! Keep it up rise and shine!
Excellent food, great service, and great uniforms (they go to work in their pj's)!

I have been here numerous times. Today I wanted a simple tomato or vegetable juice. 

They don't have it!!! Sure they have a fancy juice bar to make gross concoctions loaded with sugary, sweet stuff but not just regular juices.

Oh and those juice bar drinks are expensive to top it off. One expects a certain minimum basics when a breakfast location...

I found this wonderful spot using yelp. The high stars are not deceiving.  The place is not to big and not to small. It's conducive to large groups as well as like myself a party of 1. They have bar seating if your a party of 1 or 2 and dont want wait for a both or table. The waitress staff works really hard and fast to make sure your experience is a good one. Ask to be seated in vanessa's area. She is, fun, attentive and empathetic to your dining experience.  She gives you options along with your order that might not be on the menu or something you just didnt think of.  I ordered the ultimate steak breakfast.  It came with an 8 oz. Steak, 2 or 3 scrambled eggs, hashbrowns and your choice of bread. One of the bread options is called a pot of bread.  The title is deceiving because it comes in a little cup. But if you like a warm ooey gooey cinnamon roll, then you'll love this. I like to judge a breakfast establishment also by their hash browns.  this place to me has great fresh hash browns.  The steak was medium and was tasty. Not too much pink and still pleasantly juicy. You will not be disappointed.  I ate every bite. -- jeryl, aka Randy

Me and my girlfriend just got back from Las Vegas this past weekend and tried new food spots we never did. We decided to try the Rise and Shine place that was near my friends house that lives in LV. Wait time was only 10 mins or less for us and our waitress was very helpful (which everyone seems like there). My girlfriend got the corned beef and hash (around $10), and she loved it because of its authenticity of real corned beef. I got the steak and eggs ($12) because I figured that is what they're known for. I got the medium rare steak and it was so juicy that I did not need steak sauce, only tobasco. Great portions for its price. Only downfall is that there are other steak and eggs spots in LV that are only $3.99. But I guess this is quantity and quality in the same time from my opinion.

Delicious.  Once you have delicious rib-eye instead of a crappy sirloin or eggs with herbs instead of just cooked in oil or a crispy chicken cutlet with real buffalo sauce (which tastes delicious with all kinds of things on the plate), it'll be hard to be happy with the typical Valley breakfasts.
Simply amazing food, me and my gf are vacationing good is outstanding. And everyone is like they said In pajamas!!!!

Don't mean to make a stink, but I did a take out order today as I was doing a smiths run. I ordered chicken and waffles to go and got home and had raw chicken and waffles. I just threw the plate away as I am super paranoid.

Ok so I should have waited to give a review until after we had finished eating. Our server was not very attentive at all, we had to flag her down to ask for refills, the food was just ok but they do give hefty portions. The decor of the place was pretty cool but we  will not be returning here as the overall dining experience was just ok.

We stop by every once in awhile when craving country fried steak. The food is good but in my opinion pricey. The staff is always very nice, my kids love that they wear pajamas. Of course we always get the flower pot bread, great flavor and reminds me of the home style restaurants from the south. 

The place is usually super busy so be prepared to wait for awhile to be seated.

This place does breakfast right. Food is great, portions plenty, salads amazing. The staff takes pride in their workmanship (from the kitchen all the way to the hostess position) and they're friendly to boot! Awesome family breakfast place and I can even wear my jammies if I want to (the servers do every day).
Ryley and Colleen always take good care of us. We bring our dog with us too and they set up a nice table for us outside in the shade complete with a doggy water bowl. They're always willing and seem to be happy to accommodate. Rise and Shine rocks!

Went for the first time for Valentines day breakfast at 10am and as expected had to wait 35 minutes for a table, but they had enough chairs outside to accommodate the waiting. I ordered the Belgian waffle which was nothing special, but they made the best overhard eggs I've ever had and the thick, crispy bacon was amazing. My husband got the best omelet he has ever had, with a side of hashed browns that we ended up sharing and I wish I could have more of! The ambiance is cute and we will definitely be eating here again!
It was fairly good came with the family only problem the pancakes were half cooked but they kindly took them and brought us new ones

I wasnt impressed. Service was slow...like slooooooooow. I ask for medium steak it came out well done my hashbrowns were just soggy potatoes on my plate . Thw omelette was great ill give them that and the french pressed coffee was amazing also but I might not go back.

Cute cute place. Servers in PJ's, flowers on the ceiling. Amazing food and service to match. I had a made-to-order bagel sandwich, but we also ordered omelets and kids meals. Everything was outstanding. To top it off, service was prompt, friendly, and helpful. We will absolutely go here again.  

Recap: great ambience, food, and service. A short car ride from the strip that is well worth it.
Get there early to avoid the crowd. My favorite meals are the Steak Chilaquiles and the Chocolate Velvet Pancakes. The pot of bread with cream cheese sauce is a must.

I love breakfast restaurants. This place definitely shot atop of my list of best breakfasts. I had the chilaquiles with a steak. I'm used to traditional homemade chilaquiles but what I got was a little different. Once I started eating I couldn't stop. I didn't leave a morsel. Very, very good!!

I will say we went here for Brunch on Valentines Day. This place is AWEFUL! The food is so salty like it was soaked in the Dead Sea before they served it to us! The crispy chicken sand which was so over done to the point there was no longer any chicken in it anymore. The server brought it out any way and piled all the fixens on top in hopes I wouldn't notice. I sent it back and ordered the grilled chicken sand which instead. There was a salty sliver of chicken smothered in cheese and once again all the fixens were piled on top. The French fries weren't fries as we know them they were smothered in salt basil and lime. Yuck! It took over a half hour for my new meal to get to the table and it wasn't even busy! The owner had sat exactly two other tables since we had arrived. When the server came over to tell me my order was on it's way a half hour later I just asked for a box. She seemed shocked. I made them take my order off the total of the bill. The other people with me seemed to like their food but they all had breakfast items. All in all I will not suggest this place to anyone nor will I ever go back! Oh and I would have felt guilty feeding this to my dogs (as it would probably kill them being so salty) so I put it in the trash where belongs. YUCK!

I have been going to Rise and Shine off and on since it opened and it continues to disappoint. Merely by virtue of being the only non-bar breakfast place in the area it lasts despite mediocre food and terrible service. I have yet to eat a meal there that was not lukewarm and the victim of bad execution.
This is a simple review: best place for breakfast period! But you have to ask for Amber...truly the best server here...you have to have the best service with the best food...just makes sense

this is my favorite place to eat breakfast,the service is exellent, the food is fresh and juicy and perfectly cooked. I recommend that they will not repent of this wonderful place.
the pancakes and waffles are the best i have ever eaten, the menu of the lunch time it is very healthy, don't forget this place to share with your family a good breakfast and a good lunch.

I have been going there for 4 yrs and its been real good.  This past year it has gone down hill.  The waitresses have all left and the new ones are rude and unfriendly.  It takes forever for our food to arrive at our table after its been sitting on the counter waiting to be delivered.  The food is drowning in butter and the bacon is swimming in grease.  I will never go back.

My favorite breakfast place! I'm fussy about the way my eggs are cooked and they get it right all the time. I'm not a fan of hash browns but I manage to eat it all up here which tells you that it's really good. My favorite has to be the pot of bread. I'm never disappointed at Rise and Shine and the service is excellent!!! The friendly servers are dressed in comfy p.j.s I highly recommend this great breakfast restaurant for family dining.

A great place to eat breakfast, and an even better place for great service. The food is phenomenal. It does not matter what you get to eat, it is all delicious. The service is even better. Everyone is friendly, and they are always willing to go the extra mile to make the customer happy!

Great breakfast spot. Every time we visit Vegas and stay off the strip, we have to eat here. Chilequiles are very good, and the chorizo burritos are good/filling. The portions are large though prices have gone up more than 15% this year.

This was the second time I have been to this place and again was not disappointed. The two fisted turkey bagel sandwich is one of the best I have had. Includes eggs, bacon, cheese and avocado. Pretty delicious. Top it off with a side of cheesy hash browns and French press coffee and you're good to go. Service was a bit slow but definitely a four star experience overall.

Not one complaint here! Will come back again when we come back to Vegas! Everything was delicious! Group of 4 ordered Chilaquiles, French Toast, Belgium waffle, biscuits and gravy and patty melt everything was the bomb.com.

Lisa is one of the best servers I have ever had. Not only was she responsive to our needs but she has a little flare to her wording and her kindness! She should be praised for her above and beyond efforts. The pot of bread is a must!!

Hard night at the bar? Looking for a real breakfast that has not been sitting under a heat lamp? Well Rise and Shine is the perfect place, awesome service, french press, and great chicken fried steak, need I say more? But have taken bites of the french toast from my wife plate and it delicious as well. A must for those like myself that enjoy a great breakfast

I found my new favorite breakfast place! I started with the yogurt parfait w/ honey, granola and bananas, loved it. I had a hard time deciding what to order because everything sounded amazing but after consulting with our server she suggested the eggs benedict and I was not disappointed. My boyfriend ordered the steak omelet and I made him get the pot of bread, so good!

Great food and service, check it out
Beautiful decor. Friendly and efficient staff wearing pjs. Great food, fresh juices, and espresso!  This is as if someone took my wish list and created a business! Thank you!
Fabulous food; terrific service and reasonable price. Love it!

Small little spot in Southern Highlands. Great location for breakfast but I recently ordered food for carry out and was a little disappointed. Definitely didn't meet up to the taste and flavor of eating at the location. Still my breakfast spot just not for carr
What a wonderful place to have a hearty breakfast.  Best diner coffee I've ever had!

Food is great! Customer service every time I come is okay. Not the friendliest. But I got APOLLO this time and he is AWESOME. I will defenitly be requesting him as my  main server from now on. You rock!
Absolutely amazing breakfast. Wonderful server, super cute atmosphere! Try the pot bread, red velvet pancakes, chicken fried steak, the ultimate and eggs Benedict. We loved everything!

NEVER EVER EVER GO HERE! This place is ridiculous I am not sure if it is bad management or greedy owners, but the service here is awful. There are only a handful of employees which equals a long wait for expensive mediocre food.  The first time I came here was on a Sunday morning so I chalked up the wait and the mediocre food to the fact it was Sunday morning. Today I arrived at 12:00 and waited for 20 minutes to be sat. I was rushed to order as soon as I sat down so I ordered and after an hour of waiting for our food I left the money for my drink on the table and left. I will not be returning and will stick to blueberry hill when  I'm craving breakfast food. If you have two hours to wait then go here but if not I suggest you go SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!!!!!

Damn! Really good. I had chicken waffles w/ eggs biscuit and gravy it was on point. Havent had chicken waffles in years. Will come back when i visit vegas. Ultimate steak and eggs was just as equally as good.

Finally I got to try this place. We walked in and the friendly service sat us down to enjoy the the beautifully decorated place. Everything from the pot of bread to my own customized omelet was amazing. I would highly recommend Rise & Shine to anyone who likes quality food and great service. Now I need to go back to try lunch!;)

Average at best! WAY over priced for the quality. I got the cup o bread with my breakfast, over baked then over microwaved tough and chewy.... yet crunchy and dry on part! Had the ham steak and eggs, eggs were fine, ham was ok. Hashbrowns were cold and over cooked, and the green onion in them were burnt black. Coffee and breakfast with tax was $17.43 for one. And that was with the regular coffee. The French press coffee is almost $6 for 3 refills. Probably won't be back.

RATING: B +

SERVICE: B

AMBIANCE: B 

OVERVIEW: Great variety on their menu. The presentation of the food was one of the best parts of this spot. Nothing too special about this place. Definitely a great breakfast spot to check out. They have a wide array of different coffee options. I will definitely return if I am in the mood for a breakfast spot.
I can't think of a better place to eat breakfast.  The menu is great and the service was friendly and fast.  Will certainly be returning to this spot.  Good job

Rise & Shine is a local breakfast place by our neighborhood.  We've frequented it a few times and the service and food has always been on point. Yesterday they really showed their 5+ star service.  My family had our reunion this weekend and we had trouble finding a place that could accommodate our large party.   At last minute i thought of Rise & Shine and Liam the manager was able to book us @ 9:30am (busiest time on Sunday morning) As we filtered in more and more of my family showed that we hadn't expected. never did it throw them off.  We were a total of 52 people.  Our server Vanessa and the rest of the staff rocked it.   There was a couple of missed orders but to be expected.  Overall all 52 people enjoyed and were happy (hard feat to accomplish) Wanted to give the last shout out to the gal that passsed tickets out and made paying easy (sorry didn't catch your name).   Thank you again for such awesome service and ending our reunion with delicious food.

Met up with some friends here for brunch. Ordered: chicken and waffles, cinnamon crunch French toast platter, corned beef and hash, steak and eggs, and pot of bread. My friend got his chicken and waffles and the chicken was undercooked. The staff was nice enough to change it quickly. I ordered the cinnamon crunch French toast, it was pretty good, nothing special really. I love the warm cinnamon syrup they serve. The pot of bread is basically cinnamon bun in a cup. It got hard quickly so I kinda didn't like it. Banger sausage and hash brown were so good. I usually love my hash browns well done, crunchy, and we'll seasoned. And of course, steak and eggs were on point.

HUGE portions!!! I thought Omelet House portions were huge but this place puts their portions to shame. Food was good, nothing overly special about it for me. The value is there and that's what matters. Wish they opened at 6am instead of 7am, but oh well. We will definitely be coming back.

The decor was bright and wonderful.  Our server looked totally comfortable in her pajama uniform which reflected in her excellent service.  The French pressed coffee was delicious especially next to the yummy pot of bread.  The place misses the mark in the steak and eggs.  They were just not cooked to the way I ordered but still good.   I will totally come back try more on the menu.

The staff here was friendly but the food was sub par. There were a lot of weird twist to the breakfast plates that weren't explained on the menu when you order. Pancakes were probably the highlight on this menu after trying the spot out 4 different times.

This restaurant has turned into my go to place on the weekends. The staff is friendly and the place has a good atmosphere. Food is all around great, pancakes are yummy, the chicken and waffles are delicious, and the side sausage is like crack for breakfast meat lovers.

Visited this wonderful cafe for the first time today! Absolutely loved the atmosphere, the service was spot on and the food was delicious! It was busy so I know it is here to stay! Will be taking the family there soon!

Concept is cute.  Decor is fun and waitresses uniforms consist of pajamas and slippers.  The food was pretty good, but prices seemed a bit expensive.  I do like that they offer French press coffee, it was a nice surprise.  I have been there a few times and the service differs every time.  The waitresses are always very nice but it seems as though they are taking their time.... This morning we were sitting at the table waiting to put in our order for 15 minutes or so while the waitress was rolling silverware.  Menu was kind of small but they have a few fun surprises such as chicken and waffles and pretty yummy oatmeal.  I'll go again because it's close... But wouldn't venture out of my way to dine here.
Super friendly staff, moderately priced fantastic food. Can't wait to come back!

Yum! This place is our new favorite breakfast spot! Everything on the menu is awesome! The prices are a little high for a breakfast joint- but totally worth it! The staff is super friendly and the decor is very cute!

My wife and I are creatures of comfort.  Our breakfast options usually consist of either Egg Works, Babystacks, or burritos at Roberto's.  We were out and about last weekend and had a hankering for some waffles.  Straight-forward enough, but surprisingly hard to find.  This place pops up on Yelp so we give it a go.

Daaaang.  The service was phenomenal.  Our waitress was on the ball, making sure our coffee was topped off and that we had anything we could possibly want.  The Lavazza coffee was ok, though not as mind-blowing as I would have thought from hearing people talk about it.  It's no Douwe Egberts, that's for sure.  My wife got the Nutella latte, which was ludicrously delicious.

The waffle and cinnamon french toast were fantastic.  Do not miss out on the pot of bread with a side of some outrageously addicting sugary dipping substance that should probably be outlawed.

I sure wish this place wasn't so far from where we are in Henderson.  It's a heck of a trek.  Also, be aware that this location does not feature all of the items pictured on the menu.  I would have loved to have tried the Oreo Butterscotch Pancakes, but that will require a trip to the other location.

This place was great, really. It was on a Sunday morning and had to wait about 25 minutes but it was totally worth it. We went to the bar next door and had a drink or 2 while we waited. Service was awesome with friendly staff wearing pajamas. Nothing on the menu jumped out at me and I went for the waffles and made it I a platter with bacon and eggs. As basic as that sounds, it was amazeballs. Everyone I was with loved their meals as well. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in town.

Staff is friendly and helpful. Fresh juices and smoothies are delicious. Food is good - sometimes items might come out incorrect but they are always quick to fix the problem! Large portions so I normally order from the children's menu !

Best breakfast in town! Great service too! Food always come out perfect!
French press coffee is awesome! And you cant get enough of the pot of bread!

I took my 1 yr old grandson for breakfast and he fell in love with the French toast. My rating would totally be 5 stars, and I would be here a couple times a week, but the prices are a little high. I loved the decor, my grandson loved the umbrellas hanging up, and our server. I forgot his name, but he was amazing. Loved the syrup, of course the container was really hot and I'm glad I didn't let my grandson touch it, maybe a warning that it's hot, wouldn't had let him hold it, but when I poured it, he would try and touch. Bottom line, I Love it. Just wish it was a little budget friendly.
Since I visited the 9827 W Flamingo Road location, my review will be on there :)

My go to breakfast joint. They just opened up a new location, been there, but I prefer the one in southern highlands. But it's getting to busy, my secret spot not so secret anymore..lol. My favorite is the house made corn beef and hash, quality meat! I love there pot of bread but these past years they turned it into an espresso cup, more like a bite, no good and with there success I would like it to go back to a pot, please.
Great food. Definitely a good "local" spot that's away from the strip. Most importantly, great friendly service. Definitely worth checking out.
Great little breakfast place in the southern highlands area.  Had steak and eggs was cooked perfect  all the food at the table was awesome.

They are lucky to even recieve one star , but I wanted to make sure this posted. When a person orders a steak request medium and recieves something they can not put a knife through is absurd. I do not believe the cooks even know the difference in temperatures,or whether or not it is even cooked. Case in point order a medium receive a well done piece of rubber where a hacksaw could not cut through. or recieve on a second request fatty plate that has blood in it. DO yourself a favor not only avoid the non fully cook hasbrowns avoid recieving a belly ache , save your money at 12+ DOLLARS A PLATE AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE ... THis place sucks and will never see my money again

My husband and I just moved in to this part of town and when going shopping to Smith's saw this place and have been wanting to try it. We finally went this morning and it was reaaaally good! My husband got some eggs and steak and he inhaled the plate in no time! I got a classic eggs, bacon, hash b. Potato and there was nothing left on that plate! Both dishes came with option of biscuit, french toast or a bread roll in a cup, since my husband and I could not decide which one to choose, the lady that helped us just got them all for us! They also have fresh squeezed OJ. I asked if it was really fresh OJ or the tropicana (bottled one) and she told me she squeezes the oranges herself! Too bad they run out of it! I'm definitely coming back and getting it!.

I really like this place since it's so close to my home.  The food is good, the people are friendly.  However, when you see all the servers handling dirty dishes and then grab the toast out of the toaster with their bare hands, that just won't work for me.  I quit going there about 2 years ago for this very reason.  Then a friend told me they had quit doing that so I went back about 2 weeks ago.  Unfortunately they're still doing it.  I brought it to my servers attention and he said "Oh yeah, we're not supposed to be doing that.  I'll get you some more and I'll use gloves this time." Obviously, what goes on behind the scenes is probably much worse that this, but when they do it in front of you, it just makes you wonder how bad it really is behind the counters.  I'm done.  I wonder how many others observe this activity and just don't come back rather than saying anything.
This place hits the spot.  French pressed coffee is excellent, fresh squeezwd oj and delicious food.  This place made me a member of the clean plate club.

I used to love this place and the service. I come in here this morning the manager or owner is arguing with a couple. We finally get seated and the server is rude and they don't have what I want on the menu. I'll never come here again. Worst breakfast place ever I'd rather go to egg and I there service and food their is great. And they actually do have coffee cake unlike the pot of bread here.

Went for the first time this weekend with some friends and loved it. I had the Loco Moco and it was terrific. The gravy tasted like a brown gravy/teriyaki sauce and it was delicious. Eggs were cooked perfectly, the ribeye beef patty was tasty on it's own and combined with the rest of the dish it was perfect. I ate everything on my plate. I also added a cup of bread, which was basically a cinnamon roll in a mug with a sweet and tangy cream cheese frosting served on the side. I left full and happy. I want to go back and try the S'mores Waffles. This place is kind of far from where we live, but I will make the drive to go back again.
I travel for work and have ate at a lot of places this one is definitely #1! Great food and fantastic service

Unfortunately, we're going to stay away from this location after our last time here. We both ordered the steak & eggs, cooked medium... and both of ours came out looking burnt. And not surprisingly, both steaks were very well done. We're usually not ones to complain, but when our server came by to ask how the food was... well, we brought it up and she offered to have the kitchen cook up another steak. So okay, cool.  Sadly the next steak she brought out was even more well done than the original. How that was even possible, who knows. She offered another time to have another steak cooked up medium. 

How it was possible who knows, but each steak brought out was progressively cooked more and more well done.  There was absolutely no hint of pink in the middle or the sides or anywhere for that matter. The server was getting exasperated herself and kept apologizing profusely, and we didn't blame her at all. It wasn't her fault. But even after all that, the most they could do was take 15% off our bill.  That was a little disappointing. They failed to deliver an edible steak, and it felt like the fair thing would be to take one of the steak&egg orders off the bill. Especially when it was their kitchen staff's fault for messing up so badly, four different times. We didn't think it was a fair gesture, but we weren't going to make a big fuss over it. We're simply not ever going to return to this location.  

Sad because we enjoyed the first couple visits here.
Amazing!!! Came with a group and Ry our server was awesome. Service was great and food was wonderful. Have to try the Chilaquiles. Yummy! Coffee was excellent.

This is a great place to eat.  We ordered: the banana and frosted flake pancakes, the cinnamon crunch French toast, the steak omelet, and the ultimate steak and eggs..... All dishes were excellent.  Above all else, the food was top-notch.  We were seated quickly, and the waitress was friendly.  The food is a bit pricy, but it's all well worth it.  Highly recommends it!

Came in with my wife and friends for breakfast. It was our first time there. Menu had a wide selection of menu items. Our server Chris was so happy  and cheerful. Asked us if this was our first time here? Suggested some of her favorites. Went with Steak and eggs one of her favorites,  and my wife went with the servers suggestion  Veggie Benedict. Server told us about the pot bread she was so excited about us trying it. Food was quick and we loved our food. Server was attentive asked how we were doing. My wife and friends loved the atmosphere.  All the servers wore pajamas. Prices were fair. Chris was one of the best waitress we had in a while. Definitely well be back for the food and to see Chris again.
Food and service was great. Place was busy but we only had to wait 5 mins. Portions are big. I had the s&s burrito (see pic)
This place is great! Breakfast is made to order and perfect every time! Clean, spacious and a cute gimmick with the pajamas. Love living close to this spot!

Won't ever visit this place.  I ordered TO GO.  Yes, they were busy but after 25 minutes my food was not ready.   My daughter asked about our order and they had the nerve to try to give me my order that was sitting on the counter for at least 15 minutes. Made them give me a new order.  I will just eat on the northwest side of town from now on.
We found this restaurant on Yelp!  I'm glad we came for breakfast. Friendly and wonderful service...food was delicious!!

This used to be my favorite breakfast place.  However since the expansion the prices went up and the portions got smaller.  They're trying to be more fancy with slimmer cups so the milk you get is half of a regular glass.   I had a 3 egg meal and I know what I was served was not 3 eggs.  
It's sad because we came here frequently but now I think we'll find somewhere else.

I have eaten here about 15 times in the past 4 months and I have to say this is the very best place I have ever ate breakfast. Everything on the menu is great with plentiful servings, the place is super clean, the waitresses are all very friendly they make you feel good as soon as you walk in the door and their dress code is pajamas "how cool", this place also has a very nice decor. 

Highly recommended !
Loved my breakfast! Prepared just how I like it, good service & clean premises. I could do without the waitresses in their jammies, but that doesn't downgrade my rating. Thanks!

What a pleasant meal. We enjoyed the egg white and grilled chicken omelette, sunrise burrito, and silver dollar pancakes with fresh fruit. Everything was fresh and top quality.  We loved the cup o'bread too!  The cute servers in PJs and flower umbrellas above. I highly recommend eating here.

I order the biscuits and gravy to go.  I love 3 minutes away from this terrible establishment and by the time I got home I tried to cut into the biscuits and they were harder than a rock.  I even tried a steak knife to no avail.  I proceeded to call them back and the lady asked me if I want them remade.  I said absolutely not but u can refund my money since I couldn't eat what I just ordered.  Then I was told that they can't and won't do that.   By far the worst breakfast I ever had.  Was not even edible and the fact that I couldn't even get my money back is complete BS.  I will never patronize this place again and I'll make sure non of my friends do either.  Terrible food and service.  You've been warned.....

Awful service, waited 35 minutes to be seated. I asked if we could sit outside and was told the wait would be just as long but a group of younger African american women came 20 minutes after us and were seated IMMEDIATELY.. Why? After we finally were seated it took our waitress 12 minutes to take our order and in the middle of taking our order she walked away!! WTH? She then came back to finish taking our order. The food took 29 minutes and was below average at best. The pancakes tasted like flour or bisquick mix. The eggs were okay, bacon was a bit crispy for my liking. The best part of this restaurant is the maple syrup. Management needs to hire a more friendly and efficient staff. I do not recommend this place at all.

It shouldn't take 10 minutes to be seated (as a single diner) at an empty bar. Nor should it take another 10 minutes  before someone greets you and offers coffee...which never happened.  So, I got up and left.
Great local breakfast spot!! Staff is always friendly!! Love that they are all in pajamas! Food is great and I love their fresh juices!! Do yourself a favor and order fresh oj!!

I LOVE THE FOOD HERE!!
The service is slow every time, they take forever to seat you but its worth it. I love the chilaquiles & the Salsa Verde burrito is good too. I try something new every time and never disappoints. Try the Bagel Egg & Steak sandwich!!

once again.. satisfaction! if y'all havent tried this place.. its a MUST! awesome food and awesome service.. i would totally recommend this place to everyone. 

I tried the chicken and waffle today and i must say, the best i ever had. better than Roscoe chicken and waffle in hollywood. kudos to the chef!

Wow! I live in NYC and have had 50 dollar steaks not taste as good as this place! Super impressed with the quality vs the low price, totally worth skipping the normal ihop, Denny's, etc and trying something new and delicious. Get the spice rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles!

It was my birthday and my boyfriend offered to take me to breakfast. We yelped breakfast places and saw that Rise and Shine had gotten some harsh reviews about service, but the bf had been there before and said he didn't remember poor service being an issue. 

We decided to chance it. When we arrived, the hostess (the girl with nose ring) didn't welcome or acknowledge us. We waited and she finally just asked "how many?" and then didn't say anything like 'alright just have a seat' or 'it'll be just a minute please' which was awkward. 

Great, I thought. My boyfriend even commented about how awkward it was.

But I have to say that was the last of the disappointment because we were seated in about 5 minutes and our server (girl with glasses) was amazing! 

She was upbeat and kind and always there to keep our waters and coffees full (they serve Illy coffee which is THE BEST). And she was very attentive without smothering us. 

I got the cinnamon toast crunch french toast. It was actually a little burned. But it was still yummy. I ordered it as a platter so it came with sausage and eggs. 

Boyfriend ordered corned beef hash and liked it. It came with a pot of bread which really is like a little roll. It's cute but my guy was like "uhh do I just pull this out and eat it?" It's nothing too special. It has a cinnamon swirl in the middle which he shared with this birthday girl ;) 

We saw the owner, who has been mentioned in previous reviews, running around the restaurant seemingly doing stuff, at least very active, wearing slacks and a dress shirt. 

In summary:
If the french toast wasn't a little burned it would've been AMAAAZING. Although it was still enjoyable. 

Maybe the owner should have a talk w the hostess about how she's the first impression anyone who comes in gets of the establishment. 

Order their coffee because Illy is the best!!

Overall, my boyfriend and I felt that it was evident that they read the yelp reviews and make adjustments accordingly. We thought this was great.

Just sat down and ordered. I always start a review with 5 stars and work down from there. 

This place has an awesome menu - I had a hard time deciding, so I went for eggs eggs Benedict because it's my fave. Doug and the baby had pancakes and Doug had bacon on the side. He also ordered watermelon strawberry juice, which he didn't like. I took a sip and can see why - it's an all natural juice with no added sugar. Not really a kids beverage; I, on the other hand, loved it.

They brought out warm syrup!!! That wowed me. But the pancakes didn't need it. They were fluffy and light and had their own sweetness to them that made them delicious plain. The eggs Benedict had an unexpected but interesting balsamic reduction drizzled on top that made me an instant fan. I didn't get to try Doug's bacon because he devoured all 5 pieces before I got a chance but it looked great. Sightly thick and cooked perfectly. 

The decor was cute, umbrellas for lights and fans and the servers wore pjs:) LOVED IT!!

If I lived in Vegas, this would be my go to breakfast place!

I don't know why this place has 4 stars.. It should clearly be 2-3 due to the lack of service. They are so slow!!! They wear pajamas and the pajamas fit their service. I don't even want to talk about the food bc no matter how good or bad the food was.. The service made it all taste terrible!!!!!!!! Bad bad service I can't stress enough. They are so slow it blows my mind. Only come here if u hv a 2 hour breakfast window. And it wasn't even busy when this whole meal was happening.
I love this place! My husband and I come every weekend :) good food, great servers, great atmosphere! I love the servers in pjs and the umbrellas on the ceiling.  restaurant with personality!

I'm not sure what's going on with this place. I used to love it. Becoming complacent perhaps? 2 attempts at a ribeye to make it rare and it was well done every time. Then I was still charged almost the same when they added the eggs and hash browns a la Then the audacity to charge me $3 for gravy too. Very disappointed here..
We had the homemade corned beef and hash, steak and eggs chilaquiles, the ultimate steak and eggs which came with cup of bread. Definitely come back again
This place is amazing. Great atmosphere, great service, and most of all great food. You must try the French press coffee.
This place is rad... Their steak omelet is on point. Also try the jalape√±o hot sauce on the rack it's so good.
Good neighborhood breakfast place. Cute staff dressed in PJs. Heard they are expanding which is good because there's always a big line...

Few times I am surprised when it comes to brkfst. Eggs are eggs. This place really rocks. Stopped by on the way home to LA. 

Best steak & Eggs for the hubby. Kids loved the pot of bread. I recommend the corned beef hash extra crispy. The french press coffee a plus! 

Take the family. U won't be disappointed. Ask for Lisa. Just the sweetest waitress ever. The pjs are a cute touch.
Food was good, atmosphere was cute, but WAY overpriced for just some breakfast. Small place so a little crowded. Overall, not worth the wait or price.

We have eaten here twice so far and both times our meals were excellent. The staff is super friendly and the service is top notch. 

The first time I was there I got the steak and eggs with the pot of bread. I absolutely loved the hash browns. 

The second time I got an egg white omelette with spinach, avocado and salsa.  The salsa is delicious. 

Overall, this place is a great value with delicious food and wonderful service. A++

I love everything about this place! From the umbrellas hanging from the ceiling to the servers in pajamas. The coffees were yummy and they have a juice bar!  Between the six of us we had practically everything on the menu, and everyone loved their food. Chicken & waffles, biscuits & gravy, Crunchy Cinnamon French Toast, and Bananas Frosted Flake Pancakes were all totally over-the-top good! It was one of my daughters birthdays and they brought her a "pot of bread" with whipped cream, sprinkles, and a pink candle. She said that, and the servers in jammies made it her favorite
