Wonderful food & great service. We will definitely be back any time we are in town!
Probably the best breakfast I had in Vegas. Unbelievable food with great prices. Such a refreshing break from the food on the strip. Definitely have to go back for more.

Food was pretty good.  Nothing great.

Server ruined the dining experience.   I was trying to explain the menu to my elderly father and the server insists on speaking over us to get the order in at her convenience.  

Also, she had the nerve to sit where we (my father, sister and I) were seated to take the order of the table next to us.   This happened 7-27-2014.   She (server) was obnoxious in behaving that way.   Aside from that, she refilled our drinks quickly.
Best place to come when you are visiting Vegas cheap great service and very very amazing food

Over priced for mediocre  food. Almost everything on the menu starts at $12.99 per dish. Plain old breakfast with waffles/pancakes/eggs shouldn't  cost $12.99 an order. The waffles came out soggy and cold. Service was really really slow.

Wow!!! Everything was amazing. We had a big group and got some breakfast and lunch plates.  Everything was bomb from soup to pancakes....staff was friendly and helpful.... thank god I live close so I can be a regular from now on.
Ps try the chicken wrap

Ultimate breakfast place.  Delicious food, great decor, awesome service!   I had the cinnamon toast crunch French toast.  I couldn't stop eating it...to die for!  Friends had the hash browns and omelets and loved it.  Will be back to try their other menu items!

New place for us, tried it because a friend recommended it.  Servers are dressed in PJ's, ours was prompt and polite.  Smaller menu, a little more pricey than most breakfast joints.  The kitchen is open air , so with the radio blasting, cooks singing along to the music, and the constant shuffle of the plates and silverware it's a bit noisy.  Distracting from the nice quiet breakfast we were expecting.

 I ordered the Steak/Spinach Benedict and she ordered the Ham and egg Benedict  My plate has a good sized portion, but once I cut into the steak I find its mostly gristle and fat. The hash-browns were good. 

 The Ham and egg Benedict was missing hollandaise, and the  aged-balsamic sauce.  Requested from our waitress and promptly received. 

Probably will not be returning to dine again, the noise was a big factor.

Had Breakfast there this morning.  By the way we've been going there since it opened and still like their food.  Husband ordered Chicken Fried Steak and I had Biscuits and Gravy.  Tasty as always, but as always I had to send it back because it comes out Luke Warm. 

We were disappointed to find out that when my husband asked for additional gravy because the gravy that comes with Chicken Fried Steak does not cover it.  To get more it costs $3.95 for that small small bowl. 

 Not good to start charging for something you didn't charge for before.  Give enough to cover the dish that is ordered so that you customers don't feel slighted.

This is the 2nd attempt to try this restaurant,...and the last!  Standing in front of the hostess stand for 10 minutes,...with hostess on other side of stand,...empty tables available, and hostess never once looked up!  When I asked how long of a wait,... She still basically ignored us.  There was at least 2-3 additional parties forming A line, waiting to be acknowledged!  Another waitress. Also came by and returned menus, but also ignored everyone!  Horrible customer service!

In Vegas for a week vacation and went to Rise & Shine for breakfast.  I have been to many great breakfast locations in the U.S.; this is truly one of the best and they have reasonable prices.  I had the Chicken and Waffles...the chicken was battered prefectly, it was juicy and tasty.  The waffle was delicious and they used real maple syrup with cinnamon sticks inside the bottle.  I also had an excellent banana smoothie.  The service was fast and delivered with a smile.  Overall, very satisfying.  A must when visiting Las Vegas!

Loved this place. Food was good and plentiful and the staff were great. Loved the PJs each one wore and the t-shirts worn by the bus people ("spooning leads to forking") were fun!  I had the breakfast burrito and my husband had the stack of 4 pancakes - both were excellent. Always had hot coffee and wait staff seemed to really like their job. Made me happy to be there.
Chicken Cobb Salad is the best I've ever had. Only breakfast before, but my Realtor and I had lunch there today. Get a to go box. Can't eat it all even if you try.

My fiance came here about a month ago and could not stop raving about it.  So today we tried it with some friends visiting from out of town.  For starters, service was great!  Most of the employees looked happy and comfortable in their pj's. Which is a great concept accept when you can see lint balls on the fabric.  Not very visually appealing. 

So, 3 of us ordered some kind of steak and asked for it to be cooked either medium or medium-rare. They all came out well. For a place that is advertised as a "steak and eggs" restaurant one would think they can cook steaks correctly.  

My friend did say this place is a "hit or miss" place.  Today was a miss.

Wow I can't believe all these good reviews for this place! I was so excited when this place opened cause I love breakfast spots and this is literally a block away from my house. Went about six months ago and had the worst experience. There was only two other tables occupied and couldn't believe how slow the service was. ordered basic breakfast of eggs over bacon home fries and toast plus fresh orange juice. The eggs were overdone and the potatoes were so strange. Consistency and texture of glue! Yuck!!! The only thing good was the fresh squeezed juice. Was so damn dissapointed. Chalked it up to another crappy place in Southern Highlands. Wonder if something has changed in the last 6 months... Maybe I will try it one more time. Did I catch it on a VERY off day?? Hmm
Great breakfast place.  The staff serves you in their pajamas.   Feels like home!  Food is great.... have never been disappointed!

Went back gave them another shot after the gm responded to my post. They did not know I was coming in and the service was great food was good again. 

This place does care!

First time here for, Natasha (wife) and I.
The place is very nicely decorated and the kitchen; which you can see into, is very clean.
We sat at the bar and had a clear view of the action in the kitchen. The cooks were all in a good mood and suggested a couple of dishes. We ended up ordering the chilaquiles, and chicken and waffles. 
They were big servings. The food was crafted with care and prepared fresh before us. 
The kitchen staff was also very entertaining.

Overall the food is fresh and very tasty, it is prepared with care and attention to detail. The place offers a nice atmosphere for small and large groups. The wait staff was also attentive but never overbearing. 
 
Great place, so don't be shy and give it a try.
This is our go to breakfast spot! We absolutely love Rise and Shine! The eggs benedict is ourstanding!

After coming back a couple of times, we kept getting really disappointing service. 

They also have too many bad table locations with zero ambiance. Especially if you come in after the morning rush since multiple tables stay dirty for long periods of time. 

There are important factors other than food that make a cafe a good one, in my opinion. 

We tried their Summerlin location but that one has even worse customer service. It must be a chain thing. 

Save yourself some money and time. 

There are way too many great breakfast places in this city to go to a mediocre one like this one.
First time here recommended by one of my friends great coffee great pancakes awesome biscuits and gravy worth the 15 minute drive from the strip

I am so happy we found this place!! We were leaving Vegas and wanted some breakfast outside of Vegas and on the way home to CA.  Found this cute place off Yelp.  

Hubby ordered their Ultimate steak and eggs which comes with a ribeye, eggs, and hash browns.  I ordered their special which was Southern friend chicken breast and biscuits with eggs.  I was so happy when it came out, I couldn't wait to dig in.  I fell in love at first bite!  

We definitely will be stopping by again whenever we make it out to Vegas.
I've been here twice and have had breakfast (biscuits and gravy) and lunch (French onion soup and California salad-I think).  Service was good the first time (lunch) and great the second time.

I don't EVER get out of my downtown and China town bubble, but I was diggin on this chick that lives right around this place and we went there for breakfast one day. The outside doesn't make it look very appealing, but once inside the wait staff and management were super friendly and attentive to all of our needs. I ordered the chicken fried steak ( which was an actual breaded steak! ) the scrambled eggs and the pot of bread which were absolutely amazing!  I loathe going to the suburbs even for a hookup, but I would go that far this food. ( that says quite a bit about the food if I wouldn't drive there for a hookup, but I would drive there for this food)  I hope they open one close to downtown, so I can leave The Egg and I and go to this place!!!

Me and the wife were getting tired of the old chain restaurant breakfast places like Denny's and IHOP. As well as the mostly crappy casino breakfast buffets In our area of Anthem Highlands.. Green Valley ranch buffet is just garbage and the M is a little better but still tastes like casino breakfast buffet food.. 

So i simply went to google and typed in best breakfast las vegas and Rise & Shine showed up on yelp with a solid 4 star rating, So we decided to give it a shot and i'm glad we did!!

 We showed up on a saturday morning around 1030am and were seated right away. The place seems clean and up to date with ipad registers.. The waitress came to our table within 3 minutes of us sitting there and took the drink orders and asked if we need a few minutes to look over the menu.. Upon her return I Ordered the Ultimate steak&eggs breakfast with the optional 3 eggs with a Pot of Bread" I didn't know what it was either so i just ordered it,.. Its basically a cinnamon roll baked in a small pot,.. The wife ordered the Belgian waffle platter with a side of hashbrowns.. The food came out piping hot after only about 15 minutes. 

The food was very delicious and the portions were decent. The ribeye had a very delicious spice rub that made the steak hardly require any steak sauce and it was very tender., Our drinks were also filled very promptly without even asking."A Pet Peeve of mine" I'm only knocking a star because the ribeye steak was a little on the thin side and i asked for Medium and it came out Medium Well. Also i asked for Over Medium eggs and they came out Over Easy. But Overall the food was Fantastic and we left full. $34 not including tip. We will definitely be returning.!

Visiting Las Vegas this weekend on our way out of town we stumbled across this gem. The Waitress was lovely and the food delicious with quick service. The only thing that would make the place my go to spot when in town would be some gluten free options! Hope to see that in the future!
Place was okay, food items were wayyyy overly prices and food was sub par honestly, dont care to ever come back here breakfast failure

The food is great!!! Tried a lot on the menu. the best is probably the spice rubbed chilaquiles. It's out of this world! They have really good coffee and juice selections. It's a must try if your in the area. Oh and the wear their PJ's super comfy place.

The hostess in the pink and black polka dot pajamas was bitchy rude seated people before us when asking about it got snotty attitude   The food was sub par eggs Benedict came hard boiled. As the waiter he was sorry and was told they were short staffed. Not into excuses.  They did give  a small discount on the Benedict. 2 bites of the Benedict and was done.

I should have written this review a long time ago. We HAD been customers of this establishment from the day they opened their doors.  In the beginning, it was great! Great service, Great food, etc... slowly it all started to diminish.  Our last visit was HORRIBLE, we waited forever for the not so busy waitress to take our order, then waited even longer for our food. Never received a refill of coffee the entire time we were there.  I asked the manager when we were leaving if it had changed hands, and he said no.  I wrote a comment card requesting the owner call me. never received a call. When I received their monthly email, I replied to it asking that someone contact me about the HORRIBLE service we received and still never received a call.. Instead they removed me from the email list, because that was the last time I received an email from them

There are MUCH better options in Southern Highlands, this place is WAY WAY overpriced for what you receive... Take your money some place else!

Breakfast is our favorite meal of the day and we were so excited when we found this local breakfast spot.  The wait is long on the weekends but definitely worth it.  I love eggs benedict and their steak and eggs benedict is delicious!  Don't forget to get the pot of bread with your entree.

We love this place!! The service always quick and friendly and the juice bar is to die for! The open kitchen concept makes it fun to see how the kitchen runs and works so hard! The wait staff are dressed in PJs which is exactly how you wish you were really dressed before the coffee and first meal of the day, (or last;))They offer a variety of great food for both lunch and dinner. Breakfast meals set the tone for the day and we always leave here highly satisfied, thank you to all the staff!! We will continue to come back.
Eggs Benedict with balsamic is amaaaazing! Great customer service and low wait times for seating and food delivery. Check this place out for a great breakfast!
Good breakfast, cute decor. The breakfast options are very good and the prices are reasonable. The service was not bad either. When I am in town I would come back here for breakfast.

So the first thing you notice are the floral umbrellas on the ceilings. The servers uniforms are unique are wearing Pajamas. The staff is friendly. 

The "must try pot of bread" was alright. It was a little hard. The presentation was cute. However, it is messy to eat because of the sprinkles of powder. I got a biscuits instead it was a little crispy and toasted too much. 

The ultimate steak and eggs was good. 
The side of bacon was too crispy.

Overall this place is alright.

I took my wife here after reading all the reviews on Yelp. This is officially our FAVORITE breakfast place EVER! -- FAIR WARNING: Once you eat here it's going to be hard to eat at places like Denny's and IHOP again, it's that good!

My wife had Chicken and Waffles with Pot of Bread (Cinnamon) and iced tea.

I had Steak and chilaquiles (just a fancy word for nachos) with eggs over easy + French Pressed coffee to drink -- I also ordered some extra gravy with the biscuit that came with my meal

Our whole meal was about $35... not too bad.

Everything tasted PERFECT -- The coffee had me on 10,000 hyper mode and my appetite kicked in... and the added surprise was that the "nachos" had this BBQ beans on it -- you let that egg run + avocado + bbq beans + sour cream and the blend is CRAZY GOOD

My wife said it was the best fried chicken she's ever had and the batter they used was to die for. The waitress was sweet enough to give my wife some FREE cinnamon cream cheese stuff (that NORMALLY goes on the red velvet pancakes) for her pot of bread because the waitress tried it herself before and was basically suggesting we try that. Love tips like this.

I consider myself a connoisseur of corned beef hash, finding myself ordering it almost every breakfast restaurant I go, often being greatly disappointed with the dog food-like slop I am frequently served which is lacking in color, flavor, and texture.  

However, my trip to Rise & Shine a steak and egg place provided me with one of the best corned beef hash entrees I've ever had. The pulled corned beef had a great sear on it with a nice malliard browning along with some caramelized onions, red skin potatoes, and two eggs over easy and I was in corned beef nirvana.  The owners really spent some time perfecting this simple yet amazing dish.

The place is quaint with a creative decor and spinning umbrellas line the ceiling, a friendly homey staff and lavazza coffee, fresh pressed orange juice made fresh daily make it a breakfast spot not to miss!  Rumor is they are opening up another one in summerlin.  Can't wait to try it!

Wow! Talk about generous portions, this place was very good.  We found it on Yelp and the other reviews were right on. From the pajama clad servers, to the pleasant atmosphere, I'd return here again and again. The prices were not inexpensive, but the food was tasty and ample. From pancakes to French toast, OJ that tasted fresh squeezed (I don't know if it actually was) and coffee that was satisfying, the experience was good and worth going out of your way for.

This place was a little more unique with servers wearing pajamas as their uniforms, and cool decorated parasol lights and fans hanging from the ceiling. We got seated right away although it was busy. It was nice being able to get fresh squeezed orange juice and other juices there. The food was overpriced though and honestly not as good as Ihop omelettes and hashbrowns. Eggs seemed a little overcooked and not as seasoned and fluffy as Id like and not enough cheese in the  omelette. The cup o bread is unique and like a fluffy fresh baked tiny bread roll with frosting to dip it in. I recommend it. Servers were nice and got us everything we needed. Overall it was ok, but i wouldnt miss it if I never went again.

Took my daughters for a late breakfast and because I had eaten earlier, I opted for a cheeseburger. Man alive, I couldn't believe how great it was. 

Burger was great... cooked perfectly, tasty and hard to finish. Fries were crispy and season perfectly.  I've eaten burgers all over town, including on the strip.  This burger is now toward the very top of the list. 

Only negative? $30 (plus tip) for a kids meal, an order of pancakes and a burger.

Just had our first experience here and we were very favorably impressed with the food and the service. The hostess and cashier were super nice and seemed genuinely happy that we were there on a busy Sunday morning. Our waitress, Maria, did a great job explaining the menu and providing attentive service. Our food came out hot and delicious. I tried pancakes and eggs and was really surprised how delicious the food was. It was a conservative first try but I feel if they get that right other options are worth checking out next time. My wife really enjoyed the salmon and Lox omelet. I highly recommend this spot for a nice breakfast experience.

In every way, this place is 5-star. The menu offers a wide variety of sweet (the cinnamon crunch French toast was the best French toast I've ever had-no exaggeration) and savory (country fried steak and eggs-yummmm!!!). Our waitress, Laurel, was friendly and informative without being intrusive. And the decor was well thought-out with plenty of room for each party (i.e., you're not elbow to elbow with the table next to you). Definitely coming back...and
bringing friends and family with me!
Wonderful place with amazing food. Bright and airy atmosphere and sevice was terrific. We will be adding to our favorites!

it's not "Chicken & Waffles....", but it's "Chicken & Waffle"!  and oh my lord is it GREAT!  Freshly Squeezed OJ hit the spot too.. This place is so worth the drive to Southern Highlands.  We went on a Saturday just before noon, and a party of 5 of us only waited less than 10 minutes for a seat.  This is a must try!!

Service very friendly. Interesting menu with red velvet pancakes, French press coffee, real maple syrup and fresh baked-bread. Southern food offerings like fried chicken & waffles, which comes with homemade cinnamon rolls --what I ordered. In a large shopping center, so tricky to find with just address.

Place is really cute and love the theme of wait staff wearing pj's but the meals were very over priced and the kids pancakes were a joke there were 3 tiny pancakes and the kids' meals don't include drinks.  Glad we tried it but won't go back.
The food was delicious.  The service very pleasant and fast.  Loved the pajamas the the staff wore.

this place was great, everyone was super friendly, and I was a little jealous that the servers were running around in PJ's and I was wearing normal clothes. 

the food was really good, I got the French Toast, it was super delicious. definitely want to go back and try the other stuff on the menu
Good food, good service. Sweet or savory they have the options. Waitresses are very nice and adorable in their pajama uniforms.

I used to love his place but I am so disgusted by the prices and the service. I have never had a waitress (Amber) be so cold and rude for absolutely no reason. My food was 27 dollars for one waffle, 4 slices of French toast and probably about 4 bites eggs. The ONLY thing that was good about this place was the young girl at the front. She was so busy but still so kind. I gave her more of a tip than the actually "waitress" because she actually deserved it.

I ordered the N.Y. Steak and Eggs it was tough and dry.  The eggs were under cooked and the cook took away part of my eggs. Our server never checked back with us to see if everything was ok or to see if we needed refills drinks or coffee.

I'm going to start out by saying that I've been to the Southern Highlands location probably a dozen times, and love it. 
Yesterday my friend and I were out in Henderson, and decided to stop  because he had been to this one before, and enjoyed the loco moco that they don't serve at the SH location. 
I ordered an egg white omelet with chicken sausage, mushrooms and onions, and he ordered the loco moco. I received my "cup o' bread" rather quickly, and just like SH, it was fantastic, and thank goodness because that's pretty much when I stopped eating. 

Our food arrived, and I went to put some Tabasco sauce on my eggs. Big mistake! You know how you do things out of force of habit? Well, I foolishly turned the bottle upside down, only to find out the hard way that they had removed the stopper that regulates the pour, resulting in about 3 tablespoons of hot sauce dumped on my omelet. I started to soak it up with napkins, both on top of the omelet, and underneath. figured it would be fine now, so preceded to eat. After a few bites, I lost my appetite. Even after using napkins, there was an absurd amount of butter at the bottom of the plate, and in the omelet itself. I love butter just as much as the next person, but this was a disgusting amount. The other part that disturbs me is that generally when an order for just egg whites is placed, the kitchen usually knows that the person is trying to go the healthier route and doesn't want their food soaked in half a stick of butter (heck, they even have a healthier section on their menu with egg whites listed as the primary options). I finally ended up just picking out some mushrooms and sausage, and quit. 
My friend was struggling with his meal too. He asked me if something was wrong, and I told him it was just soaked in butter, he said his was as well, and that he was getting a little nauseous from it. 
Our waiter came by about 30 seconds after we first received our food and said, "I know it just got here but is everything ok?" we foolishly said yes prior to even trying anything. When he returned about 10 minutes later, he didn't even ask if something was wrong considering our food hadn't been touched, he just refilled my friend's drink, and we asked for the check. For a regular brewed coffee, a soda, egg white omelet and loco moco, we ended up with a $35 bill (without tip). We left our 90% uneaten food on the table, paid up front and left. 

Needless to say, I will stick with the SH location from here on out, but honestly, I'm so mad that I wasted $41 including the tip for a meal I didn't even eat, that I might not be going back to that one for a long time either.
Ham steak breakfast is the best I've had in years. Good atmosphere and friendly staff. Will make it a ongoing spot when we return to Vegas for breakfast.

Hands down the worst breakfast place in Las Vegas, the food is disgusting and the service is horrible. I tried it twice due to living only a mile or less away, and I have to say that the second time was even worse than the first. This is perhaps the slowest, rudest, and most offensive place to a foodie palate. If you want a good bite in the morning check out DW Bistro or even EggWorks.
While at a basketball tournament we stopped here between games and it was a very good choice (thanks Yelp). Portions were huge and the breakfast was great. If in town again we'd definitely be back

Best Corned Beef Hash I've ever had. Soooo good. Also, the eggs were cooked perfectly. The French press coffee was really nice. The bread in a cup was better than I thought it would be. Perfect portion sizes. Off the strip, so not crazy busy, which translated to virtually no wait time. Now I know why this place has so many good reviews.
I found this place on yelp last year and couldn't wait to come back. The cup o' bread is awesome! Great breakfast and very nice staff.

Came here on A Saturday for breakfast...  Outstanding food, fun atmosphere (servers are dressed in Pajamas) and pancakes to die for. Love this place...  Will certainly come again. 
The upside down ceiling umbrellas are so creative---

Absolutely love this place. The moment you walk in, you'll know that you're inside a breakfast establishment as the employees are still in their pajamas. There are also umbrellas on the ceiling which adds a nice touch to the room. I tried the chicken waffle and it was amazing. It's not spicy but the spice in it is really good. It gets your senses going. It came with biscuit but I got charged the gravy on the side and I was not told. If you want a satisfying breakfast, you cannot go wrong with this place.

This was probably the best steak and eggs I've ever had, amazing service. I tried the freshly squeezed orange juice they have, and let me tell you it's taste like you're bitting into an orange. I don't know how else to explain it but it was the best!

I usually come here because it is around my neighborhood.  Today was really bad.  We had to wait so long for our food which are just eggs and waffles.  The coffee I was given was not hot.  The eggs were overcooked and my son did not get the bananas on his waffle.  The waitress did not even check on us!  I felt like we were being discriminated because we were Asian! I am usually patient and forgiving but I just wanted to walk out.  I will not come here again!
Perfect breakfast... Perfect service, quaint, clean restaurant. I simply can't recommend this place enough.

It's too bad I can't leave negative stars. 3 of us saw the great yelp reviews and decided to come. It's not an understatement to say EVERYTHING went wrong: it took a while just to get ice water (no lemon as requested), when the coffee finally came there was grandma pink lipstick predominantly displayed which was replaced with no apology, I ordered the daily special to which the server had no clue what I was talking about and went to check the board himself while telling us the board was new and no one tells him about anything there, I ordered the lox bagel--a few mins later the server came back to ask what bagel I would like--about 10 min after that the server comes back to tell me that the special isn't available until tomorrow. He says the other 2 meals will up out shortly and will bring a menu back to me so I can order something else. We decided to just leave without the food...
This doesn't include the server calling me "sir", telling us about how cranky he is in the morning and sharing about how he wrote 'iced' for our waters and couldn't remember if it was tea or water. Fail!

Was in on September 1st and had server Ashley Silva, the service was excellent and so was the food.  We were visiting from Arizona and she was very polite, helpful and talkative with my guest and I (she at first said she was afraid of my shoulders haha) but she was a great server and started our trip off well.  I would highly recommend this breakfast establishment and A+ service to any local or out of town guest.
First time here. It was great. Our waitress was Laura. She was the best. Even the busboy was a great assist. Try the cup-o-bread!

This place is absolutely amazing!!! Friendly and food is ridiculously good..every time we come here or we make it a point to try something different on the menu and everything has been excellent!!They seem to have their own little twist on their menu... food is good and fresh to order flavorful and fun to eat!! Portions are huge so come hungry!!! Highly recommended

I really wanted to like this place after all of these great reviews and the look of the menu but Rise and Shine fell short of my expectations. I have to say that the atmosphere was nice and we were seated very quickly. The waitress took our drink orders immediately and the service started off great. I was vey excited that they served Illy coffee being a huge coffee fanatic but they ruined a terrific bean and rather expensive one by burning it. This is by far the worst cup of Illy i've ever had. 
The menu look fantastic and my wife ordered the croissant French toast with blue berries and I had the chicken fried steak. The French toast was nothing like advertised and actually should of been called bread pudding since the consistency was equivalent. The mound of fresh blueberries on top was a nice touch. The wife was not to thrilled about the dish probably because mentally she was prepared for something else, I thought it was just okay. My country fried steak was disappointing , extremely chewy with bits of tendons everywhere, the gravy was good and the hash browns was the best part of the dish. Dont be fooled about the picture of the pot of bread, although it appears fancy, it had no taste and was cold. I will give this place another shot someday but not anytime soon.
Great coffee, Good Food and Friendly wait staff. Solid all around off strip dining.
This place was so delicious! I had the omelet and my boyfriend had the chicken and waffles! Both so good. We loved our server Amber! She was so sweet :)
Love this place!! Breakfast was amazing the bread in a cup was delicious, Maria was our server and she did a great job! Great customer service this place is one of my favorite breakfast restaurant.

Really cute breakfast place! Brightens up the morning to see wait staff in PJs and the cute flower "fans" dangling from the ceiling and other whimsical decor. Service was friendly like a family diner. This is the place to go for a large breakfast. We tried the steak with poached eggs and bread in a cup. I ordered some extra sides (avocado, eggs, etc.) and there was definitely enough food for two people. The prices are on the higher side which is why it's 4-stars, but it's a nice place to have a family breakfast. They have outdoor seating for nice days or if you are bringing a furry companion.

Absolutely delicious!!!! Great service and atmosphere. Will be back again. Everything is from scratch. Hash browns and chicken fried steak was ridiculously amazing! I had the bagel sandwich with bacon, avacado and turkey. The boyfriend and had chicken fried steak and in a content food coma!

No complaints about service or attitude.  The place is stripped down diner decor, but neat and clean.  I ordered eggs Benedict and, as an almost after thought the server asked if I wanted Worcester sauce with it .  I said "yes" - big, big mistake.  It came with so much Worcester sauce that I could hardly see the eggs.  I'm sure that neither the server nor the cook has ever eaten Eggs Benedict plastered like this.  I tasted nothing but the sauce.  To those who don't eat Worcester sauce:  a little goes a long way.  

Note to management: If you want to offer Worcester sauce, put a bottle on the table and let the customer help himself.  In short: good food (I suppose) ruined.

Such a great breakfast place. I love to go to different restaurants in different cities to try their eggs benedicts, and their's doesn't disappoint. They take a classier approach to the breakfast staple; the classic elements are still there, perfectly toasted English muffin, runny, poached egg, and a creamy hollandaise sauce. But then they top it all off with a balsamic drizzle that is tart and compliments the hollandaise sauce perfectly. It comes with a side of crispy hash browns and don't forget to try their pot of bread! Their pot of bread is a fluffy, lightly sweet, hot piece of cinnamon bread that is served with frosting. Amazing place!

I've been here multiple times, and it's always satisfying.

I have been to the Southern Highlands branch and both restaurant have great decor and a lovely staff. 

Today I had the Cup O'Bread and the Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles and boy, was it tasty. I asked for a medium rare steak and did they deliver! The steak was juicy and nicely charred on the outside, giving it an authentic smokey taste. Though this may have been the main part of the dish, the ranchero chips may have slightly outperformed the steak. Their chips are housemade and seasoned with a multitude of spices, with a basis that seems to be paprika and cayenne pepper. The chips laid on a bed of refried beans and was topped with eggs (any style you choose), avocado, cheddar and cotija cheese. The chips were still crunchy and was served with a side of sour cream and salsa. I recommend getting overeasy eggs, so when you break the yolk it adds an extra sauce to your chips.

Overall a very wonderful experience and I can't wait to come back!
Food and coffee were sooooo good!  I had the eggs Benedict but wanna come back and try their namesake steak & eggs!  I totally need to bring Rick here!

For a great place to go the morning after a late night of fun, Rise & Shine is the best little secret in South LV.  The ribeye chilaquiles is the perfect cure to that hangover!  

As soon as you walk-in, the air is filled with cinnamon-spiced potted bread that smells and tastes delicious!  The staff is friendly, attentive and will serve you in their PJ's.

If you're coming to visit Vegas and want to take a trip into town, I highly recommend to get yourself down to Rise & Shine! 

Absolutely yummy!

Updating and Upgrading my Review.

Had a wonderful breakfast here the other day.

In addition to great food, what made it really fantastic was our server, Cary.

Cary made us feel like we were her special guests and certainly her favorite table. Every visit  - whether to take an order, serve a dish, or just to refill coffee, came with a friendly smile, a quick chat, and a laugh. The place was super busy on a Sunday morning, but we felt really taken care of.  We couldn't help but notice that she seemed to be treating her other tables equally well. 

My date is a bartender at a high-end restaurant in town, and his comment was "She's a serious pro!". 

This kind of service and attitude - and not just by Cary, but by everyone on the staff that we met - makes it worthy of a five-star review - makes it worth the slightly higher than average prices - and assures that we will be regulars here.

Thank You, and Well Done!

Absolutely amazing!!! Great service and even better food! Huge, home made delicious portions. Very family friendly. Manager is great! We have a 2 yr old and they go out of their way to make every trip fun. Vegas needs more places like this! One of the best breakfast places in town.
Delish!  Loved the crunchy cinnamon French toast.  The bacon was great also.  Portions are HUGE.  Will definitely go again.

My friend and I have visited this wonderful breakfast place several times and will be back several more. The waitstaff is wonderful always taking care of the customer. The food is excellent. I have nothing bad at all to say. Go visit and try it for yourself.
Trust me when I say get the Chilaquiles! It's a side of sour cream ;) Nothing else even compares to how good things are. The oj and the green go-go juice are my fav drinks.
We have been here a few times and feel the service is getting worst each time. Slow service and the orders were wrong. The menu is great and the food just ok.

My kids and I enjoyed our breakfast very much at the Southern Highlands location. Portion sizes are great and we loved the fresh squeezed oj. Ashley was our server and took great care of us. The kids are already asking if we can come back again soon!

Our last day in Vegas so we hit up Yelp for a suggestion for Steak and Eggs, one of the best meals of the trip, just a few minutes from South Point, open for breakfast and lunch only, great service, fair price, small local place.

Had no idea this place would be as good as the pictures looked. When always reading ratings most people are four stars and rarely fives anymore. This place deserves a 5 or close to it. Great service, interesting choice in attire where the servers where pjs lol but it's cool. Beautiful inside and even more amazing to eat outside on a beautiful morning. 
Besides the appearance and feeling you get being in there comes the food! When going through the pics on here everything g looks good so here is what we found out..... EVERYTHING IS AMAZING AND FRESH AND MOUTHWATERING!!!!! From basic eggs, hash browns to the chicken and waffles and fresh squeezed oj. You got to save room for the bread in a cup thing which should be eaten first or maybe have the waitress wait to bring it out so it's super warm and more amazing. But yes love this place and will be coming here every time we stop in Vegas. 
Oh yeah wait time for party of two was a minute if that so don't worry it's worth it. Thank you for being amazing we love your establishment.

We are new (two years) to the LV Valley, and live in the Seven Hills area of Henderson. There is no lack of restaurants in the area, so we've been doing our best to try new places we've never been before. Sadly, we have tried a few breakfast spots and none have wowed us. Until now. We finally found a decent place with good food. Rise & Shine is a bit far away in Southern Highlands, but at least it's easy traveling time, not near the strip. It's in a outdoor mini mall area with an Ace Hardware store and a supermarket. We had to go to Ace early Sunday, and decided to try the place. It was decent size and cute decor, and the servers wear their pajamas, which took a second to register at first, but cute idea. Big menu, with lots to choose from. My husband had the daily special chicken fried steak and gravy, and loved it. I ordered the chicken and waffles, and was blown away at how good it was. Even better, in my opinion, than Roscoe's in California, but I'm sure some will disagree.

The chicken breast was flattened and fried, but the flavor was rich and deep, and the batter was so crispy and flavorful. I asked, and the server said it was just salt, pepper, and flour, but it must have been dipped in buttermilk, because it really was exceptional. The waffle was light and fluffy, and their logo was stamped in the middle. The piece of chicken was huge, which was good because I took half home and ate it for breakfast the next day.

They have something called a pot of bread, which is a hybrid of a cinnamon roll stuff in a cup. We didn't try it, but will next time.

We were there at 7 am when it opened, so the crowd wasn't big, but they obviously had regular customers with whom they were really friendly.  Only downfall is that it's a bit cher...Our two meals with coffee and a hot chocolate came to about $40. So not something to do everyday, but for a nice Sunday breakfast out.

I was on my way out of town and I wanted that last great meal before I was subjected yet again to horrors of the menu my trainer has had us on for the past 2 months.

This spot is tucked away in a residential neighborhood and if it wasn't for Yelp, I would have missed this breakfast gem.  By the looks of it, it's a locals favorite and a great family restaurant. 

While I waited 20 minutes I reviewed the menu via this wonderful app. The consistent review was the Chilaquiles (Chi-la-key-less) for those non latin tongues. Equally for those who know what traditional Chilaquiles should taste like, these are not it. Although don't discount this dish out. This version is more of a Tex-Mex spin but it's worthy of my taste buds.

Before I started the meal I ordered a good ol' cup of Joe served generously in a large mug fit for the most caffeine frenzied freak. Trust me avoid all offers of carb delights and only order the pot of bread.  This simple but yet inventive cinnamon roll served in a juxtaposed mug of coffee is a must have. Paired with a cup of coffee it reminds you why you woke up this morning... to enjoy life with a slice of sunshine.  Just with this simple start, this establishment lives up to its glorious name. 

Onto the main dish, spiced rubbed ribeye steak chilaquiles. I thought it was served with strips of steak. Oh no my friend, you get a grade cut of steak worthy of any red blooded carnivore. The Chilaquiles are more chips that true tortillas, again more of a Tex-Mex flair. They are layered with refried beans at the base, then layers of cheddar cheese, chips, topped with sour cream, pico de gallo and avocado. With a sprinkle of cotija cheese on it and you are in breakfast heaven. 

The steak was phenomenal and I would gladly have a steak here over Gordon Ramsey's "Steak" located in Paris Hotel.  The steak is a fraction of the cost but more importantly it's better tasting. Granted it's not American Kobe beef but it doesn't have to be. The rib eye was seasoned to perfection. 

This is not a light hearted breakfast and if you are like me, you won't have a need to have lunch.  The high ratings is not all hype and is definitely worth checking out. This joint has a cool and laid back atmosphere great for the family. If you want you day to start with a slice of sunshine make sure it starts here.

Came in on a Sunday, there was a lot of people waiting but the great news is they seat you quickly. We had a party of 3, and got seated with in 10 mins. Our server was extremely nice, tentative, and made sure we were satisfied. The food came out quickly, and it was delicious. Ask for the hash browns to be crispy and they'll make sure they are. I got the steak omelet and pot of bread. Quality of steak was good, cappuccino with hazelnut Nutella did not even taste like coffee tasted like a yummy hot chocolate, and pot of bread was crisp on the top and soft in the inside. Overall good way to start a Sunday morning.

Food is good. Service is average. Went to exit out a door and was told "that door is always locked."  Sign on the door says "this door must remain open during business hours. Not sure how I feel taking my son somewhere where safety of customers is ranked below convenience of the staff.

This place is super cute and definitely pleasing to the eye. The decor in there is so cute and the way the servers wear pajamas is adorable. They have an abundance of good breakfast items on the menu, even beyond their steak and eggs. I decided to try the red velvet pancakes because of my sweet tooth, and they came with a side of bacon and eggs. It was all good but nothing to write home about. I still enjoyed them tho and they were very fluffy. It was a giant serving tho with just two pancakes and my sister and friends helped me eat them. 
I tried my sister's steak and it was delicious. If I ever decide to go again I'd probably get that instead. I guess that's what they're known for since it's in the name! 
Besides the food that didn't really blow me away, the service is what is making me take away stars. Wow, our server was acting so strange in a way. I work in the food and beverage industry and hate saying things like that. But seriously in my 21 years of life I have never had such weird service... 
One of our girls asked for butter for her waffle and our server (a girl, don't remember her name) looked disgusted and pointed to my other friend's butter and said "there's butter right there." Acting super confused. ew?? She wanted us to share butter? That's so gross...she had dipped her used knife in it obviously! Then my sister asked for water and once again the server pointed to someone else's water!! Is this like a communal place where we all share food? Then my sister orders salsa for her steak and eggs, and it's put on my plate of pancakes. Good combo. Also, my pancakes came with a special syrup, and it was delivered 10 minutes after my pancakes were. Oh, and that "fresh" butter my friend ordered? Came when she was halfway done with her meal. Okay so our server was very unfriendly and acting odd but once the bill came, she asked us how we were for the first time, asked if we were visiting, etc. I get it, you want a nice tip lol. After that experience I really have no desire to return.
The food is delicious.    I loved the biscuits and gravy as well as the chicken fried steak.  The staff dresses in pajamas. Lots of fun.

Went there this morning for the first time... What a cute restaurant all decorated up with flower umbrellas and the servers are wearing pajamas as their uniforms for the "Good Morning" feel! We had an amazing experience! Gilbert took care of us and gave us great menu recommendations. When the food came out, we were very impressed with the presentation as well as quality and taste! Overall great food, great staff, and great atmosphere! We will be back :)

First visit to this restaurant. Decor is bright, lively and comfortable. They make good use of the many windows, and there's an outside eating area. 
Staff uniforms are pajamas - very cute and different. 
Food is delicious. Went with the basics - eggs and pancakes. The syrup is real, heated with cinnamon sticks - a unique twist but not overpowering, just a hint. I use these basics to judge - if they can't make a good pancake, not worth the bother. Not true here - light, fluffy and delicious. Also like they offer full and half stacks!  Next visit will be more adventurous. 
Service was friendly and attentive. 
Only minor complaint - coffee drinkers don't get a saucer, so have to improvise for my spoon.

My fianc√© and I came here and it was our first time in. The food was good but our server really sucked. Her name was Kristie. I thought she had a bit of an attitude when we order water for our beverages because she walked away without saying anything to us, like she was ignoring us & not acknowledging us. But no, that's just how she was. She dropped off my fianc√©es bagel, I said thank you and she ignored me. Same when she dropped our food off, the check- everything. She charged us an extra $1 on our check, which we usually wouldn't complain about but we didn't have a good experience with her. So we told the host who was ringing us up and I think the manager had her apologize but she only apologized for the extra dollar charged- not her shitty service. When we told the host how she treated us she gave us a friends and family discount- which we weren't looking for a discount but it was a nice gesture. Hopefully Kristie leaves the hospitality industry soon.
Absolutely Amazing Food. Gelato our waitress was amamzing. Definitely a Must go to for breakfast when in Vegas

Great variety of food from healthy to not so healthy. Great options and substitutions available as well as I preferred low-carb meals. It's a must try breakfast restaurant! Great staff very friendly and reasonably priced

Surprised the hubby to a Vegas trip for his birthday and of course he wanted to find a steak and egg spot. Naturally we would've gone somewhere on the strip but being the yelpers we are we found this spot and content with the results. I'm such a foodie but since I'm also trying to watch my portions I was hesitant on what I would order. I ended up ordering the steak omelette (egg whites only) which came with the sauce and hash browns. Went with the bread in pot as my side bread option which was PERFECT for me since I'm watching my food portions. I enjoyed every bite of the perfectly cooked steak and the omelette was fluffy. I will say that they put a little too much cheese in it but overall great flavor. I was full and didn't even touch the hash browns but my hubby said they were yummy. He ordered the bacon wrapped tenderloin which he said was just perfect. This will be a must breakfast spot next time were in Vegas.

Delicious!! Really nice waitress (dressed in PJs) and good service. I ordered a short stack with bangers and my friend got the infamous chicken and waffles. Both were great and we totally finished it all. I highly recommend their pancakes--crisp around the edges, fluffy in the middle. Thin but not too thing. Their bangers were delish too, I'm pretty sure they were in a natural casing. The chicken was tender and spiced just right.  I highly recommend this place!

- excellent place to stop for breakfast if you are passing through Vegas 
- located off the strip so easily accessible without dealing with any of the madness of LV Blvd 
- freshly made OJ
- I ordered the chilaquiles which were delicious and a great value at $10.95
- ample variety of hot sauces available at every table including chipotle cholula.
- charming PJ style waiter / waitress apparel 
- very friendly and competent service staff

Came back again on our way to Lake Powell.  This place is 3 for 3.  Tried a three item omelette (avocado, cheddar and jalape√±o) with the toast and hash browns.  Was delicious; huge portion could not finish.  Manuel ordered the bone in ham steak which was massive and very good.  Keep up the great work team.

Wonderful new breakfast place! My boyfriend and I stopped in today for a bite to eat. The environment is warm and friendly (with lots of windows). Felt good inside. The woman who waited on us, Maria, was kind and knowledgeable with the menu. I ordered the cinnamon crunch french toast w/ sliced bananas. It was amazing! He ordered an omelet with chicken & avocado. Also very good. We will definitely be coming again.
The food is super good and the place is very original. The servers wear pjs because that's part of the Rise and Shine ambiance.

I wish I could give this place negative stars because I would!! We waited for over 15 minutes then left, but before that we where never asked if we wanted something to drink or even greeted by a server,  horrible customer service, what makes it even worse is they weren't even busy. I would never recommend this place to anyone.

While in Vegas, I was laying in bed from a night of drinking, searching Yelp for breakfast options and stumbled upon Rise & Shine. Immediately, from the combination of pictures and stellar reviews, I knew we HAD to have breakfast there before we left town. I ordered the chicken and waffles, the bf ordered the steak and eggs benedict, the nephew ordered the red velvet pancakes, and the FIL ordered some thing that I cannot remember for the life of me. They all knocked it out of the park!! The chicken and waffles is a must try!! I recommend everyone ordering something different and sharing because there are sooo many good things to try. 

First of all, the portion are enormous. Which is wonderful because the food is so stinking good. Which is bad because if you have little to no self control like me, you cannot stop eating! Ahhh!!!

Tips: order the pot of bread. Cutest little cinnamon roll I have ever seen. Also, get there early. They are busy, so expect a wait. But let me tell you-- it is WELL worth it.

This is the second time my daughter and I have been to this restaurant and both experiences have been great. The food is good but the service is phenomenal! I love food but I'm a stickler for service. I don't care how great the food is if the service sucks I will not be going back! This place by far exceeded my standards of service , Emily and Riley rock! 

They were very accommodating to my picky style of ordering and very patient with my 7 year old daughter, I always let her order for herself....

This place gets 2 thumbs up from me! We will definitely be returning!
It was good but nothing to write home about.  I gave it 3 stars because everyone was very nice and they asked us to write a yelp review.

I use to go to the southern highlands location, then the summerlin location. lucky for me this location is a 5 minute walk. Easily one of the best chicken fried steaks you can get anywhere in this country. Been all over the south but this place does the steak right. The gravy is sometimes a little hit or miss. but always good enough to make this one of my favorite meals.

On this visit I came alone and a bit later than I would have liked. There is no denying that the food is great... but I am back to concerned about the service. My waitress who I have had several times was awesome. But the bar was empty,  several empty tables and I was told a 10 to 15 minute wait. It took the hostess a very long time to seat the empty tables and my wait was closer to 25 mins... bar was still empty when she took me there. I was served quickly. However the plate looked like a train wreck. No grapes as I have come to expect here, they obviously haven't scrubbed the grill between orders as there was much grainy char on the plate. The servers seem to use the bar area to drop stuff on (menus, unwanted table items etc) and the buckets that have silverware and napkins at the back of the bar had a layer of dust on the back edge. Seems like a loss of revenue to not have the bar full of payomg customers instead of empty and full of mislaid items. My suggestion... either a) assign a waitress to the bar that can handle it and a table or two or b) maybe get a bus boy or hostess who is maybe interested in becoming a server to take just the bar. You lost 4 tables of 2 to 3 people while I waited and probably more as I ate. Again food is really tasty but the inconsistencies will lose customers.  Cary runs her butt off to make sure customers are taken care of.

First time here and was disappointed! One of my daughter lives near this shopping center and suggested this place. My other daughter and I we're on our way out and wanted something quick and togo. I ordered a burrito which they customized since there was only about 3 or4 items for there burrito selection. Also asked to cut burrito in half and they said they couldn't do it since it would fall apart. Not true, for what I had asked for I know for a fact  it would not! A $14.50 burrito, bacon, hash browns,eggs and cheese. Had maybe 2 small stripes of bacon, very very small amount of hash browns. Tasted more like an egg burrito. Maybe they don't specialize in burritos but quality should be in all there items. Again very disappointed
Great food. Friendly staff. Good service. Moderate prices. Great local spot.
Super yummy and they are willing to personalize their dishes for your taste. Super casual and the restaurant is really cute ! The servers also wear pajamas!:),
They always have fast service and amazing food. They are always friendly and give suggestions.

The chicken and waffles were amazing! A perfect combination of spicy, crispy battered tender chicken breast atop a hot Belgium waffle with cinnamon infused maple syrup! SO good!! And our server Laura was fantastic as always. Can't wait for their Green Valley location to open!
This place is amazing! Our server Gilbert was very informative and helpful! We would definitely come back! The food was YUMMY GOOD!

THIS PLACE NEVER EVER EVER EVER DISAPPOINTS! And I'm not even a big steak eater. The atmosphere is fun and friendly. The servers wear pajamas and it's super cute! The food is delicious. Definitely get "The Ultimate," it's a ribeye with two eggs, hash browns and your choice of bread. I come to this spot every time I'm in Vegas.

I have to say I love this place...breakfast is always wonderful...and best part is everyone is so friendly. I had breakfast here this morning and had to sit outside cause I had my pup...and I have to say they were accommodating to us...and even brought out water for my pup....and even with sitting outside they still took care of us promptly.  We will be here all the time
Love the friendly service and the relax feel of the restaurant. Food is great, my husband and I got back all the time!

Had the chicken and waffles, probably one of the better ones in town. The pot-of-bread was tasty but it picked up a clay-ish flavor from the pot. The bread itself was very good. The french press coffee was outstanding and reasonably priced. For the chicken n waffles, they used a chicken breast that is scalloped meaning, cut in half but still connected which gave it some size and helped it cook quicker. It was crispy and well cooked. The waffle was nice but kinda soft, and that is something common for most the waffles in town. I like the  crispy style waffles at Bread and Butter or Bouchon. But solid place

Spinning umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, servers in real out of bed PJ's, hip gourmet chef.... yeah, just your typical suburb local mom and pop place!

"Like say what?" It's all true. The food is GREAT, but they serve it with a lot of SWAG. Go, let all your senses be awed in an Alice in Wonderland like way. Only in Vegas my friend, only in Vegas. 

Thumbs way up, but as always let me know what you think.

http://bit.ly/1mZ9l7J
http://bit.ly/1meo0Lu
http://bit.ly/1t4WDZN
http://bit.ly/1q2412i
http://bit.ly/1q24kdy
Awesome food, good people. Love steak and egg. Steak and omelet is awesome with the sauce on the side. Highly recommended
The food and service are great. The food took a while to come out, other than that it was great.... will be back agai n

VERY DISAPPOINTED!!! The service was one of the worst ...our server 
brought out toast 20 minutes before our meals.....We where a party of 6, she brought out 3 breakfasts 10 minutes later 2 more and a few later mine..... but yet I counted 16 employees they have more employees than customers no excuse.... the food was greasy and the Chicken fried steak was spicy hot ,the only thing we liked was the cup-of-bread . The glasses were they serve the fresh juices were dirty . July1st at 1:40
Don't know servers name they don't wear name tags.

Maybe it's because I was at the tale-end of a weekend in Vegas, but this was not the best way to cap off the trip.  It has "Steak & Egg" in the title, I so of course I got steak and eggs (specifically, the bacon wrapped tenderloin steak).  The bacon was very fatty, the steak was dry.  It came with an open-faced omelet which had way too much mustard on it (why put mustard on an omelet anyway?).  

We also got the pot of bread, which was a gimmicky idea, but not really that special in the end.

The service was very nice and friendly (which is why I'm giving this place a 3 rather than a 2), but I wouldn't come back.

This breakfast place is so cute! The inside has a broken mosaic tile look and flower umbrellas flipped upside down as lights. Such a cozy and warm feeling for breakfast. And the servers wear PJs! :)

No, I didn't get steak & eggs. But I did get a breakfast platter with pot of bread. Pot of bread is like a dinner roll and a cinnamon roll mixed in one. It basically tasted like bread with some cinnamon... It wasn't AS exciting as I thought it was going to be, but the presentation still gets a 5 star rating from me. The hashbrowns were thick cut and so tasty! The bacon was done perfect and they use real eggs! 

I was very impressed with this cute breakfast spot and will definitely be back!

The servings are huge. Prices are little high, but you can feed two people with one dish if you like, so that helps. Service is really good. Last time we were there they had changed their menu and added way too many things, keep it short and simple I say. Worth checking out for sure.
Amazing!!!! All I can say. For sure try their "bread in a cup". I will always make this a stop on my way out of Vegas. Love the staff wearing pj's.

I've been here twice in July and twice in August.  I love this place because of the food.  The place is a descent size, cleanliness is average, but the food is awesome and the people are great, and that is good enough for me.  Price is average, not too steep.  Love the ceiling decor, great location, tons of parking.  My favorite brekkie place in VEGAS.

Favorite breakfast stop. The wait can be annoying but it's popular so what can ya do. I order the Salmon Benedict it's my fave. Oh and I gotta have my orange juice maybe a coffee. The waiters wear pajamas there and I don't know why I don't either??

This is the best place for breakfast. They get pretty busy because they are good at what they do, so expect that. But overall everything is killer. If you read any other reviews that contrary to that, they're crazy. These guys really have hit a homerun especially thriving in a strip mall plaza style.  I try to eat here at least a few times a month. Everything is good. Great choices for kids, like silver dollar pancakes (with chocolate chips!)

Though there isn't many choices, this place does not need a ton of entrees to be a great place for breakfast/brunch. 

The food was really tasty and flavorful. I never expected it to taste so good! I ordered the Homemade Cornbeef & Hash with eggs with the Pot Bread, my other half ordered the Buffalo Chicken Breast with Eggs and Hash browns and a side of Pot Bread, and then we had a side of the Original Pancakes. 

The corn beef hash was different from what most places offer, and was not heavy or bland. The dish was light and included a perfect amount and my eggs were cooked exactly as I had ordered. 

My other half's plate, the Buffalo Chicken... Was excellent. The checkin breast was super moist, easy to cut (even with a fork), tender, juicy and definitely delicious. Side note, the buffalo sauce that's drenched on the chicken is a bit spicy but it does add a great kick to the chicken. The hash browns were great as well. 

The pancakes, so soft and not mushy. 

The pot bread was very light and not too sweet. Best dipped in the sauce that accompanies the dish. 

I definitely recommend coming here if you want something a little different than your usual breakfast place.

Really a 2.5 but always round up to benefit business. I called this morning to place an order for pick up, while taking my order, the lady seemed very distracted and kept making me repeat the order. She told me the order would be ready in 15-20 minutes. I arrived after 15 minutes and waited another 15 minutes. This doesn't bother me so much if they are making the food fresh BUT it does bother me when they forget items. If you need 30 minutes, you better take one extra minute and double check the order to make sure it's correct. 1st, we ordered original eggs Benedict and they forgot the hollandaise sauce. This makes the dish what it is!!! 2nd, we ordered an omelette with toast, but there was NO toast. How do you forget something so easy. 3rd, we ordered a yogurt parfait that included NO granola. 

The sad part about this, is the food was delicious. It's a shame that a business makes such dumb mistakes when it shouldn't be. Luckily for them, the food was good enough that I will try them again, but not take out.  I will adjust my review then if deserving.

I gave this place 3 stars because of the host. The food is excellent and the waitress is great, but the host was very rude. There's no word to explain how rude this lady was. It made the whole experience of eating here a very bad one. It's too bad because I did like to come here to eat but I won't be back

Gonna be coming here again next time we're in town for sure!!! Pancakes were nice and fluffy. Chicken fried steak had a nice thin crunchy batter! And our server Laura was super sweet! Nice little set up inside and the servers and in pajamas... loved it!

We love the decor of the place; it's bright and cheery.  Love that the servers wear flannel pajamas.  The restaurant is clean and so are the restrooms.  The servers were friendly.

We were worried about the size of the pancakes so our server let us know we could get a half order.  That's great because we didn't even finish the half order!  I had the banana pecan and Frosted Flakes pancakes and hubby had the regular old fashion pancakes with a side of scrambled eggs and bacon.  I really enjoyed the combination of bananas, Frosted Flakes and pecans and the fact that they serve warm maple syrup.  The issue for both of us is that the pancakes were dry/overcooked.  Now that's better than being undercooked as extra syrup can help with a dry pancake.  The eggs were overcooked as well.  Bacon was good.  

We got the French press which was pretty good.  It was a dark medium roast.  

We would come again if we're in the area because based on the reviews, we suspect the chef just had an off day.

I hate writing a bad review because this place is consistently good, and because I myself work in the food and beverage industry. Unfortunately today we had a bad experience. We ordered to go over the phone. It was a corned beef hash, a salmon Benedict, and a bagel with cream cheese for my mother. So, now we're home with our food and the bagel we paid for isn't there. I guess that's our fault for not checking the bag. The corned beef hash is fine. The salmon Benedict is bad. Not that any particular ingredient is, just the dish as a whole was bad. I Never send food back but had I been in the restaurant I would have asked to change my meal. So I sit at home now with a dish I cannot eat and my mom doesn't have her breakfast. I guess we will just get dressed and go out to eat something :(

Been to this spot twice and will be regulars soon enough!

Food is great, atmosphere and location is great, and you won't find another place like it in town. The servers dress in pajamas, which makes you feel relaxed. Each time I've come to eat here, my friends and I go in our pajamas as well. They fit groups of two to eight and more if needed. I've ordered the chicken and waffles, the french toast, the hash browns, and omelets, and everything is exactly what you expect it to be and then some. Food comes out fresh and hot, they work well with substituting items, the french press coffee is a must, and their prices reflect the quality of food.

First time I went there, it was with my boyfriend and we just wanted a nice breakfast spot nearby. We yelped this location, and gave it a try. We were greeted at the door, and were sat immediately. The place wasn't that busy a little after noon. The server was friendly and knowledgable. She explained certain items on the menu that we weren't familiar with, and gave our order. They brought us complimentary fresh cinnamon bread in clay flower pots that were amazing, and we ended up ordering another, which was a mistake because when our food came out, the portions were huge. We were so full, everything tasted wonderful, and the server didn't bother us too much but checked on us often enough. She gave us our check, and we paid when we were ready to leave. Between the two of us, the bill came out to about $30 not including tip. Which I think is fair for the amount and quality of food we had.

I definitely recommend this place.
Get some grub. They do get busy at times. Feel a part of the family and fill you stomachs. Nuff sed!

This place was a pleasant surprise. We had breakfast on our way out of Vegas, away from the strip and its traffic. Awesome food quality, quick service, and all our dishes tasted exceptionally well. We ordered:
Red velvet chocolate chip packages - super chocolatey and yummy 
Chicken Avocado egg white omelette - Excellent 
Fancy steak omelette - Amazing 

All egg sides and kids' dishes were excellent as well. Even the Cappuccino was a high quality taste. 

Definitely, this place is going to be a staple to our future Vegas trips.

This is the go-to breakfast spot for my BF and me.  Conveniently located right down the street from his house, yummy food, and waitresses in PJ's make it worth the sometimes short-ish wait.  I'd for sure give it 5 stars, but I sometimes want a bloody mary or mimosa with my breakfast....especially on an early morning, after a late night...but alas. There is no booze to be had.  The coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice has to get me by, and they do so pretty well, being super delish.  Service is always awesome. Sometimes I think I'll wear my jammies to fit in, but I always forget.  Next time!

I don't hate it but I don't love it. Their coffee is awesome, and they have a French press as well that can be done at the table, it's amazing.  Their juice is fresh squeezed and brought promptly to the table. They have this bread in a pot.  So good! I HAVE to have one every time I go! Now the bad stuff... Occasionally my steak is over cooked and it doesn't taste right, and personally I don't like sending things back.  We did that once and didn't see it for another 15-20 min.  By then our whole party was done.  It has its good days and bad days but the good overweigh the bad.  Definitely worth a try, but at least you get a heads up.

This place sucks. Food sucks. Service sucks. Drove all the way from aria for breakfast and I had to wait 35 mins for egg whites and avocados. Could have gotten a better deal at Mcdonald's which I should have gone in the 1st place. Horrible.

Let me just say the food is amazing and portions are plentiful! My waitress today was the best i may have ever had. I like my coffee to stay hot and am normally let down with slow refills but I had to tell her no thank you a couple times which totally impressed me!
  On the negative, I was seated at the bar and for the entire 45 minutes I had to look at two of the three chefs inappropriate and disgusting attire. One cook was young with a backwards skater hat on with pants halfway down his backside showing off his grey underwear while wearing a short tee shirt. The main chef was older in what looked like his 40's and was even worse. Biker bandana, biker chain to wallet, short shirt, and pants that were BELOW halfway down his backside with all to see his black boxers with gold designs on them??? Are we supposed to be impressed by his "ganstaness" or disgusted? Why do I pay good money to eat great food and have to look at two cooks butts the entire meal? Looks like there's no overseeing by management to prevent such a business mishaps. If you go to eat and want to enjoy your food without seeing someone's backside the entire meal, DON'T sit at the bar!
Great place to eat..  Friendly staff, need a bigger place!!  It is so beautiful and calming in their.
Yet another great breakfast here. Got the Banger Sausage omelette with the requisite Pot Of Bread. Amazing service and quality!

The ultimate place for comfort food, especially when nursing a hangover or leaving Las Vegas. Off the beaten path but not inconveniently located far off the 15. Worth it.  Come here. Excellent service, very reasonable prices. Oh, and bring your jammies. Totally okay here.

Ordered the Three Little Pigs bagel sandwich. It was delicious! The service was...eh. Saw our waitress once ten minutes after we'd sat down, for a quick "Everything okay?" right after someone else had helped us & brought our food, & another time to bring the check. Had to ask a bust guy for a refill & some napkins. Then again I only saw 3-4 waitresses with a full house & a 10 minute wait.
Did see/hear our waitress do some weird stuff at the next table. She literally picked up their kid to get him off the booth that was about to fall apart & also blew raspberries over their table before a laugh. Probably a bit of spit..it sounded gross.
Anyway, good food, eh service. Maybe catch them at a better time than a Saturday afternoon.

Everything was so good!!  The pot of bread is delicious.  Red velvet pancakes, steak and eggs, French Toast, and Chicken and Egg White Omelet were all really good.  Service was actually really great.  We had to send a dish back and she was so nice about it.

This place is expensive, but they have excellent service with very good food and generous portions. The drip coffee was good as was my build your own omelette. The hash browns were excellent as was the gravy for my biscuit. My spousal unit had a ham steak with her meal and the ham was very tender, and tasty. The waitresses wearing pajamas, my wife thought the concept was really cute and unique(yes they were all decent pj's), the wife loved it! And her and my sons pancakes were light and very tasty & the syrup was piping hot-yummy!!

This is a good breakfast/brunch restaurant. I've been here numerous times and have been happy each time. 

Ive had the 3 little pigs Bagel sandwich that was delicious, it had plenty of ham and bacon. 

My favorite is the steak chilaquiles.  OMG, this is yummy. Tortilla chips are just right, nice and crisp. Not soggy at all. Just enough toppings. The steak comes on the side. The steak is good by it self but I personally cut about half of it and put the steak pieces over the chilaquiles. I would say I've had it about 3 times and each time is just as good. 

Each I've been there the service has been pretty quick and the people working there have been nice. The staff wears pjs which is kind of cool. I do have to agree with another reviewer that the fans should be dusted but its not a deal breaker for me (:

So,  after having gone to Rise & Shine at least a dozen times and introducing many friends,  I will no longer be returning. I ate there a few days ago and saw that they had knocked out a wall and expanded. I thought, oh good for them, because they are always busy. Then I started looking through the menu and realized it had changed, but not for the better. The prices of everything had gone up and toast or a pot of bread that was included with dishes before,  was no longer. I ordered a chicken and waffle which I've had a couple times before. The other times, the chicken,  which is always huge,  sat atop thick waffle...not this time. The waffle was thin as a pancake and had not been poured with enough batter to be whole. Our server took our order and brought us the check, but nothing in between. The thing that got to me the most about the whole visit was the fact that this place has had loyal patrons in the community and then they jack up the prices & give you less, like they are on the strip serving tourists. Way to ruin a good thing.
Came here this morning with my office , and let me just say from the service to the food it was great , Ryley was so nice ! We will definitely be coming back :) !!
This place is pretty awesome! The service is great and the food is amazing with generous portions. Definitely a go-to spot for breakfast/brunch.

How can I start with greatness and delight in the morning?  Let's go to Rise and Shine in the Southern Highlands Marketplace! 

The wait was a short 10 min followed by overly cheerful pajama wearing ladies that would be a colorful start to any day. It was for us. 

Sat down and was immediately greeted by our bubbly waitress and my husband and I knew from the menu description that we wanted to share an omelette and picked the FANCY Steakhouse Omelette packed with juicy steak, mushrooms, onion, cheese, spinach and bearnaise. Can we just say ABSOLUTELY YUM!!

Besides the pot of bread (extra yum) and the potatoes filled with onions (that were perfect)...Rise and Shine is the place to be. They do serve breakfast as well as lunch. Simply Wonderful!

Food was great. Our server was not though. I've been to multiple breakfast places in Vegas and to me, service is everything. Go for the food but be aware of the server who acts like she's on something. You don't refill coffee and pour it on place settings without even apologizing or replacing them. You shouldn't let guests wait 5-7 mins for their check. Last, if you help a guest switch a meal, switch the price. Don't wait till after the guest has paid only for him to realize he was charged extra. The restaurant shouldn't be charging for something a guest didn't eat even eat in the first place.

First, this used to be the our favorite breakfast place. Since they opened their other location this one has gone down the drain. The service is super slow, the food is subpar and the people managing do not have a clue. We ordered our food at 10:57 and by 11:57 we still didn't have our food.

I just happened to be on this side of town running errands and the group was getting hungry.  Not wanting to hit any of mainstream eat spots in the area, we basically stumbled onto this place.

Upon entering Rise & Shine, one might think they have stepped through the looking glass.  There are upside down daisy light and daisy fans.  The windows are surrounded by mosaic tiles.  The smell of sweet cinnamon lays heavy in the air.

Everyone from the manager to our waitress, April were unbelievably pleasant.

The menu though basic in it's appearance contains some very interesting items.  Some of which we were able to sample today and look forward to sampling some others in the future.

The meals consisted of a Steak Benedict served on your choice of a plain or everything bagel.  Another plate of goodness was the French Toast coated with Cinnamon Crunch.  It normally comes on a raisin bread but we opted for Crunch coated Texas Toast...Awesome!

My only negative remark was that the poached egg on the Benedict was was not runny.  I addressed this with both the Manager and the Waitress who apologized and offered to make it right.  I chose not to make a big deal out of it and continued eating.  The steak by the way was Awesome!

I highly recommend the "Bread Pot" it was absolutely delicious and a fine addition to what ever you might order.

This is indeed a classy breakfast joint that I would not mind in the future making the drive to all they while passing about a dozen "greasy spoons" to get to.

Nasty cook.
I have eaten here before and have always liked the food.
Today I decided to bring m daughter for brunch. 
The issues started with the waitress scratching her head and then making our toast.
Then as I was about to put food in my mouth I cought the cook wipping his nose with the back of his hand and instead of washing his hands, he continued making the food.
I was unable to eat and my stomach turned sour.
Spoke to the manager and she then decided to tell me they have had this issue with the cook before, that really makes me wonder as to why continue to have this person around.

The negative aspects:

The food is bad. I ordered their ultimate steak and eggs. This place is named for their steak and eggs, so I was expecting to have a stellar breakfast before my drive back to LA. What I got were disgusting eggs, a very low quality cut of meat, and hash browns that looked and tasted like badly cooked shredded potatoes with a bunch of oil splattered on them.
I brought it to the attention of the waitress, who in turn brought it up to the manager. The manager spoke with me, insisting that they only buy the best type of meat. I knew better, as I've had steak and eggs in many different places throughout LA and SD. The only thing that tasted right was the toast, but it's pretty hard to screw that one up.

The positive aspects:
