The customer service was on point. I was seated immediately, and the staff was very nice. And by nice, I mean they greeted me very warmly, and even expressed sympathy that I was not happy with the meal. I've seriously never been greeted this warmly by any restaurant staff member, so props to them.

Seeing as this was a one time occurrence, I will consider coming back here and trying out other dishes. Stay tuned for updates.
My husband choose this place for breakfast and I am a very happy girl, service was excellent and the food is good!! Will definitely be coming back!
Steak is fantastic. Definitely get this with the pot o' read. Pancakes are fluffy and airy. Good portions
Great breakfast place while in Vegas, very cute and comfortable. The staff wears pjs so you don't feel underdressed when rolling out of bed to get some steak and eggs.

It was good. Felt the price point is a touch high. Can get just as good of breakfast for less at several places close by. The balsamic glaze that is on the Ham & Eggs Benedict ruined it I felt. I love balsamic & put it on many things but what they used had a bite to it like pepper. Back of my throat burned after a couple of bites & throughout the meal.  Service was great from the waiter but the busboy that kept trying to take our plates that contained food & we were still eating which was annoying. Giving it 3 stars as there are other items on the menu I wouldn't mind trying & over all experience was ok.

I have only been to Rise & Shine once before. My boyfriend and I went here for brunch yesterday, and our experience was lovely!

I thought since it was a Sunday, there would be a whole lot more people, but we surprisingly got seated right away. We looked through pictures on their Yelp before we got here, so we already knew what to order.

I got the Fancy Steakhouse Omelette while my boyfriend got the Ultimate Steak & Eggs! Both came with a side of hash browns and your choice of pot of bread, toast or biscuit. Of course, we chose the pot of bread and as expected, it tasted heavenly! I could honestly keep eating their pot of bread forever!

As for our main meal, it definitely did not disappoint. I loved my omelette along with the strips of steaks on top; it was just a great combination overall! The only thing I would suggest is for them to go easy on the pepper.

Our server and the rest of their staff were very friendly. I'm actually jealous that their servers get to wear pajamas to work, so lucky! Anyway, I would highly recommend this place to everyone and we will definitely be back!

Very disappointing!  The table next ours was left with food and paper all over the floor for the entire time we were there to look at, until I mention it!
The ribeye steak was over cooked and tortilla chips on the breakfast menu with eggs was overwhelming so many chips and where very hard and hard to eat!
Would not go back!
A Great Morning Spot! Great service from Amber & Ryley, both were very attentive and helpful! Food came out fast and correct!! Presentation was excellent as well! Delicious food at a decent price.

Ate here for the first time today. Friendly staff. Servers all wear pajamas, which I thought was an amazing touch. Was told I had to try the "Cup of bread" and our server was nice enough to surprise us with a complimentary dose of the sweet cinnamon favorite. It was pretty darn good. I love bagel sandwiches and my husband can never turn down chilliquiles, so when our waitress recommended the two, we instantly knew what to order. 
He had the Steak and Chilliquiles and his steak was cooked as asked. I had the AvoVeggie Bagel Sandwich with fries. The shoe string fries were well seasoned and delicious! My only complaint was that the big selling point for me was fresh mashed avocado on my bagel... and instead it was not fresh, but more like whipped and browning... the flavor was a bit old and masked the flavor of the entire sandwich. I did try a bite of my husband's Chilliquiles and that ranchero flavor was grand! We shared a French Press Coffee that averaged a little over 3 cups of coffee. The decor of the restaurant was very bright and fun. I think we will try this place again, but will stay away from the avocado.

We didn't get the memo but apparently you can come in your PJs! Pajama party coming soon!

It is a fairly large and colorful place with upside down umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. Although a pretty atmosphere there is definitely nothing stuffy about this place with all the staff in their pajamas going around serving coffee like you never left your house. 

They have an extensive menu selections so good thingd our waitress was really patient while we made our selections! We split the Fried Chicken Breast and Waffles and The Ultimate Steak and Eggs Plate, with the potted bread accompanied with some fresh squeezed orange juice and delicious coffee.  Two xx large chicken breast  was juicy and well-seasoned along with the crispy, light waffle which we drizzled with their cinnamon infused syrup. The ribeye was cooked perfect medium rare as requested, and the hash browns were to dance for. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. 

The potted bread was the only item left to sample but came until the end which actually worked out great since it comes with a cream cheese glaze we treated this as dessert

The server was the best part of our meal. She was very friendly and helpful!  We ordered the chiliquilles and the eggs and corn beef hash.  The chiliquilles are basically a small doll up of vegetarian beans (which I had to dig for) and two eggs with a plate of cheese nachos for $10.95 and the hash was basically 3 eggs over a little bit of corn beef mixed into shoe string potatoes($12.95) and then I asked for jalape√±os on the side. Which when we got to the front to pay the cashier said your check is wrong because  the jalape√±os we're not on your check. And added $1.00.  So basically 2 breakfast with water to drink was $25.50. I think for what you got here that was steep. But no need to go back and find out.

Going out for Breakfast can be hit or miss. This place has consistently been AMAZING!  The staff are extremely friendly and the service is top notch.  Their quirky takes on dishes such as Eggs Benedict and Chicken and Waffles are incredible. They offer Illy brand coffee which tasted great and even have a French Press if you're into something a little stronger. 

If you are looking for a great, relaxed, delicious Southern Highlands Breakfast spot then look no further.

Came here for brunch today with my fianc√©. We sat down was asked what we wanted to drink. I ordered the chicken fried steak and she ordered the salmon Benny. When the food came I seriously thought the chicken fried steak was going to be dry but I was wrong. My fianc√©'s food was good too. Our waiter was very attentive and was always checking on us. I like this location better than the southern highlands location.

Have been coming here for years and was the worst experience.  The place was filthy.  The customer service was lacking and the food was plain.  What happened?  The hostess asked how was my breakfast and was told the truth but she just said sorry.  Rise and shine,  victims of your own success, will never go back. Bummer.

Looks like they expanded!  doesn't help much though! Waited for a little over an hour only to find out that the girl that took our names didn't actually write our names down! (The really nice waitress sat us down, no questions asked)  Lol the food is ABSOLUTELY amazing... But the front of the house... Tsk. Tsk. Every single time we come. BUT  the back of the house is quick & efficient and the food is, once again, AMAZING. If the food wasn't so good I definitely wouldn't even bother coming ever again.

Cool and casual vibe with the servers dressed in pajamas. Food was excellent. Ambiance is okay and service seemed perfect overall except for our server who may have been a little annoyed about having to work during 4th of July  weekend. Steak was super tender and I highly recommend it

We came back here because we loved the food the first time around. Unfortunately our second experience included an array of issues that really weren't handled with the appropriate level of care from the staff. Our waitress, when taking our orders, did not write any of it down. There were 4 people in our party and we had a good amount of substitutions/additions to our orders. When she quickly repeated our order back to us before putting it in, she made atleast two mistakes. Not surprising, our food arrived and 3/4 people's orders were wrong in some type of way. They were corrected in a relatively timely fashion besides one friend who waited too long for her order to be corrected. Throughout the order corrections, the waitress did not express any sort of apologies to us. Good food, but a poor experience due to how the staff handled our orders.

I absolutely loved this place. We went there for lunch. The food was delicious. I had the best Tuna sandwhich of my life! Hubby ordered steak and was pretty happy with it as he is usually picky with steaks. The servers were in their PJ's, not sure if it's their standard dressing or just for the weekend. Very nice servers, super friendly. And the deco was so creative, they have umbrellas hanging of the ceiling which look like big sunflowers. Price is ok, it's not too cheap and not to expensive. I would go again.

Visiting friends in vegas from Sydney, and have been blown away by the service and food here.  Have been back multiple times and tried various omelettes and other sweet breakfast items and would highly recommend this place ^_^
Love every bite! Chicken and waffles melt in your mouth and they even keep the maple syrup warm for you! Hash brown are so tasty!!! You gotta go!

Been here three times. First time was perfect. Our server was fast and effecient. Food was hot and delicious. The last two visits have been mediocre. Todays visit specifically was the worst. It wasn't nearly as busy as we have seen but we still had to wait to be sat when the host could've easily put some pep in his step to get us sat sooner. Once he was done forcing small talk in the patrons who were paying he sat us and the waitress who we've had previously  (and was fine) didn't acknowledge us just keep looking extremely busy. I don't mind waiting but at least touch the table so it is not awkward when you finally do stroll up and act like we were just sat and hadn't been waiting for an extreme amount of time. 

Now for the food part....each time I have tried something different. This time the steak was over done and the bermais (sp) sauce was sour. The woman next to me ordered the same thing and got salsa with her steak omelet and I am not saying it is the waitresses fault but I would've enjoyed it with mine but its my fault for not paying attention. My husband's chicken fried steak was burnt. Everything else like i said previously was just mediocre. 

All in all good place. Just inconsistent.

Breakfast is hard to screw up but also hard to make really great.  Rise and shine has done just that.  Taken breakfast to a whole new level.  
Steak and eggs seems to be their signature dish and it is excellent.  The steak is as well done as the eggs and the hash potatoes are like nothing else you have ever had.
Even their bread choices are a step above the average breakfast place.  You can get a special bread they make in house that is soft, gooey and filled with cinnamon goodness.
You must eat here.  You must eat here every chance you get.
Also... Great service!

Worth the 8 minute detour from the interstate of you are looking for a brunch time meal away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

There is something about places that beg me to leave a good review on Yelp!. Bus boys wear t-shirts that say "Help us...Yelp! us." A sign hangs in the window advertising that people like them on Yelp!. Then,  at the end of your meal,  a 20 question survey is handed to you with another Help Us,  Yelp! us advertisement.  I don't need your constant reminders to leave a good review, just quality service and great food. Also,  if you want me to leave a review,  provide me with free wifi since your network shows up as the strongest of the many networks in the area (3 of which are free).

That said,  we received quality service and great food.  My fianc√© and I shared their Country fried steak and eggs,  hashbrowns, biscuit,  and a side of corn beef hash. The steak was prepared in a great batter;  very crispy,  not hard,  thick,  but not overwhelming.  Gravy was served on the side and was very tasty.  Hash Browns are more like a mix between hash browns and home fries... home fried hash browns, maybe? The fluffy and crispy biscuit came out late,  but it was topped with sausage gravy at no charge... nice! Also,  the corned beef hash was a very good addition to this meal. We left very full and ready for a nap,  to bad we have a 4.5 hour drive ahead of us. 

The food was matched with great service from the time we signed in to paying the bill.  Good job,  now lose the Help Us, Yelp! Us shirts, it's tacky and unnecessary given the quality food and service you have. You'd receive 5 stars if you didn't have the Yelp! requests everywhere.

Excellent breakfast spot, came here for the ribeye steak and was not disappointed med rare as ordered. The french press coffee is absolutely superb and theres no shortage of breakfast items should you choose to eat something other than steak and eggs. Our server Ashley was great. Only note I have is that I had to fetch our utensils as they were not provided at the time of our seating. Other than that had a great experience! The cup of bread is delicious!

Great place to have wonderful meal. Went with my family and everything we ordered was delicious. The pot of bread is a fun little starter. I ordered the ultimate steak and eggs and it was cooked just the way I asked for it (medium rare... Yum) the chicken and chorizo burrito is huge, but taste great. If u are not a fan of spice be careful, it's loaded with Jalape√±os. we did get a kick out of the waitresses wearing PJ's. All the staff was very friendly. The one thing I did find quite funny was the POS system that was mounted on the wall... It's mounted so awkwardly high.! Hahahah

A friend from our church (The Rock A Christian Church) recommended this place and he highly recommended the fried chicken and waffles. The first chance I got, my brother-in-law and I both order the chicken and waffles. Let me tell ya...It's REALLY (No! It's REALLY Good.) The spice in the batter and the tender chicken breast (boneless) on top of melting butter and old fashion maple syrup and powdered sugar...It's heaven with every bite.  The chicken breast covered the entire waffle, so every bite you take has a piece of chicken and a piece of waffle. It's uber good stuff! And the portions were massive. I should have cut the portion in half and saved it for later. Because when I finished the entire plate, I was feeling the food coma effect. To top it off, our server Christine from Chicago was amazing. She was fun loving and had a great sense of humor. By the way, don't let their dress code (PJ) fool ya, they are very professional and serious about what they serve. I will definitely return here for another fix of Chicken and waffles and maybe try something else too. If you are in the area, you gotta stop by and try it.

Stupendous!!!

Great referral from friends knowing my quest to find the best corn beef hash. I was a little skeptical but was nicely surprised.  It was a great experience. 

Such a fun place away from the crowded strip.
The restaurant was clean and playfully decorated. At first glance the menu is a little overwhelming but with excellent instruction from a pajama wearing waitress I was able to find what I wanted. This place has a little bit of everything including it's very own juice bar. 

The homemade corn beef hash was fresh and very tasty. It was served with cubed hash and three well prepared over easy eggs. In lieu of my normal side of toast I opted for a cinnamon roll called "Cup 'o Bread". Very creative presentation. It was served in a cuye coffee cup and packed full of flavor.

Was in the smiths parking lot and saw the simple stand sign for some steaks and eggs and thought I would give it a try. Well let's just say I wasn't disaapinted. 

First thing i noticed was the cool apparel they were selling which was comical. The waiting staff was dressed in their PJ's,  which I think is great. The place was very clean and the staff was friendly. 

Now I went to a steak and egg place so I had to try their specialty which is their ribeye steak and eggs. I have to tell you it was really good, I got my steak medium rare and it tasted amazing. Then you couple it with eggs and hashbrowns, you just can't go wrong. Their Hash browns were very good and different bc they don't season them like a typical breakfast joint does and you can tell they are made with care. 

The other interesting food item that came with my meal that they are known for is their "cup o bread." It's like a mini cinabun with a cream syrup that's like a sweet and salty combo that is amazing, it's a must item. 

Their omelets are amazing as well, from the ones they have on the menu to your own custom creation. All in all the menu is great bc they have a little bit of everything that they make very well. 

Oh yeah and when you go ask to sit in MARIA'S section, she is extremely nice and very friendly.

Rise & Shine! It's Breakfast Time!

You can't help but notice the adorable decor immediately when you walk in.  The colorful umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and the pj wearing waitresses give it such a fun vibe.  We were greeted and seated with our waitress over in a flash.  She was friendly and attentive.  My coffee was always full of their wonderful Lavazza.  Mmmmm. Coffee.

I felt I was a broken record always ordering the same thing.  So to change it up, Blueberry Pancakes it is!  Was it a good choice?  Absolutely.  The blueberries were sweet and abundant.   The pancakes were thick and huge.  I couldn't finish but about half of my plate.  They had a light dusting of powdered sugar with a dollop of whip cream on top.  My husband happily ate the cream for me.  I realize it is a steak & egg place but their pancakes are just as good.  

My better half ordered the Grilled Steak & Chorizo Burrito.  Of course I had to try a bite.  It was really stuffed full of ingredients.  Along with the grilled onions, beans, egg and chorizo~ the jalape√±os gave it a nice kick.  I love spicy so it works for me.   

They have so much more on the menu that I would love to try.  Thanks for great start to my day!

Decor is one of a kind just like the server attire
Food is on point... Cooked in just the right amount of time. Coffee is great.. Staff friendly. In a location you wouldn't expect to find. All in all it's great. Definitely give the place a shot, it'll impress.
The country fried steak is wonderful
Over priced place. Food is mediocre. Servers wear pjs which Is cute I guess. Some waitresses really look like they just rolled out of bed though.

This is the 2nd review I've given to this cute and charming hideaway, and they certainly deserve it!  

Their food is fantastic!!! I love the presentation, wait staff, hostesses, and their little clay pot of cinnamon bread is mouth watering! The last time I posted, the new girl Shannon has now settled right in, and we love her! 

I would like to post a photo of one of my breakfast platters on here, but not sure how. The portions are generous, food is fresh, and their coffee is the bomb!!  

When I see someone who writes a negative review for something so little like they had to "wait" oh my, have you ever been to Hash House A Go-Go? I mean come on folks, that's the reason why people wait because it's that freakin good! What what the heck do people expect? Restaurants have bad days once in a while too, sometimes things don't go perfect everyday, and NO, the breakfast doesn't come on a silver platter for all you snobs out there! This is the real deal, real food, real people, and it's a 10 Spot!! Just sayin... : )

My husband and I came to this place with some friends because of the great Yelp reviews, but we were very disappointed. We came for brunch and asked to be seated at the barstools (since we wanted to get in and out fairly quickly) and one of the hostesses Kelly denied us and said it would be a 30 min wait. We proceeded to wait 45 minutes to an hour and nobody was ever seated in the barstools. There was an empty table for 15 minutes and we still had to wait to be seated (we needed up sitting there. Why we couldn't be seated earlier? I have no idea). All of the hostesses were rude and looked like they hated their job. The only saving grace was our extremely sweet waitress and the food, minus my husband's French fries which tasted very old. On our way out there was a couple who asked how long the wait was and the hostess responded 30-35 minutes, even though there were 5 empty tables. I would not suggest this place unless you have some time to spare. Also beware of the rude staff.

Food was good service was OK definitely took to long to address people at the door along with food being delivered ordered a smoothie that took eight minutes when It came out it was Runny, very average at best and way too expensive

Went here for breakfast. As usual the food was excellent. Filling   Although this establishment always shows live for the military.  We were surprised to find that a special consideration was bestowed upon us for Veterans Day.  Love the food will definitely make this a favorite breakfast stop

ambiance//****
what cute decor! this upside down dangling & swirling umbrellas from the high ceilings transform the place! there's also outdoor seating available to enjoy the nevada heat

everyone works in jammies~~ as in the server uniforms are pajamas! except for the one kid that wore a "YELP US!" shirt ;p

service//*****
arriving at the end of first seating for breakfast, we had the luxury of eating at our own pace! the line was LOOOOOONG by the time we left; early bird gets the worm!

our server was this lovely lady that kept checking on us and brought us some biscuits to compensate the for "pot of bread" not being available when we ordered
then she brought us another round of "pot of bread" once it became available!

food//****
everyone seemed to enjoy their orders
eggs benedict 
steak & eggs
eggs & pancake

and my CHICKEN & WAFFLES! =9
deliciousness! i normally don't like white meat but they fry it well!
PLUS their maple syrup is legit, as in the maple stick is no joke
be careful because the WHOLE GLASS bottle is hot syrup

and what about that pot of bread? it's a cinnamon bread served within a cup
while the concept is cute, it's a bit dry for my taste
~*~
if you're in vegas and don't mind going off the beaten path for some normal breakfast at normal prices, this is your stop!

A little bit out of the way but worth the drive.  Slight wait due to the cozy size.  Phenomenal servers dressed in pajamas; awesome French Pressed coffee and the food exceeded expectations.  Bucket list material!

New fan. Visited twice. 

First visit, Rise and Shine Chilaquiles, portion is enough for two to share. Taste wise, the tortillas kind of tasted like I was eating Doritos, so if you're into that..and we tried the Crunchy Cinnamon French Toast, LOVED. Also, their syrup with a cinnamon stick in the bottle is awesome as well. 

Second visit, California Bagel Sandwich, delish! Again huge meal. I only ate half. OH and those hash browns, sooo good. And we also got the Crunchy Cinnamon French Toast again. 

Fast service even with how busy they get during "prime" breakfast hours. I know it's kind of strange, but the freshly squeezed orange juice is my absolute favorite part of my meal here, ha!

I have visited this business twice and I must say I really do owe them a review. 
Is it about the fact that the servers all dress in their pajamas and looked so homely or that the food is amazing. Oh wait did I mention that it's gigantic too. It's fairly pricey for someone like me but it's worth every cent. The omelet plate comes decorated with orange slices just for fun. The juices are bomb with a slice of fruit of whatever juice you ordered hanging on the side. 
I love that they don't bother you while you dining by asking every second "are you okay?" Just because there is a line (unlike most places I have been). Eat your fill and take the rest to go. There's no contending that I won't be visiting again

I am so happy that a valet guy from the M hotel in Vegas told me about this great place to eat had a orange and carrot  juice so yummy and the best chilaquiles and steak that I  ever had I am definitely coming back next time. When I came to Vegas again I am my family I am a picky eater so that's why I loved this establishment thanks everyone you are doing a awesome job keep it up

This place is fantastic!  We ordered the New York Steak Benedict Bagel and the Crunchy Raisin French Toast. What an amazing breakfast. It was delicious! We also had the pressed coffee pot and we were coffee buzzed all day! Go check this place out. It's awesome. They even have cute umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and the servers are wearing pajamas! So adorable!!

Every time we go its around 1-2pm, and although we love the food the service is below par.  We always have to ask for refills and then wait an undertermined amount of time before we get them, and remind our waitress of any condiments that we have requested.
GREAT food and service! This was off the trail from Vegas to pahrump and totally worth it.
We tried the iced coffees, bananas Frosted Flakes pancakes, Chillaquilles, the Go Go juice and turkey Kielbasa & eggs & everything was super delicious

Went here for breakfast and everything about this place was unique and charming! Staff dresses in pajamas and are super friendly and enthusiastic! 

The ambience and decor is so cute and colorful. 

The food was wonderful - their signature pot of bread and ultimate steak and eggs were delicious! I also loved the hazelnut Nutella coffee - I personally liked the latte better than the cappuccino but that's because it was sweeter. The cappuccino was stronger and more coffee flavored. 

Definitely a gem in vegas and will be going back!

Love it here !! You guys are excellent with service ! Extremely friendly, feels like home !! 
Everyone keeps a smile on their face and that's what I love to see !

I have a feeling I'll become a regular since I can walk here for breakfast.  Located on the corner of Paseo & Valley Verde, it's convenient and easy to find.  

Like their other locations, the cute decor is complete with open umbrellas on the ceiling and wait staff in their jammies.  It's fun and creates a comfortable setting for dining patrons.  

Now since it's still fairly new to the area, weekends can get very busy.  But if you have time during the week, you can get a seat immediately.  The hostess staff have all been very quick to greet and get you seated.  The wait staff have also been the same.  The servers I've had have been friendly and attentive.  

When I find something I enjoy, I stick with it.  That's why I've had the 3 Little Pigs Bagel a few times. It's definitely a large breakfast sandwich piled with bacon, ham, banger, egg and cheese.  Some of the meats have a distinct smokey flavor that soars.  When you put this on their 'Everything' bagel, it's a complete package.  I've split this sandwich with someone and still walked away full.  Shoestring fries accompany the bagel but you can always get hash browns if you prefer.  

I'm happy to have such a close breakfast place.  See you again soon!

I live nearby so this is becoming a regular breakfast spot for me. My go to is the avocado cheddar egg & veggie bagel sandwich. It's huge and filling.

Today, Monday 5/28, Maria was my wonderful server. I was greeted immediately, my food came out super fast, my coffee stayed full, and I was even offered a coffee to go. Not much more I can ask for when eating breakfast.

Not sure why breakfast restaurants are always chaotic. Probably a combination of hungry hungover adults and hungry little wild children. This place is no exception. The check out is in the front door walkway. Kind of bazaar. This place is always extremely busy. It's very easy to get stuck and lost at the entrance.

Very cute breakfast place. Amazing food!

I'm sitting here drafting this review as I watch my son finishing our breakfast. It makes me a bit sad that this place is so far from my home. I drove here from Henderson, its located on Southern Highlands Pkwy & Cactus. If it was close, I'd be the Duchess...fast! And weigh much more, probably...

I was a waitress back in the day at locally owned restaurants like Rise & Shine, and as I giggle watching these ladies serve food dressed in flannel pajamas, all I wondered was "Why didn't I work at a place where pjs were the uniform?!?!" How much more comfortable can you make it, right?! So you can imagine, it definitely has a warm feeling. The smell of French toast and coffee and cinnamon gets your nose up as you walk in the door. 

The menu - you can order your standards. Omelets, pancakes, bacon & eggs. Then you see Crunch Cinnamon Raisin French Toast and Spiced Rubbed Rib Eye Chilaquiles, Fried Chicken and Waffles, and homemade Corned Beef Hash. 

What else? Most egg plates come with your choice of toast, biscuit, or the ever popular pot of bread. Very adorable little round loaf of slightly cinnamon gooey deliciousness seem to be on many tables during my visits. 

The drinks - freshly squeezed orange juice is always a favorite of mine I share with my son. But I had to try their French press coffee after reading about it. A generous serving is brought to your table, accompanied by a sand hourglass, with three separate colored sands. You decide which sand to follow to determine how strong you want your coffee. Love it!! (see photo if you can't picture what I'm saying)

I haven't dined here for lunch, but I slightly glanced at it while drooling over the breakfast choices. If you're not in the mood for breakfast, like their current special, Baked Blueberry Pecan French Toast Casserole or my personal favorite, Make-Your-Own Yogurt Parfait, you can choose from burgers, salads, panini sandwiches, and daily specials like meatloaf, fish & chips, and chicken broccoli pot pie, served until they run out. They also offer a few kid's plates, however, if you have a toddler like me, the generous portions they serve is more than enough to share! Prices are decent, the service I've received have been warm, inviting, and prompt. 

I think if the next few visits are as awesome as my previous ones, they definitely warrant a 5-star review. For now, it is far to drive to, and I do wish they offered lighter healthier options, too. Do I end up ordering them? Not much. But I like having the choice when I'm feeling weight-conscious on those rare occasions. Nonetheless, I'm a big fan of Rise & Shine's yummy breakfasts!

This place is friggin AMAZING!!!!!! I've been back a few times over the past few weeks cuz everything on their menu is super fire!! The spice rubbed steak & chilaquiles is by far my favorite. Get the pot of bread w/ that (and ask for a side of the cream cheese sauce if you're feelin kinky)! #cinnabunstatus!! The vibe in the restaurant is pretty dope too. The servers rock their jammie's & are super friendly. If ya got a hankering for some killer steak & eggs, this is a no brainer!!

We've been coming here for years. Although the food is good, the service has gotten worse and worse :( 
I had to ask the server to pick up our food that had been sitting in the window, after she delivered it she never returned to our table. And it wasn't busy. I got my own to-go box and as we paid at the front I wanted to express how bad the service was, but the woman who rang our check was rude and didn't get eye contact with us once. No smile No thank you, nothing. So sad to see a great place go down hill

Good breakfast.  I have been a few times and the space is nice, the pj's are cute and the food is good. It isn't my favorite breakfast place, but a good option. My only issue is it seems they are always a little unprepared. I have gone on weekdays and there are seats open but we have to wait for them to clean off the tables. Like they were short a staff member.  

On another note the white chocolate coffee is DELICIOUS! !

Ex and I went Dicing 2 Eat (Dice Living).     I chose the restaurant because I had heard that they wear their Pajamas when serving and it sounded neat.    I was right!    They do and it is neat!

Once there we were seated in the nearest booth to the door because I walk on a cane from a broken ankle I sustained in December, no fun!    but that was very nice of the waitress to do for me.

The restaurant was clean and surprisingly empty-very few people were there and i had heard to come early and be prepared to stand in line so that made me wonder....

I had to try an item off the menu from a section chosen by The Die.   ~The Classics done better~ was chosen for me and then my Ex Don got to choose an item for me to try from that section (want to go Dicing with us yet?    we need a 3rd  :D )    Chilaquiles was chosen for me (that may be the incorrect spelling though)   It was basically fried Tortilla chips covered with Refried beans, cheese, sour cream, salsa, avocado and topped with 2 eggs.   YUM!!    

I chose the section for my partner and I chose beverages and then I was to choose his item and chose a Mocha Iced Coffee.   He did not like it, he said it was watery and weak, I decided to order the Vanilla Mocha and had the same results and we love Iced coffee, Ihop seems to make the best from what we have had so far and this is the ONLY reason I have to give this place a 4 instead of a 5 star review.

The service was excellent and because I told the waitress that we were new, she brought me a Pot O Bread for Free, its a cinnamon roll in a cup served with a kind of sweet and not sweet dipping sauce-It was excellent.

Highly recommend this place!       They even have spinning umbrella lamps!       We will be going back next time The Dice chooses it of course!

Oh my deliciousness!  We happened upon this little gem on the way to LA.  The steak was cooked to perfection, cup of bread was a sweet little taste of a yeasty cinnamon roll with a yummy dipping sauce.   Serve was AwSoME!

This is absolutely the best breakfast place I've visited since moving to Las Vegas. If you enjoy a good breakfast, it's worth dropping in. If you're not in the southern Highlands area, it's worth the drive. 
Ambience: this is a smaller restaurant, which gives a great feel for breakfast. The wait staff is in pajamas, which is a nice touch. If you make a trip alone, I recommend sitting at the bar and watching the cooks work. These guys are on top of their game  
Food: the portions are big! You definitely get your money's worth. As far as taste, the food is flawless. The pancakes are perfectly fluffy. I had one of the bagel sandwiches and I was thoroughly impressed. 
Staff: everyone from the hostess to the manager is very friendly. The waitresses are very attentive and are always around, but not in an annoying bothersome way. 

Overall, a great little restaurant. I will be back many times for sure.

Yum! I believe this place has been around for awhile and I've been meaning to try it. So glad I did. I LOVE breakfast but it's hard for me to enjoy at most places because I don't eat beef or pork. Despite the fact that they are a "steak n eggs" place, this place has more then a few options for people like me. Although not very healthy, I love their chicken and waffles.... The portion size is large but it is great to take to go for a later day snack. I am also a huge fan of the fact that they serve coffee in a French press which is my absolute FAV way to enjoy some joe. The only complaint I have is that they do seem to run out of things frequently. Especially the infamous pot of bread. Other then that, service is always fast and friendly. Food is good. Wait is never as outrageous as some places (but we don't go on Sat). Nice job Rise and Shine.

Love the chilaquiles from here! I've always had a good experience when I've dined in. It does tend to get busy in the mornings (like all breakfast places), but the wait is worth it. Portions are pretty large, too -- I usually end up splitting an entree with the hubby and that's plenty for the two of us.

Alright place for a steak and eggs breakfast. The steak that I got wasn't the best cut, it was full of fat and eggs were bit overcooked. I'll definitely try to place out again to see if it was fluke or not. Service was excellent.

As a frequent visitor of Las Vegas, I don't know how I could've possibly missed this super awesome and delicious eatery!!

My friends and I had arrived into Las Vegas, and I just just arrived from New York, while my friends were recovering from a long night, and we were clueless as to where to go for some good lunch/breakfast.  We yelped on our phones, and when we came across chicken and waffles, we thought well, could they possibly be better than Roscoes?  Well, let me tell you...

The Staff & Service

Impeccable, supremely dedicated to customers, and so friendly, I thought I was in another planet!  Seriously, everyone's smiling, and so welcoming.  Customer service is super important to me because I work in this field, and when I don't receive supreme customer service, I ain't happy!! We didn't know what to order, so we asked the nice waitress, and with her recommendations, my friends and I ordered our dishes.  She gave us enough time to order, and she was spot on with her recommendations.  To summarize this area, the word to be used is: perfect!

Rating:  5 out of 5

The Food

My friend and I ordered the original Chicken & Waffles.  Let me tell you...it's far better than Roscoe's.  The fried chicken wasn't dry--just perfect and crispy.  The waffle was delicious--no flaws for sure.  The portions were just about right--I was super hungry so I ate it all.

My other friend ordered the Rib-Eyed Chilaquiles.  The steak was juicy, and the chips that were layered beneath the steak was to die for. 

The "pot of bread" was a first for me.  It was delicious--not too sweet like cinnamon buns, but just perfect.   

Rating:  5 out of 5


Overall

I will most definitely be returning to this restaurant from now on, every time I visit Las Vegas.  This would be place for me to get a hearty breakfast without a doubt.

Rise and Shine: If y'all are reading this, thank you for your awesome and delicious meal!  You guys are awesome!!

I've been here only once but my first impression of this place - I love it already. One of my top favorite breakfast places in town now. I've been wanting to try this place out for like six years and FINALLY just got to try it today. I wish I tried it sooner ! There was no wait when we came in this morning too.

They have an extensive menu and everything sounded so good for breakfast but I finally settled with their crunchy cinnamon french toast. They have the BEST french toast in town ! And I'm not just saying that because I came in starving lol. I really enjoyed their variation of french toast. It wasn't too sweet either. It's a must try. I also ordered my french toast w/ egg whites and turkey sausage and my friend shared some of his hash browns. Loved every single part of my meal. One of their other highlights is their pot of bread. Presentation is cute , it comes in a small mug. It's like a cinnamon roll and you dip it into their cream cheese icing (or whatever the deliciousness is). It's also served w/ butter on the side but it's that good on it's own so it doesn't need it. 

Love the theme they got going on too - they have twirling flower umbrellas on the ceiling and all the servers wore PJs. I would love to come back here again if it wasn't so far from my house. If they could open another location in Henderson that would be perfect :)

Here visiting Vegas and steak and eggs sounded good so we tried this place out...SOOO glad we did!!! It's delicious, made from scratch goodness. It changed my life, it was that good!! Order the ultimate steak and eggs or the chicken and waffles, you won't be disappointed!!

4 stars for the food, 1 star for the coffee 

This is an above average breakfast spot. I highly recommend trying their fresh-squeezed OJ and an omelette or the banana pancakes (although the pancake batter is noticeably sweeter than other breakfast spots). 

My only complaint is the coffee! The regular coffee is weak, and the french press is barely drinkable. I always order OJ and then go to Starbucks after (located in the same plaza) for my coffee fix. Several other locals I've talked to do the same.

Best breakfast diner in town HANDS DOWN.

Your best breakfast options are not located in the heart of Las Vegas (the strip, spring valley, etc). Rise & Shine is located on the far Southside off the 15 freeway of Silverado Ranch Blvd.

At this joint, they offer some serious quality breakfast in exceptional presentation. I have already visited this place twice in less than a week. All for good reason.

On my first visit, I tried the Ultimate steak & eggs breakfast which consisted of a massive and juicy 8oz rib eye steak. Along with my meat was hash browns and 3 egg whites. It's about $14+ but you get what you pay for. This is one massive meal and a quality that you can't find at South Point or wherever the hell you go for your midnight steak & eggs.

On my second visit, I tried the Ham & Eggs Benedict on a English bagel. Though I'm not much of a Ham & Eggs Benedict type of person, it was tasty as well! Served with your standard hash browns.

Already came here twice and looking forward to a 3rd time to see how the corned beef hash is. Apparently, it's made fresh from scratch so can't wait to give that a try.

Service was great as well! Servers were all attentive and courteous. They even wear pajamas to resemble an early-day atmosphere.

5 stars is not enough for this place. Food is amazing, service was excellent and a very relaxed atmosphere. Place was very busy wait was about 20 min. The eggs benedict and the kitchen and waffels were great they are a must have. If your in the south valley this is best breakfast place.
Phenomenal service, delicious food and great prices! Everything on the menu looked so good, I can't wait to be back in the area to eat here again! It was nice to have normal sized portions as well.

The service is great. Seated fast, and very happy. The coffee is great with choices vanilla and half and half. That's what we came for, then it happened. The waitress said the potted bread is good and cinnamon toast crunch French toast. We had this for two, off the hook!! I wish there was a place like this where we lived. Brads recommendation: hide the waitress Serice bar out of site. Everything else great!

My first time here.  The service was great from Maria.  I had their new breakfast burrito..the green chili and pork carnita.  Very tasty...although had to much pork and not enough eggs.  Spoke to Maria about it and she let the kitchen know, so they can fix it in the future..

Cute place, great food and descent prices.  I had the chicken fried steak and it was one of the best I've had in Vegas.  The pot of bread was amazing.  Staff is very friendly and place is very clean. Will definitely come back.

I live a few minutes from restaurant so is convenient but it's really overpriced. The food doesn't impress me but we usually meet with family so it makes it better I guess. Last time I went the workers were not having a good day. There's no manager walking around to make sure everything is fine.  Based on last time I went I will not be going back at least for a long time. Hopefully they improve their food and service. I don't mind paying more for good taste and great service. Good luck if you like your steak medium rare.  I like their fresh juices.

Can it get any more fun? Staff serves in their p.j's. Decor is a blast and menu is endless. You like it, they make it.
Best of all... A+ RATING WITH HEALTH DPT!!!
must go to place!

Just go to Rise and Shine, you'll give it 5 stars too! Great service, quaint environment, and delicious food. Beware this little cafe is a hot spot for Sunday breakfast and brunch so plan accordingly. Well worth the wait!!

You just lost a regular customer. Come every week. Bring every visitor I have. Came today with my dog, on a gorgeous 70 degree day,  but today I am informed  you aren't serving outside. I won't be coming back.

Huuuge selection! I've been here a few times and I've always had a great experience. Ashley took great care of us, she was super sweet and down to earth. I love that they all wear PJs! How cute is that?

I got the salmon and bacon bagel ~~yummy  and my bf got an omelette and hashbrown~~yummy.. you really can't go wrong with anything on their menu here.

Best breakfast ever. Service, decor all A+
Highly recommend 
Steak was killer (ultimate)
$$

We went on Friday Memorial Day weekend 2017. Went in at 10:30 sit down didn't get our food till like 11:45am. Le They were really backed up on the kitchen. It's a cute place but we waited a long time for our food. The service people were wearing PJs as uniforms. Food was tasty but I would go back another time. I got the all white omelet with chicken, spinach, cheese, mushroom.

Omg!  What a gem!  We found this place on our way out of Vegas. It will be one of our usual places now that we've found it. It was very cute with the wait staff wearing pjs.  They have several types of Benedicts, yogurt parfaits, and do many other dishes. Everything was delicious!  I had an avocado Benedict which was amazing. My husband ordered the buffalo chicken breakfast that was fabulous. Can't say enough good things about this place.

A good thing, just got better! Rise & Shine has expanded in more ways than one. The original restaurant in Southern Highlands was recently remodeled and not only seats more folks, but it now features a specialty juice bar/latte station. No need to stop my Starbucks before entering here. Additionally, a second store is now open in Summerlin; although, I have yet to visit. What can I say, I like to stick close to home in the mornings.

Great service, we got our food quicker than expected, the only downside was what my friend ordered. She ordered a corned beef hash, but there wasn't really enough corned beef on her plate, it was mostly potatoes. She was upset to be eating eggs and potatoes on a "corned beef hash" plate. That's alright, we'll try other things on the menu next time!

Ambiance: We walked in and were immediately seated by the very friendly host. My husband and I both immediately loved the decor and the color scheme. We especially appreciated that it didn't smell rank and was nice and clean. My 2 year old did his part to rest the patience is staff by throwing his silver dollar pancakes and breaking the plate. The server assured us that it was ok and without our asking, brought us a fresh serving in a kid friendly dish. 

Food:  I had the Ultimate Steak and Eggs. My husband had waffles. Everything was seasoned to perfection, tender, fresh, and wrapped in the taste of home. The Green Go Go fresh juice drink was delicious and didn't taste like grass like one would assume. Don't visit Vegas without leaving the strip to visit Rise and Shine!

We came here for breakfast and boy was it good. Our waitress was Maria. She was nice and super helpful. I wanted to order the sourdough hamburger which isn't available until 11:30am according to the menu. But Maria said she could ask the cook and he happily made the burger for me. Yum!! It was cooked to perfection and very flavorful. It came with seasoned fries and they were tasty too. My boyfriend ordered the Ribeye steak and eggs and he ate every bite. My Mom isn't a very big eater and they have a menu for kids and seniors which has smaller portions. She had the grilled cheese with fruit and ate the whole thing. We all had the best food and excellent service. Even though it was busy here she still made us feel very welcomed and satisfied. I recommend Rise and Shine for delicious food and Maria will take great care of you.

This place rocks! Nice pleasant atmosphere and friendly staff. If I could give it more stars I would. The best steak and eggs/chiliquiles ever.. I mean come on a rib for the steak!! The whole meal was awesome!! Can't wait to go back when I'm in town.

OUTSTANDING FOOD AND SERVICE!! Great friendly neighborhood restaurant! Everything is yummy!! The ambiance is geat with jammies and hanging umbrellas. Potatoes are amazing with a hint of rosemary. The french toast- and I would recommend the addicting crunchy selection is always served with whipped butter and a bottle of warm syrup! The pot of bread with a touch of cinnamon is is offered with a spot of jam and whipped butter. A wonderful selection on their menu. They always wish to have your feedback for any improvement and the owner comes around to talk and ensure it is a pleasurable experience. Very personable. This is my first review and I eat out for almost every meal. Worth the time.. Hope you enjoy!!
Great food and amazing service!  Maria is a wonderful server, and the food is excellent every time we eat here!  My favorite place to eat breakfast in the Valley!

I want to pick zero stars, but yelp made me pick something. 

Went to breakfast this morning and I thought I saw something in the kitchen....sure enough, the bread was FULL of mold. Told a worker and they were mortified. I'm sure they were very sorry, but my question  is this.....with all the people working there, how come NONE OF THEM SAW IT? Why isnt the kitchen staff aware of the food they are serving? Was a nice place to go to, but knowing they are serving up any old thing, won't go any more!

The food was good, (i had the egg white and chicken omelette. So fresh and delicious!) and the only reason this place didn't get one star.

The wait was "15 min" when we got there and we weren't seated for 30 min. The hostess was rude, but the waitress was lovely.

Unfortunately the food came out veryyy slowly and the place was not "packed full" to support how slow the food came out.

To top off the "ambiance," the restroom was a mess (there was no hand towels or toilet paper.. But that's not the end of the world).

Lastly, there was a lot of tension between all of the employees (especially the hostess and the wait staff). It was very unprofessional, and if I was the owner I would be embarrassed that the negativity is so strong that it bleeds to the customers' experience.

I may order take out from this place some day because again, the food was great, but I do not want to be around the employees.

Today was my wife and I first time, and boy did we enjoy ourselves. The food was amazing the the service was even better. Ashley was amazing and she actually made conversation which we both love since are both in the same industry. My steak and eggs were amazing and cooked perfectly and my wifes country fried steak and eggs was amazing too. Lots of flavor and cooked just right. We will definitely be back.
Great place for breakfast.  My husband loved his pancakes.  The coffee was exceptional.

May just be the best breakfast place in vegas! Highly recommend the chicken and waffles. Chicken was perfectly crisp on the outside, and juicy on the inside. Waffles may just give roscoe's a run for their money. Don't forget the little pot of bread! Baked fresh, and super scrumptious. We did have to wait for around 25-30 min, but it was during the weekend, so I bet most breakfast places would have been busy anyways. Would definitely come back again! :)

So disappointed. Horrible service and the glasses were extremely dirty asked for new ones and the second time around the glasses were even dirtier and this with food stains. Can't even imagine how that kitchen looks
Went a group of 11 for breakfast. Every member happy + service great prices reasonable. Would return.
Fantastic food, servers in pajamas and cute decor. The service was great and the syrup pourer was drip less. Can't wait to go back

Was excited to try this new location since hubby and I enjoy their Southern Highlands location.  Was very disappointed here.  Cold, hard biscuits, thin, lukewarm gravy.  Hash browns overwhelmed with green onion.  We spent $40 for breakfast for two and felt ripped off.  Avoid.

Wanted to find a nice, quiet breakfast house off the strip. We found Rise and Shine purely by accident but we were impressed as soon as we walked in. Bright, cheery and clean. We were sorted very fast and had our coffee immediately. Our waiter was Gilbert in his cute checker board jammies who was always willing to make our meal a success. Very attentive and obviously has many years of experience. Food....OMGOSH! You don't need to add salt, pepper, ketchup or anything. All the food has good flavor. We will definitely hit this establishment again the next time we're in Vegas

Cutest little breakfast spot EVER!  Servers wear PJ's - all were friendly and welcoming. 

Came in around 9:30 on a Saturday morning and had to wait about 15 minutes - Grab a Vegas & Seven magazine next to the hostess stand to pass the time. This place is worth the wait!

I opted for the Pot of Bread, the omelet and hashbrowns.  

Pot of Bread - excellent, medium sized with the perfect amount of cinnamon twist.  

Omelet - My go to is usually egg whites with spinach & onions - I saw kielbasa for an option and my polish heart just couldn't resist.  Perfectly cooked & great portion sizes.

Hashbrowns - now i am VERY particular when it comes to my hashbrowns - I despise breakfast potatoes & am a huge fan of crispy.  These hashbrowns were not your normal thick breakfast has browns, but instead thin and crispy.  Probably the best hashbrowns I have ever had.  

All & all i will be adding this to my list of favorites.  Very nice to actually sit, eat and visit in a home-cooked setting.  Not in a casino - not in a bar, but in a great neighborhood.

I found this place by accident when leaving Vegas with the hubby.  I searched and search and drive the 20 off the strip to eat here twice. This has to be one of the best places to eat in Vegas for breakfast. Pot of bread is great. Plus 13.95 for rib eye chilaquilas!!!! Love it also cinnamon toast crunch French toast.  Both worth braking paleo

I went on sunday and it was crazy!  I sat at the bar so i could see the cooks and man are they efficient!  Chicken and waffles are to die for.  This place is a well oiled machine. Good food, good service, i will definitely be back..

Great food at a decent price but I did not feel like our waittress was very good. My table had empty drinks and for some reason she was outside the restuarant for a while. I plan on going back may have just been a fluke or she was having a bad day, which is understandable.

We just moved into the area & this has now become our regular breakfast spot. Their french press coffee & pot of bread is a must to start out your day. Their omelette is my usual go to because their ingredients are so fresh. You really can tell the difference. Texas toast French toast is excellent & their original pancakes are my step daughters favorite. They serve them with warm maple syrup with a cinnamon stick steeping in it. There is a large outdoor patio & inside seating. The prices are a little high for breakfast but the quality of the food is worth it. Oh yea you can go in your pjs bc the servers are in theirs too.
Great little joint. For a holiday weekend and only having one server for the entire restaurant she did a great job. Poor management for only scheduling only 1 until 830.

Red Velvet Pancakes with Cream Cheese syrup matched with ribeye steak chilaquilles and filet mignon bagel sandwiches all done to perfect flavor.  That's just the food.  The servers are amazing, the environment friendly and the menu diverse. What more can you ask for with a local family style breakfast/lunch diner.    (try the pot of bread).
Its a really busy place which is good because the food is awesome! Big portions and great service. Definitely coming back. The red velvet pancakes were oh so goooood

This place is amazing!! The service is great and the food is delicious. I had the Chilaquiles, which truly exceeded my expectations. My mom used to make the dish for me as a kid so I am really happy to find a place that makes them and they're tasty!! 

I can't wait to go back and try new stuff!

Came here for breakfast with G/F after I got off shift. Very festive inside, we were greeted at the front door by the hostess and was sat immediately.(Since we were the first customers of the day). Server was very friendly but kind of slow on the service side. I ordered the country fried steak and eggs and g/f got 8oz ribeye and eggs. The ribeye was very tasty along with their hashbrown, which are shoestring. The only gripe I have is that they do not put enough gravy on the plate, it comes in a separate portion cup (3oz i believe) I like my stuff smothered!!!!! Also its kind of on the expensive side.
Food is good, but pricey. $38 for 2 people for breakfast ! Hummmm

Astonishingly amazing food, nice, quiet location, and incredibly friendly staff who go out of their way to provide exceptional service. If I ever come to Las Vegas again I will absolutely return. Exceptional!

Living (trapped!) in the hospital with my son who has leukemia for the past month... he is SICK of nasty hospital food.  Finally able to eat, we Uber'd breakfast to share with my son, my husband and myself this morning.  We ordered from Rise & Shine earlier in the week and it was fantastic!  Told my husand how good they were, so we ordered again.  BUT, appears may have a consistancy problem here!  We ordered nearly $50 in food and had missing items, and no condiments.  Sadly, one of the items missing was supposed to be MY breakfast!

Being a breakfast fan, this is my favorite breakfast spot ever.  Pleasant staff, dressed in pj's.  A nice touch.  A good place to take anyone.  I've been probably a dozen times and have tried something different each time and have not been disappointed once.  They also serve illy coffee which is the best.  

One very minor complaint.  Some of the booths are a little beat down and not the most comfortable.  Time for an upgrade.  The food and service make up for this though.  Not really a big deal

Love the waiters in pajamas and the flowers on the ceiling. Location is convenient if you're near southern highlands and food is good. Fresh pressed juices available which is a pretty sweet touch and decent servicing sizes. Yummy options but nothing that specifically stood out. All in all a place I would stop without second thought if I'm around the area!

Came here for breakfast with my husband and Father.  Everything was so delicious.  Staff was wonderful. My Dad loved it so much that he took
My Mom there later that day.

Really good food service 
Very good very impressed with the whole experience
Awesome will be back very soon
Found my new normal place for breakfast

Really great neighborhood spot. Cool joint good home cooking food. Just get there early to get good seating or the pot of bread "Yum" it gets pretty busy on the weekends! Must try plenary of options and ok price.

Yelp never fails to disappoint! Yelped breakfast spots and this place magically appeared! We dropped in on our way out of Vegas. I asked our waitress what she recommened and she said the chicken and waffles...I took her advice and let me tell you...IT. WAS. WORTH. IT!! My friend got the steak and bagel eggs benedict which she loved as well, but we both agreed that the chicken and waffles was AMAZEBALLS! We also got the pot of bread...which was so cute and good! Oh and the service was great...waitress was so nice! Definitely will visit this place when I'm visiting Vegas again!

The reviews here seem to cover the bases pretty well, so I will only add the key points.   Foremost. this restaurant should seriously consider adding a newspaper machine outside or sell newspapers inside.  It seems like that is a must for any breakfast place.  Also, the prices are a little more expensive than I would expect, especially for a local neighborhood joint.  Overall its a good breakfast.

I visited for Sunday brunch and the place was slammed.  During my fifteen minute wait I watched various delicious looking meals go by, and noted the satisfied bliss of those receiving them.  I was seated at the countermand was attended to promptly my one of the many pajama clad waitresses.  My bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and egg breakfast was awesome!  I shall return to try more of their delights!

A bit salty for my liking...but portions are huge and tried their chilequilles...it was good.  The pot of bread was aeesome.  The only odd experience was, our waitress served us caffeinated coffee when i specifically asked her for decaf. And the only reason we found out it was caffeinated was because I had asked for another cup since the coffee was lukewarm!! Lukewarm at 730am?! I've never been served lukewarm coffee!  When i questioned the coffee and asked her if it was decaf for sure,  she was hesitant and had to ask her manager...So this 3 star review is more for the experience with the waitress and coffee fiasco rather than the food...i will not be returning.

I'm just going to start off with I'm never coming here again. It's not that I had some atrocious experience, but this place just really isn't that great - especially for the price. I've had much better food at much shittier restaurants and that's saying a lot considering the value. They play country music, which to me is mind boggling since the number one response to "what music do you listen to?" is "anything but country". The service is mediocre I went an hour before closing and the server made me feel like I was inconveniencing her for having to do her job. The interior is surprisingly tawdry as well, it's like they substituted everything in a Greek restaurant for even tackier decor. Plus they sell a bunch of crap that could only be categorized as "Things grandmas buy their nephews after going to Church but before they have brunch". Do yourself a favor and go to Kitchen Table or Served.

Love this breakfast place!  It's cool that the waiter's and waitresses wear pjs to work!  I always get the eggs benedict..it has balsamic vinegar on it which is a really yummy twist to the traditional!  Hubby always gets the chicken and waffles which are great too! Service is always great!  Rise and Shine is our favorite place for breakfast when eating out!

I just wish to post an update regarding my latest review which unfortunately discussed some potential health issues and shortcomings of service.  I can't update without giving a star rating.  So for now, I'll revert to my 4 star rating.

I received a personal message from the new general manager, Davilan, who was very apologetic for the shortcoming of the restaurant.  He has assured me that that level of service throughout our visit was not acceptable and not at the level expected of staff  and has been addressed accordingly.

My wife and I only expect to be treated as all the other guests, nothing more, nothing less.  

In all fairness, and based upon the very timely response from Davilan after the review posted, my wife and I will return in the near future.  I'll keep you posted.

I've been here a few times and loved the first two times. It's a cute atmosphere and friendly staff. However, the third time they ran out of pot-of-bread, which was one of the things that made this place special. The fourth time, they had pot-of-bread but were no longer offering the awesome homemade jam that used to come with it (another thing that made them special). All in all, the food is pretty good, but nothing different from the other tons of breakfast places in Vegas. They do have warm maple syrup, but I wouldn't be surprised if they soon got rid of that too. It's the little touches that can make places like these successful, but is seems they are moving in the wrong direction.

Note to the owner(s): bring back the homemade jam!!!

Great food and excellent service !
Laura took care of us and guided us through a very interesting menus with tons of variety 

Will defiantly return.
Maybe even tomorrow!

Came in here on a Sunday morning for brunch. My bff Ame and I were able to walk in without any wait. This restaurant is located in Southern Highlands, a super nice, relatively new neighborhood in Vegas. 

We each ordered the short stack of pancakes platter with the choice of bacon, banger sausages (what we both got), or turkey kielbasa and two eggs. 

We decided to get a side of tomatoes to get some veggies, as well as a pot of bread to try. I also ordered a cup of coffee (they brew ILLY coffee - THE BEST!).

I had no idea what a pot of bread was, so this was the best way I could describe it: It's like a cinnamon bun, without being sweet, and served with preserves. I thought it was delicious and appreciated that it wasn't terribly sweet. Also, it comes in a little flower pot. SO adorable. 

Also, our waitress was kinda amazing. One of the nicest servers I'd ever seen in Vegas. She kinda reminded me of Shania Twain (random I know). She seriously kicked ass, and did a great job of taking care of us. 

Just a couple of minor things I would have Rise And Shine work on:
-My banger sausages (DELISH) were warm but not hot
-The prices here are a little more expensive 

A few things on my list to try next time:
-2 cup French Press Illy coffee
-Steak and Eggs -- this is their signature dish
-Hash Browns - seems like everyone had this and I had major food envy

The staff was not sitting guests in hopes for the kitchen to 'catch up'.  Also, while whimsical pajamas day for the staff only remains funny when the restaurant actually has efficient service.  Don't try to be funny if you can't make your guests at least sAtisfied.
Really good food. Coffee presses available but poured coffee is also good. Quick service and very interesting menu.

not what it used to be! if your vegan they will still give you chicken and get mad when you complain about it. terrible customer service, the owners don't like to cater to "ethnic" people whatsoever. owners are also very rude smh

Haven't been here in awhile because it's always just been ok. It's close to us, so thought we'd try it again. Went around 10am and it was busy. They told us it was a 15 minute wait but was less than 10. We both ordered omelets which were good, not great. One was fluffy and the other was almost too done, should have a little consistency. The breakfast potatoes are bland. The pot of bread is good, cute idea. Service is really good, servers wear pj's as their uniform and are all sweet. Two omelets, a hot tea, and oj was $34 before tip, seems a little high for what it is. I'd go back but mainly for the convenience that it's so close.
This place is legit, if you are super hungry this is the place, food is hughe, very tasty, the service is great and right on time. Definetely a place to go and spend some time.
The food was absolutely amazing here.  No wait, cute atmosphere and the prices were good.  Forget those high priced buffets when you can eat here!  Service was great!

Wow.... The food here is AMAZING. I ordered the steak & chilaquiles to try it out and they give you a whole steak cooked/seasoned perfectly! Fresh watermelon& strawberry, orange, or green juice. Our waitress was really friendly as well. If you're in Vegas this is a MUST try. I look forward to coming back & im so excited I found my go to breakfast place in Vegas. You cannot beat the quality of this food.
Bagel with cream cheese cucumber and tomato cost me 7.50. Ridiculous pricing. Only reason it gets two stars as oppose to 1 is due to the fact the food was okay

Loved the concept from the reviews and it sure was busy on a Sunday morning. The menu is interesting and the pot of bread is a winner. Perhaps didn't order the right item and if I come back may try to be more original, but the omelet was nothing special and light on filling and any type of seasoning, but the hashbrowns were so peppery that almost rendered them inedible. There were peppers in the hashbrowns but the peppery flavor was a heavy pepper shaker. The too busy atmosphere almost made the pace seem frenetic so didn't enjoy the experience that I was expecting to.

Love this place!!! Yelped and found this gem. It's a cute little cafe with daisy umbrellas hanging down from each light fixture. Servers wear pajamas!! It was just a little hot because it's 100 degrees outside and we were sitting on the window table, and drinking strong hot coffee with my fav French vanilla creamer. 

I ordered the ham n eggs Benedict with spinach. Delicious! Hollandaise sauce was on point, better than most other breakfast places and it's also drizzled with balsamic. ;) The BF ordered the roasted turkey, bacon, egg, Swiss, tomato on an "everything" bagel. Wow is all I have to say!!! Super huge with lots of cheese and delicious. We will definitely be here on the regular!!
We love this cute restaurant for breakfast!! The food is so good and the service is great too. Kris was our server this morning and she was awesome!!

Great waitress (funny, attentive, quick)

Fun atmosphere (music, temperature, vibes)

Great coffee (no nasty creamers at the table)

Amazing food (perfect steak of course, vegetarian and gluten free options, large portions)

Not too pricey.  $40 for two + tip.
This is one of our favorite breakfast place. The only thing that I dont like is I always order medium rare steak but it ALWAYS comes in well done. French toast is great! Fresh orange juice is great!

BEST STEAK AND EGGS EVERR!!!!!!
Great service, great vibe, great food!
I recommend to anyone!

We have been coming to rise and shine for about 3 years, for a while it was our Sunday breakfast spot and we would go every Sunday. We always get the same thing, country fried steak, the Texas French toast and a side of bacon. Slowly the service and "friendly" atmosphere turned to crabby and sloppy. I understand that breakfast places are usually packed on the weekends but that is no excuse for the lack of customer service. When I say "thank you" as you put down my food I don't expect a lot but maybe a "you're welcome". Last week we went to the newer location on Valle Verde and because the food has always been Phenomenal we will take the drive and go to that one. We will miss our regular servers but the new staff that has been hired needs to be trained in basic manners at the Southern Highlands location.

Service is very friendly. I had the cheesequila with steak and it was a great breakfast combo. Lots of gluten free options but still pancakes and toast if you want to have the traditional breakfast stuff.

It's a wonderful place! Love the food and the staff are always warm and friendly! We try and make it once a week. The portions are large and delicious. Kinda pricey but that is because SH rent is so high. Two  thumbs up!!

Food and service were awesome. 

French press was to die for if you need something to kick start the day. 

I ordered the chilequiles and steak. The chilequiles was topped with shredddd cheese, cheese cojito, beans and eggs. It was delicious! The steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly. It was very moist and tender. My hubby ordered the chicken and waffles. It's not often that restaurants know how to properly cook fried chicken but this place made the chicken very moist with the right amount of batter. I'd also recommend ordering the pot of bread as a side. It's yummy cinnamon bread. 

Also our server was very friendly and attentive!

If you're looking for a quality restaurant I would definitely recommend coming here!
This is probably going to be my new favorite breakfast place. Absolutely amazing food, awesome service, festive atmosphere. I highly recommend the fancy steakhouse omelette and the bread in the cup.

The Chicken and waffles were surprisingly very good. I was against the whole chicken/waffle thing, but I finally decided to try. And I'm happy to say I was able to try them here for the first time. Theirs so many flavors while chewing it in your mouth. Well done! The coffee was also delicious. The only down fall to this place is that it's so hot inside the restaurant! I was sweating and not just because I was having a coffee, but seriously hot in there from the minute I entered.
Been here a few times before leaving Vegas. Very cool vibe and food has been good everytime. It is a local spot but still expect a wait if going on the weekend.

The food does not disappoint. The patty melt and fries with the added rosemary on the fries were delicious. The chicken and waffles were some of the best I have had and I go to roscoes chicken and waffles.

The smoothie and coffee bar is amazing! Very busy on weekends, but what breakfast restaurant isn't? Waiters in pj's, comfortable atmosphere and family friendly. Add great food and u got a great place. 

This is my second time here and I ordered cinnamon French toast platter with scrambled eggs and bacon. It was so good and reasonably priced. 

I will definitely be back again!

It's good, not the greatest, but good. I wish they would do a traditional country fried steak instead of the fried NY steak that they do. The last time I went I ordered the ham steak and eggs, the ham was great, not over salty and very tasty! I asked for sunny side up eggs, when I received my plate they were sunny side up but basically cooked all the way thru with hard yolks. The breakfast gravy here is better than most places in town and the cup o bread is amazing!

First I have to say I went here when it first had opened I had so much fun the food was amazing. Now a couple years later craving the food the menu is different food was good but not what it used to be didn't get greeted as I walked through the way everyone was dressed was very sloppy and not as uniformed as used to be. They over charged me for French toast you can go to Ihop for half the price. I asked if I can have blueberry French toast and the server Vanessa says "sorry we took the off the menu" and offers something else, comes back with the food and said "sorry that's the best I can do for you". Turn off right there if I could I would have walked out of that place immediately, but I didn't want to embarrass my family. Moral of the store is I will not be returning and very disappointed, because that was the place I recommended to eat.
food is always great and good service. perfect place to start your day...try the french press coffee!

This place has never done me wrong. Staff is friendly. It's a chillax vibe with the pajamas. Good good. It's Beene great experience! I've taken my friends here and multiple occasions and always recommend getting the cup o bread no matter 

Second review! Had to just share my second experience here! This plAce is just amazing. It's high quality food and the portions are huge. It's a country fried New York steak and eggs, not that bottom round shizz. Gabe has coincidentally has been our server both times at the same table. The dude definitely puts the word shine in the restaurants name! Keep killin it Gabe
I've been to this location a couple of times now. The food is wonderful & the ambiance it's the best. My only reservation is that the wait staff seems to run around a bit haphazardly. I will return.

Food in my party of 6 was okay except the homemade hash! Greasy and now appetizing. I had the specialty dish Mexican which was good, however I got something real chewy in my mouth! Plastic about 2 inches long by 1 inch wide. Must have been off the chorizo mixed in with beans, chips, eggs, avocado,  salsa, and sour cream.  They didn't charge me for it. I would go back. My group wore our pajama tops to fit right in withe wait staff. Outstanding service!!

This was the best part about my brief stop in Vegas. Service - very friendly, our waitress was new but had the perfect suggestions. She also accidentally brought us a bread-cup, which was tasty (no charge). French press coffee was perfect for 2, strong flavor. The ribeye chilaquiles were outstanding!! The meat was cooked just right (med-rare), even the fat just dissolved in my mouth. The chilaquiles themselves were just crunchy enough and not soggy at all. The d√©cor is fun and I love the fact that the servers get to wear comfy PJs and be themselves, tattoos, piercings etc just make everything more genuine.

First time checking this place out, I'm pleased. The food was delicious and beautifully presented! My friends loved the bacon! I loved their hash browns and pancakes! Their decor is interesting and unique. Seems like a family owned place. It took me a little while to realize that the employees wear pajamas, I think it's a cute idea! Overall, I had a perfect experience. The food, service, and atmosphere was all really great! I will definitely be back.
The best breakfast EVER!! Our new "going home" breakfast place:) Food was A+, Service was A+, very pleased!!
Great breakfast place with reasonable prices. I just wish they had a changing table in bathroom.

I've been wanting to come here for a while now and finally i did yesterday! People are friendly. I love the menu! They have a great selection for lunch as well! Small place, goof thing there is also out side seating. I ordered the crunchy cinnamon raisin french toast and i made it a meal, The eggs were really nice and fluffy and the sausages were nice and tender! My boyfriend raved about his ham and cheese eggs Benedict, it came with potato hash browns on the side. The hash browns were soooo good! We also ordered the pancakes , regular ones. The pancakes were super fluffy and almost melted in my mouth! Best pancakes ive tasted in a while, but it didn't beat the yummy french toast i got!! Can not wait to come back, its all ive been thinking about. Service was okay, could be better.

If you live in Southern Highlands, it's a great little diner to eat breakfast at. I always worked mornings, so I couldn't go as often as I liked. I just ate here this morning and it is still as great as ever! Plus, I think they extended the hours. They're open until 3pm now. The waitresses are cool. I ordered an egg-white omelet with tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach, and swiss cheese. It was PERFECT! It also came with hash browns and toast. I ordered it like that, but there's loads of other choices as well. The portion was just right. I adore the spinning flower umbrellas on the ceiling, too. If you sit at the barstools you can watch them make the food. It all looked so amazing. The place is really clean and there's lots of light. If you want to see some pictures or their menu check out their website and Facebook. Definitely go here!!!

This is my favorite breakfast place in Vegas so far. I have been going here for over two years. Previously was close to my place (it's just off cactus and Decatur/southern highlands parkway) but now I happily drive there. 

The wait can be long sometimes and no reservations. So go early! It is a small place. But worth a wait (never too long anyways) if you are a late-comer. 

The menu is great. Lots of options but especially great because all the food is amazing! My personal favorite is the New York steak spinach and Benedict bagel. I opt for the everything bagel.
