The hollandaise sauce with the balsamic flavor on top of perfectly poached eggs and fresh spinach and a steak is nothing to complain about. Their hash browns are delicious too. Shaved yet thick... And have a buttery crispness to them. Love!

They also make these little cinnamon breads in clay pots "pot o bread" that is wonderful. Now... This used to be more wonderful when they made homemade jam with chunks of strawberries... But it's still delicious with butter or the packaged jam. OR I have been known to get a small side of the cheesecake icing or something they have so it is cinnamon bun like :) (recommended a while back by a waitress there)

The next best thing here is their coffee. IF you're a coffee fan they have an option of French press or regular brew. I always go for the regular brew which is ILLY coffee. This is one of my fave roasts :) so I usually take a cup to go since it's hard to find in the city. 

You can tell the staff enjoy working there. I always see the same servers. Great atmosphere and great food means happy customers and happy staff :)

The next best thing would be... That mostly anything that can be split in half you can order a half order. The price is somewhat changed (half or so) and is nice because the portions can be way too big! Or in case you're split between two dishes... It isn't written on the menu BUT they are so accommodating. You'll see!!

Try it! You won't be disappointed. And IF by chance you are --- let them know and in a jiffy they will correct it... That you'll forget anything wasn't perfect and still leave there smiling!! 

My only downside would be the price.  Somehow I would like to see somewhat smaller portions and a slightly lower price. That is what makes me not go there as often. I feel breakfast should be max 10 per person. Not 15... But that would be my only complaint..

YUM! Salivating writing this... Can't wait to go back!
This is the best breakfast place. Everything is really good. I love the eggs Benedict. Everyone is super friendly and we get great service. I also love the French press coffee!

Just had our first experience here and it was amazing. The carnita chilaquiles were excellent and my wife normally doesn't care for pancakes loved them. They use sweet cream pancakes instead of buttermilk and I guess that's what the difference was. Thank you Laura the recommendation and we will definitely be back.

**Updated Review **
This was my first time back here in years, and my rating sadly has tanked. 
Came in on a Monday morning and the place was pretty empty (to be expected for a weekday). 
We sat at the counter. 
I had some questions to make a veg or vegan breakfast, and the waitress was not helpful in the least. Okay, I get it, the name may say it all..but you can be helpful ...right??? Wrong. 
I asked about the breakfast potatoes being cooked in oil or butter and she said it was butter... imitation butter. Wow, a place that charges $10-$15 per plate and you're serving fake butter? Regardless I wanted my potatoes cooked in oil. It was a no go. So I ordered a juice... sucked it down...and will not return.

What a find! Thank you Yelper's. Before we left our Strip hotel we wanted to find a local place on the way home. Just a couple of miles off the freeway was this gem. 

Whimsical decor and fun waitstaff. We ordered the pot of bread as recommended and were not disappointed. Just the right serving size in its little teacup. 

Someone else suggested the corned beef hash and eggs. Not my go to breakfast but I haven't had it in a long time so I gave it a try. So so good.

Our waitress Cary was delightful and attentive, always filling our glasses even half full. 

We will definitely be back
1st timer, busy breakfast place in southern highlands- everything was delicious. Full coffee and juice bar. Chilequiles and chicken and waffles were delicious.
Great breakfast place. A wide selection of food and everything is cooked to order.  Highly recommended
Pretty Good palace . My plate was $15 . Only down fall is they charge $1 for cheese on both my eggs & hash browns  .  But they everything about the meal was really good .
Crunchy French toast is amazing. I also like their green go juice. I eat here on every trip to Vegas.

Being a huge fan of breakfast food, I wish that I could say I loved this place and that I'm excited to go back, especially since it's locally owned. But, unfortunately that isn't the case. 

he service was great. We were greeted right away and seated. Soon after someone took our drink orders [they serve illy coffee!]. Soon after, our waitress came up to see if we had any questions. 

I'm on a mission to find the best chicken fried steak in Las Vegas, so it was an easy choice when I saw it on their menu. I'll admit, once the food came out and I saw my order, I wanted to drool a little bit. It was a nice big portion of the chicken, scrambled eggs, gravy, & hash browns. 

The eggs were cooked well enough, but lacked any taste whatsoever. A little salt would've gone a long way. The hash browns seemed a little undercooked. Potato was still kind of starchy, and they were missing that nice golden brown color on top. The gravy was actually quite good, and was probably the highlight of the dish. Moving on to the main item, the steak. I liked the fact that it was a thick steak with a thin batter on it. Unlike the eggs, it did not lack in flavor whatsoever. Unfortunately, the ONLY flavor it had was of black pepper. Apparently what they lacked in salt in the eggs, they made up for with an excessive amount of black pepper on the coating of the steak and on the steak. 

One of my fellow diners ordered the chicken & waffles. His chicken had the same exact problem as my steak. All we could taste was the black pepper. It's unfortunate really, because both the chicken and steak were tender and cooked well. 

The pot of bread that came with my order was sub-par. Like the eggs, it lacked taste. I don't usually like to but butter on my rolls, but this bread definitely needed it to get some flavor. 

So, all in all - great service but lacked a bit in the food department. The food was cooked well, but needed better execution in my opinion. Hopefully, I just went on an off day. Maybe next time, if I so happen to be on that side of town during breakfast hours I might give it another chance. But it's definitely not worth another 20 minute drive for the sole purpose of eating there.
This place is AWESOME! Great food, great service and the prices are very reasonable. It's pretty cool that all the waitresses wear pajamas.

When you put a cold dinner roll in the microwave do you know what happens? It becomes warm and hard as a rock. It's very obvious that the few orders of cup of bread we received were reheated in the microwave. They were super dry and after about a minute or two they were hard as rocks and completely inedible. Wouldn't be such a big deal but at $3 a pop I expect something edible. Very disappointing. Everything else was fine. It's just aggravating when restaurants make poor choices in hopes to save a few cents, cuz in the end they're losing a lot more by inspiring us to find a different breakfast spot.

Some of our friends said this place was really good so we decided to give it a go; it also had good Yelp reviews and, being the Yelper I am, I try and put faith in my fellow Yelpians (is that what we're called?  I dunno).

Unfortunately, it was a little less than what I was hoping for.

We arrived and were seated immediately.  The restaurant was maybe half-full and it looked like most people were eating or had already finished, enjoying cups of coffee and talking amongst their parties.  We expected pretty quick, efficient service due to this, and did not receive it.  Everything was slow: ordering, getting things to our table, the check - it was really disappointing since it was obvious we missed the "big rush."

The hash browns were definitely nothing to write home about and tasted starchy - I tried some of my fianc√©'s.  And their coffee was like watery mud oil.  I ordered a signature dish because I really like to try those from places.  So, I got the blueberry and cream cheese stuffed french toast (I believe this was the name).  It came out and was HUGE!  They definitely don't skimp on portions, hence the extra star.  When I tried it, though, it was way too processed sugary.  I picked at the blueberries and the french toast for awhile but got full super fast and ended up sharing it with the rest of the table.  French toast doesn't really make good leftovers.  Pretty sure I should have gotten a heart attack from that, but the overall taste WAS decent.  Another downer was they didn't have low-fat cream cheese as an alternative, which is probably why I felt so full so fast as well.

Overall, definitely not impressed.  Perhaps everyone else just got lucky and had better food / service than I did.  Considering the above plus the prices, I'd rather just go to IHOP.

Went here for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised and happy that there is another breakfast place near my house.  The d√©cor is very friendly and colorful which I love.  They have upside down umbrellas hanging from the ceiling which is pretty unique and indicative of a street in England.

I ordered a lot so I could try a bit of everything:  

I got the cup of bread which is essentially a cinnamon roll cooked in a coffee cup with cream cheese frosting to dip.  It was good but needed more cinnamon and I would've preferred a glaze to dip.

I got a side of biscuits and gravy which again was good but too pricey for what it was.  Also, my biscuit was hard as a rock, luckily they replaced it for free.

My main dish was the chilaquiles which was very tasty.  Chips, with ranchero sauce, cheese, refried beans, salsa, sour cream, two eggs, and avocado.  

They have so many different types of dishes, many that are not seen elsewhere that I really want to try.  Guess I'll have to go back!

I think I'm going to have to drive back from LA just to come eat here!!! The chilaquiles and rib eye steak plate was AMAZING! Absolutely delicious!!! Very well priced and the staff are dressed in pj's!!! My type of place. I fit right in with my messy mom bun lol. Def going to be our go-to for breakfast when we're in Vegas!!

I love eating here but this time I ordered for take out. Food was ready in 15mins but everything was just so wrong. The burger I ordered was really plain, no mayo and came with onions which we did not want. The chilaquiles I ordered were okay just had to take the eggs off since they were extremely runny. Totally killed my appetite. The pot of bread was yummy as usual. Next time I'll eat there instead.

This is the second time at rise and shine. The first time I ordered the chilaquiles with the steak. It was different than most that I had. But still very good and a good portion. The steak had a good seasoning and was very tender. The second time I ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken was very very good , nice and crispy , and the waffles tasted like fluffy cake batter. It went well with the chicken. Orange juice is squeezed fresh and sweet. Not bitter at all. And you get a little pot of bread with a side of cream cheese syrup . Also very tasty! Service is good and it's adorable inside!

Quick Sunday Brunch! The concept of the restaurant is cool. I really like that the waiters were in pajamas and twirling umbrellas on the ceiling. I ordered the steak and eggs medium rare with the bread in a cup. The bread in a cup was the best part for me. It was sweet and the bread soft.  Unfortunately my steak left much to desire. The steak was well done instead of medium rare. I told the waitress and they fixed it immediately. The meal for me was nothing special. My friends on the other hand enjoyed their food very much. They ordered the chicken steak and Hash. I also ordered their Kale and apple drink it was really good! I just chopped it up that I picked the wrong thing on the menu. Also their cutlery and cups were dirty. The good out weighed the bad so I will probably try it again.

This place is awesome.  they are great for both breakfast and brunch. It seems to get busy in the morning, but worth the wait.  Any time I'm in Vegas I make an excuse to swing by here now.  Nothing but good memories and great food. 

The red velvet pancakes are amazing.  Super rich and very delicious. The omelets are good too.  I recommend getting both something sweet and something savory, then sharing! 

The service here is spot on.  Very friendly and they seem to actually enjoy being there. All the servers wear pajamas. Maybe it's due to the comfort of the uniform or the people at work, but everyone there seems to really enjoy it.
Love this place.   GREAT breakfast.   You must try the cinnamon pot of bread...Delicious.   they are known for their steak which I believe is butchered in house.   Try the steak and eggs.

I really want to give this place more stars but after two mediocre experiences, I have to settle at three. Both times the food has been good (the French press coffee is very nice), it's very cute inside and I love that the staff is wearing pajamas. It's the service that has been the disappointment. This last time we got in right after they opened and had zero wait getting seated. But then we had to wait more than 40 minutes for our food (a long time with a hungry 2 year old) our server didn't even make eye contact when she was talking or supposed to be listening, we had to consistently ask for refills, toast that was supposed to come with breakfast, creamer etc. and the bathroom was in a pretty dismal state.
Also no biggie but would be nice if they would add non fat milk to the menu. 

Lastly, we went on Mother's Day and they handed out roses to every mother but me! I didn't want to ask, "hey, can I have a flower too??" I had the damn baby and I want my rose! ;) I'm pretty sure our waitress just wasn't paying any attention but I felt like the black sheep, ha. 
I might give it a third go to see if it's the charm but honestly, I left feeling like I'd have had a better experience at an IHOP and would have spent less.

This place is amazing!!  We live around the corner so it's very convenient to stop by anytime.  If you come to Vegas and want to get off the strip and enjoy good atmosphere and food, check this place out!!  I would say it's more of a breakfast place but they do serve lunch as well, I have tried many items on the menu and have yet to have a bad meal!  A must have is the pot of bread, even if you order it separate, delicious!!!!!
This was a Fantastic place we found by Google-ing breakfast on maps.  Such a wonderful surprise.  Stop in before 3 pm.

Our family is always on the hunt for great restaurants. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner places. Loved the atmosphere. When we arrived the place was packed had to wait for 20 minutes to get a table.There was three in our party and we ordered three different things so we could all sample different dishes. 
The chicken fried steak is gigantic, enough to share. The breading was awesome. Order extra gravy. 
The steak and eggs were delicious not too big or too small. The steak was very flavorful! 
The corned beef hash was good. Had better.The corned beef was diced into big pieces prefer it the traditional way.  
Wanted to try so many other dishes that sounded great. Will definetly be back!
Cappuccino was okay but the steak was delicious. The ultimate ribeye steak and eggs is delicious. Service is okay.

This was my first time eating at this  establishment and I was very pleased with the staff and the level of service. The menu could be a bit more diverse but nonetheless the food was great. I had the chicken and waffles and was blown away. The portion was huge it actually made 2 meals for me. I would definitely eat here again.

Customer Service=Excellent 
Food: AMAZING
Cleanliness: Flawless 
What I recommend: The red velvet chocolate chip pancake... and try the bread in the pot.

Without a doubt , the worst breakfast experience I have EVER had .. All started with flat Pepsi , staring at our food under the lights for 15 minutes , bringing us liquid butter,toast that could've broken a window , my wife's omelette brought 10-12 minutes after mine, and the refusal to bring the manager over, and then charging us like everything was normal.
I'll make sure that all of my friends that frequent this place are well aware of the utmost lack of compassion that was displayed today..

Delicious reasonably priced food served by friendly and prompt servers in a clean and comfortable restaurant. Your breakfast/brunch/lunch experience here will be exceptional.

We stopped by on an early Sunday afternoon for some brunch. It wasn't, fortunately, very busy so we were seated quickly. I'm not sure how we missed the opening of this restaurant. We love their southwest location.

The restaurant is clean and comfortable like their other location. The servers are prompt and friendly, like their other location. Basically, another very nice Rise & Shine location.

We had the meaty egg white omelette and a bagel sandwich of some kind. Both dishes were very tasty.

Ok so if you go here you have to ask for Riley because her service is awesome. 
The food is absolutely amazing. Everything from scratch and just good clean food. 
The pot of bread... oh my goodness. Not overwhelmingly sweet so you can enjoy the uniqueness of the cinnamon roll baked in a espresso cup 
This is definitely my new favorite spot for breakfast when I'm in town. 
Been twice already and want to go back for more.

Awesome delicious food.  Vents make it a little cold.  The organic coffee was outstanding. Every plate of foods that would come out looked spectacular. Will definitely come back!  Have perfect waffles. My boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles and it was delicious.

This place is pretty good. The wait time to be seated is always long since the restaurant is so small but they do have good food. Southern Highlands needed a breakfast place in that shopping center and Im glad they opened it there. It beats driving all the way to go to Ihop or Dennys on Las Vegas Blvd.

I've tried two Rise & Shine locations and both times I've had issues.

Southern Highlands location - Once seated, it took close to more that 15 mins to get our water,  30 mins for the server to take our order and another hour to get our food. We've seen people get seated, eat and leave while we were seated. Totally unacceptable.  We spoke with the manager but did nothing about it.

Henderson Location - Thought I'd try this new location out. I ordered for pickup. Low and behold, I had a very long piece of hair in my food. We called and spoke with the manager and requested for a refund but we needed to go back to the location. Once at the location, the manager was no where to be found.  Got the refund from the host but WHAT A WASTE OF TIME.


I DO NOT RECOMMMEND GOING TO THIS PLACE.
THIS PLACE IS A JOKE. I HAVE HAD BETTER SERVICE AT DENNY'S.

I've tried two Rise & Shine locations and both times I've had issues.

Southern Highlands location - Once seated, it took close to more that 15 mins to get our water,  30 mins for the server to take our order and another hour to get our food. We've seen people get seated, eat and leave while we were seated. Totally unacceptable.  We spoke with the manager but did nothing about it.

Henderson Location - Thought I'd try this new location out. I ordered for pickup. Low and behold, I had a very long piece of hair in my food. We called and spoke with the manager and requested for a refund but we needed to go back to the location. Once at the location, the manager was no where to be found.  Got the refund from the host but WHAT A WASTE OF TIME.


I DO NOT RECOMMMEND GOING TO THIS PLACE.
THIS PLACE IS A JOKE. I HAVE HAD BETTER SERVICE AT DENNY'S.

I tried our new breakfast place but was little  disappointed with all the high rating they have. The location was perfect, the waitress was very nice but the food was very average, you can pretty much have it any place in the city. Maybe I order the wrong thing, next time I'll have the rib eye steak with eggs, will see if this improves. The prices were 15% higher than most places.

WOW what a fantastic find, the food was fantastic, very fresh.  The service was top notch, thank you Riley for the wonderful dining experience.  We will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas..  #fighton

The first time I had the food it was brought home to me by my husband and it was amazing. The second time we went in and ate. Let me start by saying the environment and decor is amazing. It's so cheerful and bright. I could stay there all day and be in a great mood. And yet again the food was amazing. The service was great and our waitress was so sweet. Our friends steak was over cooked the last time we got food from here so he was hesitant to come back. The waitress was so sweet about it when we told her and kept telling us if anything is ever wrong please tell us we will fix it don't worry. I would highly recommend this place. I can't wait to have family or friends visiting and bring them here.

Absolutely terrible! Takes forever just to get seated even when there are plenty of open tables. They have 1 moron waitress wearing dirty pajamas,no busser or hostess. Food is marginal at best. They mess up the order and don't even care. And theres also some huge fat slob (I think the owner) who just sits there an eats and doesn't help seat people or do anything about the fact that te place is totally understaffed. Looking at the owner alone is enough to make someone lose their appetite. I'll never go back to this place!

I have been wanting to try this place and was not disappointed.  The food was made to order perfectly, brought in a timely, friendly manner and was proportionately perfect for the price! I recommend this little place to everyone.  Great brunch menu! Awesome breakfast menu! I can't wait to try everything on the menu!  We came in at almost closing and were there up til close and we were treated with respect and kindness!  Love this place.  I wish the fancy shmancy restuaraunts were even close to the friendliness of this place! way to go! we need more here!
Standard American breakfast place. Ordered the press coffee, had to return the press because it had seen better days and we we were getting grounds through the filter. Food was ok.

My husband and I always comes here for breakfast when we are in town we always seat by the counter and watch the cooks prepare the awesome meals. Service is excellent the staff are friendly and very attentive. Food is served large portions we always spit the Steak  and Eggs Which is perfect and delicious. Can't go to any other breakfast place except here has variety of plates to choose from the menu don't forget to try the Biscuits n Gravy and pressed coffee excellent.
Awesome new place for breakfast in the Southern Highlands area, we so needed this place! Amazing food.. only downside is they dont serve alcohol so no Sunday morning bloody Marys or Mimosas!!!

I heard great things about this place and went a few weeks ago and was disappointed to say the least. I thought I ordered the wrong thing and tried it again today and it was worse then before. The service and environment is nice, however the food is subpar at best. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

PS 3 hours after eating there I feel sick!

Rise & Shine is a perfect breakfast spot if you want to try something outside of the high priced tourist areas of Vegas. Located in the corner of an unassuming strip mall is this high quality breakfast spot. 

While the steak and eggs is the go-to (and they sure looked delicious), we went with a normal pancakes, eggs and bacon breakfast combo. It was so large that we ended up sharing it for the two. Awesome bacon and fantastic pancakes.  For the amount of food and the price, you really can't beat it. 

Nice and quick service as well.

So first and foremost, I'd like to say thank god for this breakfast place in Southern Highlands. It makes my heart smile, I love breakfast and hate the drive all the way to "The Cracked Egg" all the way on Rainbow. So about the food......my new favorite is the stuffed blueberry french toast.....it was deliciously warm and very satisfying. You have to try that plate!! My boyfriend loved the steak and eggs, his words the steak was to die for!! I was very impressed with not only the food but the cute and quaint decor.......the hanging flowers from the ceiling was a nice touch and I have found my new found breakfast place and would recommend this one to everyone who is deciding or contemplating on coming in to try this place....not to mention the prices are perfectly priced for the food...great job!!
Beautiful restaurant, great service,  and amazing food!! Get the French press coffee :)
omg..the best breakfast place in town for sure..i seriously recomend this place...i would give them an award if i could..amazing service too by jenn who was wearing leopard pjs..so cute.

Food was very good, but had to wait an hour to be seated.  I would give this restaurant five stars if it wasn't for the wait, the poor organization, and horrible level of customer service by the hostesses.

Went in today,  the day before Thanksgiving, and the service was extremely slow.  In addition,  this place has an obsession with beans.  Beans in their breakfast burrito and an extra side of beans.  Country Cafe is 10x better than this place and I would never recommend it to anyone.   Sorry just NOT good at all.

Absolutely one of the dirtiest restaurants I have ever been to. They DO NOT wash the coffee cups

This place is right by my house in Vegas (Southern Highlands). The first time I tried them, I had to send my coffee back because it had LIPSTICK ON THE COFFEE CUP. When the server brought back a "new" cup it had a DIRTY COFFEE RING on the inside (like coffee had been sitting in there, but not washed) I finally just asked for a to-go cup.

Decided to give them another chance since they are so close. The second time.......THE EXACT SAME THING. Coffee cup with dirty coffee ring on the inside, AGAIN!!!!? We IMMEDIATELY got up and walked out.

If you go here, make sure you inspect the cups / dishes.  Something is very wrong here.

My husband and I live in the area and always drive past this restaurant everyday and so finally we decided to give it a try on a Sunday Morning ! Wow it was awesome ! Seated right away, our waitress Laura was a doll and was excellent and very attentive to us. The atmosphere with the umbrellas hanging from the ceiling was so cute I was obsessed lol and not too mention the food was delicious, Definitely will be back again ! :)

I love right by this place so I come here at least once or twice a week and I can safely say I have experienced the worst as well as the best. They revamped the menu so there are more food choices than there previously were. I love the steak and eggs but sometimes the steak will be over cooked or under cooked depending on the day who is making it. I would stay away from the poached eggs as they are normally undercooked as well. All in all if your meal is prepared right it is a great spot to grab a bite at. The manager doesn't share the wifi password which I find kind of odd, but to each their own. All the good servers usually get better jobs and move on so this place is usually stuck with the bottom of the barrel so to speak. Don't have high expectations coming here and you won't be disappointed, unfortunately I am stuck with this breakfast place until we get some competition on this side of town!

Found this place a few weeks ago. We've been here EVERY weekend since.

Everything we've had has been absolutely amazing. Chicken fried steak is out of this world. Pancakes are to die for! Word to wise... Each pancake is huge, south short stack will likely be more than enough. :) Don't even get me started on the hash browns! Without a doubt, the best I've had!

Well be back again next weekend! :)

The pot of bread was a really cool idea but wish it was a bit sweeter though. Also the steak omelet was the right size for me. Not too big that I would be blooded and not to small that I had to ask for seconds. Just big enough for me to be satisfied.

This place is awesome! The chicken fried chicken & biscuts with sasage gravy was amazing! The wait staff is too cute in their "PJs" and everyone was super friendly and interested in our opinions if the food. My hundband loved the crunchy French toast. A definite must when we come to Vegas.
SUPER cute place, staff was friendly, food, Ultimate Steak and Eggs, fantastic!  Can't ask for anything else except delivery in bed!

It is truly an early bird who catches a worm as the saying goes. My guess is that they've consumed some of the amazing eats from this gem of a restaurant while on the prowl.

On a recent visit with my Dad we ended up here back to back days during the trip and our only complaint was that the food was so scrumptious here that it pained us to leave the remains of the unconsumed on the plate. You certainly can share without embarrassment here as the portions (on most items) are enough to feed an army!

Before I get into the main attraction I do want to point out from top to bottom the staff here. Once again they are beyond inviting and the genuine care they portray to each table of patrons is a staple that they are well worth the 5 star rating from not just myself, but the other masses as well who choose to dine within those walls. I really feel so at home there and that is a special gift!

For day #1 I had my heart set on trying something different so I went for the red velvet chocolate chip pancakes. Those are a MUST if you have a craving for a "short" stack, but there is nothing short about that stack by any means. I was served 4 huge battered circular halos and with literal chunks of chocolate chips how can you go wrong? They were quite fluffy overall and the after taste of chocolate in each bite partnered with the cream cheese syrup it comes partnered with left me feeling like I was sharing a sunrise with Willy Wonka in the chocolate factory!

For day #2 I scaled it back a bit and devoured the pot of bread and the three egg breakfast with bacon on the side. It was simplistic in nature with just eggs, hash browns, and bacon however even in a simple form the food is still on point. The bacon (being the high point) was crispy and had a slight smoky tint to it that elevated it to a whole other level. I actually had a full on body shake because it was so amazing!

With top notch consistent hospitality, this is by far my #1 breakfast destination when I am in the area and it's been fun to watch the growing cult following they are getting as time goes on. To keep it simple, people know what's up!

I got the chicken egg white omelette and it was amazing!!  Maria was my server and she was friendly and kind! My food was ready before I had a chance to finish my cup of coffee. I would recommend Rise & Shine Steak & Egg to those looking for a local breakfast spot in the Henderson area!

Food is terrible, food over cooked and greasy. 
I have gone many times tried the so called home made corned beef hash, it was thinly sliced deli meat, the worst I ever ate
Eggs Benedict sauce too salty and they put so much on the muffin is mush. 
Went today ordered eggs over easy bacon and hash browns. Eggs came crispy had to return them, bacon looked cooked but wasn't and the hash browns were greasy over crispy. 
The cost for this and coffee 17.00!!!!
Never will eat here again.  Better food from McDonald's for 5.00

My husband and I came here today for breakfast, we both got the smoked salmon eggs Benedict and we also shared the bread in the cup . Both were very yummy !! Our waiter was Vanessa, she was super nice and had a great personality! We recommend to come here !! And we will be back :)
Great new breakfast spot!! Super friendly staff, excellent service & delicious food!!

I was totally hyped to check this place out because I love love love chicken and waffles and really that's the only reason why I came here. I placed a to go order since the boyf wanted something else. We were greeted by this woman who either didn't want to be at her job or didn't want us to be at her job. I couldn't tell. Nonetheless, this brief and short interaction wasn't pleasant. 

I ordered chicken and waffles - both were bland. The chicken was a breast filet that desperately needed seasoning. The waffle although is a waffle, was nothing special either. Hey at least it wasn't eggo frozen waffle right? Ugh. I also had the breakfast plate of biscuits and gravy with 2 eggs and hash browns. Again, nothing special. The gravy was almost too salty and the hashbrowns were just meh. 

These 2 dishes were just MEHHHH!  

This place is overpriced and overrated. That lady needs attitude improvement (not necessarily everyone's service since this was a take out order I wouldn't know the general service). Go back to bed crabs! I will most definitely not return.

I read good reviews and so I went.
First impression restaurant packed with people inside and on waiting list, your seated quicker than served.
They are extremely busy and not able to help seated guest in a timely manner.

However, when you do get your food, it is wow with fresh ingredients and their bread in a cup yummy!

If you have the time to give up than I suggest.

Best breakfast place in Vegas! Great venue and amazing food. Came with a party of 6 and everyone loved their food. Ashley our host was amazing she was also very friendly and engaging.  Definitely will be coming back here again.

We were a bit disappointed with the food quality today. The coffee tasted burnt, but it turns out they changed the brand. We went for the French press the second round and it was better. The chicken on the chicken and waffles was almost burnt and same for the chicken fried steak. Over medium eggs were also over cooked. Also found the kitchen won't take the time to split the order on to two plates any more. It was a busy day for them, and our waitress was absolutely wonderful as always. We will be back and hope it was just an off morning.
Tried the steak and eggs with a glass of OJ. The OJ was freshly squeezed and amazing. The steak and eggs was also delicious. The cup-o-bread was sweet, warm and tasty.

Tried to place a to go order this morning. First the girl who answered kept saying Sienna Heights which was really confusing. She apparently is from a different location. When I tried to order they apparently need a cc on file. I don't want my cc on file. That's how people get scammed. I tried to get them to wave it so I can order a to go order, but they refused. They just lost a customer due to this. Either I pay $5 to deliver this or I have to risk the chance of them getting hacked and my cc gets stolen. Tacky way to handle business. Will not be coming back. Rise and shine prices are high as it is. I don't like to deal with places that refuse to service their customers. Wow.
I had the chicken and waffles and I loved the chicken but the waffles were doughy. My husband had the chillaquilles and that was really good and I think I'll try that next time. Service was nice too.

A wonderful place for breakfast or lunch. The decor was nicely done with colorful umbrellas etc. Our waitress Maria was dressed in PJ'S which was cute, she was pleasant ,accommodating & explained everything on the menu. Our food ( Breakfast) was excellent and enough of it. We can't wait to go back!!

This would be my third time eating breakfast here.  Each time has been wonderful.  Quality of food is great.  Staff is very friendly.  I always order my steak well done and each time has been consistent.  Very tender.  Best breakfast place Ive seen in the valley. Beware this place gets pack fast.  I always go here at 8am and it's already full of people.  By 9am there is a waiting list.  My boyfriend and I waited for 30 minutes to get a table. Since they were very busy I thought the quality of food would not be as good.  I was wrong.  It was excellent.  Go here.  You won't regret it.

I am on a Vegas foodie adventure, and this spot hit a line drive right over the fence for a breakfast home run.  Professional juice bar, open kitchen, LavAzza French press coffee, waitresses wearing pajamas, just a fun place.  First up were the amazing homemade popovers with a maple infused cream delicious dipping sauce.  Main course was the well seasoned and properly charcoal grilled rib eye steak with 2 eggs over and nice crunchy hash browns.  Clearly a 4 star plus breakfast winner, will return for fried chicken and waffles tomorrow.

I would give it five stars, but my husband's utensils and plate have arrived dirty, which was a turn off for him. 

Overall, we love this place. Saturdays and Sundays are usually their busiest time, and weekdays are a breeze to get in. We live down the street, and so we go here frequently. They recently opened another location in Summerlin, but we haven't been there yet. They used Summerlin as sort of a "test" for their new menu, tweaked it there, and then changed their menu at this location. We've had everything there...and I mean that. We used to go there basically every weekend. The french toast and pancakes are to die for, according to the kids. My new "super bad" food addiction is their fried chicken breast and waffle. They bring their syrup out in a warmed bottle and you can see the fresh cinnamon inside. Yum. The servers are very kind and they all dress in pajamas, which is a neat vibe. They also have hanging flower/umbrella decorations, and the walls have neat colors and decor. Their portions are huge, so that accounts for the average $15/per plate (that is an estimate on my part), and you have plenty for leftovers. 

Oh, and the part I wrote above about the dirty utensils/plate? It happened once, and has never happened since. 

Like I wrote, this place is really worth a try. You'll be glad you made the trip.

Yummy breakfast place on our drive home from Vegas.  The wait staff are dressed in pajamas which is super cute, the coffee was great and the food was excellent.  Everything is fresh and portions are decent.  Each traditional breakfast dish had a twist to it that separated it from the norm.  I'll definitely be back on my next drive to or from Vegas.

I visited this spot after Yelping the highest-rated breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas.  I was really excited about the "bread in a pot" which was reason enough to visit.  The decor is cute, slightly weird, but cute.  The servers wear pajamas and it took me a minute to realize it!

As for food, it's pretty underwhelming.  It's not terrible, but I was not impressed- no bold flavors.  The "bread in a pot" was bland and the chicken and waffles were pretty bland, too.  I won't ever be returning because I like a little more excitement when eating carbs and other foods in general.  

There are so many better breakfast places in Las Vegas, skip this one!
The chilaquiles are by far one of the best items on the menu. Everything is made fresh and has been consistent every time we stop by.

This is one of my favorite spots to go to when Im in vegas. Their bkfast is great, and its really filling. The waitresses are in pj's and the place is pretty lit up with decor. Its a great place away from the strip.

Horrible! Service was terrible and the food was even worse. Ordered a steak dish with hollandaise sauce and potatoes. Steak was ordered medium rare, it can almost burnt. Eggs ordered over medium and it can with super runny whites. The potatoes tasted like they were cooked three times and put back into another container. I would of asked for a new breakfast but my server only came to my table twice, to take my order and to give me my check. She wasn't even the one to bring me my food. This was around 1pm or so and the place had two other tables occupied. Overpriced and definitely not worth going back
Been here 3 tomes and each visit has been wonderful!  Steaks are cooked to perfection.  Love it!

This marks the 10th time I have been there and I leave with the same impression every time. That is for the very mediocre food they are sure expensive and service is just plain bad!  OK so what is the problem? well two people for breakfast one being oatmeal was $35!!! My bagel with steak was overcooked and soggy hash brown and overall tasteless. They had to come out 3 times for my wife's oatmeal cause first trip they forgot the milk and fruit, then came the milk and forgot the fruit...mind boggling incompetence and they did this every single time we have been there so she can't start her breakfast and just sit there sometimes for 5 minutes! oh I ask for a large orange juice with two straws so the waitress decided to change it to a carafe and charged us $8.8!!! We are not complainers but this time like one time a year ago we said something and did anyone did anything? NOPE! what they do is to hand you a discount coupon, not write off the juice or anything , so the moral of their customer service is  TOO BAD BUT UNLESS YOU COME BACK, YOU MEAN NOTHING TO US SO HERE IS A COUPON FOR NEXT VISIT AND IF YOU DON'T COME BACK, THEN WHO CARE! That is the message, perhaps I should have left a note for the waitress, and say SORRY FOR NOT TIPPING BUT IF YOU DO IT RIGHT NEXT TIME I WILL TIP YOU!  Wonder how they would like that. I handed back the $5 coupon and said we won't need this as we will NEVER be back. we left a tip anyway, not that she deserve it cause when you can't serve oatmeal, you really need to think about a different profession!

Normally I would give this place a 4 Star review, but on Sunday May, 3 2015 that all changed.  Granted this place is packed on the weekends and to keep pace with the knashing carnivors waiting anxiously to get in and get there feed on, the staff in nasty pajamas has to be on point with the kitchen.  This seems obvious right?  Well on Sunday there was a line out the door, normal, and the experience started like this:

The hostess, a girl I had not seen before and unfortunately did not get her name, asked us how many and told us that there would be a 15-20 min wait.  So I looked to the Bar which no one was at and asked if we could sit there.  First she eye rolled me and then said I don't know.  I asked if she could check and again the same exasperated eye roll that she might have fallen backwards from, "Ill check," she said.  I waited 5 min while she talked to severs, played with her pen and gave the general I could give a rats hind end about you as a customer look and finally I asked if she even asked any one (of which she didn't because I was watching like a hawk with a caged animal in my stomache ready to leap from its depths and attack on site).  Also, I wasnt the only annoyed one as all the people were talking about how rude that hostess was.  She is definately not the face any owner would want at the FOH.  Lazy, non-caring, and rude.

While sitting waiting for Griselda the Mean to get back to me, I looked around and there were 6-8 four tops sitting with dirty dishes on them which would have acomodated most of the people outside waiting.  Those table stayed dirty for exactly 15 min before they started to be cleared.  This whole team led by there Manager Jessica, who didn't lift a finger to help any one and simply walked around with a face that could sink a1000 ships and then complained about the customers attitudes only a few feet from me.  Maybe its just me but the Manager should be the buisiest person in the restaurant, cleaning making sure that customers are taken care of, smiling, greeting, not hiding in corners and avoiding the crazy crowd that had acumulated outside the door.  Jessica only became interested in us when we asked for a comment card.  Then she couldn't stop walking behind me and my girlfriend looming over to get a peek at what was being written.  So unprofessional.  She was training...if you want to call it that, a server by the name of Cali for management, who was AWESOME.  She was sooooo weeded and still she took the time to come by and make sure that we were ok at least 3 times.  Great job on the floor Cali, hopefully you will be replacing Jessica so very soon!!

Food...well it was satisfactory this time.  My steak came out mooing at me, way rare (I ordered medium), and the hashbrowns were raw and I think if I equated it to a measuring cup I got a bout 1/3 of a cup of hashbrowns and the eggs over easy were dripping with oil, saturating everything on the plate.  The open air kitchen was getting slammed, plates were being thrown on the floor by the line cooks, (Seriously?) the cooks were openly swearing at the servers and calling them horrible names behind the line only 2 feet from me and I was able to hear everything.  Sloppy plating and the list goes on.  My girlfriend said here omlet was good but the pot of bread she ordered was raw about an inch down in the cup.

Sorry Rise and Shine, normally you all are so on point and friendly and look so comfy in your designer flannel pajamas.  Please understand people normally this place is the bomb, but under the horrible leadership that day it all came crashing down.

Delicious food and top notch costumer service.,Amberly was our waitress and she was exceptional , we are currently in our way to Vegas and already talking about what we are gonna have this time around .:') .. Give it a try ,you won't regret it .

I went to this place when they opened their original location in southern highlands. Good then, good now.They wear pajamas and serve a mean breakfast. The French Toast is excellent. My wife had the chilaquiles. They had a spicy rub,   not that saucey. French roast coffee, they brought out sand timers to distinguish how bold you wanted it. That's different. We sat down immediately but the place looked pretty full, food came out quickly. I woukd come back. Welcome to Hendo!

I'm very picky when it comes to Breakfast and most importantly eggs and how's certain people make them. I chose the ribeye and 3 eggs with cheddar and I had zero complaints!!!!! Will definitely return the atmosphere is nice and our server was definitely cool to.

I'm still annoyed about our wait. When you quote someone a wait time, your estimate should at the very least be within a ten minute window, not over three times as long as your quote. 

They also ran out of potted bread that day, which I was excited to try after reading other Yelp reviews. Our server told us that it would be another half hour wait for that menu item. Obviously, since we waited over an hour doe our table, I passed. 

That being said, the food and service here were both excellent. I had the chilaquiles, and my boyfriend opted for a standard breakfast dish with pancakes and bacon with eggs. Both dishes came out hot and delicious and in a prompt manner. While I'm glad we stayed to try this place out, I really do think the door staff could use some training on estimating wait times. Even after I complained to the hostesses that we had waited for over an hour, a manager never spoke to us to apologize. As I've worked in the industry for over fifteen years, I thought this was pretty unacceptable.
We love this place. I've had the Steak and Eggs Chilaquiles breakfast and it was soooo good. Their steaks are so tender and juicy. They also make fresh juices which I love.

One of our favorite places to eat breakfast. The food is always delicious (the mug bread with the sweet cream cheese butter is my favorite). Three service is always wonderful especially Maria. Definitely recommend this place.

A very cute brunch place! The waitresses wear pajamas and the restaurant is colorful with a friendly atmosphere. Our waitress was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. I had a bagel sandwich that had turkey and avocado with coffee. Service was fast and everything was very good

AMAZING! they have great food & customer service, I had red velvet pancakes with eggs and sausage on the side, it was my first time trying red velvet pancakes, I was a bit skeptical but they were amazing very warm and they were just soooo fluffy and delicious! A little pricy but honestly well worth it. I would eat there again and again and again

Good food, but very rude service.  Not accommodating with my 3lb chihuahua which is a service animal whom I bring everywhere with me.  They said she needed to be on a leash when she was in a baby carrier.  Stupid and not the law.  Won't go back ever again.  They don't like people with disabilities I guess.

First time visit this restaurant since it was close to our home, they tottally IGNORED US!, they have like 10 people who they're supposed to be working on tables (server/bussers), restaurant wasn't busy at all, they'are just standing, chatting, walking on circles, we read the entire food menu, wait for 25min without someone even asked us what do we like to drink, saw a busser just walking and playing with a rubber band, person making pastries without a hair net and looking more like a hair stylist, hostess uniform looks like she's been wearing it for a whole week without washing it.
This place seriously needs a new managment, looks like everyone is in a playground and don't care at all.

an excellent brunch experience! the name steak and eggs place is the tip of the iceberg! with top shelf cuts available with your eggs! 
we shared two succulent  dishes. the fried and  battered buffalo chicken breast breakfast is a brilliant switch on the typical country fried chicken and gravy! a medium buffalo sauce with hashbrown eggs and toast was tasty. 
our second dish was the Mexican twist on a rib eye steak breakfast! eggs placed on savoury bed of beans, cheese and chilaquiles! a rib eye! but wait there's more, salsa, sour cream and avocados! 
the place was busy yet we were seated in served in less than an hour! well worth the short wait. the staff has optional uniforms pajamas or company gear. creating a fun ambient.

Found this place on yelp while leaving las Vegas. It was out of the way but seemed worth it. The wait was 45 minutes which was kind of long but it was fine. The decor is so cute in this place very sunshiney and bright. I loved it. The staff wore pajamas and was very friendly! I ordered red velvet pancakes which was delicious! I loves this place!

WTF. Seriously. This is the fourth time I've come here. And only ONE time was I treated nicely and fairly. Hence this review. Hoping a MANAGER OR OWNER MIGHT SEE IT!!! I'll just discuss today's debacle.  It started off great. No wait!! Even got a booth!! Waitress shows up... looking annoyed, disinterested in general. I felt like my entire visit went downhill from here.... 
I asked her for a large OJ... and I get a CARAFE.... is that large? Um. Ok. I asked for for a 1/2 order of French toast... which I got, yet... they were "less fluffy" and basically looked like I got the welfare white bread version instead of the Texas toast version. My 12 year old daughter asked for chocolate chip pancakes and eggs/bacon....this is where it gets "interesting". She's 12... not 15 or 20... ya think the waitress bothered to ask me 1 question? Or tell me sizes or maybe whether we want the adult or child or just completely ala carte? Nope not a word. (Let's "pad the check"...huh). So when she brought out my 12 year olds breakfast... you might has well thought she's a LUMBERJACK!!! Because that's what the waitress ordered for her. 4 supercalifragilistic ginormous god damn pancakes. And a small side of some crappy tiny eggs and burnt bacon. I sat there dumbfounded. When she finally came back around, I had already finished my "French toast" and asked her what this was... POINTING to my daughters meal. I asked her why she didn't tell us it was for a lumberjack. Why didn't she steer us to something more HER SIZE?? Basically she was speechless... then with an attitude she said "I can take off 2 pancakes"... but the look on her face was right out of the movie "waiting"... (ummm... ya know...yikes... like I'll take the food back and spit on it.) So I declined. Of course my daughter didn't finish the Paul Bunyan meal. So we go to leave to pay the check. She rushes up to hand me the check and says nothing. The cashier asks me how everything was. I complained. Did anyone get a manager. Did the cashier apologize or offer any assistance. NO. NO. NO. NADA. NYET. NOTHING. It's not like I'm looking for a free meal. I paid the whole $35 god damn dollars for a senior size French toast, a lumberjack meal and 1 "large" OJ. $35 dollars. THIRTY-FIVE FRICKING DOLLARS FOR BREAKFAST. Way to pad the check. I am so aggravated at the bullshit. At the LACK of assistance and LACK of service, as well as the LACK of common decency. Yeah I said that. Because who in their right mind gives a child a big ass ala carte sized meal. That's completely ridiculous. And I even gave that jerk waitress a tip. I do plan on calling and "trying" to speak to a manager or owner. I just don't know if they will have the same attitude as their employees. Ugh.

Great place to eat.  Bring family here all the time. Affordable breakfast!! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Love the potted bread! outstanding service!! If you ever have Lisa as your waitress , she's absolutely amazing!!
Service was amazing! Food was amazing! Prompt service! Clean atmosphere! Great hostess! Great start to our trip!
The food there is OK but overpriced. No matter what I seem to order my breakfast always seems to come out to $25. A little high for three cent egg.

This is our go-to breakfast spot on the weekends. We always request to get sat with Riley - because she's awesome and so on point. It's always so nice to walk into a place where there's good food and friendly service. I always try to mix it up with what I order but lately I've been ordering the chicken breast and waffle - and I haven't been disappointed yet!

This place was good! Very crowded but the wait wasn't too bad. Our waitress Rylee was amazing and always around if we needed something. The pot of bread is to die for and a must order. I want to go back just for 5 orders of that. The only thing that wasn't amazing was the steak, it was dry and tough. However it could have been an off day. We will definitely be going back.

First time eating here..we've lived here for 3 years. Our little hood..lol. Super crowded on Saturday morning, we didn't wait long. We were gonna leave, but the aroma was so good, smell of waffles and bacon..We had to wait. It was worth it..Ed had spinach, Avocado, and swiss Omelette, with home potatoes. I had the fat kid breakfast..Pancakes..Real warm maple syrup. .Bomb!! Bomb!! Wait staff was super curtious, and in thier pj's. Lol..

Great little find on the way out of town, I will definitely put this on the rotation when I'm in Vegas. I had the eggs benadict and it was amazing best part was the hash Browns, perfectly seasoned with the right amount of crisp. Waitress was great also.

Found this away from the strip spot,so worth the drive!

With three in my group we enjoyed the decor and friendly helpful service. The coffee was best so far, since being in Vegas 

The waffle combo was absolutely delicious,  fluffy and great flavor. Strawberries on the side and crispy perfect bacon!

We didn't get to try the bread in a cup but it looked amazing, a must revisit spot!

Conveniently located for us. We love the ambience. My kids enjoy it here too. They think it's kind of cool how the waiters are in PJ's. Their fresh squeezed orange juice is a must here! As well as the bread in a pot. All the entrees we all order, we all enjoy and continue to re-order whenever we come back. 

Sunday's have loooong waits. Don't go hungry.
Delicious food and good service! Definitely should try it out, won't regret. The service is fast. The portion of the meal is huge. Loved it here.

Seriously one of the best breakfast places we have ever been to, hands down and we don't live in this state. The restaurant environment is so welcoming and happy. The servers even wear pj's as their uniform! How cool is that! Also, you should definitely try the cup-o-bread and hash browns... You will not be disappointed :) So, so tasty!

Rise & Grind is a really cute place to grab breakfast with family/friends, or you can choose to go alone and sit at the bar. They serve my favorite coffee (illy) and offer these cute little plant pots of cinnamon bread. (FYI; you need to arrive early to receive a pot of bread. They only make 100 a day) The prices are a little high for breakfast but you do receive a good portion of food. There's a variety of items on the menu to choose from. I will definitely visit again to enjoy my illy coffee and try something new.
Delicious!!!! Definitely a must when in Vegas! Big portions and great service. I highly recommend the rise n shine chilaquiles!!

They still struggle with how to make eggs over well.  This is not good for a place that has breakfast as a focus.  Their eggs are horrible and I was again disappointed with the lack of ability to actually make french style eggs over well, crispy on the outside,  firm and not broken yolk.  The pot of bread is good, but the lack of specialty coffee just is not enough for a place serving breakfast.   A year later and no improvement is not acceptable.  I hope to give them more stars next time because I love local egg breakfast places.  This place makes me want to stay home and cook my own food.  Woah, did I just say that?  I hate cooking.

We absolutely loved this place!! Wish we could buy a franchise. Really!! That's how good it was. The staff was very customer focused. The food was delicious with a great variety. Everything we ordered was good. This review is being written long after we ate there; but, it is a place we will make a point to get back to the next time we are in Vegas.

Very cool place. Staff is courteous and friendly. Portions are large and prices is an average of $11 a plate. Food is tasty and the decor is fun and quirky and a great place for family breakfast. A must visit when you're in Vegas.

Great because it's close, food is good and prices are fair. They serve Illy coffee(yay), I get the chicken and waffles or rib eye chiliquilles. By 9am is busy and wait is 30-45 min on weekends, we usually go past brunch time. Thats when i wake up anyway on weekends.So it works out perfectly....hehe
The staff wears their PJ'S to work in. I like the upside down rotating shape umbrellas in the ceiling.

Our second time here. We were satisfied with food and service. We ordered the buffalo fried chicken steak and eggs- the proportion was a good amount, the coating on the steak was well seasoned, the meat was tender and delicious. We also has the steak and chilaquiles- the chilaquiles topped with an egg had good salsa and was very good. To my surprise the steak was very good. It wasn't chewy or fatty. It was tender and well seasoned. The coffee was good too. We will be back.

The first time I went there it was one of the best breakfast I have had in this town I went with their ultimate ribeye and egg breakfast...Sense then I have went back twice each time to only get a steak that was so fatty and grizzly that you almost couldn't eat it.... has quality really dropped out that far... I mean At one time I would have recommend this to everyone I know and now I would recommend it to no one....Who wants a steak that you have to push half of it to the side because they're is so much fat.... Unfortunately their quality has declined immensely but that's only for them to decide what kind of customers they really want...

Very cute local breakfast spot, all the servers wear pajamas. I was very pleased with the service I received last time I visited. My server's name was Vanessa, and she was the sweetest!!! Very attentive, pleasant, and knowledgeable.

Woke up Easter morning a little late and was a little frantic to find a place to eat. Luckily, we found Rise & Shine. The atmosphere was light and happy, especially with the waitresses in their pajamas! The food was just as enjoyable as the experience. The food presentation was incredible and the service felt more than just a generic "nice to meet you" vibe. Overall, I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants to have a fantastic breakfast experience.
Place has really gone downhill... Using cheaper ingredients and still charging same expensive prices... Very disappointed. Food was terrible

I enjoy coming here for breakfast when I'm in town.   The food is always good and the price is decent.   I'm not as big of a fan of their lunch menu but I could eat their breakfast for lunch and dinner (if they were opened for dinner).

My favorite is the Corned Beef Hash and Eggs and also the Ribeye and Eggs.   Both are cooked well and very tasty.   

I also like the hash browns here,  they have a nice crisp to them.   They used to give you little pots of bread but stopped doing that.  That was a nice touch I wish they would bring back.

Service from the waitresses is typically very good and service prompt even when busy.   

Seems like the primary hostess is not always happy to be working early in the morning.  She rarely has a smile on her face.

It's the best kept secret in Vegas.  Located in the Southern Highlands area, a lot of locals end up here for breakfast on weekends.  Staff is friendly (dressed in pajamas) and service is quick.  I have liked everything I've had on the menu. Fun place to have breakfast and relax.

Found this breakfast spot on yelp based on the reviews. After waiting for an hour for a table, the waitress told us that they were out of pot of bread. The one reason I wanted to try the restaurant was for that bread. Disappointed, we ordered peanut butter and blueberry French toast and a steak Benedict. The food came out quickly and the steak was prepared pretty close to perfect. The food was amazing the coffee was quite delicious and the service was excellent. As we sat around chit chatting after our meal, the waitress brought out a fresh and hot pot of bread! She surprised us all and created a WOW moment! The bread was delicious and perfect even though we were stuffed, we made sure to eat it all up! I would definitely return and recommend this little gem of a breakfast place! There is no doubt why they were voted a best of the best!
I love this place! Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day. They have EVERYTHING including GF stuff if someone in your party has dietary restrictions. Try the Green "Go Go" Juice.

I dined here for the first time last Sunday.  It was absolutely delicious.  They have a huge assortment of food and a fun ambiance.  They are very busy in the weekends but seem to get people through fairly quickly.  I enjoyed the green juice to start and then ordered the classic steak and 2 egg breakfast.  The steak was cooked perfectly.  My friend ordered the biscuits and gravy and he loved it too.  Go give it a try!

We came here 2 weeks ago with our children.  They cleaned their plates and asked if we would come back.  Which says a lot in our family.  My husband loved his steak and eggs.  I had a Bloody Mary.  It was a meal in itself.  I also got a side of biscuits and gravy.  It was just the right size.  

We are back again this week.  I got an avocado Benedict.  It was great.  Our friend got the s'mores pancakes.  They smelled delicious.  Our server was attentive.  She noticed that the pancakes were missing something and fixed it before we could ask. 

We  definitely be back a third time.

This breakfast restaurant has been in the southern highlands plaza for awhile and I've never had a bad experience here other than maybe a 10min wait at most because it can get busy. The fresh squeezed orange juice and freshly baked pot of bread with powdered sugar are amazing. I've ordered many items in the past among those the corned beef hash, ribeye steak and eggs, salmon lox bagel, steak and spinach eggs benedict, chicken fried steak and all are good.

Ooh! I love this place! My husband just discovered it and we've been twice so far. We went to both locations. Great food! Steak & eggs are delicious!! Fresh squeezed orange juice! I also tried the omelette and my daughter had a waffle one time and pancakes the next time. Everything tastes delish! My daughter is super picky but she loves this place, especially because one of the food servers gave her a nice side of whipped cream. Oh and the style inside is really cute. Big flowers hang from the ceiling. Very colorful.

This is my new favorite breakfast spot. I had the pancakes with the 2 egg and turkey keilbalsa wich came with real maple syrup and cinnamon. Great customer service and I was very impressed by the presentation and reasonable prices.

Great place for breakfast!  We dine in here on a regular basis and the food, service and fresh squeezed juice is always on point! Yesterday we placed a to go order with Chris and she was awesome!  Only reason they don't get 5-stars is they are a bit pricey.

Very good for our family of 7 on our way to the lion habitat! Bagel sandwiches were huge. 3 little pigs version- Hungry teenagers couldn't eat it all! Omelettes were nice. Chicken and waffles very good. Pleased with waitstaff all in jammies! Very attentive.

The boyfriend finally agreed to go out for breakfast and this made me beyond happy. The place: Rise and Shine in Southern Highlands. Very quaint, family-run breakfast/lunch spot.

We arrived just after 11 and had a 20 min wait. Thank goodness for the gorgeous Fall weather.  Our name was finally called and a 10-13 year old brought us to our table. Normally, the idea of children working in a restaurant annoys me. Restaurants is a serious business and throwing your underaged kids in the mix is more distracting than it is helpful. But at R&S, this little one was very mature and informative.  Pleasant surprise.

The wait staff are garbed in PJ sets to match the name of the restaurant. Clever. But the food...not overly complicated and that's how I like my favorite meal of the day.

-Corned beef hash with eggs: yum! Not my typical choice but happy I did this time.
-Peanut Butter and Blueberry jam French toast: this was a buffer dish in case the hash didn't work out but then I just ended up way stuffed.
-Spiced Rib eye steak and eggs: this was the bf's meal. Served with the egg atop nachos instead of the meat was odd and looked very heavy to me. He said it wasn't bad. The streak was seasoned well as I had to try at least one piece.

There are no TVs for distraction so it's a great place for families with kids. Can't wait to go back to try their pot of cinnamon bread as they ran out this time.  Food was good but service will make me a repeat guest.
There isn't a better place in town for Ham and Eggs Benedict. Staff is always friendly and the food just delivers every time.

First time here.  Certainly won't be my last! Had the Steak and Chilaquiles which was amazing! The Pot of Bread was really yummy too! Other things I had a taste of were the Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes and the Cinnamon Raisin French Toast which I highly recommend since my kids pretty much cleaned their plates.  Overall, food was great, service was great, a definite new favorite place for breakfast!

Great breakfast place.  Everything I've had has the little touches that makes it better.  The oj is fresh squeezed and the coffee is good.  I've had the steak chilaquila a couple of times and I think that's the best thing.   The cinnamon raisin French toast is also a winner.  Only thing this place lacks is a bar. I really like a bloody mary. Another minus is the wait sometimes an be quite long.
Worst service ever. Waited more than 15 minutes to be seats. food was okay. The owner had a rude attitude when I spoke to her about an issues. Would never come here and eat again.

Great experience here yesterday with a girlfriend of mine! We went bright and early for breakfast and catching up. The food was great, it was a quiet Monday morning at rise and shine which allowed for us to catch up. All the servers were super sweet and friendly, we will certainly be back to try more of the menu!

The service here is very spotty. We arrive and or our name in and notice 3 table available. One party gets sat and the other two are left open and we continue to wait. All the while the rest of the patrons start to clear out were kept waiting now with multiple tables open. We get sat in the back by the kitchen and service station. How annoying, why would you sit a patron in the back by the service station when there's other tables available? When I worked in the service industry I would apologize to patrons for them having to sit there. So now all the traffic of running food and imputing orders is right in my face. The waitress is barking orders at the cook and complaining about her station and another server.... Very unprofessional if you ask me. Also the table that was used as the bus station was the table we sat by. Pretty disappointing to experience this when I make it a point to drive all the way here when I'm in town. Not sure if I care to come back.

Was looking for a new brunch place so I clicked on the nearby icon and this place popped up. Why not? Walked in and the place was really open and inviting and we didn't have to wait at all, even at 12:30 on a Saturday. Pretty simple menu, and service was great. I'll admit my hash browns were undercooked, but now that I know how they come I will just tell them well done next time. And I will definitely be back. Make sure you check out the t-shirts and socks. My favorite one said "spooning leads to forking" lol. Also the wait staff wears pajamas. What a job!

The place has an amazing menu. My friends and I each order different things and share. The chicken and waffles has to be my favorite. I also enjoyed the french toast. I think we ate here atleast three times while we were in Vegas. Large portions and the prices were decent.

My favorite breakfast joint in town. Their Chicken and Waffles is to die for. Everything on their menu is deliciously homemade from scratch and all the ingredients are fresh. The staff is very helpful, friendly and fast. The atmosphere is very fun and casual.  I have ordered carryout from them a couple times and all were pleasant experiences.
This place is delicious . They have great customer service... but everyone has pajamas but MIKE... MIKE deserves pajamas... LET MIKE WEAR PAJAMAS NOW!!!!!

Was in the area on a weekend and decided to try this place out, its tucked in a corner of the plaza, where Smith's is located. Large selection of breakfast items, lots to choose from. We did ask the waiter what he recommends. Items we ordered were the country fried steak and the salmon benedict. Both very delicious! Country fried steak was not dry at all and the gravy was very tasty. If you like bendicts than the salmon benedict is definitely worth trying! Very yummy!!!! Looking for a causal breakfast brunch place here's the place to try! will be coming back here soon to try their other dishes on the menu!

Very busy place - the staff does a good job at keeping on pace and keeping everyone moving through . The food and menu isn't anything above average but it's good fills the purpose. The PJ uniforms and Umbrellas are a bit off putting, I get the concept but at least provide your staff with some quality PJS instead of making them work in paper thin see through pjs they just look sloppy .

This place embodies the phrase, "Rise and Shine." Waiters are in pajamas, merchandise have breakfast puns on them, and decor has floral print all over. I actually enjoyed it all. 

I ordered the Rise & Shine Burrito, which was amazing. I love large portions of food and this burrito satisfied that. It came covered in Ranchero and Green sauce (half and half). The burrito came with refried beans, which I asked to substitute for something else. For whatever reason the waitress said that wasn't possible, so I just went along with the beans. Ultimately, the refried beans were actually really good too! I also ordered a coffee, and the staff made sure that the coffee cup never became empty. 

The one thing that bothered me was that the menu had A LOT going on, but that's just me being picky.

This has turned into my absolute favorite breakfast spot! The service is great, I love the pj theme and how laid back yet respectful the employees are. The food never disappoints! The portions are great. I always get the chilaquiles w steak or without, either way they're scrumptious. They come with avocado, beans, sour cream. Sooo delicious. I've also tried the veggie egg Benedict with balsamic vinegar, overall it was good. The juices are fresh and amazing. I love waiting outside and the waiters never forget about you. I've been recommending this place to friends and family. Every time I post pics of the plates I get sooo many messages asking where it's from. You guys have a loyal customer here.
A breakfast place where the waitresses dress in pajamas is sort of neat. A breakfast place with no Wi-Fi? That ain't good...
Great bfast spot!  Typical American style menu with some added variety. Smoothies are awesome!

This place is really convenient and nice to have around. If you have the time to actually go out for breakfast it satisfies. Its a small place though so going at peak times you can wait. The servers all wear pajamas, upside down umbellas hang from the ceiling and its very quirky in decorations.  The service was good with her continually asking if we need anything and bringing drinks. only issue was he ordered a biscuit and got served sourdough toast. 
There aren't many healthy options on the menu so I got a cobb salad minus a few things. They were good about putting my bacon on the side for him.  It was very good with a nice balance of all the ingredients and not too heavy on the dressing.  It was huge though and I couldn't finish it all so we switched plates....lol.....he got the bacon wrapped steak and eggs and he enjoyed it, only thing left on his plate when he gave it to me were the hashbrowns.  The bread is simple bread as not a fan of the pot of bread as not enough cinnamon gooey-ness if I am going to splurge. 
The guy who you go to in order to pay wasn't sure what to make of our sense of humor but he was very polite and efficient.
Last time I was here I got the fruit which is nicely cut up and a nice size portion.  I would go back as convenient and good options for kids too.

Four weary adults were leaving Las Vegas, in search of breakfast.  We found this place on Yelp, read the reviews, and figured it was worth a try.  We were not disappointed.

A variety of food filled our table, from omelets, to pancakes, bacon, eggs over-easy, hashbrowns and sausages.  Everything was fresh, HOT and delicious.  The coffee was exceptional, and the pot of bread and biscuits were warm and satisfying.

Service was extremely friendly, without being overbearing, and there is no doubt that we will return to Rise & Shine!

One important thing to add.  There were no TV's in the place, which is such a welcome thing in any restaurant these days, but especially after the sensory overload of Las Vegas.

I was looking for a place to have a brunch while casually celebrating my husband's birthday. There was going to be a total of 8 family members, varying in age from 23-86, so in other words, a variety of palates to please. Since we all live in town, but not all in the same area, I wanted a place that was easily accessible for those that lived further & not too far, for the senior drivers. 

When I stumbled upon Rise & Shine in my Yelp search, and saw the huge quantity of great reviews, I knew, that we had to give it a shot. I knew in advance that they didn't take reservations, so I warned everybody that we could have a possible wait, a 15 minute average on the weekend mornings, I was told. Everybody, whether via phone or in person, was delightful, and the service was just as good at our table. I don't recall our server's name, but she handled our table of 8, no problem. The food was great! Almost everybody ordered something different and not one complaintThe prices were very reasonable, for the quality & quantity of food.

Perfect for when you're hungover and probably just as good when you aren't. I hardly had any money so I just got toast and peanut butter because I was in dire need of carbs in my system and it made me feel 100 x better. Can't wait to actually try the real things on the menu next time!

I've noticed a difference in the quality since the last time I came, unfortunately I forgot to take a picture before the review. Their portions are WAY too big for one. And secondly the eggs benedict I ordered were drenched in a pool of sauce and the hash browns next to them turned out soggy due to it. There wasn't as much spinach as I'm used to there being. The consistency in quality should be upheld, there shouldn't be fluctuations. Their juices and smoothies are always amazing though.

Probably one of the best customer service experience I've had in a while. Great service! Maria, our waitress, was  amazing! Had us all seated down in less than 5 min with our waters and menus ready to go! Mind you we were a party of 10( including 2 kids) The food was excellent, coffee was nice and warm, and the bread in a cup was tasty! Would recommend this place for sure! Also, everyone that works there wear pjs, how cool is that.

Omelettes are a very simple item to make. Eggs, cheese, and some fixings.  The omelette I had was off the charts. Never in my wildest dreams did I think an omelette could be as magical as a leprechaun flying on a unicorn. This place is great. The pajama wearing staff are the friendliest bunch of people I have encountered all day.  I will be back. A

Our second time here today and like the first time, it was splendid.  The server we got today Jennifer was very nice but lacked the service we got last time. Thankfully for Seth he saved the day. He is awesome and from our hour visit, he sat us down, checked on us, got our second drink order and evem saw him
cleaning the outside windows. We will definately be coming back.

I love how cute this restaurant is. The wait staff wear pajamas and there are adorable upside down flower umbrellas that adorn the ceiling. 

I've tried a few things on the menu but today I'll focus my review on the Chicken & Waffles. The batter for the Chicken comes off as really spicy and peppery (if you don't like spice it will be too much for you) and it's paired with your usual waffle. The trick though is to smother it all with the maple sauce and voila! The sweet off sets the spicy perfectly for the right amount of salty, sweet with spice. 

The tables are placed really close together so if you're not into that kind of thing, this isn't the place for you. It can get really busy, especially on the weekends. The open layout leaves you to view the kitchen and the cooks like a diner so the atmosphere is really casual. 

Overall, if you're in the area I'd say definitely give this place a try. They're only open for breakfast and lunch though so if you're trying to go there in the late afternoon, I'd call first because they're probably closed.

We came here about a month ago based on ratings and were not disappointed. Staff was good and food was great. It's cool that they wear pajamas. Will come again for a third time next time we are in town.

Our first few visits were great. The service was efficient, the food was well prepared and made with quality ingredients (fresh & flavorful). We have been bringing visitors to Rise & Shine telling them what a "great place" it is. Unfortunately, our experiences of late have not been great. The service has slowed considerably.
