Drinks are empty before refills are offered. Butter or syrup come well after the meal is served. The food is room temperature and the portions have diminished. Tomatoes are yellow and scarce in a dish, eggs are dry and overlooked, toast is barely brown. The fruit waffles are just a plain waffle with fruit in a cup on the side. There are a lot of restaurant options for Southern Highlands area. It is disappointing that Rise & Shine isn't maintaining the original level of service & quality needed to keep my patronage.

Okay so I'm reviewing 1 star because of the awful service I always receive. It never fails. I've been here over 10 times and I can't ever seem to get good service. I am a server myself so I know the drill. The hostess gave better service and I have tipped her before tipping the server. I live down the street so it is convenient and the food is so amazing! The pot of bread is to die for! But it takes the server about 5-10 minutes to even greet me. Then I don't see them again till I get my check. This place has so much potential but it is sad that I am starting to do take out because the service sucks ;(

Immediately walking into Rise & Shine we were greeted by the smell of cinnamon...the interior is delightful, and the staff is amazing!  This is mine and my husband's second time here..we brought his brother to show off the abundance of food served and the delectible flavors!  Our server April was genuinely nice and friendly.  I ordered the short stack which I didn't finish because it was more like a full stack!  They were all very attentive, never had an empty glass.  By far the nicest staff and the most delicious food!  My husband and I plan to make this place a ritual in our weekly outings!

Made this choice because of other Yelp reviews and to get OFF THE STRIP ITS ABOUT A 15 minute drive huge portions fun atmosphere wait staff wear pajamas and the ceiling has colorful umbrellas hanging from ceiling

Chilaquiles were amazing! I have to respond to some of the Yelp reviews, first of all the one customer that was complaining about the Chilaquiles, do you even know what they are? The tortilla chips are supposed to be soft, they are soaked in enchilada sauce before making, and are made with eggs, it's a mexican breakfast dish. I thought they were so good. Next, the complaint about the chicken and waffles, my friend had them & they were equally good, the breast was tender and flavorful. I've been here a couple times and had a couple different items on the menu, I have never had anything disappointing. Customer service has always been top notch. Love the French press coffee and the pot of bread & fresh jam. They also have a patio, people bring their dogs, comfy table & chairs with umbrellas.

No complaints what so ever! 

Staff is amazing and very friendly. 
Food is very new & refreshing. 
the ' pot-o-bread' is adorable & very delish.

Great place for families!
Great breakfast spot. The country fried steak taste like real steak. Big portions and good food, everyone who I bring here leaves happy

Good food! Def expensive for breakfast food! But the quality is there. The chicken fried steak
Taste like real steak, which was a nice surprise and good size portions.

Menu changed. Service is inconsistent. Some days are ok some days bad. Some servers there don't understand concept of service. Some are ok. Also tried to order pickup for the family (7 people) couldn't get through when I did I was hung up on 6 times. Oh well even if it is walking distance from me I won't be back. I shouldn't have to feel like a bother when I'm there or when trying to give my business away.

OOMG...sat at the counter and got to see the magic firsthand.  Chicken fried steak  never before seen by these mortal eyes.  Chicken and waffles fit for a giant with culinary tastes(the chicken must have been from a Nevada A-bomb site- it was HUGE).  Panko breaded fresh chicken strips for the little ones.  Hand cut fries.  Ecletic breakfast menu- "One of each please".  My first time was today and second time will be tomorrow.

First time in this place, the atmosphere is family friendly. I had Buffalo boneless chicken  and eggs and pot of bread, my wife had the rib eye steak and eggs. They were both cooked to perfection, very tasty and we loved that they give you big portion. Definitely coming back.

Our family of 5 waited patiently as the rude staff kept seating parties of two than parties of four who walked in WAY after us. We asked if we could pull a table together and they said NO. A military veteran and his family being mistreated like that was uncalled for. We walked out after being left standing for almost half an hour and what a BAD rap this location gives to other locations who are more respectful and accommodating.. Shame on you!
Rise and shine chilaquiles are the shit, better than my abuelitas. Amber is the best server here, tip her the big bucks!

Not worth the price. Their food is good, but not great. Service was a little slow and I was sitting at the counter. This place seems to always be busy so maybe I was there on an off day or maybe I was just not feeling it. Suggestions to the owner: check your pricing. Your not on the strip.

Crunchy Cinnamon Raisin French Toast - DELICIOUS. Coated in Cinnamon Toast Crunch, this was the best breakfast item out of all the things I ordered. They gave you a good hefty serving too.

The steak - really quite terrible. My medium-rare steak was super thin, dried out, under-seasoned, medium-well, and tasted mostly like char. It was super disappointing.

At least they had real fresh squeezed orange juice, a staple of any brunch place. Too bad it wasn't good enough to wash away the taste of burned steak from my mouth. For a place that has "steak" in the name, they sure know how to serve a half-disappointing brunch.

i got the ny strip benedict bagel and it definitely was tasty but also a mess to eat. oh well! while i won't complain about the food the atmosphere and pricing weren't great. $3.50 for a cup of apple juice. the dining room is pretty small and there's no waiting area so everyone was crammed in the doorway.

I'd love to give this place 5 stars for their GREAT SERVICE and DELICIOUS food but it's just a bit OVERPRICED. $9 for a single waffle is ridiculous. But it doesn't stop me from dining here and ordering the buffalo chicken and eggs special.

We've been to the other locations before and it never ceases to impress or satisfy our hunger. We decided to try the Henderson location this time around.

Definitely was not disappointed. If you're familiar with the other locations, it's the same menu besides the specialty drinks. Started off with the cup o bread. One of my personal favorites. With a hint of cinnamon it's definitely reminiscent of a homemade cinnamon roll with a sweet and slightly tart and tangy icing that goes perfectly with it. Also started off with a single biscuit. This is where it goes from five stars to four. Biscuit seemed a little W. Not as crisp and as flaky as I remember it from the other locations.

I want to hadn't had the biscuits and gravy with two eggs and hash brown. Grady is very rich, chunks of sausage and I believe him add a decadent taste to the silkiness. I couldn't tell if these biscuits were not as flaky as the one I had previous because it was drowned in the savory gravy. Two eggs over medium cooked perfectly and hashbrowns golden perfection and of course the green onions inside the hashbrowns always add the extra kick. Gave this is Danny five out of five. I added the side of bacon to give it a little bit more of that salty savory taste.

We also had the chilaquilles and went to head and splurged and got the steak at it with it. Basic chips over beans covered in red sauce and we have the eggs scrambled. The sauce poured over the tortilla chips is a simple red sauce, very reminiscent of an enchilada sauce. The beans at the bottom were a bit overcooked and dry. The steak was cooked medium as requested and had a very simplistic salt and pepper taste to it which we love.

Had the French press coffee for a stronger coffee taste. 5.95 for a press that served about a cup and a half each for 2 people.

This location is a tad bit small so you tend to hear everything that goes on. There was a Chef or a cook in the open area where the runners and servers go to pick up the food who we could hear on the phone. Not very professional especially when you're using profanity. But other than that Maria, our server was top notch and make sure we were plenty well taken care of.

Stopped here with the family yesterday and the food was pretty good until I got a hair in my pancakes. I told them I didn't want them any more and just ate part of my wife's food since I wouldn't be able to eat pancakes thinking about the hair after that. They took the pancakes off the bill but charged $4 for the sides. Seriously, you ruin my meal and the whole family's experience and then you don't even take my personal meal off the bill? Good food, weak customer service. If they had been reasonable I might be back but that's just too little to resolve a problem, especially when breakfast is $15 bucks a plate. Everyone knows you can get a hair anywhere but anyone who works in or owns a restaurant knows you can't charge for the plate that had the hair in it. I didn't expect anyone else's meal discounted but the one with the hair should have been taken off. Get real.

It seems they responded that sides weren't included in the price unless you made the meal a platter...which I did so their point is moot.

What happened?? I've been here about 3 or 4 times in the past and it was my favorite breakfast place. My last visit made me realize that I am no longer a fan. 

My favorite breakfast dishes of all time would have to be chicken n' waffles and corn beef n' hash with eggs. And by far the best place I've had them was at Bouchon inside the Venetian. I know I can't compare a local place like this to an upscale fancy casino spot. However, I've had those two dishes at other places that were by no means fancy and it was still delicious. So I know I'm not being picky. But I was truly disappointed with what I was served on my last visit. 

The corn beef n' hash I ordered was a total disappointment. First I ordered the eggs medium. When my food arrived, they weren't yolky at all. It was cooked completely through. The hash was complete mush and the corn beef was sparse. I hate wasting food, so I ate as much as I could, but I still left some on my plate. The cinnamon bread they serve in the pot was my fave. 

My bf ordered the chicken n' waffles. This was a lot better than my dish. The chicken was crisp and the waffle warm. The chicken was a bit on the dry side so I just smothered it with syrup even more. I love that the syrup is served warm with a cinnamon stick inside the bottle. 

My bf is a huge coffee drinker during breakfast. He will probably go through 3-5 cups. He said that the coffee tasted like the coffee you get at a hospital, so when he only had about 1.5 cups, I knew there was something off. 

3 stars for being seated quickly, our super friendly waitress Shannon and the cute decor. I was really excited to bring the bf to a new breakfast spot, but I'm sad to say that I will not be returning. I will miss the pot of bread though.

Wish I could give 5 stars because the food is just so delicious! Everything I have tried has been amazing but the prices are a bit ridiculous, sadly mostly everything is overpriced and the portions are just ok.
Great family eatery.  Cool decor, tasty food for us and the kids and our waitress was awesome (April).  Will definitely return and take out of towners for a treat.  I might even wear my pajamas.

Every time my parents are in town we have to come here multiple times. My dad says he doesn't know why we would risk anywhere else when we still haven't had everything on the menu at rise and shine... 

I'm not really a huge fan of breakfast restaurants in general and even I like this place. The chicken and waffles, bagel sandwiches, and anything with steak are always reliable. Also, try the pot of bread, it's yummy and adorable!
One of my favorite places for Sunday morning bfast. Love the menu, service and everything. Waiting sucks, restaurant is small, but worth the wait.

Went to Rise & Shine today for breakfast. We were very disappointed!!! 
Our cinnamon French toast was very dry & very well done! Burned!!! Fruit was not fresh. Rotten strawberries & bananas! Brown in color. Avocado was brown! The owner & our favorite waitress was not there. I'm really surprised the standards have drop. The fresh orange juice was water down! I'm truly sad because this was one of my favorite breakfast spots.

Awesome breakfast this morning at GVR Rise & Shine! Delicious! Loved the green juice. I had a Cheese omelette with avocado & fruit. Excellent service. Our waitress was very pleasant and attentive. 
The family was pleased and ate every bite and cleaned their plates. They serve lunch as well. 
Clean and cute. Love the umbrellas on the ceiling.

We sat for 15 mins and weren't greeted/ acknowledge AT ALL by our waitress. I get that it's busy, but a simple "I will be right with you, thanks so much for your patience" would have sufficed! Not even asked for anything to drink... I made sure to tell the host (a man in glasses) that we left for this reason. I was really looking forward to eating here.
Wow, everything I want in a breakfast and more.  Staff was really friendly and fun.  Wish there was one of these back in LA!

Rise & Shine is a fun family restaurant to dine for breakfast or lunch. The servers and hostesses are kind and knowledgeable. They have great novelty items for purchase at the front which are one of the best I've seen at a restaurant. I ordered the chicken fried steak that came with a side of eggs and hash browns. The eggs were done well and the chicken fried steak was flavorful. The only critique I would give is that the breading was a bit chard on the edges.

Not only do they have the best steak and eggs in town they also have the best ice coffee's and fresh juices ! The staff is awesome I try and go every Saturday and the wait time is usually pretty decent 10-15 mins max! The waffle is also beyond amazing !!! Love this place always come back !!!

I put in a pickup order for a spice rubbed steak chilaquiles and a chicken breast and waffle. Ariel on the phone did not go over pricing with me just told me my food would be done in 20 minutes. When I got to the register to pay, my bill including was $31.58. 15.25 for the chilaquiles and 13.95 for the waffles. The online menu for prices reflecting 12.95 and 11.95. I spoke with Vanessa the manager to see if she would honor the price but said the web designer hasn't updated it. I was told no discount would be given. I paid my tab and off I went. This is bad business. I won't be coming here again.

Came for Fathers Day brunch and it was amazing!  The staff is so nice and hospitable. The portions are outrageous. The quality of the food is amazing. I had the Steak & Eggs with Chilaquiles and they were to die for! Anytime in Vegas this will be my new spot.

Quirky and cool breakfast spot we found while on mini vacation. Our AirBnb host recommended. I thought the upside down flower umbrellas were a cute touch and the servers in Pjs was different. We all ordered steak and eggs with cup of bread. Cup of bread had a super cute presentation & was good. But if nuts were added it would have been even better. I asked for medium well steak & all of ours came out very charred...a little too much for me, but my friends liked it. I ordered side of fruit and was unimpressed with size, miniature portion, so I got unimpressive hashbrowns. We sat outside because weather was nice. Worth a try and prices are afforable.

Not going back. My family checked out the menu online and ordered take out. It was their online menu. When the food got home it wasn't what we ordered. I called the restaurant to let them know and the female who answered told me what I saw online wasn't correct. When I let her know they should probably fix that she stated they don't even have prices online. Umm??? Sorry. Not lying, lady. When I pay as much as we did and we overpay and get shorted on the items I expect better customer service. The short stack platter online should come with 4 hotcakes and 2 eggs and bacon. I got 2 cakes and 1 egg and barely cooked bacon. The fullstack online comes with 5 hotcakes for $0.70 more. If they've changed their menu fine. What about that other egg? Why are the pancakes in various sizes and falling apart?Sorry you were busy but if you guys can't provide quality every time why put anything out? So upset we paid so much for what we got.

Great service,  but the food was just ok. For a professed "steak and egg" place, they didn't have a t-bone steak meal. Also,  no choices for syrup,  you had to use their house cinnamon syrup if you wanted syrup.  Won't return.
Tasty breakfast, fast service, friendly staff, reasonable price! I'll definitely bring my family in for breakfast  or brunch  when they come to visit me

Made it in for breakfast today and it was awesome. My servers name was Bruce, he was great and always there when we needed him. I had a waffle and a side of biscuits and gravy, both were delicious. Next time I'm going to try the buffalo chicken dish it sounded amazing. Thanks for everything Bruce we will definitely be back!

OMG!  So good. Pot of bread is fresh, hot, yeasty and cinnamony.  Chicken and waffles are huge. The cinnamon sticks in the warm syrup bottle are a great touch.  Hash browns are wonderful. Very different.  Waitstaff is friendly, attentive and fast.  Hubby had chicken fried steak and eggs. It was a huge plate of food and he said it was great. We are from CA and just passing thru and saw this on yelp and it was so worth the stop.
Our new favorite place to eat breakfast!!!! The food was delious and such amazing customer service Venessa was a great server! The pot of bread is a must try along with the Ultimate Steak & Eggs.

This place is excellent for Breakfast. I'm so glad we stopped by on our way back home to LA. I ordered the Eggs Benedict. My fianc√© ordered the Steak Chillaquiles. Everything tasted delicious! I will definitely go back when visiting Las Vegas in the future.

This place was an absolute disgrace to breakfast places everywhere! My husband and kids ate there for my husbands birthday breakfast and the food was just awful .i got the eggs Benedict which used to be my favorite dish until this place singlehandedly ruined it , it was a tough English muffin and the hollandaise was super sour and had way too much lemon in it, not to mention the hash browns we're basically raw and had freezer burn taste to it , they tried to cover it up with an excessive amount of butter . My husband got the country fried steak which was just a piece of thin meat with breading and the breading was very chalky, to call it a country fried steak is giving it too much credit for whatever that mistake was . My kids however liked their food because they are 2 and 3 and giving sugar and pancakes to children is always a success . Long story short , you're over paying for shit food! NEVER AGAIN!

All I wanted was to place an order for pickup. Someone picked up right away and said it'd b a moment then placed me on hold. I waited for 20 mins then hung up. Why make something so simple so hard? I'm over this place.

The food was delicious! This was our first visit to this place. They have a very open atmosphere that is pretty welcoming. Our server, Vanessa, was very nice and accommodating. I easily will travel across the city from centennial to come here again. 

The menu itself has plenty of options, so naturally i ordered more than one thing
The NY Steak, Spinach and Benedict-Bagel, which was amazing, i finished the whole thing, along with a side order of there Crunchy Cinnamon French Toast. I am basically in a food coma while writing this review. I generally don't eat this much, but i traveled quite a bit just to check out the place so i said what the heck. It was worth the drive. I'll be back again to try more food out.
Huge breakfast portions but very good. You could easily split a dish with someone. We came during a weekday so it wasn't overly busy. Service was great.

Best Chicken and Waffles ever. Huge portions and all homemade. Warm bottle of homemade syrup with Cinnamon sticks in it..  Also tried the Homemade Corn beef hash with the local hot sauce it was also amazing.  Great service!  Menu was overwhelming as we could not make up our minds.. Cute room with flower umbrella fans.. We'll be back to try more of the menu items.

I am a very happy customer.  I went with my daughter and she had the kids waffle and loved it.  I ordered the ribeye steak and eggs over medium and everything was perfect.  There were many large parties with lots of adults and kids and still the service was good.  I love the French press LaVazz coffee too.  The quality of the steak was good and had an excellent flavor.  Cute and clean place! We will be back soon!

Interesting concept but overpriced in today's market. 

Weirdest thing is that the server staff wears PJ's. Yep, same thing people sleep in. Just something about being served by a dude wearing pajamas that is quite unsettling.

For those more tolerant, at least the food is good.

Everything was really great! The peanut butter French toast is a pb&j sandwich, dipped in eggs and cooked up French toast style. Absolutely brilliant! The corned beef hash was made with real beef that did not come out of a can and the pot of bread was just fresh and warm and squishy and wonderful. We sprung for the French press coffee, which was fun, but then we followed up with just some of their regular house brew and it was just as good, if not better than the French press. We waited for over 40 mins on a Saturday morning, so be prepared. I think it was worth the wait though.

Originally I had a draft for this place last month.  This breakfast place in southern highlands has been great for the neighborhood.  The only other closest breakfast place in the area is the griddle on Eastern and IHOP on LV blvd.  Which is crazy busy, because of the tourists.  My original review gave this place 3 stars because the service was very bad and I'm sure it was because they were new.  We have since eaten here 4 times and I have to say that each time has been better service.  The second time we went our waitress never came back to us.  We had another waitress tell us that she would be our new waitress.  I haven't seen that other waitress working there since.  I know I'm focusing on the service on this review, but let's face it.  It's just breakfast food!  I like it because it's close to our house.  
I have to say a little about the food.  I have ordered the ribeye, tenderloins with open face omlet, and the chiliques.  all of these dishes were great.  It's not steak house quality but it's also not steak house price.  My wife always orders the french toast.  She said the french toast is great because it is big texas toast and fluffy.  She makes it a platter with eggs and bacon.  One thing I enjoy about this place is I think they make their own jelly and maple syrup.  My wife also gets the freshly squeezed orange juice.  Overall this breakfast place is a must try!  be prepared to wait for a table on the weekend but at the end it's worth the wait!
Outstanding place to have breakfast.  The homemade corned beef hash & eggs was amazing.

I'm not really sure how this place has ANY bad reviews. We've been here several times as we live in the southern highlands area. We LOVE rise & shine! The service and food  have never been anything but amazing! We refer all our friends and family here and have also got nothing but raving reviews from them. Keep doing what you're doing and we'll be forever customers!

Never disappointed, best steak and eggs in town. Rib eye!!! And chicken and waffles to rival all others. The pot of bread is like a cinnamon roll in a cup. Every single thing on the menu is fantastic. **the summerlin location has bananas foster pancakes- a la mode!

SOOO GOOD ultimate Ribeye steak. I can really taste the quality and just the right portion for me.  The only thing was the price ($15-still good for a delicious easy to cut-steak) compared to a $7 breakfast steak I've tried before.  

Also...though it was just a small appetizer; the pot of bread with one-of-kind-perfect sauce, was truly appetizing!  

The BYO berrysaucestrawberrypecans parfait wasn't as good.

A breakfast and brunch cafe that has a family-owned feel to it. That's why I prefer going here as opposed to large chain restaurants. The waiters wear pajamas and are super casual. My wait for Sunday at 10am was 15 minutes, so definitely not bad. Menu is extensive, and they're known for their bread in a cup which is essentially a mini cinnamon roll with the sauce on the side for dipping.

Yum! This little place was awesome! We're we're around the corner looking at granite when hunger struck. So I get on Yelp to find this little gem. We were seated right away. Hubby ordered the homemade corn beef hash and I had the turkey, ham and bacon Dijon panini. We were both really happy with our choices. Our waitress was great too. I think that her name was Amber. They all wear pajamas. Cute!

I went here for the first time the other day and I was really disappointed. I had the steak and eggs and French press coffee. The steak I ordered medium plus it was the worst cut of a ribeye I have ever had, all fat and tissue, no meat. The eggs I ordered over medium they came out over hard and the service was uninspired and slow the silverware was dirty. I don't think I will be back.

First off, the main reason I took away one star was because it took 20-30 min to get seated. When I walked in there were so many empty tables. If anyone can justify the long wait, I will change my rating, but I don't understand why it would take this long.

BUT, I love how the waitresses are all in their pjs, and there are spinning flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. The food was good, I ordered the "spice rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles" which came with a "pot of bread" which is similar to a brioche with cinnamon lining the creases. Think cinnabon without being really sweet. The steak was flavorful and tender, eggs were well seasoned and cooked just the way I ordered (over-medium).

I also stole a few bites from my sister's orders - the "baked blueberry croissant French toast" was pretty good. It reminded me of bread pudding slathered with super sweet blueberry compote on top, and it comes with extra compote on the side in case it isn't sweet enough for you. My sister gave up after a few bites because of its sweetness and large, overwhelming size.

As for the "two fisted crispy chicken bagel and egg sandwich".. it was really large and bland. Needs more seasoning. It came with half a plate of fries which were really good though!

If you want great food...great service in a "Mom's & Pop's" atmosphere...this is definitely the place to come for breakfast!!! 
Try the Steak & Egg white's Benedict...it's AMAZING!! Oh but wait...don't forget to also try the Red Velvet chocolate chip pancakes!! 

Can you say FOOD COMA!?! 

Stop by here and try this place out...food is Bomb.com!! ;)

First time here, it's busy but food is good.  They are not stingy, food portion is a good size and not like other places where you only see your food in the middle of the plate.  Staffs are friendly, they all wear PJ, makes you feel warmth and cozy.

This is a really nice place to go for breakfast . The food is great , people there r very nice and friendly. I went to breakfast with 2 of my friend there ,for one of their birthday and we really enjoy it.

Back for the chilaquiles. Really, really good. We split the order which was huge and we both had plenty. Like before the pajama crew was great. Looks like they are knocking down a wall for more room. Se ya next time.

Yes yes yes yes yes !!!!!!! Come here and eat breakfast!!!! Food is awesome people are friendly.... got the original pancakes and made it a platter  and the special country fried chicken and biscuit!!!  they keep up on the coffee refills too !

We were so lucky to have Halle as our server.  Total sweetheart!  She recommended the country fried steak which was perfectly fried.  We also loved the Nutella coffee and had room for a blueberry pancake stack.  This is definitely my new weekend brunch place!

Cute little local spot. I had the eggs benedict. I've never had a benedict before with balsamic vinegar drizzled on it, I think it could've gone without. Also my potatoes could've been cooked a bit more. Other then that, this place definitely has potential.
Love this place; awesome friendly staff, and food is delish. So wonderful to have a breakfast place like this in SoHi!

I wanted you to know th experience I had here today. My husband saw this place and we decided to try it. Initial experience was okay nothing great. The waiter came to take the order and instead of seeing if we had any questions with the menu she kept asking if we needed more time like she was in a hurry to walk away. We did so she walked away and went chatting with another employee, I turned over and she was eating fries from a table nearby. What really blows my mind is that a couple walked 20 minutes before closing and she made it a point to mention to them twice that they were closing shortly and would have to order soon. Not only that but before that couple walked in she made a comment to the other female employee about the couple walking in. Needless to say they left without ordering. Again another couple walks in and she again makes a comment. They sit and she makes it a point to let them know they were closing soon. I asked for a tea refill as I was finishing my food and tells me that they are running out and will check what they have left. She then walks over with a full pitcher. The food was decent but the slaw lacked salt and is not comparable to replace fries. I would not recommend this place based on this experience. I hope this does not fall on deaf ears.

GO HERE! Definitely worth the drive a little out of town!! Great service, love the PJs! We had our 4 year old and the food was perfect for him. The coffee was really good! Then came the chicken fried steak and eggs...Goodness, just goodness!! It had depth, and I mean it lifted off the plate! The hash browns actually had flavor and the eggs were fresh! My hubby had really GOOD biscuits and gravy. GO HERE!! I'm considering driving back from CA 9hrs to come here again..haha...seriously

LOVE this place!  We go almost every weekend, the best pancakes I have had in town.  The staff is always friendly, and the service is good.  My husband and I share the little "pot of bread" which is fluffy bread w/ a hint of cinnamon and sugar mixed in.

We live nearby so we thought we would give R&S  a try for breakfast @ 10:30 on a Sunday. After a 10 min wait we were seated. My bf commented that the large crowd of patrons and the tight seating arrangements didn't make for a very private or comfortable meal. Half of our tiny table was filled with various condiments. The waitstaff was professional, prompt, and pleasant. The amount of healthy options on the menu was limited. I would say the prices for most items were a bit high. Even though it is close to the house, I don't think I will be returning.

This is a favorite breakfast place of mine. Service is is quick and friendly, despite always being busy. Coffee is great, fresh squeezed OJ is wonderful.  Get the pot of bread,  you won't be disappointed. I have tried the location on Flamingo a couple of times,  but it was slow and service sub-par and food was not great. This location is the location to go to if you want to enjoy some great food and fun atmosphere.

I heard about this place from a friend and decided to try it. I am glad I did because my fiance and I both agree-that Rise & Shine is outstanding! The staff is very friendly and the food is excellent! We ordered the chilequiles and cinnamon raisin French toast. It was incredible! The chilequiles were very flavorful and the chips were still a little crispy-which we loved! The french toast is huge and sweet, but not overwhelmingly sweet-the perfect amount of cinnamon, crunch, and soft on the inside. Yum!

Can't wait to go back next Sunday! And every Sunday for that matter!

Thirty Dollars for two people for breakfast is god dam ridiculous. I guess it is my fault for not looking at the menu price. I just never expected the amount to be that high for something we order all over the West coast for usually $9-11.
My wife had Corn Beef Hash. Very small amount that was decent tasting but nothing to let your mom know about.
My Chicken Fried Steak was tender but very greasy. The gravy was your basic gravy. My hash browns tasted like they were old and had been sitting on the grill too long. 
Now what REALLY pissed me off was when I was placing my order I asked for Rye toast and was told that I had to pay extra for that. WHAT? My dam order costs $16 and I have to pay extra for toast. What a load of crap. Of course my for some lame reason my wife whose order came with toast. 
I will never set foot in this place again.

It was my guy's turn to choose a place to eat (yes, e gets a turn ). Intrigued by the name, he chose Rise & Shine - A Steak & Eggs Place. Two of his most favorite things! Score!

I couldn't decide what I wanted & 'everything' wasn't an option, so I let him choose our meals! Haha. We usually end up sharing, anyway 

We got the steak and eggs with hash browns and the breakfast burrito, which was sooooo huge & came with rice, beans, avocado, salsa, & both green and red sauce. 

Everything was absolutely amazing! I want to emphasize again that the burrito was massive. Definitely enough to share. It was also very delicious. The steak was cooked as we asked (medium rare) & it was seasoned very nicely too. As a side, we got the cup-o-bread (I think that's what it's called) & it was warm & fresh. That cream cheese dipping sauce was so yum, I wanted more! 

Food was amazing, service friendly & prompt (love that they're in their pj's too!). Would recommend to friends & visit again when we come back from Hawaii!

Hands down the best breakfast place I've ever eaten at plus great coffee and add-ins as well as a pot of French press! Their steak is cooked perfectly and the bread in a cup is to die for or so I've told.

I have to say, it is nice to have a decent breakfast place in southern highlands finally. it is conveniently located in the middle of southern highlands in the smith's shopping center. it is a quaint little place, with giant sunflowers hanging from the ceiling. the owners of the place are always there and are very very friendly and personable. 

They have a good size menu, lots to choose from. Mostly breakfast fares but there are some sandwiches and entree salads as well. The first time I was there i had the corned beef and hash with eggs. It was homemade corned beef hash with big chunks of beef and potatoes. it was seasoned well and was agood portion of food. i also have tried their egg and ham hollandaise. hand-cut ham on top of english muffin and perfectly poached eggs on top. the hollandaise sauce was a little tangy for my taste but was still excellent. I tried my boyfriend's steak and eggs and the steak was really good. very tender and well seasoned.

their food is really great and they have a special menu coming soon for daily specials like homemade meatloaf and braised short ribs, etc.
overall a great cozy place to have breakfast with excellent service and good quality food.

p.s. the restaurant owners informed me that they chose not to put televisions in their restaurant wc is amazing.. so many places now have tvs and are so distracting. wout them at least u are able to really enjoy the food and company.

I want to emphasize something, dear eateries--cuteness doesn't make up for okay food.  I wanted to like this place a lot, not just for the cow and egg canvas on the wall or the spinning and standstill flower lights overhead.  I wanted to like this place for the simple fact that local eateries should be supported and loved dearly.  Although I love my local places, this one just fell a bit short on taste and overwhelmed me with portion size.  

When you walk in to this place, it's like walking in to a freaky garden turned upside down.  I almost felt like I walked in to the Bug's Life section of California Adventure with the oversizes flowers above my head.  It's cute, though, and has plenty of seating.  The servers are friendly, but they aren't as attentive as they should be.  Although checking on us regularly, when we did want to hail one down it took about three minutes.

My mother and I, after going through the sections of the menu--sandwiches, paninis, waffles, pancakes, specials, omelets, steak, etc.--We landed on two dishes that we felt were different-chilaquiles with salsa avocado and chicken with waffles.  We were excited and couldn't wait for the food to come over.  Thinking it was a regular portion size we even ordered a side of hash browns and bacon.  When the food arrived, however, it was unexpected.  The chilaquiles was actually nachos with eggs on top and half an avocado sliced on top.  IT wasn't that pleasant, although at first it seemed to taste okay.  The chips were soggy and were simply covered in salsa and cheese.  I couldn't see where the chilaquiles part came in at all, to be honest.  The after taste was strong.  The chicken was a breast beat out to what I believe was a chicken fried steak-like thing on top of waffles.  The problem with putting a UFO disc of boneless chicken breast on top of a soft waffle is the oil went in to the waffle a bit, but the heat between the two created condensation that made the waffle soggy.  The chicken was well seasoned, a bit too spicy for just fried chicken, but moist.  The portions, however, were enough to feed 6 people between the two dishes alone.  Still, it was okay.  I do have to emphasize that fried chicken and waffles should be the classic fried chicken pieces with a waffle, but that's just me.

The hash browns weren't pleasant at all to me.  We did order it to have a crispy outside, and I assumed it would be either home fries type of hasbrowns or the typical shredded potato one.  It was..well..like a baked potato was roughly scooped out then patted in to a pancake like hashbrown thing.  They didn't season it either.  I gave it to my husband in a take away box with the leftovers so as not to waste it.  The bacon was nice, though.

Overall, it was okay, and the restaurant is interesting, but I think that there are a few tweaks they need to make.  Then again, I'm one palette against a full restaurant, so maybe I need to try something different next time.  I do like them, and I hope that my next experience in six months will be a more tasty one.  Still, you should try this place for yourself.  In the end, I feel that a cute eatery cannot cover the the fact that it's oversized, just eh food.
Love it here, great food and great service...Fresh squeezed orange juice is FRESH not from a bottle

CUP O BREAD! Definitely a must. Tried the fried buffalo chicken. It was absolutely great. Everything we tried was delicious. The only downfall was our waitress. She kind of seemed like her head was somewhere else.

I've been meaning to try this place since our family live close by but it was always so packed that we did not get to try it until today. We wanted to see what the fuss is all about. 

If you go here on the weekends, expect a longer wait time. We waited for a table for around 45 minutes even though we were advised that it will only be a 20-minute wait. When we were finally seated, we were attended to right away. I liked the motif of the interior especially the spinning umbrellas on the ceilings. Our food came out right away, which was great. I ordered the corned beef hash - a classic, how can you mess that up. The flavor is better than most breakfast places that I have tried but I do not like the texture. It was chopped ham with onions and mashed potatoes (supposedly hash brown). It was a little disappointing. Everything else that we ordered were meh. Nothing really stands out. The waffle was too doughy. The orange juice tasted like it was not freshly juiced and it was a little sweet like it was mixed with concentrate (this is just my guess). 

I would still recommend this place. I might come back and give it a second opinion, maybe try their steak and eggs or their pancakes. I think since Rise and Shine is really the ONLY breakfast place in the area (I mean you can get breakfast food at The Lodge except it's a bar), a lot of people would be willing to wait for a table here. I personally think it was not worth the wait. They need to open more breakfast places in this side of town.

I find the food in this restaurant to be some of best in this price range. The casual atmosphere is enhanced by the fact that the wait staff all wear pajamas. It's a cute touch.

We always make a point to order at least one pot of bread, because they're fantastic. Of all of the breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas, this one of my favorites.

The only negative thing I can say is that the biscuits and gravy are a little too spicy for my taste.

I'm writing this review before I get my food as I can already tell it will be awesome. It was super busy but they still managed to seat us right away. Love that the servers wear pajamas. Yelp is the bomb!

Very fortunate to live pretty much next door to one of the best breakfast spots in Vegas. The servers are all in their pyjamas which adds a fun and upbeat atmosphere. Not to mention the classic Christmas songs playing which made my breakfast even more merry. I chose to go for the cinnamon crunch french toast....it is unreal! Price is very good and worth every penny.

Food was amazing! 
The staff also wears their PJs which makes you feel like you're right at home getting a home cooked breakfast!

They serve you while in their pajamas!!!

One little quirk that I found endearing was the fact that the servers here run around in their pajamas while taking your order and serving you. Nice little gesture to make you feel at ease and that you don't have to take things too seriously.

We arrived and were told that the omelets are great, the Pot'o'Bread is THE BEST, and that the steak n eggs are pretty bomb. 

Well, what was told is pretty much truth. I got a pretty hefty and filling omelet, the wife got the steak n eggs, and we all got Pots o Bread.

Now I have to say - the PoBs were a little underwhelming. Really cool concept, fun little quirk to have as a staple of your establishment... but too me, there wasn't enough cinnamon and there wasn't quite enough flavor. But still! The texture was great and it was really fun to enjoy.

The servings are all pretty big as both the lady and I had to take our food to go [and I'm a pretty hefty eater]. The steak that she got was more fatty than we'd prefer, but there was still a substantial enough amount of meat for us to enjoy.

The service here is great, everyone is friendly, and you feel very welcomed to enjoy a good time at Rise & Shine. Not bad, you guys, not bad at all.

Come here if you want something off the strip, not nearly as noisy, and a good time.

Very cute atmosphere, especially for a strip mall establishment. I was really impressed with the decor and attention to detail on all of the styling.  The flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and tile framed windows made the setting more whimsical than industrial. The waitresses all had on pajama style uniforms which was a nice added touch. (Though I also have to mention the owner was working the cash register but didn't make much of an effort to make an impression with customers). 

The food was very good - we ordered the chiliquilas and steak along with the Belgium waffles. We also got the French press coffee which is served at the table with a timer for the perfect cup. 

So why only 3 stars?  This place was good but a little expensive and they charge extra for everything! In fact, a whole column of the menu has the run down on these charges... But these items arent really "sides" -- unless you usually eat avocado by itself?  Also, $4 for bacon?  I got my breakfast with steak for only $3 more than the chiliquilas by themselves so I'm not sure about the math on this one. Bottom line, this place is a little out of the way, nestled in a neighborhood strip mall, and could do better on the pricing for what it is... So, I have to conclude by saying this place is probably best left to the locals.

The place has a good morning feel to it. The staff was really friendly, and overall nice. The food that I order came out in a good amount of time. I tried the country fried chicken and waffle. By far one of the best combinations I had and it tasted very good. I would recommend to check this place out.
Fast, low wait times and AMAZING orange juice! When I say amazing it's understated.  Seriously, go try it.  Oh and the food is awesome as well.

What a fun place! Instead of toast or English muffin, you HAVE to have the "Bowl of Bread", a yummy cinnamon roll baked in an espresso cup served with cream cheese topping on the side. Then came my breakfast with perfectly cooked over-medium eggs. I don't get them perfectly cooked very often but this place is meticulous. My husband ordered the Asada Burrito which was perfect! The homemade refried beans are yummy as well. Writing this review...I want to go again but I'm 5 hours away. Next time I'm in Las Vegas...

Maybe I missed something. Or, maybe I just ordered the wrong food but Rise & Shine was not all that to me...at all. 

I arrived around 11am and it was busy. I drove here from Lake Las Vegas so when I was told the pot of breads were all gone, I was definitely disappointed. 

I had some coffee to start which was actually a good cup of joe. My waitress was really busy and I was in a really patient mood so it was all good. She finally came to
take our order. I ordered the Ultimate Steak breakfast which consisted steak (obviously), 2 eggs, hash browns and my choice of bread (except the pot of bread).

I ordered my steak medium but it came more well then anything. We waited about 20 minutes or more for our food so I decided to keep it. First off, this rib-eye was super thin. I have never had a rib-eye steak that was so thin. 

I ordered my eggs over medium. The yolk portion was perfect but the eggs were a little too brown on the outside and they were more yolk than egg white. It was like two big eyeballs on my plate. Not sure what happened to the egg white portion. 

My hashbrowns were okay but like most everything else on the plate, it was cold. 

NOTE TO RESTAURANT: Why is the air up so high. My food was cold in a few minutes.

I saw some other plates going by that looked pretty good but my food was not up to par. I would say it  was okay, so I won't be back.

It was good.  I live 1/2 a mile away so after reading the reviews I had to check it out.  Yep the servers wear PJs.  They look good too.  My server was A+ she explained the menu very well.  I had a nice three egg breakfast with the smoky bacon and hash browns.  Maybe not the best I've ever had but very good and their coffee is terrific.

The food and the reviews are what pulled me into this place. My husband ordered soda to drink and it tasted very flat ordered a second choice and that too was flat, thinking the food was going to taste better we went for the rise and shine chilaquiles and steak burrito. Not only did 5 customers that came after us got their food before us but the food was okay, I really wanted to like this place but the food was a 5 out 10 just like the customer service.

Refreshing change of pace over all the other local breakfast spots!

The decor, atmosphere, service, and food are all top notch.  You'll read many reviews raving about the flower pots of bread and their Chilaquiles and Steak and you definitely won't be dissapointed.

This is definitely my new favorite breakfast spot and you just get a much more alive vibe than the Egg Works, Egg and I, Pancake House, and other breakfast competitors.

These reviews are spot on about the quality of service and food.  This place is truly a gem and you should definiltely check it out!

They know what they're doing and they're doing it right! Amazing steak! I had the chilaquiles and ribeye. Both amazing. The chilaquiles aren't authentic Mexican but they are still good! The parfait is also amazing. I will come every time I visit Las Vegas! 

My husband also had the cinnamon raisin French toast with bacon. He struggled finishing it but had to because it was so delicious. Also, don't forget to get some French pressed coffee. Will be purchasing a French press after this.

French press! I'm in love.
This eatery is not close to where I live, so to come here is not convenient and I need to have a very good reason. French press is good, but not something to drive across town for. I have been here twice and had a very good experience the first time, but a not so good one the second time. Service and food were on point the first time, which brought me to the second visit... that kind of just fell flat. I might return if I am on that side of town.

Very disappointed! I wanted to take my son and grandson to a new place for breakfast. Such a waste of money and time. First I have to say the restaurant itself is cute. I loved the umbrellas on the ceiling. Very unique and adorable. That's the only thing I could say I actually liked. 

The service was the worst I've ever had and I mean worst!!! As soon as we were greeted by the server (christine) we felt her negative vibe. You could tell she didn't want to be there. She even rolled her eyes and started looking around the restaurant while we were taking to her. I was really hoping my son wouldn't notice because he's super picky about customer service. As soon we'll she walked away he's like "Did you see that"!!! Unfortunately I did. Not once did she not ask us on how our food was. When they (her and another server) dropped our food she didn't even ask if we needed anything else. My son waited 10 minutes after our food was served to get sour cream. He tried getting her attention....She looked right at him and walked away. Finally he just got up and went to go ask the cooks for the sour cream. 

The food was not worth the $44.00 we spent. I had the red velvet pancakes with a side of eggs and bacon. I specifically asked the server to make the bacon well done. Didn't happen. The pancakes were hard and crispy. Really pancakes crispy!? Ugh. My son had the steak omelette I think. He said it was ok but not worth the money. 

All in all I would never go back to this establishment. The service alone killed it for us. Then to have mediocre food ugh. Honestly there's so many good places in Vegas to eat breakfast... believe me I'm a native and have been to plenty. Try somewhere else!

My friend was visiting from out of town and we are both fans of Steak & Eggs, so we decided to give this place a go. We went on a busy Saturday morning, the weekend of thanksgiving, it was packed but we were seated in a timely manner. Service was good for how busy it was. The steak was alright and the eggs were, well....eggs. You get a choice of toast, biscuit or a cinnamon roll in a mug (bomb). I was a fan of their coffee and the ambiance of the restaurant is nice.

This used to be one of my favorite places. Recently they expanded their dining area and changed their menu. It's clear that even though they expanded their dining area by a lot they didn't expand their kitchen. The last time we were there we waited 45 minutes for our food. I ordered 1 soup and my boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffle. Really? It was a very small order and zero reason for waiting that long. 
Also, they removed my favorite lunch combo (soup and southwestern chicken salad) They no longer have the soup and salad combo and they no longer have the Onion Soup or the Southwestern Chicken salad. They also removed the delicious Pot of Bread from (at the very least) the Chicken and Waffle. 
You simply shouldn't remove items that accompanied entrees in the past. If you want to remove an entree fine but removing an accompanying item gives a bad experience. 

I will not be frequenting this place as I did before. 
We used to go almost every weekend and there's zero loyalty, they simply wouldn't budge and wouldn't allow me to order a soup and salad. I'll be taking my business elsewhere.  

This is is exactly how businesses fail. Poor management.

I have been meaning to eat here for months! With quite an appetite I had high hopes for the food here but my experience was off. The poached egg tasted really weird and lost all the egg taste and texture. The steak was unseasoned and the hash browns were meh. Even the plain bagel it came with was terrible. I've never found a bagel I didn't like until this place. The pancakes were ok. It was a little weird of how crumbly they were though.

Sometimes when you are hungry enough even average food tastes awesome but it didn't work here. Almost everything was terrible.

This place is off the strip in a plaza with other restaurants and eateries. 
We waited a while to get seated and for the food to come. 
Our waitress was nice, but did not write down our requests, so as a result got a lot of our items wrong. We had five people with somewhat specific requests, so it is better to write it down. Usually they do at restaurants I go to. We did not want to send back our items as it would take even longer to get the right items. 
The restaurant is not too fancy. Not too new. Reminds me of a Denny's. The price isn't great either, same as strip prices just about. I thought going off the strip is supposed to be cheaper.
Their most unique item is the bread in a cup. It's bread baked into a cup. That was really good. Fluffy and flavorful. 
I got the omelette with fruit, avocados, and hash browns. Nothing special. Just a regular breakfast. Won't return. Will stick to the strip next time. Closer and cleaner!

I had the chicken and waffle and it did not disappoint! My only regret is not being able to finish it all. I also had the bread in a bowl and it was to die for. Like monkey bread but not as sweet and gooey and just as good.
We had never been here before and went off reviews on yelp and decided to try it. We had a great breakfast, the staff were very friendly and the service was good!

I think the egg and I have some competition when it comes to breakfast. I love trying brand new restaurants and just having so much anticipation on how the place will turn out. 
Located in the southern highlands neighborhood in the smiths grocery plaza. We had a 15 min wait, pretty packed obviously this was brunch for us, got there at 1pm on a Saturday. Friendly staff and excellent food! Hugh portions, food came in hot. We started with the "bread in a cup" that was so yummy it had a cinnamon roll like texture! I had the steak and eggs chilaquiles, steak was a pretty good size and a perfect medium rare. Chicken and waffles were yummy too! Best piece of chicken I've tasted in awhile. Large piece deep fried crunchy coated chicken breast. This place does breakfast right. I'm assuming this is family owned which is great because they really care about the quality of the food.

Ahhhhh!!! This place is soooo amazing! I wish I lived in Vegas! The concept of the whole place is so neat! I had the chicken waffle and omg it was sooooo good! The red valvet pancakes were amazing as well. I love how the servers were in their pajamas and sleeping slippers. This place is a must if you're in town. It's going to be my stop whenever I'm in the neighborhood! Yummy yummy!

The wait was 20-25 minutes when we came at 9:45 on a Sunday morning.  Well worth it.

We had chicken & waffles- very good, very crispy, and the syrup came warm.  Also country fried steak and eggs- excellent!  Huge, crispy, and with a little bit of a spicy kick.  I personally got the pancakes, and took the server's advice to ask for the blueberries cooked inside.  Loved!  It was fresh, flavorful berries, and a generous amount.

Best of all, everyone in my family loved breakfast, from baby to grandma.  Take it from me- this bunch is hard to please.

Finally found a breakfast place that we love!! My husband and I just want to say that everything from the service to the food was amazing!! Laura our server took such great care of us! She was so funny and even though she seemed to have quite a few tables our food came out quick and she still made time to chat. We will definitely be back!

We've been to the Southern Highland Rise & Shine and loves the open atmosphere. The food is great so when we found out there was one open in Henderson, we had to come and try.

This one is smaller, a little bit more closed in, and has been just open for a month. Service was good, but not fabulous. Just seem like you have to constantly ask for things like water, napkins, straws, and etc.
I ordered a cappuccino and I got whip and caramel on top thinking it comes with it. However, I found out they charge 95cents extra. Everything is ala carte here. Food was yummy except for one dish. The Loco Moco. They served it with day old rice and hard rice from the bottom of the pot. Ground beef was burnt. The waitress took it back and they brought it back with the same rice with a different patty with no eggs. By the time we got it back, everyone was done with their meal and nothing was solved. I could have chipped a tooth with the rice it came with. Waitress was apologetic and took off the check. The thing is, one person went out still hungry with an overpriced check.

Therefore, I don't think I will go back to this one because it was the manager that still approved for the meal to go out the same way the second time. Horrible. This is my reason I gave this place three stars. Or if you still go, don't get the Loco Moco!
Nice yummy place to have breakfast! Awesome service as well! Definitely will go back!

I gave them a 2 stars only because they do not have any kind of vegan option they do not carry any other milk but cows milk.  On the positive side the service is great and it feels like a neighborhood dinner
Coffee, amazing. Red velvet pancakes with cream cheese syrup, bomb. Burritos, huge.
Great service! Super-cute place and great food! My daughter loved the red velvet pancakes! The cream cheese syrup is incredible!

steak was cooked perfectly, but was so overseasoned that it just blended with the plate.  the plate i ordered was the chilaquiles, which is basically a plate of savories.  the steak alone was probably the only saving grace.  the chilaquiles were ok.  the sauce was a little acidic but then again, it's chilaquiles.  i ordered my eggs poached, and they clearly were made with the kitchen trick of adding a drop of vinegar so the whites stay intact.  well, these eggs just tasted sour, like vinegar and SMELLED of vinegar too.  

for the money (think, a whole 6 oz steak), the entire dish, and not just the steak should be amazing.
Stunned. So good. Tried the chilaqilues, b & g, and cinnamon crumble French toast. French press coffee: do it. My favorite thing though? Probably the hash browns. Best I've ever had.
it was alright, no booze so its no longer my go to place but the food was alright and the staff was nice, the smoothies are great.

Read reviews and since I'm new to the neighborhood wanted to check it out.  We were seated right away but, waited a little too long for drink order.  Waitress was very nice.  Ordered country fried steak and eggs. $15.25.  Generous portion but hash browns were burnt.  Steak was bland. I was a little disappointed based on reviews. No bread came with meal. $3 for ice tea that was refilled.  Gonna have to push myself for a second time

This place is on my go-to list for breakfast and brunch any day. After a few times here, I have come to find their service is plenty attentive and their food is always tasty and fresh.

Absolutely love seeing servers dressed in pajamas. The wall/ceiling decorations are also fantastic and add to the overall inviting feel of the restaurant. I love the fresh squeezed orange juice. Not to mention their french press coffee and their super delicious hash browns. I have had the chicken and waffles, eggs benedict, and french toast for breakfast so far and have nothing but good things to say about all of it.

There is a unique and charming flare to this restaurant that we don't see much of in Vegas and it's that rare quality that keeps me going back. Thinking about it, there is really no breakfast joint here that I can even compare this place to and that says quite a lot to me. They may get a little busy at times, but Rise & Shine is certainly worth the wait.

This place was awesome. The atmosphere was cool, our server named Vanessa was really good and knew exactly what she was doing and was very attentive. The guy back in the kitchen was fast and made excellent meals. They had a wide variety on their menu and had good coffee. I ordered the avo-veg eggs Benedict and wow it was awesome. Great place! Highly recommend.

Beautiful decor, friendly staff, good food. Had the Ultimate Ribeye Steak and eggs and it was good. Not flavorful enough to be memorable but good. I will return to try other items on their menu. There are lots of varieties and portions are large. The Green Go Go drink was refreshing and delicious with a naturally light taste. The French toast is fluffy and well made also. I am excited for my next visit!
I had the Chilaquiles with the steak. Either I was really hungry or the food was really good.  Best breakfast I've had in quite some time.....eat here!!!

Oh, how I love chicken and waffles! After seeing the pictures, I had to go! Like almost everyone else, this place is really far from us in the NW but it was well worth the drive. It is kinda small and we went for brunch but I'm guessing during breakfast, you may have to wait a bit.

Of course I got the chicken and waffles...and it's one of the best versions I've had in Vegas! Even though I usually prefer bone-in breasts, they give you two huge boneless breasts that were excellent! The chicken itself is fried perfectly, crispy on the outside and super moist inside. Killer seasoning on the chicken too, it's not overly salty and even had a slight bit of spicy kick in it. The Belgian waffle was delicious, super moist, fluffy and they bring out a bunch of butter and warm syrup with the plate. My wife had the biscuits and gravy which she's normally really picky with but she loved it.

We really liked this place but I think there prices are too high. The chicken and waffles is $13 which is a huge plate but the biscuits and gravy was kinda small portion-wise and was $10. They also charge $2.50 for HALF an avocado which is ridiculous. The waitresses dressed in pajamas was a nice touch and ours was really nice. Other than pricing, we loved the food and would come back in a hearbeat!

So this is my second visit.  Had the corned beef hash both times, first time service was ok, not the most attentive but adequate.  This time around the corned beef was not as good as the first time: this time it seemed like more potato than meat which is disappointing.  So may not come back for corned beef next time.  My party seemed to enjoy their food the most part, the chicken fried steak my sister in law had was very fatty and far too breaded.  Service this time was pretty bad, never checked how our food was, never bothered to see if we needed more beverages till we had to ask.  I asked for more water and only half the table got water...  So service is really lacking.  We were also very bothered that not just w our table but the table next to us when we were still eating or had food on our plate.  It was a clear ploy to get us going since they are backed up on a wait, but never rush your guests... Bad form.  Sure other people are giving 5 stars but I'm wondering they are being objective.  This place has some improvements to had if we are to come back.

I just had breakfast here. There was a 10 minute wait, so worth it. Made my own omelette. Comes with hash browns and your choice of bread. I got the bread in a cup which is delicious. Everything was sooooo good and well seasoned. I ordered a French press coffee, very good and makes 3 cups. Atmosphere is lively and family friendly. Customer service was great. Will definitely be back to try other stuff.

Waitstaff...awesome. 
Food...excellent. Great selection and all steak (even if you get steak in your burrito) is cooked to order. 
Only downside...not a big enough place...if there were more tables, we wouldn't have to wait as long on weekend mornings!

My boyfriend and I went yesterday morning for breakfast on our anniversary. The food was amazing although I did have to wait on my cream cheese syrup for about ten minutes after I received my pancakes so they were a bit cold when I finally got to eat them. The only real complaint I have is that our server a guy wasn't very friendly but the lady with glasses was amazing and picked up his slack

The food was great and I wish I could give them 5 stars.  Unfortunately the juice bar guy is enough reason to NEVER return. As I sat facing his direction, I observed him cleaning the oj machine with scrubbing pads and kitchen rags, WITH JUICE IN THE CONTAINER, that was being served in the process. I was appalled. Then he continued his health code violations by eating with latex gloves over the the prep area in view of the entire restaurant. This man should be fired!!!!!

Got here at 9:30 am on a Sunday morning and this place was packed! 

Service was good since we got a table right away. The waitress in her PJs was pretty attentive too.

I ordered a ham egg Benedict and it was good! The hash browns just needed a tad more seasoning. My bf ordered a ham steak that came with a strand of HAIR! I immediately noticed it while the waitress was serving it. I mentioned it to her right away and took the plate back and replaced it with a fresh new plate. The ham was pretty good too. It was not dry and you can taste a bit of the char from the grill. 

I especially loved their pot of bread. The presentation was something different (bread in a plant pot). The bread was so soft with a hint of cinnamon. Delish! 

All in all even with the hair experience, it was not bad and will be back here.
Consistently great breakfast, I've tried almost everything on the menu. There still hasn't been a disappointment. The size of the dishes is far more than most breakfast places. I never leave hungry.

Found this place via yelp reviews and tried for brunch... Not disappointed! Had to wait a bit but well worth it and it just reassured that we chose a good place. 

Food is reasonably priced and tastes great! Service was also good- friendly staff and refilled our waters/coffee multiple times. Only thing I would say is that I got an omelette with steak and some of my steak pieces were fatty- therefore I was unable to eat all of it.

Will definitely come again though- and recommend for anyone looking for a cute, local and cheap breakfast place!

Tried this place based on their reviews and glad I did. The portions were generous, the food was tasty, and the waitress kept my coffee cup filled and was great about offering pointers on what to order.  Did I mention they have real maple syrup? 
Bread in a cup and red velvet chocolate chip pancakes are a must.

Had a great breakfast here over the Thanksgiving break.  Of course I ordered the country fried steak and eggs and I was not disappointed.  It is the best I've ever had!  The meat is really tender and moist and the batter is nice and crispy.  You can't get any better.  Next time I'm in Las Vegas, I will be coming here.

This place hits the spot... Even ran into 3 people from Utah where were from. Just ask the server what's good and you will be fine. Vanessa was awesome and her recommendation of the the buffalo chicken breakfast was right on the money. Put a little syrup on top of the buffalo sauce and I was in heaven.

We LOVE this place!  The pancakes are to die for!  The omelet and hash browns are also delicious.  We also tried the oatmeal and that was served beautifully and tasted great.  The service is great, the coffee is yummy, and all breakfast items seem to be delicious.  We are so excited to have this place in our neighborhood.  We hope to check out the lunch menu soon, too.  My husband's only complaint is that there are no newspapers to read and not a newspaper stand nearby.  

Definitely go early on the weekends, or bring a newspaper and read it while you wait for a table.

I've been here at least 5 times since my first review. It's still my favorite breakfast spot in South Las Vegas. The coffee is really good and the steak and chilaquiles is still my favorite dish. I've since tried the corned beef hash among other dishes and was quite impressed. 

I think the potted bread as a side should be a little cheaper. I also think the wait staff is better than before but still needs a sense of urgency when moving around the restaurant. There's one brunette woman who I like a lot but some of the other servers seem less than alert. I'd like to see a bigger team effort when it comes to the service. There's nothing more frustrating when you see other servers standing around and my coffee cup is empty.

I joined a friend here for a late breakfast while visiting Las Vegas and it will now be one of my regular stops when I am in town.  The staff here wear pajamas.  So cute! Very cozy and unique.

Pros:  great location, near South Point Casino, delicious omelette, great coffee, excellent service.

Cons:  Located in Vegas and I live in San Antonio.

Amazing place to grab a protein filled breakfast.

I ordered the spice rubbed ribeye with the chiliquilles. The ribeye came out super tender and charred nicely. The Nachos on the side with the refried beans, cheese, and egg works so good with the steak. 

This location is the best one I have been to in regards to the service which was top notch the entire time we was in the resturant. 

We also ordered the country ham steak which was a little on the mediocre side. Do your self a favor and stick with the staple this place does. Get da steak and eggs!!!

GET THE 'CUP OF BREAD'!!!! My oh my what a way to start off breakfast. Food was excellent. Rib eye and eggs perfect, coffee very fresh and best part is the atmosphere. Definitely as good as the food. Servers don their pajamas, down to earth and friendly. Worth a half hour wait.

First time visit and it won't be the last! Had the lox and cream cheese omelet which was a surprise since I wasn't expecting all the extras in it, capers, spinach, onion and I had avocado instead of potatoes which has never been an option in any breakfast spot I've gone to unless you pay extra for it. You'll have to try the cinnamon roll instead of toast, it has a cup of the frosting on the side to dip it in after its pulled apart out of a tea cup that it's baked in, a yummy pre breakfast treat!! The decor is cheery as there are umbrellas in the ceiling that spin and the wait staff wears pajamas.

I eat here often but this time made me write a review. I am a Chef, i am writing this because its probably the best breakfast I've had from here yet. I ordered the Country Fried Steak which is normal for me but to start the portion size is well worth the money you pay for it. Second it was seasoned so perfectly every time i took a bite it honestly left my taste buds jumping for more. Kudos to the Cook that made it for me i will be only ordering it when you are on shift now because i don't want it any other way. Thank you for an amazing meal and service from the FOH staff keep up the great work!
Their food was great and I loved the cleverness of them wearing PJ's! My kids enjoyed and I will be back!

This was our first time at Rise & Shine. The restaurant is beautifully decorated with vibrant colors, open windows, exposed brick, and high ceilings. Very clean and open + cute pajama uniforms for the staff that made it feel like you were having breakfast at home! Their menu was diverse, and they serve fresh juice. Upon arrival to our table, our server, Ashley was attentive, personable, intentional, and her customer service was A+. I got my go-to favorite kind of breakfast: rice, spam, and egg over medium. This wasn't offered on the menu, but I was comfortable enough to ask Ashley it was possible and without hesitation she said, "of course!" Overall extremely satisfied with my food, and will definitely come back.
Delicious food and excellent service. Wish it was a bigger location, not much room for waiting.

This place is perfect for brunch and you seriously do not have to worry if you just rolled out of bed, even the servers are in pajamas! They have cute overhead umbrella flowers, and the rest of the decor is really homefeel like. 

Our server was really friendly, but a tad slow on bringing back our drinks when the restaurant was not busy. She asked to refill coffee a few times and checked back with us with a smile on. 

I ordered the Ham N Eggs Benedict which was very appetizing to look at, who doesn't eat with their eyes first? The ham to English muffin ratio was perfect and the hollandaise sauce was smooth and rich. The hash browns were more on the crispy side,which I prefer. Overall it was a great tasting meal. I would definitely order it again. 

I recommend to definitely get the pot of bread, if your meal does not come with it. It's like a less sweeter version of a cinnamon bun in a cup. It was delicious. Just thinking about it makes me salivate. Honestly this bread along with another side choice, & a cup of coffee would be a perfect light breakfast.

It's a little ways out of the main city/strip but definitely worth it for some good old comfort food.

This Place is delicious! My GF and I both got the Chilaquiles Steak and Eggs and by far that is some of the best steak I have had out to eat in quite a while. Staff is friendly and attentive and Management is GREAT. Towards the end of our meal Steve Bell came and introduced himself and asked us how our meal was. This restaurant has some of the best food and customer service in town, you will not be disappointed!! We will for sure be back!!!

One of my go to places for breakfast spots because we live right down the street for it. Always a wait when you come so you know it's going to be good. Takes about 5 mins to be seated if not less and they make sure to get you started right away. The staff is in pjs and it's really cute.

Started off with their coffee and some pot of bread which is what they are known for. So good. For my meal I had one of their bagel sandwiches and it had egg cheese and sausage, can't complain it was good! My sister had a parfait, once again yummy. My boyfriend had the steak huevos rancheros and it looked amazing!

They are really speedy with their service and it's also really good food. Every time I get something different and I have no problems. Greta restaurant great food.
I would like to start off saying that me and my roomie showed up in onesies. This place is adorable and probably the best place in town to eat breakfast hands down.

This was my first time at this place and I have to give it five huge stars! I ordered pickup and stopped in the place is really cute and the people are really friendly. Even the pickup order after driving home was still the bomb! Fresh, plenty of food and so flavorful. Me and the hubs got the three little pigs bagel and the steak chilaquiles...they both were really good! Definitely the new breakfast spot for us!!!!

First time eating here and it was fabulous.. Maria our waitress was wonderful, she explained the menu and their items to us, which was helpful since it's a lengthy menu.. lots of delicious choices!! We will definitely be back!

This place is so cute. I love the umbrella flowers spinning about the ceiling. I love how the servers wear pajamas! Super cute. The service was great. I ordered the country fried steak it was pretty good with the gravy on the side. Only downside it was breaded a little too much to my liking. I also tried a side of the red velvet pancakes to compare with the ones at BabyStacks Cafe. I'm sorry it just doesn't cut it. These pancakes did not even look RED, it looked more like a burned pancake. It was also too chocolatey inside. The cream cheese syrup was too thick and too sweet. I guess I'll have to go to BabyStacks for my red velvet fix. Other than that I enjoyed my main dish. I also ordered the steak chilaquiles for my boyfriend togo and that looked delicious. He enjoyed it! I would like to come back and try their other breakfast items.

Update: They raised the prices which is unbelievable considering very few items are made from scratch. It's all add water mixes for the pancakes and the egg whites are from a container not separated eggs. The omelette was over cooked to make matters worse. I'm so over this place especially since my two favorite servers have left. The remaining staff seems miserable and it makes one wonder why. On to other places for us. 


My husband and I frequent Rise n Shine at this location. Our first experience was made phenomenal by our server, Christine! We love her and request her whenever we go. She is very attentive and professional. I think the prices are high but I don't mind paying a bit more for the great service we receive from Christine. I can't imagine anyone feeling a negative vibe from her, she is always cheerful and funny. 
I love the waffles! The caramel coffee is delicious and I don't have to order when I go in, Christine knows what I'm ordering. Lol. Go on in and ask for her!!
Absolutely one of the best breakfast places! Delicious food and fun atmosphere. Servers in pj's and "pot of bread" cinnamon rolls are a great touch. Try the "cinnamon toast crunch French toast"!

Amazing experience and the absolute best breakfast we have have ever had! My daughter Paris says they should put a Rise & Shine in EVERY city; then she said every corner.

I had a bacon, egg and ham omelet with hash browns and a bread cup (espresso cup filled with warm cinnamon bread). The omelet was perfect and the hash browns had this amazing taste where you knew spices were involved. 

Paris had bacon wrapped steak. Also amazing. We'll be back on every trip!

I am obsessed with this place!! The food here was Stellar and it had such a fun happy vibe to it. The decor just made me smile and all the servers wear PJs! I ordered the double fisted bagel sandwich with hash browns and it did not disappoint. Service was on point, will be visiting next time I visit Vegas !

First time here. It did not disappoint. Great service and I love that the waitstaff wear pajamas. The menu has everything you can imagine for breakfast, and Some unusual ones as well. I will definitely come here again. If you're in or around Southern Highlands I highly recommend this restaurant.

Holy Moly
Drop your forks, we all know there's only a few breakfast restaurants in Mountains Edge / Southern Highlands. Don't waste your time at any other than Rise & Shine!
The food is Phenomenal! Seriously staff usually doesn't make or break a place for me but this staff was sooo on point! Including their adorable pajamas.
