The chefs were voice full which made that busy kitchen run smooth.But the food the food was the knockout!! Rubbed steak & chilaquiles was Masterful!! The flavor was bursting the authentic flavors I haven't had since being in Mexico!
Great Job guys! You have a weekly guest now and I couldn't be more ecstatic about Breakfast Time!!

Talk about big portions.  I couldn't even eat half of my plate.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy.  It was delicious!  If you love coffee you must try the french pressed coffee!! The service was okay, the women was really nice, but we felt a little rushed.  Other than that I would recommended trying this place out for breakfast.
So many times w come here and the food is great. Blueberry pancakes, avocado eg sandwich and chicken wrap all super tasty. Great service.

The service was great, our waiter had a great sense of humor and was sufficient at his job. We went on Wednesday so not to busy at all. The cup of bread was delecious! The most I had was just an omlet nothing fancy. It was slightly overpriced but overall a great new place for breakfast.
Cup o bread and ok is a must!!! Very cute place and great food!! Eggs Benedict was delicious
Good food and nice seevice. The juices are great too. The chilaquiles are my favorite so far. Yum!
Good breakfast place, really cute atmosphere! 3 stars because service is hit and miss & food inconsistent.

In my opinion you really can't mess up an egg, this was the case here. The eggs were done right, the hash browns were fresh and the bacon was perfect. Oh, they have these little cups of cinnamon roll heaven. The atmosphere, cleanliness and service was great. The food was hot, and the coffee strong.
Yes, you should give the small out of the way breakfast place a try!

I Was Tipped Off About This Amazing Breakfast Spot By A Friend Of Mine. I Looked It Up On Yelp And Found All Of The Good Reviews. Me And My Wife Went And It Was AMAZEBALLZ. Our Server Cary Was Very Helpful And An Amazing Waitress. I love when you go to a new spot and they know how to help you choose the right meal. My wife got the county fried steak and I got the rib-eye. Everything was killer and I would tell anyone in the area this is a must eatery.

Breakfast being my favorite meal of the day - I had to try this new spot in Green Valley. Upon entering I was greeted and sat quickly. After 5 minutes of not being approached by a server, I asked a hostess for a cup of coffee and to find my server. Server appeared a few minutes later with my cup of coffee. He apologized and said they were short handed and they are still trying to work the kinks out of a new restaurant. 

Servers are  inexperienced and move very slow. If I could offer one tip for the servers that would be to treat your section as one big table vs. 4 or 5 individual tables. Stop making a trip into the kitchen each time you leave a table. Stop, make eye contact with your customers to see if they need anything before disappearing.

I found the coffee and the food to be much better than the service. Hash browns were crisp on the outside and flavorful inside. The ham steak was thick and juicy. The eggs cooked perfectly. I opted for the cup of bread instead of my usual wheat toast. The cup of bread is a bland cinnamon roll with frosting on the side. I think this would be good as an appetizer but didn't care eating it with my breakfast. 

The prices here are crazy expensive for a neighborhood breakfast restaurant. My bill worked out to be $20/person with tip. 

I would come back here for the food, but not very often because of the service and the price.

Staff is very attentive and friendly. Great breakfast and environment. Place was pretty cold since we were one of the few first ones in on an expected hot day in Vegas. I had one of my breakfast faves - chicken fried steak and eggs. The hash browns, gravy, steak and eggs came out perfect. I'm very satisfied with my experience bring it's my first time eating in the area.

went back a few times.   Food is still delicious and the chicken and waffles are always a winner.
I also enjoyed the bagel egg sandwiches, and the burgers.

It is cool seeing the waiters wearing PJs.
Fast service, delicious healthy food, and friendly staff! Waitresses are dressed in pj, which makes you feel like home. The design of the restaurant is cute too:)

I'm so sad they're not in the San Fernando valley. I absolutely love this place and I only had one meal. I don't care about ihop, Denny's, norms, or cocos or really any breakfast place. This is my number one! My dad and I were disappointed they discontinued corn beef hash at ihop, but this place oh my god!! I swear it's like butter! Like I can taste the butter in the corn beef hash. If I could I would refuse every mashed potato meal/side and just have the corn beef hash from Rise and Shine.

I had a wild craving for some chicken and waffles while waking up after a night in Vegas, I started searching for nearby eateries that served chicken and waffles and also had pretty good ratings (which is always my determining factor) and came across Rise & Shine.  After looking at the photos on yelp and reading the reviews I had already made up in my mind that I wanted their chicken and waffles, but once I was seated and saw how small the waffles were, I asked if I could have pancakes and waffles instead; and indeed did I make a good choice.  Those where the most fluffy, soft, and flavorful pancakes I've ever tasted.  The chicken on the other hand, could've used a bit more seasoning but overall, I enjoyed the food and the service.

Again this will be short and sweet. I love coming here because my monkeys and I feel like family. I brought a fellow yelper (YAY Mackalicious!) to see what I was bragging about and he felt the exact same way. We love you Steve and crew. Will be back soon for more breakfast goodness.

The cinnamon french toast is great. The red velvet chocolate chip pancakes are excellent! Best red velvet pancakes I've had. The 3 little pigs breakfast sandwich is also excellent. And of course, there's the pot-o-bread which is very good. Always good service. Do not waste your time with places like Denny's and IHop. This is a real breakfast place.

Thanks Yelpers!  All of your mouthwatering pics drove me into this place!  I felt like I needed a breakfast "do over" after eating at Republic Kitchen and Bar for Sunday brunch.  On Monday before taking my mother-in-law to the airport, we stopped in at Rise & Shine and I couldn't resist the baked blueberry French toast casserole.   The hubs and his mom had what appeared to be the regular eggs and bacon breakfast with hash browns but the taters were so tasty and seasoned and the bacon so crisp and smoky!   I stole a piece to go with my blueberry yumminess!  I loved that the blueberry compote wasn't super sweet.  Our server was though and  we can't wait to go back and try some of the other menu offerings.

I love me some rise n shine! This is a quality breakfast joint and a southern highlands staple restaurant! They are always on point with their fresh pressed juices and fried breakfast meats. I usually get the chicken a top a waffle or biscuits and gravy. Today I came a little closer to lunch time so decided to try the friend chicken and avocado sandwich! And let me tell you it did not disappoint. Juicy chicken fresh avocado and perfectly cooked bacon made this sandwich almost to die for! Thank you for being the quality we need in the southern highland neighborhood!!

Great breakfast place.  Good food and good friendly service!  Had the bacon & eggs.  Husband had chicken fried steak & eggs.   Mine was good ( bacon could have been thicker) husbands chicken fried steak was huge and very good.  Will be back.

The only reason why I gave this place a 3 star was because the customer service was really bad! The waitresses and hosts were like all in a bad mood  with each other!! On the other hand the food was delicious I had the chicken and waffle it was great! However will not go back to this place customer service is a big thing in places specially restaurants!!
Great food, coffee and service. It's mom and pop places like this that should be supported.

I always ate here. Every time! We found a plastic piece from a bread bag in our butter and no one came over and apologized or offered anything. It was very matter of fact and no importance to customer service or value at all. It's sad because we will now need to find a new breakfast place to eat. Wish their customer service was a bit better. When we left the server didn't even look us in the face when she nonchalantly said "thank you have a nice day" like it was pulling teeth. We are going back to the Griddle or New Day.

I have visited Rise and Shine on many occasions, I live clear in the North East Las Vegas and I am willing to make the long drive to this location in Henderson for a great breakfast. Their menu selection has something for everyone in your party (assuming you don't have strict limitations like kosher, vegan, paleo and all that stuff that I fortunately don't care about. although I did see some stuff that may fit some of the healthy needs) they have sweet dishes, savory dishes. My personal choice for this trip was the corned beef hash with a pot of bread...if you haven't had their pot of bread I highly recommend it! The rest of my party all had something a bit different, Chilaquiles, some amazing looking steak bagel benedict and a dish that I can't recall because I was too busy stuffing my face and enjoying a nice morning cup of coffee. I will say that on this visit it seemed like my coffee was a bit cooler than I would like, but the service from Maria made it ok, she topped our drinks off frequently and made sure we had everything we needed on this visit. The prices are a bit above average for a sit down breakfast and lunch place, expect to pay around 14 to 18 per person, but the quality and portion of food makes it a way better choice than just swinging by McDonald's or I-Hop. Price is fair for the food period. If you are looking to have a great breakfast with your significant other or a group of friends, check this place out. The servers are all wearing pajamas, so if you roll in wearing yours, you might get asked for a refill or something :-) 

Dishes that I enjoy
cinnamon crunch french toast thing
Corned beef and hash
Steak bagel benedict thing
two fisted bagel sandwich 
Pot of bread
This is my favorite breakfast place in the world. Their French toast with cinnamon toast crunch cereal on it is my favorite, along with the fried chicken and waffles. Good coffee.

Only have had breakfast here. Food is very good with good choices. Service is pajama service and good. Cute umbrella decorated ceiling. Usually order ham steak and eggs with hash browns. The steak is huge, eggs always done to my order, hash browns could be crispier, but that takes longer. Not cheap, but good value for your buck.

I live in Southern Highlands and I've heard of this place and driven by it many times. A friend finally recommended it so we thought we would  try it out. It was everything I thought it would be;  overpriced the food was great and not good at the same time with the drink delicious but small and the service was fantastic.

The waitress was friendly, helpful, and had recommendations as we had never been there.  She was very nice throughout.  I had a GoGo drink that was fresh juice and id say about 8 oz for $5.  Way to small but delicious.   Then i ordered the corned beef hash with bacon.  It was nothing short of fantastic!  3 poached eggs that were cooked to perfection with this dish.  This came with 1 small biscuit.  It needed 2 at that size.  My friend ordered a steak breakfast burrito with the steak done medium.  The sauce (like an adobo) was aweful.   The meat was super well done.  And as a hole it was terrible.  (Hate to say that about any dish) but she had about 1/2 and was done.   1 coffee as well.  Couldn't tell you about that as i don't drink much coffee.  

Bill was $35 and i feel it just wasn't worth that price.  
I would order the corned beef hash again as it was just amazing.  But that's it!  Hope this was helpful for anyone wanting to come here.

My mother and I came visiting from Los Angeles and stayed in a hotel nearby, and found this place on yelp. Everyone else is so right! Their food is amazing! It was so great that we went two days in a row! The first day we got the fruit plate, coffee, 2 cup of breads, and the salmon omelette with egg whites. The food was great and the cup-of-breads are to die for! You have to get one! Our server was so accommodating and I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas!
Loved this place, food is delicious and everyone so attentive. Will definitely stop by when I am in Las Vegas again. The steak is a must!!!!

Fun breakfast place to hit when driving back to LA. Has all the standard breakfast fair, but most with a twist, like their chilleqetas with steak.  It's made with Doritos, wrong but oh so right. The portions are big and prices reflect it.  I like that they have healther options like yougert and fresh fruit and granola parfets and fresh pressed juices.  Theur hot latte and ice latte were not that great but I'm picky.  The service was great, fast and friendly. Probably because all the waitresses are on their pajamas and their comfy.  They also have fun twirling flower umbrellas on the ceiling for lighting.
If your on this side of town. This place has amazing eggs Benedict. The place is clean and the service is amazing! And I hear the waffles are to die for!
Every time we're in Vegas we eat breakfast here on our way home. The service is heat, the food is amazing. The bread in a cup is unique and so good! Love this place!!

Really long wait this morning. Orders were getting lost, customers were waiting a really long time, and there was lots of complaining from the cook.
This is only my second chance to try this restaurant and will probably be the last. To start off my experience, my wife and I were asked to wait for a seat. Normally, this is no problem but I could see at least 4 tables that were clean and nobody sitting at them. Not a big deal as we were in no hurry. 
We were seated and taken care of right away. We ordered coffee and water and needed a couple of minutes do decide on our food. My wife ordered the French toast and I ordered biscuits and gravy. For the next twenty minutes we listened to the cook argue with the waitresses and watched customers walk out the front door. Almost 30 ,minutes went by and our food finally arrived. I got scrambled eggs instead of over easy and the waitress fixed it right away. My wife's meal was warm but certainly not hot.
As I dug into my biscuits and gravy, I was greeted by crunchy biscuits and a sad excuse for gravy. The biscuits tasted like the kind you would get in a tube of Pillsbury and I needed a knife to cut them. The gravy was clumpy and tasteless. I have been cooking gravy for many years and it looked like the flour, or mix, in this case was thrown in and not blended very well. This was, by far, the worst plate of biscuits and gravy I have every eaten. Biscuits and gravy is a relatively easy dish to do well and it says volumes when a breakfast restaurant cannot do it right.
I did let the girl at the register know how disappointed I was with my breakfast and she took it off my bill. That was very cool.
My first time to Rise and Shine was pretty good and the second was less than impressive. I was told that the reason the prices were a little high is because of the quality ingredients that were used. I would disagree. It seems like either corners are being cut or the cooks are not happy with their jobs. Either way, this will probably be my last adventure out of the way to come to Rise and Shine..

Wow... What a menu! They've got something for everyone! I might be one of the pickiest eaters out there! We ordered a bunch of items and everyone one in our party was beyond satisfied! I will definitely be a returning customer.

First choice was closed, so came here instead and I am glad I did. Although it is far, but it is worth it. The cinnamon pot bread was moist, warm and just delicious. Wish it could be bigger!! Tried chicken and waffles for the first time definitely not disappointed. The fancy steak omelette was a winner as well with the sauce. Yum yum!!! Totally satisfied and will be making the drive again.
Very poor service, this place used to be good.  I'm not impressed with the service or food.  I walked out this weekend after waiting over 25 min for table.
Everything was cold , we won't be back. The service was just as bad. This was very disappointing because there were some good reviews.
Have become a regular here. Small wait times and big delicious plates. I have tried almost everything on the breakfast menu, can never go wrong.

Came in here do to the great reviews.  Service was great and the food was delicious.  The steak had lots of flavor the eggs are perfect.  The hash brown was good but a little oily but overall I was very satisfied.  I would definitely come back again.

Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place fills the breakfast/brunch void in the Southern Highlands area. It is in the same shopping center as Off the Strip Just Real Food, which offers brunch but only on Sundays. It just opened yesterday and appears to already be a hit with the locals.

There is a wide selection of breakfast and lunch options but, as their name suggests, it is all about their steak and eggs. My husband ordered the Southern Style Chicken Fried Steak ($10.95), his usual order that is usually the determining factor in whether a breakfast joint is worth it. I ordered the Crispy Fried Chicken Breast and Waffles ($11.25).  Both dishes were huge and very filling. The chicken fried steak was good but, according to the husband, doesn't live up to his standards because the batter wasn't flavorful enough. I really enjoyed my chicken and waffles. The breast was moist and the batter was light and airy. The Belgian waffle was delicious as was the maple syrup.

The d√©cor is nice with mosaic walls and flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. The service was prompt and decent considering they just opened the day before. I give this place a 3  1/2 stars because it is definitely worth trying but I still prefer other breakfast/brunch places such as The Original Pancake House and The Egg & I. I do see this restaurant thriving in this area because I predict there will be regulars that will patronize this place.

Well executed food for adults in the vein of "MTO" downtown.  Not the MTO/Hashhouse experience, but somewhat that style. Rather underwhelming for children though! A five and two year old and we had to share the adults' food to satisfy them?  And they normally leave food on the plate. The five dollar half waffle (not Belgian/huge/pick your adjective) was the biggest head scratcher. So much so that we asked the server if it came with anything else to which the answer was an apologetic "no". So either keep the kids at home (if able) or have them split an adult entree (which is well executed). Will we come back now that we know this?  That is a head scratcher too.

What a concept! Steak and Eggs used to be a once in awhile treat because of the price (usually) and the calories (who cares now...!)! But, at Rise and Shine, it is BEYOND delicious, portions are just right, and the price is right! The servers are dressed in Jammies, they have Illy coffee (French Press too if you like and I highly recommend it!) fun cinnamon bread in flower pots as a choice of bread (NOT to be confused with a cinnamon roll - it is not sticky sweet like that. More like Cinnamon toast - you can put butter and jam on it). They have Chilaquilles, which my hubby who loves SW cuisine/flare, was just in love with . The perfect hint of heat, great flavor on his steak - "Baby, most places just don't season their steaks anymore... this is perfect!" was the comment that I got, and let me tell you, my hubby is Picky with a capital "P"! 
definitely recommend going early. We went at 8am after dropping a friend off at the airport and by 845am there was a wait already (on Father's Day). Love it Love it Love it and will definately be back!

I see why this place comes up as one of the best BREAKFAST in Las Vegas.
I will definitely return here next time in Vegas!!
 On a scale of 1 to 10 I give it an 11!!!
Completely off the beaten Vegas path, but well worth the visit!!! Loved it!!!! Do try the pot bread;)!!!!!

Came here with my toddler after my eyebrows threading appointment and we had a 10 min wait before we were sat down.

We shared the green juice and the corned beef hash plate.  Too bad there wasn't rice for me to order with the food.  They do however offer the cup o bread.  I was so full after the food, that could not eat the cup o bread.  The decor was nice, my toddler was naming all the colors of what she thought were butterflies attached to the ceiling.

It's also very cool to see all the staff in the pjs.  Different than majority of other b-fast spots.

Pro's
Wait for a group of 20: only 15-20 mins!
Service: far superior than some fine dining places! Staff actually looked like they enjoyed working there.
Food: Cinnamon french toast was perfectly crisped, sweet, & fresh. Steak Chilaquiles got high marks from our group as well.

Meh:
Toast in a cup: though you'd think otherwise.

First impressions are important to me. I really want to give these guys more stars, but it didn't meet the hype that everyone have it. We were told 30 minute wait, we waited 45 then left. Might I add, I noticed 2 four tops 3 two tops open but not cleaned. The efficiency of the place can get better, I hope it does. I started my experience like most and washed my hands, the bathrooms were disgusting. Clean it up.

Found this place close to home --- thanks to YELP. ::claps hands::

The flowers from the ceiling is really quaint and cute. Open lay out to where you can see into the kitchen. The servers are in jammies - which just makes you feel a tad comfortable. 

The potted cinnamon bread was a little cold - if it was warm, I would think they would be amazing. 

Cup of Illy coffee was ok. 

I had the steak and eggs while my partner in crime had the chicken fried steak (she fancies Crack'n Barrell - but it is 2 hours away!)

The steak was ok - it was moist not dry. It was good with its side kick A1.

The chicken fried steak had a piece of hair or nylon in the breading which we made sure the waitress know, but we said its ok we just wanted to bring it to your attention. Five minutes later, the server brought her a new freshly cooked chicken fried steak as a courtesy @ no charge. Well... since she was halfway through her meal we decided to take it with us. 

Overall good experience. There was a tad wait for the food, but kind of expected it in a full FOH, but we didn't mind as we were catching up on our current events. And no... that doesn't mean facebook. News!

Til next time.
The food was pretty good but there wasn't much corned beef in the corned beef hash. The staff is very good. The pancakes were delicious

Your first thought when walking in? "Look how neat this place is!" Servers in pajamas, upside down flower-print umbrellas hanging from the ceiling (some even spin!), and overall relaxed vibe. The wait for me is usually about 10-20 minutes depending on what time I get there. 

Like Marie T., this place USED to be my favorite breakfast place. It was also icing on the cake that it is walking distance from my abode. I keep giving them chances to change my mind, but I get disappointed every time.

My favorite thing to order is the Fancy Steakhouse Omelet. Thankfully, its taste consistency has remained the same and is always "good." My second favorite would be the Crispy Fried Chicken Breast and Waffle. I was never a fan of Chicken & Waffles until I ate it at this place. The New York Steak, Spinach, & Benedict-Bagel was the worst thing that I have ever ordered. The presentation was extremely lacking.. The words Hot Mess came to mind; which made my food unappetizing. 

The Pot of Bread for a side is one of the reasons why I keep wanting to come back, but for the last THREE times they have been unable to keep up with the demand and simply say "they're out." Instead, customers have to choose between getting toast or a biscuit. Ugh. If you're a server and you see that my hash browns are either burnt or undercooked then do not bring it out to me. I will say something. Also, we keep getting handed other people's tabs.. get it together guys.

I decided to try the chicken & waffles.   Jennifer was our waitress again.  This was only our 2nd visit.  She remembered what we ordered last time.  She's funny and professional.  When we we're getting our check, my husband asked her, so since your so good.....then she butted in and said, military discount.   (ohhhh snap)  she's good, and my chic and waffles were delicious.  I think that's my favorite there now.

Went here this morning $60 For crap! 
4.50 for a cup of KIDS orange juice RIDICULOUS. 
I got the avo steak egg whites omelet it was bland and the avocado was three slices the steak was cheap steak. The hash browns were bland as well. 
For the price I will not be returning I rather eat at Denny's.

Sometimes you just really want a huge breakfast after a weekend in Vegas served on a plate bigger than your face. Hubby had the chicken and waffles it was some of the best chic and waffs I've ever tasted with warm homemade syrup. I had country fried steak and eggs. Usually it's like a pounded out piece of mystery meat but here it was literally a steak. Maybe we just fill up fast but neither of came close to finishing our food. Waitress was nice. It's cute having everyone in pajamas. And someone tell me, do all the flowers on the ceiling spin or just some? I couldn't tell and I forgot to ask haha. Driving me crazy.

Today was a disappointment. I come to this from time to time that I almost know what's on the menu without looking at it. As today is the their time in a year that I've ordered corned beef, I've noticed how very different it is now. There is hardly any corned beef I see in my plate . It's probably just this meal that they have changed but breakfast being the first meal of the day, this really made me lose my appetite. I didn't even touch the meal anymore . They showed me a side order of it and it's the same. I guess they don't understand, people expect breakfast from restaurants to be better than what we could make at home. This one is worst corned beef hash meal served to me in all the restaurants I've ever been to here and abroad.

Place has been open for 7 weeks already. Came here with my buddy. The loco Moco and signature ribeye chilaquiles were off the hook. Our server Maria was great! She explained the menu very well and her service was on point. Hope to come back after our gym workouts again! Thanks Rose and Shine!

i just wanted to say thanks to jessica the hostess. i couldnt decide what to order so she suggested the pot o bread. very tasty. i then chose egg whites only omelet with cheese, bacon. my waitress carrie made me feel at home she has a lot of energy which made us all smile and made it a fun visit. jessica and carrie your the best !!!!

Didn't know about this place and happened to come across it on Yelp...so glad we did! We usually frequent Cracked Egg, Egg Works, etc and we were looking for a new place to add to our rotation. Servers wear pajamas which is really fun. I ordered an omelet and it was delish; came with the pot of bread which was very tasty and such a cute idea! My husband ordered the cinnamon crunch French toast platter....I kept stealing bites it was so good! We will definitely be coming back, there were a lot of things on the menu we would like to try!
I love their creations! The food is great! Pancakes are heavenly, I love the eggs  Benedict! I love the popovers. I've seen the chicken and waffles they look amazingly! Try this place!

This place is busy, busy! Choose your timing well; regardless, it's worth the wait! 

I had the steak and spinach Benedict. Huge serving (for 2 hungry people) but the meat was tender, cooked perfectly and I love their hollandaise sauce with the balsamic extract. YUM! 

The spot is clean, well decorated, and I can't speak highly enough about the service. 5 stars for the service without a doubt.

I feel their menu is slightly limited and given their huge portions (a lot of meals are pretty heavy, too) I won't make this my "go-to" place, but I'll get a craving for it (and their cup o' bread). We'll be back! 

Worth checking out (for you meat lovers only).

We haven't been in this area since my disaster of an experience a few doors down(Refer to my Xtreme Sushi review) but with all the high ratings, I knew we'd make it here one day.

Yes, it is clear across town, yes, we're up by Mt. Charleston, Yes, I am that person who'll drive AAAAAAALL the way to Hendertucky for the best Snow Ice in town, and Yes, there are too many whiner vaginers who make a big deal because of the distance travelling farther than outside of their hood....two answers for you-1) Stay home, or
2) Make like Rhianna and SHUT UP AND DRIVE!!!!

Breakfast/Brunch is my absolute favorite meal of the day, and we're always looking for another spot to add into our breakfast/brunch rotation. I like the quirky atmosphere here. Everyone is so welcoming as you walk in, spinning umbrellas up on the ceiling, waitresses in pajamas like they just rolled out of bed ready to serve you. Puts a smile on your face..:) One weird thing was the "Help us...Yelp us" on the back of the busboys' shirts. Don't know if that's against Yelp policy, but its not like they need to do that....They have a great fan base, and great food!

Menu selections here are plentiful, and our waitress Riley was AWESOME SAUCE! She was very informative, personable, and offered up suggestions, popular items, and even her personal favorites. when we narrowed it down, we split the Fried Chicken Breast and Waffles and The Ultimate Steak and Eggs Plate, with the potted bread(Took a page from Jamms?) as our bread choice, with some fresh squeezed OJ(they use Navel, not Valencia) Two HUGE chicken breasteses were fried to perfection-crisp, well seasoned exterior, and the inside stayed nice and juicy and went perfectly with the crisp, light waffle drizzled with the cinnamon infused syrup, which was unfortunately Log Cabin. The ribeye was a perfect medium rare as requested, and the hash browns were not your typical out of the box type and you can tell it was made in house. Nice and crisp on the outside, soft and creamy on the inside. As popular as they are, the potted bread didn't arrive until after we were done with breakfast. No one's fault though, as Riley even offered another bread choice, we chose to wait. Its kinda like a little Cinnabon in a flower pot that comes with a cream cheese glaze on the side and was a great ending to our meal.

Definitely can't wait to come back to attack their Sweet Cream Pancakes, Chilaquiles, and other popular items.   ALOHA!!!

LOVE this place. The service is excellent and so is the food. The portions are pretty filling. The staff is dressed in PJs which I think is too cute!! I have tried a few different things and there is nothing that I did not like.
We eat here every  Sunday after church. The food is  consistently good and the wait staff is  great! Thank you Ashley, Cary and Vanessa. You're  all amazing  & thanks  for buttering my toast!

First time eating here. The line was out the door but it was well worth the wait. The staff were all very friendly, our food came out quickly and everything was amazing. The kids loved the fresh juice as well. My eggs were not cooked correctly and the owner came out herself with a fresh order and said you can't not like your eggs. We were super impressed with the customer service. Best breakfast we've had in a while, we will definitely be back! Well worth the money and the wait.

Ryley girl you are fantastic! She had a great personality and made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived. 
The steak and eggs Benedict on an everything bagel was perfection. The BF got the ultimate breakfast and loved it as well. The chilaquiles were delicious. Bread in a pot gets an A+ from me. Oh and how could I forget the hash-browns seriously sooo good. I was sad I couldn't finish my meal. 

The decor and staff adds to the charm of this neighborhood breakfast spot.

Average breakfast place. Had some high expectations due to recommendations from a friend, left kinda diappointed. 

Eggs were not runny in the eggs benedict. Sad.

I loved this place! Food was awesome, decor was gorgeous, atmosphere was pleasant, all the employees were happy & comfy looking in their pajama uniforms, & the variety of food was perfect for breakfast! I was really impressed with the juice bar too, it's been way too long since I've had fresh orange juice & I was so happy to be able to order some! 

Def. a must try place!

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after reading all the good yelp reviews. We went in just before closing on a Monday. Our waitress wasn't the most friendly person but she was reliable and efficient. The menu is huge, however everything was a bit more expensive than I expected. For example, a plain waffle was like $9 but one with fruit was like $11. Considering it wasn't a specialty waffle or novel in any way, that seemed a bit much to me. Overall, everything was good, but not as over-the-top as the yelp reviews made it sound.

My new favorite place to eat breakfast.  My girlfriend and I just moved near here.  We've stopped by about 3 times since.  Haven't had a bad meal yet.  The service has been good and friendly each time.

I really liked this place. Nothing negative to say. Cute idea and execution; especially the uniforms. Food is well prepared and very flavorful. Will def go back next time in town. Wait staff was awesome and aimed to please the customer!
Meh...I had better, my eggs & cornbeef hash was underwhelming. Also, my girlfriend had the bagel eggs and bacon sandwich not so much flavor. It wasn't terrible, but we expected more.

Fabulous place. Food yummy. Service excellent. We had the county fried steak and eggs, and steak and eggs. Steak was cooked perfectly. I highly recommend if you want a delicious breakfast at a reasonable price point.

I was very impressed at Rise & Shine! A cute place with indoor and outdoor seating. People bring their dogs too and the staff brought them water. The servers wear pajamas! 

I ordered the NY Steak and spinach Benedict bagel. The bagel had everything on it and the steak was cooked to preference! When choosing your bread option, ask for the pot o bread! It's a little cinnamon bread in a flower pot and is yums with butter!  My friend ordered a breakfast sandwich and it looked really good! 

Good sized portions here and good coffee. Friendly service and a perfect meal after a Vegas weekend!  I hope to find a place like this in SoCal!

Been here twice, my girlfriends been there about 4 or 5 times now.  This place is awesome.  If you haven't eaten here, do yourself a favor and go get some breakfast right now.  Their biscuits and gravy is addicting.  That along with some fresh squeezed orange juice (with lots of pulp) is a winner in my book.  My girlfriend is more adventurous when it comes to food, so she's tried more meals than I have.  She's liked everything she's ordered as well.  She loves the french press coffee.  I'm not a coffee guy so I figured I'd take her word for it.  Also, the staff is very friendly.  It's in a good area, not too far away from where I live, and the prices are great.  The prices for the meals are only slightly higher than what you'd pay at an IHOP or a Denny's, but the food is soooo much better.  You just really can't beat this place.  The only suggestion I have for this place is that they offer Gluten Free bread products.  

A+++ in my book.

Uhm, what? There's, actually, a yummy place near my house?

The waffles are gigatic. Not scary Man vs. Food gigantic but, definately better tasting than Hash House a Go Go, iHop, Denny's, even Egg and I. Their potatoes hash is really good. Not mushy and spiced just right.
The steak was made perfect. Moist but, over done like South Point's steak.

Super excited that they serve my favorite coffee ever-in-life: Illy. Yessss, ILLY IS ILL!

Love that the waitresses are all in pajamas; and the decor is just bright and makes u wanna wake up in the morning! --- I mean, besides the fact that I'm a morning person and all.

I have yet to try their lunch which has rave reviews, too.

All in all thankful to eat something other than McDonald's egg mcmuffins in the morning =)
great food and service. Get the bread in a cup. Fresh juice A+.

I work in the "industry" and I would've gave a higher rating but service is major and thus we lacked. Food and portions are great but service sucked, well OUR server anyway.(For her sake I won't mention her name). She was really nice though, just lacked in customer needs. We were there a little over an hour and WE had to ask to refill our coffee, came to checkup on us once. While she stand at the prep area talking stories and just hanging out. Would eat there again, just hope we have a different sever.
It's a cute brunch place. The portion size is pretty big. The steak is a nice portion, very juicy n tender. I would also recommend the cup o bread.

Just finished eating here and it has never failed to put a smile on my face! Staff are very personable and relatable and continuously makes sure that your dining experience is awesome great start of my Easter morning!
Maria was terrific! We were in a time crunch and she got our lunch out to us quickly. The food was great. The crunchy French toast is our favorite and their coffee is outstanding!

This breakfast is like a great home cooked meal. Delicious food, portions are enough to share. Customer service was good .Dain our server was nice and have great suggestions on what to order. The decor was cute and I loved that the servers wore their pajamas to work.

Came here as we were searching for a place to eat in Southern Highlands and did a search on Yelp. Ultimate Steak & Eggs is the best breakfast I have had in Vegas for the price. Corned beef hash is amazing and service was friendly. Breakfast seem like it would just be breakfast and you can't make it any better than what it already is but these guys prove that wrong. I have now been here 3 times and everything I have ordered has been top Notch!! Thanks Rise & Shine!!

Excellent breakfast and service! Really liked the country fried steak and eggs, waffle and fried chicken great, steak omelet was great too, along with Pressed Coffee.  Only thing that disappointed me was the common jelly, homemade fruit or better end jam or jelly would have really been the icing on the cake to go with their homemade signature bread in a pot. Get over there now!! They close at 3:00!

We make a point of coming here whenever we are in Vegas. Love the atmosphere and friendly staff. Food is always great -- their waffles are crispy and delicious and the menu is fun and inventive. Tried the chicken and waffle and banana frosted flake pancakes and we were not disappointed.

This place is a pretty good american style breakfast with nice portions and a great price.  I had the Spiced rubbed ribeye and chiliquilles.  It was very good.  My wife ordered the avo-veggie and eggs benedict.  This looked scrumptious.  They have fresh juices you can order that they make on the spot.  We ordered the strawberry watermelon juice.  This place serves alcohol, also.  It is hard to find, but the list is on the top right hand corner of the menu.  We decided to order a carafe of the Tokyo Screwdriver, which is orange juice with sake.  The freshly squeezed OJ put this over the top.  This place doesn't take itself too seriously.  All the servers wear pajamas.  It almost makes you feel like you are having breakfast in bed.  Now rise and shine, it is time to eat some breakfast.

I've given this place multiple chances and each have come up short. The service is always slow, even when the place isn't busy. The servers are friendly and their pajama uniforms are fun, but it doesn't make up for lack of service and sub par food. The food is overpriced in my opinion, and either too seasoned or totally bland. After many attempts to get a timely, good meal here, I have given up.

OMGosh- This place is heavenly! The best omelette and hash browns that I have ever had. My omelette was cooked perfectly ( not too firm and over cooked like their Flamingo location). And the Pot of Bread was a fun way to serve a cinnamon roll. Service was attentive with a smile! If you have a hankering for some good grub then this is the place to be.

I'm not quite sure what the rave is about with this place! 
Average seat time was 20 minutes, we we're sat in 30. The set up is totally disorganized, tables sitting dirty, 1 bus boy carrying dirty dishes from one table to the other to consolidate the dirty tables . 
The pajama appearance accompanied by a dirty floor, booths, table almost give the place an unhygienic feel. 
The food was ok, nothing to rave about. We have had better coffee and breakfast at sunrise cafe, brio, I hop! The oj was fantastic. We would not return. It's actually a shame considering how convenient the location is to our home.

I have been here a few times. The food, staff and coffee are all wonderful. On a weekend morning/afternoon be prepared to wait at least 45 minutes so don't go hungry. (I made that mistake a first and last time-lol). They fall in line with the other like breakfast restaurants in town. I go here most because it's the closest to my home.

I came here about a year ago and the food and service were great. Stopped by for breakfast today and was instantly brought to a table. Sat there for over 15 minutes without anyone coming over, even to get a drink order. The two tables next to us had waitresses constantly checking on them. We got up and left, won't be coming back here. Customer service goes a long way.
This place is good if you're not on a diet. Otherwise, trying to order a custom omelette or breakfast gets VERY expensive.

Not great, but not horrible. It's a small restaurant with only a few staff at a time. The wait staff is awesome. Quick with refills and to clean off tables. They make them wear pajamas which I thought was a little weird... I ordered a country fried steak and egg breakfast. This thing was enormous and I was excited, but when I cut into it I realized that it was WAY over breaded and didn't really taste like much. It didn't come with gravy which is my fault for not asking but that would have helped. The hash browns were pretty good and the egg was fine. They brought me this thing called a "pot of bread" it was just a roll in a coffee mug. I would have rather had some toast or a pancake or something besides a plain roll. I give it a 3 because of how hard I see the wait staff working but the kids working in the back may need some more experience on preparing the food. I probably won't come back.

Went here for a nice breakfast on our way out of Vegas. The ambiance is nice and relaxing.  Servers wear pajamas and invite the guests to do the same. The pot of bread was great as others have commented, but, the best offering, WARMED SYRUP. Such a sumple concept that so many get wrong. 

Daughter had chcken and waffles, yum, tasted kinda like pancake batter on the chicken. Baby girl ordered chicken fried steak which did not disappoint.  The gravy is served in ramekins on the side. Hb had corn beef hash which was disappointing. Had a lemony taste to it. Unpleasant.  I had the crunchy french toast, wow! Never thought I'd enjoy it, but, it was great as well. 

Overall, can only go four stars due to the lemony corn beef. Riley was a great server, best service we've had sine we've been in Vegas.

This was the best breakfast I've had in quite awhile! I got the rib-eye with the chilaquiles and it was OUTSTANDING! The steak was cooked perfectly, the chilaquiles were cheesy, crunchy, ooey goodness! My mom had the NY strip benedict which was delicious and my grandma got the biscuits with gravy which she is extremely stingy about her biscuits and gravy and she loved it! The hash browns are soooo good to; super crisp and golden. We also got the french press, which was pricey but very good. The service was nice too, not anything outstanding, but a definite 8/10. Overall I loved it and will be returning to try the chicken and waffles!

We found a new breakfast spot!!!
Amazing food but there very busy ( I guess that's a good a thing) so be ready to wait!!
Delicious!! I recommend the buffalo chicken & eggs or chicken & waffle. The chicken is so light and crispy.. it's like nothing I've ever eaten..so yummy..and a lot of food!!

I'm usually hesitant about restaurants with a gimmick, as well as those that I've never been to. Finally decided to go there for breakfast with the family and glad I did. 
Portions are HUGE!!  Service is a bit understaffed it looked like but they made up for it in attentiveness. 
The food tastes absolutely delicious and as if it was homemade. 
The aroma of the place was very pleasing and welcoming. It's very spacious clean. Every staff member was always moving about to take care of something or someone. 
I recommend this place for anyone who loves big breakfast/brunch and flavorful food. 
5 stars all the way.

This is one of my favorite breakfast places when we visit Las Vegas.  The ambiance is cute, colorful and quirky. Servers in PJ's give the atmosphere a very homey quality.  Food has been delicious and consistent on each visit.  Service has always been good as well.  Order the pot of bread...it's delicious and unique!

I can't get a bad meal here .. True true stuff .. Our waitress was named Cary and she was wonderfully excited and attentive and funny.. I had the ny steak and eggs Benedict which was cooked to a perfect medium rare on the steak as was my preference .. The eggs were a soft medium poach and they were delicious !! Gotta say, whether you're visiting or a local like myself , rise and shine is a must for breakfast !!

Great breakfast joint that doesn't just do a solid steak and egg plate, they also approach common breakfast items with a different style meaning you are just eating the same hash browns you could get at a million breakfast joints.

This place is pretty good breakfast/brunch place in the southern highlands area. I had the chicken and waffles, I'm not a chicken and waffles expert but it was pretty darn good. I liked how it their chicken was boneless which made eating it clean and easy.

If you're into the iHop/Denny's style breakfast you will love this place. Imagine a full breakfast at one of cheap diners and the turn up the quality a few notches and you have Rise and Shine. 

I'm not much a steak person for breakfast so I can't comment there, but I did have the biscuits and gravy, bacon, eggs over easy and scrambled, and crunchy French toast. I regret not snapping a photo of the spread. Everything came out hot and fresh at the same time. Oh, also make sure to get the fresh squeezed orange juice, you won't regret it. 

Rise and Shine doesn't have the flashy-ness of anything on the strip but the quality is 100% there. I will definitely be coming here again on my next trip to Vegas.

We really enjoy going to the pajama breakfast place as my husband calls it. The waitresses wear flannel jammie's  and the service is friendly. So far We have liked everything we have tried from both the breakfast and lunch menu. Only downside is the pricing. If there were a few more lower cost options we would go more often.

Yelp- you once again helped me find my new favorite breakfast place (in Las Vegas anyway)!  I found this place using my mobile search app, and I must say I am damn glad I did.  First of all, the atmosphere is darling- bright sunny yellow walls, cute parasol light fixtures hanging from the ceiling, it just made you feel more cheerful walking through the door.   The servers were all on point, and maybe that is because they are extra comfy- all of the servers are working in their PJ's.  

Now for the important part- the food.    I ordered the chilaquiles and eggs. They didn't dissapoint.  Eggs cooked perfectly atop perfectly cooked tortilla chips softened in a tangy but not too spicy tomato sauce.   My Son put the hurt on a huge portion of chicken and waffles.  He was also impressed that they did little things like warming the syrup.   My daughter ordered a spinach/mushroom/swiss omelette.  She said it was delicious and not "too" cheesy.  My husband ordered the english banger sausage and eggs.  He said that the sausage was a bit too mild, and could have been a little more savory. 

If there was anything that I could say could improve is explaining to the customers the unique things that the restaurant offers-  The server asked us if we wanted toast, muffin or what sounded like "powder bread" .  None of us knew what the hell that was, so nobody ordered it.   It was only later that I noticed these cute little individual breads baked in tiny little terra cotta pots sitting in the pass.   I would have definitely ordered this just to give something new a try.  Something that could have been avoided with a little enunciation.

These guys are truly deserving of 5 stars. I order from Postmates from them. When I do, I order a ton of food. They have never messed up on anything or forgotten anything. The food is cooked to perfection and tasty.

A cute place to grab breakfast. Service was quick & everyone was very nice. I had the red velvet pancakes & boy that could've easily fed 2-3 people. Pancakes were very delicious & moist.  I didn't even need the cream cheese frosting that was served on the side. Also got the cup o bread which was recommended by many yelpers, another yummy choice if you are a fan of cinnamon rolls. The orange juice is freshly squeezed which they mention you can tell by tasting it.

4.5 stars!  This place is off the beaten path...  no where near the strip and thats a good thing.  The food is very very good, we ordered the chilaquiles, eggs benedict and a waffle.  The minus half star is for the waffle, too doughy and the temperature in the restaurant (on the warm side).  Aside of those minor glitches everything was great, the chilaquiles were perfection from the beans, cheese, homemade tortilla chips and salsa.  My husband raved about the eggs benedict too.  Definitely try the french press coffee, so good.  We will be back next time we visit LV because this place is legit.

We had breakfast here this morning and our experience here was not that great. We were a party of five and when we sat down, we asked for water and coffee. We waited for our beverages for more than fifteen minutes. While waiting, we start seeing other parties being seated. They were getting drinks... Where the hell was ours? We couldn't even find our server and we were getting agitated and hungry. 

Finally, our server comes out of the woodwork and gives us our beverages. We gave our order and that too, took forever and a day! They were out of peanut butter and blueberry French toast that we ordered, but didn't tell us until ten minutes later. While waiting, we watch getting more and more pissed with every person on the same row as us get their food while we did not - and we arrived before ALL of them! 

Our server was not attentive, never apologized, and we just felt like they could of cared less if we got up and left. After feeling like we've been there for thirty minutes, we finally get our food. I shared the corn beef hash with my sister. It was ok - I've had better corn beef hash elsewhere. The only reason I give this place two stars instead of one was their Belgian waffle. It was pretty yummy.

Come for the steak and eggs which are a glorious start to the morning. The french press coffee is a must. Amazing! The chilaquiles were pretty good too, but the eggs were pretty runny and Cristina ordered them over medium =(

I wanted to give this place 5 stars based on my meal, but I gotta say when you're waiting to be seated. It's kind of awkward. I mean usually someone will come up and be like "I'll be right with you, Sir." Here, you kind of just wait lol. When they get your name, there's usually tons of empty booths, but it takes a few minutes for them to get set up. I'm looking for things to complain about now, but it's really a non-issue!

Definitely a great place for some steak and eggs.

Delicious fresh juices ! The French toast is amazing . Even just the half order is a lot for a great price. The staff is always nice and accommodating. My favorite new server is Ivan he gives great customer service . We will be back . Thanks Ivan
Our server, Krystie, was super awesome and knowledgeable.  Great food, terrific service and attention to detail.  Definitely a top notch breakfast place. Exceeded my expectations.

This is a great way to end a crazy weekend in Vegas. Best hangover-prepare for normalacy food. 

The food is great for the price too!

FOOD:
Standard breakfast foods. It's better than Denny's/IHOP and such. I try to come here to have their breakfast meals. SO GOOD. 

SERVICE:
Great. The people are in jammies and are attentive! 

DECOR: 
Very cute! Umbrellas and pajamas. 

WAIT:
You will wait on Sunday mornings.

PARKING:
Tons, free, lot

PRICE: 
Like Denny's... you get your bang for your buck.

What a great spot! I had the three little pigs on an everything bagel. It was huge! Ha browns were crispy.
Vannesa our waitress was so friendly and extra sweet! My wife ordered french toast (crispy cinnamon) yummy :p
All the food on everyone else's table looked great too. If I lived in Vegas we would come back here more!!! Until next time ;)

I was on the border of 2 or 3 stars for this place. Reading the menu online I was looking forward to coming in. 

To preface this review, the food was good. And you get a lot of it. Customer service was...meehhhhh.

THE REVIEW: I ordered the steak and eggs bagel. The steak was cooked great, the bacon was good, and the amount of food was insane. I ordered it with a side of fries. I was munching away, actually rather enjoying my bagel sandwich, when I was unpleasantly surprised by a sharp poke in my mouth. I had bitten into a toothpick that had been left in the steak. The toothpick had been used to hold the filet medallion inside the wrapped bacon. Now, I wasn't seriously injured, but it was an unpleasant sensation at the very least. I informed the waitress who apologized, and about 5 minutes later a man (whom I take it was a chef) came out and apologized. We get the bill of $34 for our breakfast, which surprised me. I have always been under the impression that when your food isn't cooked/presented appropriately (which I would consider foreign objects left in my food "not cooked/presented appropriately"), that you never charge the customer for that item. I was definitely disappointed with this, but neglected to argue or contest this. To me it should have been up to the management to make that decision on their own, and it will most definitely influence my decision in the future as to whether or not to patronize this establishment again.

Would I come here again? Probably not.
Would I recommend this place to others? Possibly. Have not decided yet.

If a breakfast spot calls themselves "A steak and eggs place," they'd better have some bomb ass steak and eggs. These guys do.

Cool, colorful atmosphere with employee's in their cute pajamas. I probably wouldn't mind working here just because of that.

I always get the ultimate ribeye plate with a pot of bread. Can't go wrong there at all. Their caramel iced coffee is good too.

Service is always good, but you'll definitely have a wait on weekends. I like to do Monday meetings here to avoid the big crowds.

Came from San Diego and didn't want to eat in a hotel. By chance we came across Rise and Shine and it was was FANTASTIC! Great simple breakfast served beautifully, and hot. The waiteress are all very helpfull, friendly, and very cute in there "jammies" (bunny slippers would also be great). Service, food, atmosphere all A++. I will refuse to settle for runny eggs and swill from the hotels and will come to Rise and Shine every time we go to Vegas.
Great service good food would I go again YES.! Do I recommend this for others yes It's prices are inline with others

A solid 5 stars! 

How can people be so cheerful in the morning?

Amber was our stellar server!  She and the other staff wore cute pajamas and t-shirts with clever sayings!  They all greeted us warmly and checked up on us often!

The decor was so cute and fun! We enjoyed looking up at the floral parasols and tried  to figure out which ones were spinning and if there was some sort 2 pattern...

Food was great!  I cleared my plate of Salmon and Cream Cheese Omelette - so yummy!  And the Bread in the coffee cup was so fun and tasty, too!

We'll probably return if we are in Las Vegas again. It was such a pleasant experience with free parking, convenient location, and awesome food and service!

Had the "ultimate" steak n eggs as they call it... 
It wasn't the BEST I've had but good, it may need more flavor, it kinda had a burnt coal taste? Eggs n hash browns up to par, I ordered side of country gravy for my biscuit and it was a bit bland, needs more sausage grizzle in there or salt... Either way it should be savorrrrrrrry to the tongue....
Service good as usual... Lisa was very nice.
I will have to stay with the chicken fried steak as the winner here.... Next time it's flapjacks to try! 

C

It had been over a year since our last foray to Southern Highlands to dine at Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place.  Unfortunately, we experienced the same issues that had kept us away for so long; the ineptitude of the hostess staff.  We added our name to the list when we arrived and were given a 30 minute wait time.  At the 45 minute mark, I asked about our table and was told that there were still 8 parties ahead of us and that they were seating the larger parties first.  uh, okay...  I asked if we could sit at the counter and was told that the counter was part of the wait list, but it was empty.  At the 1 hour mark, I inquired again and was told that there were 4 parties ahead of us.  I asked again about the counter (now with one patron sitting there) and was told that it was closed today.  Weird  

Even though I was annoyed, I felt committed to stick it out after waiting so long.  We were finally seated after waiting an hour and 20 minutes, but only because two parties of 2 in front of us gave up and left.  Maybe they did not appreciate being told that larger parties were more important than they were. 

On to happier subjects:  The food!  

I ordered the Ultimate steak & egg breakfast: $12.95 for an 8oz Rib Eye, two eggs, and hash browns with the pot of bread.  The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare, the eggs and hash browns standard, and the pot of bread (basically a cinnamon roll) was good. solid 4/5  

The BF had the Fried Chicken & Waffle: $11.95 for a boneless chicken breast coated in buttermilk and fried sitting on top of a Belgian waffle.   I didn't try this, but was told that it was just okay. 3/5  

I also used the Chamucos Jalapeno Hot Sauce on my eggs and saw that it was made in Henderson.  The waitress noticed that I was reading the bottle and advised that they had bottles for sale for $6, so I scooped one of those up for home use!

I can't really say for sure if we'll ever go back, but I hope they work out their front of house issues.

Been here on 2 visits. The first one was 3 years ago or so and I recently came here because 2 of my friends raved about how good the chicken and waffles is. The first time I don't remember what I ordered but it was something from the steak and eggs side of the menu, wasn't really that good considering I can't remember what it was and it didn't bring me back. We had the pot of bread on both visits and yes it is good especially if you smother it with butter, but hey adding butter to anything makes it taste good. So the second visit my friend I shared the chicken and waffle. It was a huge piece of chicken breast on top of a waffle. The thing that stuck out to me was that the breading had a slight spice to it, very nice touch I must say.  I also like the fact they use a chicken breast which makes it easier to eat with a waffle and place both waffle and chicken on your fork. The is definitely a sharable portion as my friend and I were full afterwards.  It was pretty good, but nothing to make me drive all the way over here considering the location is all the way in Southern Highlands. One of my friend's who recommended it said it's better than Roscoe's chicken and waffles?! I've never had Roscoe's, but if Rise and Shine is a 3.5 in my book I can only wonder why people rave about Roscoe's?! If I wasn't too weight conscious I probably would of gotten a parfait as well. Our other friend ordered the red velvet pancakes and they said it was okay compared the pancakes at Baby Stacks.

My husband and I were highly recommended to Rise and Shine, and were excited to try it. We went today at 12:30, after a short wait we were seated. Waited 10 minutes or so to be acknowledged by waitress, then ordered....45 minutes later my husband called over the waitress and asked about our food. She keep apologizing but no food. I ordered a smoothie and my husband ordered a wrap. FINALLY, it arrived...wrong side for my husband and a lumpy smoothie. Highly disappointed and can not recommend. Will not be back!
I got the chilaquiles. It was good. I love the decor and the concept. Will be back again -after playing at south point :)

The chilaquiles might be the greatest breakfast I've ever had. I can't remember if it was just a special or if it was on the menu, but holy moly. There was a lot of food and I generally don't clear my plate at a breakfast place, but this was amazing. A must try!
Very cute place. The staff is always very fiendly. The food is delicious and a little different than regular breakfast places. It's always a treat for my spouse and I to go. Always left satisfied.

I like to give some credit where credit is due. But, there's not one thing that impressed me or even remotely satisfied me about this place. 

To say that I'll never come back is an understatement. I want the 2.5 hours of my life back with it. We arrived at 950 and were given a 15 minutes wait time, we were sat at 1041. That's right,  almost 50 minutes later. The only reason we waited was because of the great reviews. I'm willing to give some time for something delicious without a problem. Again, it was a Sunday, so a wait is expected, but I counted 3 groups before us who I overheard complain of the wait. ..one waited close to an hour! If my meal had been mildly satisfying I wouldn't be giving 1 star.

By the time we were sat, we were crazy hungry. So, you would think that because we were starving ANYTHING would taste like heaven!  There were 5 of us, and 2 ordered two meal options to share, so we ordered 7 different things. I don't even remember how long the food took, but it definitely wasn't a reasonable amount. I'll start by saying 2 ordered ribeye option and we left half of it on our plate.  I've never had such disappointing ribeye in my life. And my father who never complains, commented on the quality. I don't remember what came on the side with it because everything on that plate was a total dissapointment. The burrito my boyfriend ordered was pretty to look at, but even with the handful of ingredients was nothing but a bland mess. We get a "dessert" pancake that we had one bite of and didn't take home, which we always do because I hate wasting food but there was no saving that thing to eat later. 

Considering you pay about $11-16 per dish, I would think you get something well worth your money. I'm thinking now, their hope is to starve people with the wait in hopes they're so hungry at the end they just inhale everything and say it tasted delicious. 

Either way, don't take my word, eat here then drive down a bit further and try something else. There's a plethora of restaurants within a couple miles, some good, this one terrible. Also, please stop with the pajama uniform. It's not cute. I couldn't tell which waitress was awake and which rolled right out of bed. Some of those pajamas looked pretty gross. The staff looked more disheveled than the customers.

Tried this place for the first time today. The crunchy cinnamon french toast with hot, cinnamon maple syrup will change your life! And fresh squeezed OJ! Why have I not been here before?
My husband had steak and eggs and loved it. We will be back!
First time at Rise and Shine. The whole family LOVED it!  Lorell is a fabulous server. SO nice and efficient. A definite asset to Rise and Shine. Love the Bangers. We will be back!!

the best breakfast place in southern Highlands. been going here for years and have yet to be disappointed by the food or service.

I'm all about eggs benedict and the ham eggs benny is always on point. the ham is freshly sliced and not that cheap kind of boxed ham. I love the light balsamic drizzle they use on top to give it a kick to the taste. the seasoned home fries are also awesome.

if you like cinnamon rolls, you HAVE to try the pot of bread! it's freshly baked in house and served with sweet cream and butter. getting this is a must!

The food is good. Variety is sparse. Wish they had cottage cheese or apples or bananas as an alternative to potatoes. Not a lot of booths but so there is often a wait for seating. Tried it for lunch too as it is close to home tomato soup is very acidic and not very good, tastes like tomato paste.  Grilled Cheese was ok.
Oh my goodness...jammie wearing, smiling, friendly servers....a Cup of Bread....java.....delicious and now my new fave place

5 star for French pressed coffee and peanut butter and blueberry compote French toast.
4 star for service and cute bread in pot (but now that I tried, I won't wait for it next time)
3 star for the steak and egg. Our steak came out over cooked. Their saving grace is our server sent it back and brought out a much improved version
2 star for the over priced juice and milk in small glasses:(

I don't know if the cooks have changed or something but that last few times we've been here, the food quality has been OK at best. My wife and I moved over to mountains edge late last year and we use to eat here every weekend. I always got the chicken and waffles and it used to be great. The past few times the chicken has gotten smaller and oily and the waffle is thin and soggy. We are probably not going to go back for a while which I sad because we loved this place.

In Vegas, visiting family down here and so glad I picked to come here for breakfast. First of all the decor in the restaurant was so cute. We came here around 11am and didn't have to wait too long. The service was so nice. I decided to get the crispy chicken breast and waffle. It was soo delicious. The crispy chicken was just so perfect. With this meal, I had the option to pick toast, biscuit, or the pot of bread. I decided to get the biscuit because my cousin got the pot of bread for her breakfast. I would definitely come here again! Our server was really nice and gave us great service.

Arguably the worst service ive had in a long time. Didnt see our waiter for up to 25 minutes. The girl up front seating people had to step up and ended up doing more than our waiter. On top of that, our food was sitting under the heater for so long that everything dried out and got hard. Never coming here again.

Best chicken fried steak we had!  The chicken waffle is also very tender and they serve with warm maple syrup.  
Kids love their kids meal, kids' price but the portion is as huge as regular meals.
It is not too far away from the strip, worth to drive down here for a nice American breakfast.

Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!!!! The manager, Vanessa Lirette was wonderful, so accommodating and made our visit and trip to Rise and Shine one of the highlights of our vacation. She introduced us to menu items we loved, she spoke affectionately and passionately about her love for her job and her employer and her employees seem to respect, love and value her and the large team of employees were happy and seemed to work in harmony. Not something you often see in restaurant operations. She is a jewel and should be cloned!! and promoted!

The quality of the food is excellent, the presentation is wonderful and the portion is big and the "bread in a cup" is DIVINE. My girls wanted to keep ordering the "bread in a cup" - a wonderful sweet roll with a decadent cream cheese concoction on the side and I finally had to cut off the number of bread in a cup orders they wanted to eat!

The restaurant is spotless, with colorful and fun decorations and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an excellent meal, impeccable service and happy employees that don't roll their eyes when you receive the fifth cup of coffee so you can wash down too many to talk about bread in a cup orders!

I told our waitress, Christine, that based on the reviews, we had high expectations, and that they had exceeded them. Chicken fried steak: a New York strip. Unheard of, and I've seen a lot of chicken fried steak. Perfectly done, with just the right spice in the accompanying gravy, which came in two side porcelain cups. I'm happy with my fried steak covered & smothered but it made my wife and son happy as they are not into their food touching, and the serving size definitely is share-worthy. The bacon: perfectly finished, with a unique, slightly smoky flavor, and a side is 4 pieces, not 2 or 3. Cinnamon French toast: one of about 8 carb-centric breakfast options, each of which sounded incredible, but again, better than described or expected. My wife's favorite part was friendly Christine whose bright and positive attitude left us with all feeling happier about the day.  We will make a point to return!

Tried this place a second time to make sure it just wasn't what I had to eat. Had the chicken fried steak and gravy. Was a bit better, but still lacked greatness. The Chilaquiles and the French press coffee is still my favorite way to go! Great service with a smile.

This place is now my absolute favorite place. I went there this morning with my daughter and my best friend for the first time. We were greeted and sat immediately. We were served by Ashley who was amazing and went over the menu with us and recommended some delicious dishes. We ordered the chiliqulies ,red velvet pancakes, avocado and egg bagel sandwich and a omelette. The food was so delicious and so was the "go go" drink. I would definitely recommend this place and will for sure be going back frequently. I give this place and our server Ashley a 5 star review!!!! I also need to add I drove from Aliante to Southern Highlights and it was soooo worth the drive!

I was tempted to give 5 stars but there must always be room left for improvement.  Great little spot, a hidden gem in Southern Highlands.  I hope not too many people find out about this place as I hate waiting for my Monday morning table.  Keep up the great work!  

First times try either the Steak Benedict or the Chicken and Waffles.

*Quick note-  Avoid Sunday's at all cost, 1hr wait at times, plus folks bring in there screaming kids, that haven't been taught how to behave in public, which ruins the whole experience.

WOW!  What an awesome breakfast/lunch/brunch place!  They're only open for these three meals and close pretty early in the day (I think they close at 3:00pm).

Inside this simple exterior tucked in a strip mall you'll find some excellent food.  The inside is similarly simple but with a warm, comfortable feel.  There is a small outside patio area with tables they will setup for you with an umbrella to shield you from the desert sun.  This is ideal if you want to dine with your four legged friend.

The servers wear pajamas!  It's true!  What a fun little touch.  They seemed very friendly as well, and drinks were kept topped up.

The food was awesome.  I recommend their ultimate steak and eggs featuring two or three eggs, hash browns, steak, and a bread choice.  I went for scrambled eggs.  These were just OK; the consistency was kind of... solid.  Sort of like when you scoop them out of a hot tray at a buffet.  The hash browns were very good.  Crispy, crunchy, and actually seasoned instead of just salty.  The steak... wow!  I did not expect it to be such good quality.  It was marbled but not overly fatty, and it was tender and tasty.  I ate the whole thing, and I'm not even a huge steak fan!  Do yourself a favor and try the pot of bread choice.  Think of a small cinnamon roll served in a teacup and you'll get the idea.  It's just enough for a bit of sweetness without eating a huge cinnamon roll.  Given the quality and quantity of food it's a bargain at $14.95 ($16.95 with three eggs).

Rise and Shine was awesome!  Give it a try!
The spinach benny was absolutely phenomenal!!! And the hostess was absolutely amazing!  our sever Ashley gelato was so awesome!!
Super cute and cozy place! The wait staff all wear jammies and the ambiance was fun. The bread in a cup was delicious too!
My favorite breakfast spot in all of Las Vegas. Always fast service and a great menu. Never had a bad experience here.

If you're like me, breakfast is your favorite meal of the day. After my first visit here, I was hooked. I made it a point to plan the rest of my stay in Vegas around having breakfast at Rise & Shine. My wife and I found each experience to be more enjoyable than the last. 

The atmosphere is pleasant, the staff friendly and professional. You have the option of dining inside or outside. The place is patronized by many people, and you may very well have to wait to be seated, especially on the weekends. We were there when it seemed to be peak hour for business and we never waited more than 15 minutes.

The menu! It screams "breakfast", yet with many creative twist to otherwise conventional meals. Overall it's the perfect combination of quality and quantity. I had the Ultimate Steak Breakfast, oh so satisfying. A large ribeye steak, eggs, hash browns and choices of breads. All made to your liking of course. What really blew me away, was the Cinnamon Crunchy French Toast. My taste buds are still having a party (licking my lips).

A must try place in my opinion! It's hard to go wrong with a place that has people lined up to eat there!

I love this little hidden breakfast treasure. Clean and so tasty. All the food looks so pretty as it comes out and is huge portions while still being flavorful and fresh. They use to give everyone this amazing pot of bread with your meal and now it is extra so that makes me a little sad. The chicken fried steak is to die for, chicken and waffles is amazing too but it's that waffle that blows my tastebuds away. I'm not a waffle fan but this is the only waffle I've ever tasted that is moist, fluffy, and full of flavor. To top it off they make their own syrup with vanilla and cinnamon inside that make u keep it dripping for more. About $15 a person so not a cheap breakfast spot but you will have leftovers.

The ambiance was great and our server awesome.  It's cool to come in and see flowers hanging from the ceiling, you'll know what I mean when you see it.  The servers are dressed in PJ's, just a really cool, quaint place that isn't overly loud or overly quiet.  A great place to catch up with friends.  The servers are pretty awesome too.  Come check it out.

I was in the mood to try a new place for breakfast and I checked Yelp and found this place.  It's a good distance from where I live, but why not drive a little to get a great breakfast, and that's just what happened.

I like it so much when menus are posted online and I had already chosen the breakfast I was going to get.  When it came time to order, I took my server's recommendation and ordered the rib eye steak chilaquiles.  I chose the pot of bread instead of toast or biscuit.  The bread was good, but I wish it had more cinnamon.  That would have made it and outstanding breakfast accompaniment.

The main action was the spice rubbed rib eye steak--there was a small amount of rub flavoring--and it was done rare just the way I ordered it.  For the eggs, I got over easy which was put on top of the refried beans and chips of the chilaquiles.  The cotija cheese added so much flavor!  The eggs were topped with sliced avocado.  Very nice presentation.

My server, sorry I didn't note the name, was quite good.  The restaurant is not large and when I was leaving around 9:30, there was a wait for tables.  I think I'll go back sometime and get my original choice and compare the two!  I am glad I gave Rise & Shine a try!

Fun place, nice options for breakfast, great Lavazza Coffee (#1 Coffee in Italy), traditional breakfasts and health conscious options available.
Upbeat, cheerful staff offering great service.  Recommended.
No outdoors or pets allowed.

Best breakfast spot! My siblings and I use to come here all the time. 

Food is good. It's reasonably priced. The staff are friendly. Cute decor and the workers also wear pajamas lol. This place does get pretty busy tho.. considering they are only open until 3pm.

If you are in the Vegas area this is a must stop! To quote my husband, "This is the best breakfast I've ever had!". He had the chicken fried steak. My daughter had the buffalo chicken and she said it was very good. And that is coming from a very picky eater. The atmosphere was great also. Staff wear PJ's like they just got out of bed. I can't remember our servers name but her last name is Gene or Jean. She was great!

Service was GREAT! Food is delicious! This will be a go to place on our way out of Vegas. I wish this place was in California.  They have fresh squeezed juice(green go-go is delish), smoothies, french pressed coffee.  We had steak and eggs, cooked to perfection. The pot bread(dinner roll and cinnamon roll in a little ceramic cup) is a must.  So glad we tried it.

I am not a breakfast kind of girl and was not happy about going to a breakfast place when my husband told me about Rise and Shine.  So glad I did go tho!

I get the steak breakfast and it's awesome!  My picky kids like their food too!  It's a WIN for us.  We always ask for Colleen because she is totally sweet and takes the best care of us.  Did I mention that we are picky?!?!   LOL!

Can't wait to take my in-laws there when they come into town!

Wanted to like the place, I really did. Cute idea with the jammies and umbrellas. French Toast was good. But my sister ordered a burrito with NO MEAT and they put chorizo in it. When we asked if there was meat in it she said no, just chorizo. Ok so chorizo is what? And she says sausage.... ummm. So cool, I haven't eaten meat in 7 years until I tried her burrito. Sweet. The server felt kinda bad but maybe she should have an understanding of what is in their menu items. Lame.

Reminds me of the downtown coffee shop. The staff was friendly, the service fast, and the food good.  I'm a waffle person so I don't have anything special to rave about. Next time I may venture out into the menu. There are lots of choices. We'll be back. It's in the corner of the shopping center, surrounded by Yogurt, Italian, and Japanese.
