Arrived at 10:45 on Sunday for breakfast with my gal pal.  Surprised by the short wait.  We got a junky table right next to the open door with frigid gusts coming through.  We asked to be moved and were reseated in a nice booth within 5 minutes. Crisis averted.

Good coffee.  We just got the plain ole, plain ole instead of the french press, and it was good.

I decided, since the name says "a steak and egg place," I should probably order steak and eggs.  So, I ordered the "ultimate," a ribeye (my fave cut), 2 eggs, hashbrowns, and sourdough. $12.95.  The steak was cooked perfectly and nicely seasoned.   The hashbrowns were good.  A nice rustic style different from your average frozen shredded hashbrown.  Eggs were cooked perfect as well, just needed salt and pepper.  Easy to add. No complaints.

My gal pal ordered the steak and chilaquiles.  They were very tasty, and quite a portion! I cleverly coerced her into ordering the cinnamon bread so we could share.  It was good.  However; not sweet like I had anticipated.  

The restaurant is super cute.  Decor is charming.  Menu is cluttered and overwhelming.  The service was excellent.  Offered to refill our coffee 3-4 times, allowed us planty of time to chat.  Didn't rush us.

We had a lovely breakfast and I would go back anytime!  I would give it five stars if they had additional offerings such as lattes, cappucinos, bloody mary's and mimosas.  Necessary breakfast beverages in my book.

$33 for two coffees and 2two breakfasts.  $19 each with tip.

Absolutely love this place. Today was my first time and I don't know how I never knew about it! The atmosphere is very welcoming and the waiters/waitresses are extremely nice as well! Must try the chicken and waffles.... Country fries steak... And the pancakes(flakey and fluffy!!!) !  So good!!
Called for a carry out and waited on hold for over 15 min, hung up, tried to call back and the line was busy for over 30 min. Would love to try the place but as of now can't get through.

I drove over here from the southpoint so i didnt need to eat their nasty buffet, I was happy to see a regular restaurant without smoking or gambling... they also have these amazing cinnamon rolls that come in a cup. what a good idea they are delicious.

Wonderful choice on our way into Vegas for the weekend. Wait was about 20 min, not too bad. We had Crispy Chicken Bagel, Chicken and Waffles, Chiliquiles and Chicken Fried Steak. Everything was great! Wish we had this back in San Diego! Can't wait to go back!  Customer service was outstanding!

Ordered food for pick up and once I got there I had to wait 20 minutes to get my food. The service was slow, the manager was rude. I guess people that eat there are more important. I walk in and there's only 1 person at the cashier. I politely wait but the cashier was trying to save all the papers from flying(the workers would open the side door and the receipts would fly everywhere) then 3 people get in line and the manger tell me to go behind them. But I got there before them?!! That's not fair. I pay and the cashier says have a nice day. I tell him, "where's my food?" I loved waiting 20 extra minutes to get my foodlol...just kidding. Oh and you should see the $2.50 I got charged for a side of strawberries. If you don't believe me, look at the picture I posted on yelp. The service gets worse every time I come.  Not coming back.

Awesome breakfast place.... nice decor and Lavazza coffee! The breading on chicken fried steak was perfectly seasoned and it was nice to automatically have gravy on the side to prevent the steak from getting mushy. Salivating just thinking of the food again!

The BEST chicken and waffles I've ever had. Definitely better than Roscoes. The buffalo chicken and eggs were awesome too. My family and I went to Rise & Shine two consecutive mornings because it was just that good.
The cinnamon crunch French toast was amazing.  My wife had lox and Salmon omelet (keto friendly) was fantastic. If your in the area it's a must try.

Great local place for breakfast. I ordered the Country Fried Steak and Eggs and it was phenomenal. The rest of my family got chicken and waffles and the bananas foster waffles and they enjoyed them just as much as I did. Great service and great coffee as well. Excited to go back again real soon!
It is awesome to have a Rise and Shine in Henderson, NV, excellent steak and eggs and the pot of bread is delicious. They have fresh squeezed juices and fresh brewed hot coffee.

We have been to rise n shine four times.  At first, we were excited to have a neighborhood place near our house.  Our first experience was good - food was delish and the server was attentive.  

The second time, we waited in line for 20 mins, then waited another 20 mins for someone to help us, then waited another 20 mins for coffee before we walked out.  

Third time, we managed to get sat, again the server was inattentive (waited a long time to get drinks) and got our very slowly made order wrong (my husband always orders eggs over hard, with emphasis and they came back runny).  

Today, we decided to give it another shot, and were seated next to a woman who was talking on her speakerphone.  It made an already loud cafe unbearable.  Management should have asked the woman to step outside for her call.  We walked out and the hostess was unapologetic and a little snippy.

We will not be going back for another try.

Every time we come to Vegas we are always looking for great breakfast spots off the strip. This place doesn't disappoint.  I ordered the Ultimate Steak and Eggs and it was delicious.  Ribeye was a generous portion cooked perfectly, hash browns where seasoned well.  I started off with the pot of bread and it was decent.  Decor is very nice and the waitresses wear pajamas.  The service was excellent as well.  The only drawbacks were that the water cups were dirty and the tables were not leveled so they were rocking back and forth quite a bid.  Overall I would definitely recommend and come back.

Cool breakfast spot in Southern Highlands! Everyone is nice and the PJ's are a great touch. Good food, tastes fresh, great for families and children. Request Amanda, she is friendly and polite! Great service! Definitely one of my favorite places to eat.
Love this place.  Try the red velvet pancakes-they are awesome.  Great omelets too. Service is prompt and courteous

The corned beef hash was edible, but I would not order it again. 

The pot of bread is worth every penny as well as the fresh squeezed OJ. 

The coffee is acceptable, but not great.

This is my second time here and I am still so amazed on everything about this location place. Amazing food and the staff is so friendly and you can really tell how well they all work together. I highly recommend this place! And the banana pineapple smoothies are the shizzz nizzz

Great food and service!!!  Amber is out favorite server always with a smile and good food!!! Had the red velvet  pancakes that come highly recommended they were fantastic. Can't wait to go back next month!

The servers wearing pajamas is original and the french press coffee is a refreshing option for this side of town.

We had high hopes for this restaurant, but unfortunately the menu serves up cheap ingredients to its patrons (for the exception of the Illy coffee) and the cooks fall short on preparing food properly.  

At a price point of $10-$15 for breakfast, they should know how to cook eggs properly.  Nothing irritates us more than when a cook makes two cheap/small eggs (over medium)  together on an extremely high heat using a bright yellow colored fat  (margarine?).  The plate was loaded with what appeared to be nasty refined margarine or oil.  I soaked up two napkins full of this nasty stuff.  We were delivered two rounds of this type of cooking and just gave up.  The hash browns that we ordered as golden (as opposed to raw in oil) were flash fried.  Disgusting and half hearted presentation.  Seriously, Robert Irvine would have hit the roof if he was ever served this food.  

We also ordered  pancakes that were loaded with artificial vanilla extract.  I've tasted better frozen pancakes than the chemical cakes cakes served at this restaurant.
Sorry but it's true. Very disappointing.

If money is no object and you don't care about what's in the food that you put into your body, this is your place.

If you really want to have a top shelf breakfast with amazing ingredients, visit EAT downtown.  It is so worth the drive and your body will thank you for it.
So yummy! Cup o bread was so good and not overly sweet. Chill and laid back location...love the pajamas!
We drove from Los Angeles and we were yelping for a good breakfast spot. We came across this place and it was delicious. Everything we had tasted great!! Will definitely come here again when in town.

Great place for breakfast! Love the "bread in a cup" which is actually a cinnamon roll baked in cup with frosting on the side! TO DIE FOR! My favorite breakfast is the ham and eggs Benedict, what makes this special is the drizzle of balsamic on the hollandaise sauce, perfect poached eggs. Sliced ham instead of Canadian bacon! Awesome! My friend had other things and cleaned their plates!
Will be back, Maria is the one who helped me decide on the bread in a cup and I'm so glad she did! Great service! Thanks Maria!
I love this place for breakfast. I keep getting their french toast. The syrup is just so good and the coffee is amazing. :)
Good food, just a little expensive.  Almost as much as the prices on the strip.  Sitting on the weekend is a little tight, nice and clean place.

Yummmm!
Breakfast here was absolutely delightful. The restaurant is cute because they have sunflowers on the ceiling and the servers are dressed in pjs, which makes it the perfect lighthearted and pleasant place to eat breakfast.

The pancakes were great!

The bread in a cup was delicious!

The orange juice was so fresh!

Terrific place opened up a few months ago for breakfast/brunch.  The food is delicious and plentiful and reasonably priced.  We have eaten there several times now and have not been disappointed.   There is something for every palate on the menu from voracious meat eater to vegan.   Service is excellent. Today Maria was a star holding down the fort almost single handedly and taking good care of our 3 person table.

The menu is extensive and full of tasty choices.  I've eaten the Salmon Bagel (egg, spinach, salmon, cream cheese, capers, onion on The Works bagel) with outrageous french fries.  We ordered watermelon strawberry juice - squeezed fresh. Pancakes that melted in your mouth. Benedict that sat ontop of a hunk of perfectly cooked thick and juicy steak. 

Service is attentive, engaged, courteous and funny as the waiters wear their favorite pajamas taking and delivering one's orders.  The seating is comfortable and the decor is light and happy feeling.  Shirts and other merchandise that will bring a smile to your face is available for sale as well.   Rise & Shine has become one of our "go-to" breakfast and brunch restaurants.   It is hidden away in a small "strip mall" area, but well worth discovering.  We commend Rise & Shine to you - you won't be disappointed.

Just due to the cleanliness could be better come on this place rocks breakfast and service but if that Fifth star I know breakfast places are busy, we've owned one but first impressions??? Ya know, defiantly a staple morning spot and I love the service and speed. Just buss a little betters all I'm saying

Must have - pot of bread and the French press coffee. Food is always tasty, service leaves a little bit to be desired. Think the service in pajamas makes the experience a little too casual. Go with patience as there will be a wait on weekend mornings!

This was a pretty good restaurant. Portions were very large and offered a good value. Everything tasted good, but not great. The waffle was the best thing we ordered. The chilaquiles were decent, but we've definitely had better.

New fave breakfast spot!!!! Steak and eggs, pancakes, French toast, bagel and lox, biscuits and gravy, breakfast burrito, Bloody Mary w/ bacon?! Whatever you want, they've got it AND YUM!!!! Amazing service from all. Maria, Sharon, and Lauren are awe-mazing. Atmosphere is friendly, a great way to start any day!!!!

After reading about the wait most people have at Babycakes Cafe I decided to give another breakfast place a try (I'll try Babycakes one day...). So I Yelped a spot and was instantly intrigued by Rise and Shine. It was the location-not far from where I live- and those darn cute flower umbrellas that they have hanging from their ceiling.
It was busy but with a ten minute wait on a Sunday Morning I'm not complaining....The flower umbrellas were so cute and everytime the door opened the air spinned some of them around-Whimsical I tell ya!!!
Anyways, I did also enjoy all the mosaics on the walls as well-Artsie!!!

The food= An option for bread is a cinnamon bread baked in a flower pot with a knife stabbed in the top served with butter and strawberry jam. Let me tell ya one is not enough- It was so good but I wish those flower pots were fatter for more darn warm yummy bread. Cute idea though...
I loved reading that the Chicken in the Chicken and Waffles was a chicken breast-YAY!!!!!! So I picked that and it was really good. The breading was pretty tasty and spicy as well and the chicken breast was pounded flat so you got a pretty big piece. My daughter got a short stack of pancakes-So fluffy and good too...Now on to the grumpy BF who already was having attitude-He got eggs,hash browns and bacon-He was not impressed and hated his bacon-Oh well, so sad....I tried his food and it was fine he is just too particular about his bacon but like I told him thats why you have a voice use it and request what you like!!!
I will be back and the BF can wait in the car....

On December 8 we came in at 2 o'clock. 

Expectations were extremely high as I have heard of this place for years and their pot of bread is infamous in this area of town. 
We felt neglected by our server as we had to ask Passer- by servers for silverware and refills. 

My wife ordered the biscuits and gravy with Hash Browns lightly cooked and they came burnt. I like crunchy and dark, but they were burnt. 
She also asked for hot cocoa to be X X X HOT, came out hot,  Maybe it's a legal issue, wish they would've microwave that. 

My waffle had excellent flavor just a little mushy, but the biggest disappointment of the whole meal was
The pot of bread had been sitting on the shelf for a while, and we watched the server take it from the shelf to the kitchen and microwave it. You know how bread gets chewy after the microwave; that's what it tasted like!   I would've rather had it at room temperature.  Very Disappointing. 

The server did without hesitation refund the money for the biscuits and gravy and the bread. I truly want to believe this was a server issue and not a restaurant issue, the problem was our Extremely high expectations.

Delicious food that is worth the long wait. We have tried everything from pancakes to biscuits and gravy and their dishes have all been winners. 

Check out the cute little gift shop. Fun stuff!

Also, there is a fresh juice bar. Yum!
We tried this breakfast place finally and we all are highly impressed!! The food was actually pretty good!! I highly recommend to try their freshly squeezed juices!

This restaurant is on a downhill path and they need to fix it. Based on the recent reviews and my recent experience everyone seems to agree. The wait time are out of control. Really waiting over an hour for breakfast!  The wait times are caused from poor table management. There is no sense of urgency. Tables are left dirty, servers are not moving the flow and customers are left waiting.

This was a very disappointing experience

We just ate at Rise and Shine for the first time. We plan to make it a regular stop. All 7 of us loved the food. The pancakes were incredible. Same with the steak omelette. Our server, Maria was friendly and helpful.

Went here for breakfast this morning. Will NOT be going back. The food was very good and the service/staff was amazing. But breakfast for 2 adults and a 1 1/2 year old was $50.00!!!!!!! Unbelievable!!!! Belgium waffle the thickness of about 2 pancakes was $8.00 and to add maybe HALF a banana was $2.00. Omelette was $8.50 and to make it with egg whites and add bell peppers was $5.00!!!!! And the bell peppers were MISSING and there was very little egg. Babies food was 1 pancake, 2 eggs and 2 pieces of bacon for $6.00. Not bad. That's about average. Again, the food is amazing. But the price is WAY to much for the little that you get. Will drive all the way to Jamm's for something almost as good and A LOT more food for a reasonable price (even with paying for gas we will be ahead of the game).

My husband, son and two friends flew into Vegas Sunday night.  We had a hard time trying to find food late and had to settle for a wing joint.  I opted not to have any food there and so by morning, I was starving.  Looked on Yelp and found this place.

Really cute decor and wait staff in PJ's,, very charming.  We had an excellent waitress that took very good care of us, always very attentive.  I would say the table ordered just about every type of breakfast for the table.  From pancakes, omelets, oatmeal, bacon/eggs and potatoes.  Everything was delicious and filling.  My meal came with the pot of bread which I loved.  Half cinnamon roll and half dinner roll.  Yummy, although is wish it was bigger.

My only negative is that I was a little pricey.  This place is in a shopping plaza not anywhere near the strip (which was our intention).  I felt I was a bit expensive for what I perceived to be a local place to dine.  Since we did eat late for breakfast we were good until, dinner, no lunch required!  Very filling!

If you want to splurge order the fresh squeezed OJ.  Pricey at $3.25 a glass but tasted fresh and it was fabulous!

This place is nice. It doesn't feel like how you see it from the outside. When you get in you already feel comfortable. It is clean and most of all we had a very friendly server - Lisa. Each of us tried something different and everyone were pretty satisfied with what they had. Overall it was a great atmosphere, great food and great experience. We will definitely go back again.

Was kind of disappointed that they had run out of corn beef hash at 10:15 so I had to order something else. But I ordered the build your own omelet and it was great! Also their old fashioned pancakes were great. Very family-oriented. The wait for my food felt like forever though, but it was probably because I was really hungry haha. I got my food like 30mins later so idk if that's typical.

Yes, I'm a fan...As we walked in I noticed the worker wearing pajamas which I thought was different and cool at the same time...The menu was can be a bit overwhelming at first, but thanks to our server who was so kind to go the menu, which made it easier to narrow the selection down. A must to order cup-of-bread and be sure to eat while it still nice and warm.

The food is adequate for the price, not worth waiting more than four minutes for a table though.  GIven the service, you might be better off grabbing grub from the supermarket and/or starbucks across the parking lot.

The service falls squarely in the I-have-more-important-things-to-do-so-just-deal-with-waiting-and-be-happy-when-I-eventually-pay-enough-attention-to-you-to-drop-the-check category.

Three visits: cumulative duration of 90 minutes
 - I ordered coffee immediately each time when the waitress finally found a moment to greet me, total pricetag: $8
 - I drain my mug immediately - in 3-5 minutes.
 - I spent a total of 70 minutes with a totally empty mug on my table
 - to make a point on the final visit, I left the mug overhanging the far/waitresss-side of the table
 - On 2/3 visits the mug finally got refilled when they dropped the check - the definition of a minimal effort at service
 - On the final visit, no refill at all.

Best breakfast spot in southern highlands. Fresh food, decent service depending on how busy it is but the fact that the food is amazing makes up for the mediocre service. Its hit and miss with service I have been there 10 times or so and I have had good and bad service but always amazing food. Its a way better ihop or dennys is the best way to describe it. My family and I always come here for breakfast. Its way better quality than dennys or ihop. Becareful going to late because it can get very busy. My family and I go early so its usually never too busy.

This was our first time here. We usually go to the other rise and shine. Our server was MARIA! She was so friendly and awesome server.  We got our food right away. And it was perfect and delicious. We will definitely come back soon

It's my second time here, and I think everything is delicious. The blueberry pancakes are fluffy and buttery to perfection, and the eggs Benedict is absolutely divine. 

The service is good, but it's definitely an area for improvement. They're quick, but a few times the waitress forgot my order and didn't refill our drinks. Overall, I'd say this place is a thumbs up.

Maria's service was impeccable!! Everything was delicious!!!! Mimosas on a Saturday morning is the way to start!!! Be back soon!!!  I would love to go to work in my pajamas!!! Everyone was really nice!!!

This was our second time coming here. It is a bit unique as everyone knows that the wait staff wears pajamas. Okay, that is cute. The upside down umbrellas hanging from the ceiling are cute and colorful. 

We decided to split a Steak and Chorizo burrito and Corned Beef Hash. Our waitress was really nice, and brought waters to the table before we even placed our order. 

The burrito was huge and looked amazing. We cut into it and began eating. The steak was perfectly cooked at medium-rare. The more we ate though, we did not find any chorizo. There were eggs, but no chorizo. We figured that maybe we got the wrong order, but I didn't see any other steak breakfast burrito on the menu. So that was a bummer. it was still tasty, but not what we were looking forward to having. The Corned Beef Hash was good. It was seasoned differently than any other we have had up to this point, and because of this it kind of threw us off somehow. 

It was very loud in here for breakfast. The entrance is very awkward and cramped as well. Immediately inside the door there are benches on either side. There is nowhere to stand, only to sit. While paying, people are coming in and being led to their seats. I went to wait outside because I was constantly having to move out the way of incoming customers and the wait staff. Behind the register is the door that leads out to the patio. It is just a very small area, with a lot going on all at once.

Although the food was decent, the experience itself was just okay.

As good as it gets in Vegas for breakfast!  Breakfast joints in Vegas are hard to find let alone good ones especially of the strip, so when I found this place a little over a year ago I was pleasantly surprised!  (They only serve breakfast and lunch here, by the way)
Simply put, EVERYTHING is GREAT here!  
I recommend this place all the time!
Two thumbs up!
Customer service was amazing! The food was pretty good. I wish I would have ordered the red velvet pancakes though.
Piss poor management when you only have TWO servers on a national holiday...line out the door...and you tell us its only a 20 minute wait.  Crock o shit

This could be a 5 if not for our server, Amber.  We found this restaurant on Yelp, and with the near ease of our Navigation system, managed our way to the restaurant.  We were seated almost immediately, which was great since about 20 people showed up in the next 15 minutes or so.  After waiting far too long to be greeted at our table, I walked up and asked the hostess if there was someone assigned to our table.  She said yes, and that she would go find her.  She returned in just a couple of minutes to say that the server must be in the bathroom, and offered to get us started with coffee.  We told her that we were in a hurry to order because we were trying to get out of town and back home (who'da guessed we were in for a 6-1/2 hour traffic jam all the way back to San Diego) to our kids.  She suggested that she could take our breakfast order and get everything started until our server was able.  And she did.  Amber appeared on scene a few minutes later.  We knew it was our server, because the hostess was going over our order with her, and because we hadn't seen her before.  She was either sick or just unhappy to be there, and her demeanor when she did finally come to our table reflected that.  Her energy, or lack thereof, was the counter balance to all the other busy bees.  In fact, she even dropped one of the pots of bread on an adjacent table.  Our food was served by another server - who we are guessing was either the owner or manager.  She was extremely pleasant, and the food was delicious.  We asked Amber for our check - again, because we were trying to get out quickly - and it took her several minutes to drop it.  I was just about to go up to the hostess stand to request it when she dropped it on the table.  When she noticed I already had cash in my hand, Amber did offer to go to the register and cash it out for us.  We didn't take her up on it, but that was something.  I would have just liked to have seen some degree of service before we were on our way out the door.  This was our first trip to Las Vegas in more than 10 years, so it's unlikely that we will be going back soon.  But if we were in town again, I would absolutely return for breakfast.  The food was delicious, and with the exception of our one service experience, everyone else seemed very accommodating.

If you are not a local and you rely on taxi to get around, then you might be better off renting a vehicle for the day. If you stay at the Mirage hotel, parking is free. Otherwise, you will come off the pockets for taxi because it is off the beaten path from the strip. 

We waited for a good 39 min (which is a good sign) and glad we did because the red velvet pancakes were delicious!!!!! Comes with 4 pancakes so it is a shareable plate. The breading on the chicken (chix & waffle) was sweet. 

If you don't have a microwave in your hotel room, the pancakes still taste amazing without heating it up.

I'm from California and love going to breakfast places. The food was amazing, it has flavor! Our waitress was kind and funny. The only reason I don't give this restaurant a 5, is because it took them almost 30 mins to get my food.

Best breakfast brunch place!  Their chicken and waffles is to die for, and I love decor and service (who wear cute pajama uniforms). It's like a modern diner feel, and everyone is so friendly. Get their early because by 8:30am it starts getting pack!
This is our go to place for breakfast in Vegas. Love the service, love the food! Chill relaxed environment!  Our top pick for breakfast!

This is a great breakfast and brunch place, with cool decor and friendly staff. On Sunday afternoon around 1pm, my fianc√© and I were in the mood for some breakfast, so we decided to try this place.

The food was delicious and it didn't take long after we ordered to receive our food. We both ordered the massive chicken and waffle. I also ordered a side of potatoes and he had a side of biscuits and gravy.

I liked how the maple syrup had two or three sticks of cinnamon inside, and the great choices to choose from on the menu.

When I have visitors in town, I am defiantly bringing them here for breakfast.

This place has a great atmosphere! The waitresses wear pajamas and they sell funny shirts and socks in the front. Also the decor is definitely original. The food is absolutely amazing. The steak is tender and cooked well. No complaints here, I'll definitely be coming here again soon!

Absolutely nothing for people lactose intolerant or non meat eaters. Super unhelpful staff trying to find something, anything on the menu to eat. Super expensive to get a 1/8 cup of strawberries for 2.50. Overall terrible experience.

First and last visit nothing to come back for.
The coffee is bitter the hasbrowns are soaked in grease 30 min wait with tables available for the entire hour I was there. I can get this poor quality anywhere.

We really wanted to like this place after seeing all the good reviews, but sadly this was not the case. 3 of us went today for breakfast-1 got the Cinnamon crusted french toast,which was gross tasting-1-got the Red Velvet pancakes-those were okay, had better- and 1 got the NY strip steak and eggs, the steak looked more like a rib eye that was super thin. If your going to say your a "steak & egg" place your meat should be better quality especially when you are charging $13.25. The first 2 cups of coffee were warm. The pot of bread was okay-too much of a yeast taste for me. Service was okay, even though our waitress got our order mixed up with the table next to us-which might explain why the steak was not right. For 3 of us it cost over $40 for breakfast-definitely was not worth it. Save your money and go elsewhere.

Better bring an extra shirt for breakfast because this place is deeeeeeeeelicious.
Great service, all you can drink coffee, comfy seating!

We love this breakfast place! We eat here every weekend. The food is consistently tasty. Everybody is friendly. The servers wear pj's and are friendly and efficient! The host, hostess, and cashier are nice! The upside down spinning umbrellas are super cute! We try to get in before the lines start (after 10:00 AM). Our only complaints are there are (1) only 2 bathrooms for such a big restaurant, (2) it can get a little noisy with the radio on a high volume in the kitchen, and (3) the location of the register is a little awkward when checking out. It is right next to the door and is a combination register/hostess desk. So, when it gets busy and a line starts forming for incoming new customers and the exiting customers checking out, it gets a little hectic and jammed. They've recently expanded, and could possibly put the register and exit at the new door. This way the entrance (main door) is just for the hostess and the exiting door could be designated as the register/checking out area.

I think we found our Vegas morning spot! Red Velvet pancakes were insane! Only drawback being that the whip cream wasn't homemade, but from a can. Be what can you expect at that price? Great service as well.

I was hoping this place would be good but sadly no. My omelette was very runny, my husbands breakfast sandwich was very small and flavorless. Nothing special about this place and overpriced. Go to Egg Works instead.

oOoOoh so good!

My son and I split the bacon wrapped filet w/ egg and cheddar cheese. I'm not a big meat eater but I sure did enjoy myself when I ate this plate of goodness!

Lots of flavor and nice atmosphere. We've returned twice since this particular visit. Try it, you'll like it ;)

I would recommend this restaurant. The service was very good. Our waitress, Laura is an adorable brunette , very personable and very efficient. She had us in absolute stitches .Our food was very good, price was fair. The restaurant itself is cute, as far as atmosphere goes.  I'd come back if she was working.
FRESH SQUEEZED orange juice, great selection of food, get the "cup of bread" for your side. If you hate Ihop and Denny's you'll LOVE IT HERE!

Our party of 2 arrived Sunday morning around 10 AM. We were told 20 mins for a table and got our table exactly 20 mins later. 

Service was ok, not overly attentive but there when it was needed. 

Had the Texas French toast  and chicken and waffles, both were just ok and average. 

For the price and service it was all just ok.

Their orange juice is freshly squeezed, thats one of the things I really liked about them. The restaurant has a cute theme, the pink flowers in the ceiling were rotating. The staff are all wearing jammies lol 

The restaurant is clean except for a few tables that weren't cleaned, probably because they didnt have enough people for that big place.

I'm not one to complain- but the service sucked. Also, they had 3 wifi connections and they cant even share it. Lol food is ok, nothing really special about it. We had corned beef hash and biscuits and gravy. Maybe next time I'll try their steak and eggs.
1st timers here. Food was excellent. Best toast ever. Laura our sever was outstanding and friendly. Always checked up on us. Great experience!

Great find.  On our way out to Zion and stopped off the freeway and found this gem.  Lots of healthy options and incredibly sized portions. Vanessa was attentive and nice and very helpful. The cooks in the back that you could see were doing a great job throwing it down and not taking any shortcuts. Will definitely come here again the next time we drive through.

GREAT breakfast,  and the pressed coffee is wonderful.  

We come from southern California,  and always have breakfast at Rise and Shine.  Best in Vegas

My go-to breakfast place! I love the Bagel Sandwiches, they are huge, so it'll probably be your breakfast and lunch. Also, the Cinnamon French toast Crunch is the bomb! I get a half plate of that and make a platter with some eggs, so I'm not too sugar-carbed out for the day.

Noise level is decent as long as they keep the radio down a bit. When it's too loud, the patrons get louder to talk over it... it's a never ending cycle. But it's very RARELY too loud, maybe 1 in 20 visits :P Only brought this up after going through the survey questions.

Also, would love to see them move the checkout register over to the door in the new wing to keep the Check-in crowd and check out crowd sperate. But it's worth the line, even if they don't. :)

I was trying to find a reason to give this place less than 5 stars, and I couldn't! (It's Nov 17, and they already have Christmas music playing. I love that sort of thing, but maybe those who think it's too early for all this festive cheer may dock a star.)

Shannon our server was so sweet!!  Almost as sweet as the freshly squeezed OJ. (You have to get a glass of this stuff!!)

We ordered the biscuits and gravy, which tasted great!  The biscuits weren't too doughy, and they were covered in that quintessential Midwestern gravy.

Also had the double fisted crispy chicken bagel sandwich.  They weren't kidding when they named this thing. It was giant, with a tender piece of friend chicken, scrambled eggs, melted provolone, spinach, AND bacon!!! I got it on an everything bagel. 

If you want a satisfying and flavorful breakfast off the strip, this is your place.

Today was a Horrible Experience!!! We were not even served because our Service Dog (for none of the waitresses business) was told he's not a service dog!!! I will be telling everyone to not come here due to this!! I have 1.6 million followers on Instagram soo this is just a start!!! Not Veteran friendly

This place was delicious and fun. The servers were dressed in pajamas. I ordered the eggs Benedict with hash brown. It was yummy. Their coffee is great and it's a cute place to get breakfast. Portions are pretty big so I think it's shareable. Next time I'll come back in pajamas as well. Haha
Found this place on Yelp on our way home from Vegas.  So cute, great service and delicious food. Super fun menu.
Excellent service. Food is great. I had the ham and eggs Benedict. Hash browns are very good too.

I've been coming here since they opened and I must say today SUCKED!!! The only positive thing is that the food came out fast. The servers look and talk unprofessional and extremely unkept. I didn't get offered anything as my side besides hash browns no fruit or anything. Didn't get checked on the entire time I was eating. I'm just mad cause they jacked up their prices so much I expect better service not worse service.

While I gather their food is good it is still just breakfast. You can make most of what they sell in your own kitchen for a 10th of the cost. 

Nice restaurant decent food but the prices are way too high. 

Me my wife and 2 boys. Almost $70!!
Cute place always busy.  Always our pick when we have a large group, very big menu everything comes out fast!   Wish they would have more vegan choices tho

I thought I had a great CFS yesterday and I did, but today I had an even better one at Rise & Shine.  The steak's breaking was very flakey and light.  Not too heavy.  The gravy was served on the side with the eggs sunny up on the steak and hash browns.  The steak looked nice and crispy without the gravy smothering it.  The hash was crispy and the portions are huge.  They also serve French pressed coffee, but I brought my own Starbucks.  I think next time, I'll try their French press coffee.  They also have a thing called bread in a pot as a substitute for toast.  It's literally some bread in a flower pot.  It's combo of various breads/rolls.  I opted for the plain biscuit which was very good, but small in comparison to what you get in a bread pot.  I didn't finish my meal, so the biscuit was just fine.  The only complaint I could have is the sunny up eggs had a bit too much raw whites, but that's okay. It's just more gravy for the hash browns when mixed with the yolk.  I would rank this CFS right up there with Maple Tree.

This place is awesomeness in its entirety, minus it's tucked away. That could be a good thing though. The decor is delightful (pics to follow) and the staff is wonderful! Usually they have a wait but today people must be bbqing. One thing that stands out
about this cafe as opposed to others is that it's family owned & run and they wear pajamas while serving you. Love it! Riley was a fantastic server. She was helpful with suggestions and a joy to have. I'm a fan, this place is consistently on point. If you're in the southwest side of town, you must give them a try. Definitely in Vegas' top brunch spots!

Had the ultimate steak breakfast.  Ribeye, eggs, and hashbrowns. It was very good. The steak wasnt as fatty as I usually like when I grill myself, but still very good. The hashbrowns and eggs were awesome. Fresh squeezed oj was great.

Henderson just can't get enough brunch spots. They have been popping up like crazy over the last couple of years and I love it.

We stopped in around noon on a Saturday and to our surprise there was no wait for a table. Our waitress was over quickly to greet us and take our orders. She was friendly and continued to check in us during our meal.

The Pot of Bread sounded intriguing so we shared that to start. It is a combination of a cinnamon roll and a roll. The combination of a sweet and a non-sweet is perfect. The frosting to go on top was delicious. 

I had the Spice-Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles. This was very good. Their presentation was like a deconstructed chilaquiles and while I wasn't a fan of the presentation I did love the flavor of everything. The steak had a great seasoning and enough fat to additionally flavor the steak. The chips also had a nice seasoning and the perfect amount of cheese coating them. 

My husband as always ordered the better of the two entrees, the Southern Style Chicken Fried NY Steak. The fried steak was perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. The gravy on top was delicious. I would definitely order this entr√©e on a return visit.

I've been to both locations; both are a great way to start the morning! Today I ordered the fancy steak omelette and tried the Lox Bagel special. The steak was cooked Med-Rare. I was very impressed by the Lox bagel, which has capers and perfectly cooked bacon. I also ordered a side of fruit, which was probably the most disappointing part of my meal (only because Mr. Mamas and Egg Works have such a good portion with no up charge.) I left very full and satisfied.

This place was such a delight, from the decor, food, and the service. Lisa was awesome. I felt like I was eating in her kitchen. The bread pot was delicious. They have the cutest lights that were daisy umbrellas. I would definitely come back. It was a lot of food I'm sad I didn't have a place to store and reheat my chilaquiles because I was staying in a hotel.

The food at this place was delicious! The portions were huge and the price was reasonable. Our server, Ashley (look for the girl with the pancake printed pajamas) was super friendly and very attentive. It was our first time there and she answered all of our questions and made recommendations. She made conversation with everyone at the table and made sure we had what we needed. I recommend coming here. Friendly staff and delicious food. Plus they have a variety of freshly squeezed juices.

First impressions lasting impressions.
The place is decorated whimsically with soothing colors and hanging umbrellas. 
The wait staff are wearing pajamas! ...very clever.
The wait on this particular Sunday morning was reasonable with a sunny outside patio.

The menu choices were abundant and varietal. 
I'm having pancakes "plattered" which adds 2 eggs, meat, and something else.

This place specializes in steak and eggs by the way, which my three companions ordered and took great delight in. I ran an obstacle marathon (Spartan Race) and am craving carbs something terrible.

Side note: this neighborhood is gorgeous, you'll notice all of the trees as soon as you are here; very beautiful.

Rise & Shine is very cute! The wait staff looks like they just rolled out of bed (they serve in pajama attire) and it adds to the overall charm and theme of this place. Interior decor is very cute as well.

Service was exceptional from the hostess to our server - no complaints here! 

Why 3 stars? 

Corn beef hash was a very small serving size and I've had better. The breakfast burrito was huge but tasted okay. One thing to note is that the retried beans were EXTRA salty. Maybe it was just a bad batch but it was horribly salty and the part of it that touched the burrito made my burrito super salty. I'm usually a fan of breakfast burritos so I was disappointed here. 

We got banana pancakes as well - this was delicious! The pancakes were the highlight of the meal, but otherwise the food was okay. 

Prices were a little on the high side in my opinion, especially for mediocre food (with the exception of banana pancakes).

My overall experience was good, but the food - I'm not sure if I'd come back because I didn't have anything that stood out.

Open up around the corner so I thought I'd try it. I know the food was excellent because I wasn't that hungry and I ate the eggs benedict in about 5 minutes. Delicious... the service was good the food even better the only negative thing it's a little pricey for breakfast. Too bad because I'd be here every day.
Food was so good! One of the best breakfast meals ... and the service was amazing ! Will definitely come by next time in Vegas
The flavors just did not work,  had to send back my bloody Mary,  was not good.  Had high hopes,  but will not return.

I come here rarely when I absolutely refuse to make my own eggs. I have eaten here several times, but the most recent one to date... I ordered a special egg white omelet with specific ingredients. I came about 35 minutes after I ordered the food. I was fine to eat the food... But they had thrown it away and offered to just make a new one no charge. I was very appreciative..(I just always have a fear of cooks doing something to the food in orders like these.) but I accepted and it was quite delicious. Maybe a little runny. But sizzling hot and I guess as good and as exciting as an egg white omelet can get.... 

One thing I'd like to note... I know it's 'their thing' to run around in their PJs. All the servers etc... But when I come in there sometimes it looks really messy. I see people in their PJs. 3 tables that still haven't been bussed and crumbs everywhere. Just something they might want to take note to. Also, the cooks and servers are always shouting to one another from across the room... Because the cooks station is open to the restaurant. (You'd understand this layout I'm mentioning if you've actually eaten here).  

BUT.... It you are in the area, they have consistently good breakfast food and always seem to be pretty busy. All servers I've ever had have been nice... Some of the hostesses make me nervous... Like I have to be reallyyyyy nice to them because they're having an 'off' day. I know we all know what I'm talking about here. K hope everyone else enjoys !!

This place is very spacious. Me and my aunt went on a Sunday and had a little bit of a wait but the food makes up for it. It's reasonably priced except for the drinks. The oj is about $5 a glass. My aunt had the French pressed coffee which she says is the best coffee she's had in her entire life. A must go

We came to this place with our son and d-in-law, and wow! The staff is so cool - friendly, helpful, offering suggestions to newcomers. When you come, ask for Lisa or Riley. But heck, all the staff seems great. 

The decor is incredibly imaginative. The ceiling fans all have umbrella-like covers that are large flower prints - dahlias, chrysanthemums, others. The wall colors are vibrant. Located in a strip mall, the restaurant is modest size. It's also quite popular, so don't be surprised to wait for a table.

However long your wait, it's worth it. The food is sublime. Rise and Shine bills itself as a steak-and-eggs place, so I ordered steak and eggs. My half pound ribeye was perfectly done and just great flavor. I asked Lisa the secret. She said the steaks are seasoned with salt, pepper, garlic and coffee grounds. She said the delicious hash browns had the same seasonings except substitute shallots for coffee grounds. 

Your order comes with a choice of breads: get the "pot of bread," as unique an offering as there is. It's a cinnamon roll baked in a coffee cup. Tip the cup and out comes the roll; apply butter and enjoy!

Chicken and waffles is also on the menu; the waffle is light and terrific with the cinnamon-infused syrup. The chicken breast is pounded thin, breaded and flash fried to a crispy delight, moist and tender and not greasy at all. 

How about the coffee: choose from an Italian blend, or French press. The French press comes with a three-tube hourglass that allows you to gauge the strength of your coffee. 

An important part of the dining experience is your server. He or she can make or break your meal. The servers here are clad in pajamas which are colorful and clearly comfortable. Lisa was an integral part of our experience. She engaged with us, laughed, joked, teased and was teased in return. She took excellent care of us. 

In a city full of great restaurants and celebrity chefs, this small family owned and operated restaurant is a gem.
Maria was a great server loved her pajamas very attentive and the food was great came out quickly.  Great place to try on our visit to Vegas :).
The food is the best.  We were here for 3 days and ate there every morning!  Amber was a Really good waitress!! Salmon eggs Benedict.... Wow!!!!

Pot o  bread and servers in pj's. Good for breakfast or lunch. Always have the fresh squeezed juice and french press coffee.  Food is always good. Gets very busy on weekends but they have a nice spot to hang outside.

The breakfast was excellent! The service was awesome, Vanessa is the best! We always request her to be our server. 

Our favorites are the country fried steak and 2/3 egg breakfast but can literally recommend any of it!

Bomb bomb bomb! Uploaded pictures. My boss used to eat heere when they first opened and said it used to be better but idk. Pretty bomb. I've had the eggs Benedict before and today I have the bacon wrapped tenders with eggs. Twas uhmazing. The waitress today wasn't as nice as my last but everyone else was super friendly. Older people tend to be judge me and my friends but it's whatever. It's her tip. Other than that the resteraunt and food itself is clean and bomb.

Sometimes after a weekend in Vegas, you just want to get out ASAP especially if you have a long drive home. We all have our exodus go to spots. Many of us want to cure our hang-overs so we head to Chinatown for Pho. Some want to get that steak and eggs for under $10 at smaller hotels. Few of us want to load up at a buffet before having to sit in that strenuous car ride and hoping that we can make it home before we have to drop the kiddies off at the pool. On the most previous occasion out to Sin City, I suggested something a little different to the crew. Let's check out this place called Rise & Shine, a Steak & Egg Place which is kind of south of the strip and sort of in the path back to LA. It seemed like the majority of the people who dined here were regulars and/or locals. 

This little restaurant is open daily from 7am-3pm only. They serve breakfast items the entire time during their hours of operation and lunch menu kicks in at 11:30am. We arrived right before noon on Sunday. For our party of seven, it took nearly 20 minutes for them to get us a table. The place isn't really big to begin with. I would say that 4-5 people max per table is ideal. There is a dining counter and you can also eat outside if the weather permits. Take notice of the waitresses' uniform; they're catchy because they are wearing pajamas. An awesome concept and it looks very comfortable. The bus boys have black tee shirts on that say something along the lines of help them by visiting Yelp.

We all ended up ordering hefty breakfast dishes on this morning because we were all mc-fatties ready to go to town. I went with the Crunchy Cinnamon Raisin French Toast - cinnamon crunch coasted, served with a warm glass bottle of maple syrup ($8.95). I made it a platter by adding two eggs and a turkey kielbasa (bacon or sausage is also avail) for an extra $3.50. It was a big meal indeed. The French toast was soft but not mushy and full of flavors from the cinnamon and tang of the raisins. The big turkey kielbasa was a nice compliment with the eggs. Surely French toast by itself isn't sufficient. I was definitely a happy camper.

A couple of my friends got the Crispy Fried Chicken Breast & Waffle ($11.95) which was a hit on the table. A thick piece of battered chicken breast sitting on top a fluffy waffle. Juicy white meat and far from dry. It's nothing like Roscoe's Carol C. Special but it should deserve recognition of its own. Before you start bashing me by saying, "I've had better fried chicken Smitcha!" All I'm saying is that it's pretty good and never did I claim it was the best I've had. 

Another friend ordered the Southern Style Chicken Fried Steak but from what I heard, he wasn't too impressed and felt like he should've went with the fried chicken and waffles.

Service was on point and like an oldskool coffee shop, I took my tab and paid at the register. I regret not trying pot of bread that everyone seems to be rave about on Yelp. Bring your appetite to this place because after this meal, I was seriously full until later that night. Plus, there are many options to choose from their menu. I will say that it was a great meal but it also made me feel like I was good on a typical American breakfast for some time. Once in a while a 1500+ calorie, single serving meal is okay but just not too often or else Dr. Chen will start chewing me out about my weight and high blood pressure.
Fabulous food, generous portions, and friendly service. The decor and personality of this place is refreshing. A place I'd visit again and again.
Help us...Yelp us!! WILL DO!! And DONE! Always excellent service and  love that it's close to home. I even got my birthday coupon in the mail and I am SUPER excited to use it!!
There food is good, service is excellent- price is average.  But there bread in a pot is to die for... I could go there and only eat that and be a happy camper!
Good food but just way way too expensive for breakfast. 1 breakfast and 1 child breakfast with drink and 1 iced tea, $28! Plus tip.

Food is delicious. I have never been disappointed. The waitresses are super friendly and personable. Even the young lady at the register was very social. Great atmosphere and good off the strip location.

EXCELLENT . 
The flavors were AMAZING & I'm picky because I cook a lot . Our waitress Vanessa was great . She's very sweet and bright . 
I am impressed , we aren't locals and I really chose the best place on yelp. Yummy yummy . 
I got the waffle and chicken . The chicken was JUICY and moist!!! I was skeptical because I hate dry meat but this was SO PERFECT !!!! 
The pancakes were SO good too

I'm so sad about this. Was very excited for this restaurant to open as I live a block away and after 3 attempts I'm going to have to give a thumbs down. Food is greasy!!! Very greasy. As in my veggie egg white omelette was greasy? Why? How? Tried to change it up but still had an overall bland oil taste. Restaurant appearance is cute, no wait times (though I understand why) and super cute merchandise though!

This is an amazing place for breakfast and brunch!
Everything was wonderful, food, service, cleanliness and decor!
Little busy but hey it was a Sunday AM in Las Vegas and busy means great place!!
We will be back and glad it's a neighborhood locale not on the strip!

After hearing from my sister that this place was good we decided to eat here while visiting Las Vegas. So glad we did. The quality and staff were soooo good. The prices were reasonable and felt like one of the highlights of our trip. Will be returning for sure.
Love this place it's beyond cute inside, food is yummy portions are big staff is nice... you'll smile as soon as u walk in.

One of the best places I've been to in Nevada. Hands down. I love everything about it, the service is great, the food is amazing. Don't even get me started on the bread! I will definitely recommend this place to all my friends before they go to Vegas.
Very delicious. Breakfast sandwich was huge. I hope to return. Staff shirts were funny.
The food was great and service was the cherry on top. Christina made us feel like we were having breakfast in her home. She went above and beyond.

Without fail when you walk in the door there are smiles all around. Right away an experience begins with all the cute decor on through out the restaurant all the way down to the servers uniforms! PJ's! So very cute!!

Food!! I've had a few different items here but down to it all the crunchy French toast as a platter is the best thing every with banger sausage!! Mmmm!

Not only was the food amazing at each visit. But you can see it all being made in an open view to the kitchen! Nice and fresh no sitting in the window for 10min! From griddle to plate to my table. Yum!

I drive out of the way past eggworks and all that to go here simply for service and over all quality of their food(:

See in about an hour Rise & Shine. 
P.s. Coffee is so yummi and strong definitely my morning pick me up.

This place is so over rated that it's not even funny.. the people rating this are not foodies just locals living in the area with nowhere else to really eat. Vegas has top notch spots in this town and this one doesn't make the cut.. the food isn't that good and the price is way over board for what you get. The employees look like they are shipped over from the hood. Southern highland residents should be embarrassed of this place.. I know I was when the bill came after that long wait to be seated,get served and then to have a meal that I didn't even want because it was shit. I can't believe I payed for it..  but hey don't take my word for it, you go wasted your money.

The first thing you notice about this place is probably the floral umbrellas on the ceiling. It's the first time I've seen a set up like that. It was pretty cool.

You can tell this restaurant is very laid back as the waitresses were all wearing PJs. It kind of threw me off when I first saw it but I suppose it's their uniform and it goes with the breakfast theme.

The service was okay nothing too impressive about it.
The food was okay too.

I got a Belgian waffle and a side of fries. Yeah, very healthy breakfast. The waffle was the only thing on the menu that interest me. It was too soft for my liking. It just felt like I was eating a pancake but in a waffle shape. I did like that they put the butter on the side in a separate container and also asked me before hand if I wanted whipped cream. I order fries because there's this other brunch place my boyfriend and I like to go to and their fries are so amazing that whenever I visit I always eat there. Sadly, the place is on the other side of the town so I decided to curb my carvings by getting fries here. The fries here are very thin and didn't really impress me.

We were staying at the M resort and wanted a local breakfast spot. We yelped and found this place. Chicken and waffles were fantastic, service was impeccable... A great break from the crazy of Las Vegas. It's worth leaving the hotel for this place.

We ordered breakfast for pickup on a Saturday morning. We used the menu available online, called in our order, and were told to pick it up in 20 minutes. When we arrived, the hostess told us a total of over $40! We ordered a bagel sandwich, French toast, and 2 orange juices!!! We were shocked at the price because the menu we ordered from had completely different prices. It stated $2.85 for an orange juice, and we were told they raised the prices and it was now $5 for a small orange juice, the size of a kids cup!! They did NOT update their menu or prices online, did not give us a total over the phone, and really expected us to pay $10 for a few sips of orange juice? The food was decent, but the hashbrowns were mushy and flavorless, instead of crispy and salty. The bagel sandwich was okay, but nothing worth $15!! We will never be back here again. The prices are insane and the food is not worth it.

1st time to eat this place, hubby & I ordered Ultimate Steak & eggs....
Food is- delicious
Place- clean and nice
I can't give 5 star, coz the service is no good..
Don't expect the staff to be all happy, coz no smile ont their place... most especially the person, that stays by the door....
Poor customer service.

Red Velvet Pancakes?! How original, I've never seen those on a menu until I dined at Rise & Shine. Unfortunately due to the 24 hour buffet pass I was only looking for a salad or something green. I'll have to try the red velvet realness on my next visit. I ended up getting a most delicious grilled chicken cobb salad. It was HUGE! It was one of the best cobb salads I've ever had it comes with ranch dressing and I did SOS sauce on side. Usually cobb salad comes with blue cheese which I thought was good until I had R&S grilled chicken cobb. My friend devoured the chicken wrap. He said it was very similar to McDonald's chicken wrap, which is discontinued, but better. Wish I had taken photos but we were all super hungry and had to eat and go quick. 

Rise & Shine is a local breakfast joint where waiters and waitresses get on with their day in PAJAMAS! Wild. It's very family friendly, reasonably priced, and best of all the menu has a little something for everyone. There's a large variety of breakfast items as well as "afternoon items" which we had at 11:30am so I guess it's just what they call that section but doesn't mean you have to wait until noon. The interior is big and cool with a fun surprise on the ceiling. Everyone here has a great attitude, very friendly and attentive even when they're busy. You can call ahead of time and check out the wait time, it'll most likely be 5-10 minutes. 

Parking is plentiful, but not really shaded... there are tons of other stores located in this shopping center such as a grocery store and other restaurants. Will definitely be returning next time I'm headed to Las Vegas!

I agree with a few of the other posts, it is off putting walking into a restaurant, and no one says hi, or comes up to you for a while. It was good to expect that before I went, because I probably would have cursed and stormed out had I not been expecting it. The first time I went, I got the chilaquiles (not sure if that is spelled right), and I won't be ordering those ever again. They were way to salty for me, but my husband liked his chicken fried steak, and eggs benedict the last couple of times we've went. We'd come back, but it's not my number one breakfast spot in Las Vegas.

Great breakfast spot. Wonderful options for the kids and adults. 
Love their omelettes and Nutella coffee drinks.

I have one word, CHRISTINE!   We are tourists and she went way and far beyond the call of duty. She gave us so much attention for eight people at one table. 

She did not do it for personal gain but  because she genuinely cared about us and catered to our every need. My husband and I highly recommend her for promotion in your organization. 

I am a human resources professional of over 40 years and to me she is the epitome   of customer service

I am so happy I found this breakfast spot. I always get their ultimate steak and eggs. I am really picky about how my steak is cooked. They make it perfect everytime! It's always so juicy and and soft, it just melts in your mouth. The servers are always nice, and they wear these cute pj's. Me and my husband come in often for Sunday brunch, there's always a little wait, as it's always packed. Great place, I recommend you try it!

My husband and I are here for breakfast before leaving Las Vegas.  It is a nice place, and it is decorated with cute umbrellas hanging upside down from the ceiling.  All of the wait staff are in their pajamas, and everyone was super friendly.  

I was happy that they had enough healthy and vegan items to select from the menu.  I just had the Go Go Greens Juice, a fruit plate, and potato hash.  They were all delicious.  I could have ordered oatmeal but decided to go with the potato hash for my carbs in the morning.

My husband had the eggs and corned beef hash with sourdough toast, and he enjoyed his meal.  I would come back here again if I am in town.  It is in a quiet neighborhood, and it is very close to the 15 S Freeway south of the busy city of Las Vegas.  Lovely place.
Best service and wonderful coffee and well prepared delicious breakfast food. Bigger now with more tables. Love the waiters in pajamas, cute touch

I went there today with a business partner. I ordered a build your own omelet with 3 choices, bacon, avacodo and cheddar. The omelet came to me without the avacado, scorched egg and tiny tiny bits of bacon- GROSS. My business partner ordered 3 item omelete
Egg white spinach cheese and avacodo, received without the avacodo and spinach . Chef sent it back without the actual order corrected. I do not recommend this restaurant . We should have went to Metro Grill

I came here this morning with my son to have breakfast because we had time to kill before his haircut appointment across the street. Glad I did. 

Cheyenne was our server and she was so patient with me. I normally don't take my son out to eat without my boyfriend, so I was kind of nervous. But she let me take my time and always checked on us.

I'll def come back :)

A cute, locally owned brunch and lunch establishment that serves good food. Living in Southern Highlands is great, but I have to admit that the community is detached from many places. The area was in need of a brunch place and I'm glad Rise & Shine filled that void. 

My family was immediately greeted and promptly seated. We got our orders and food quick. Selection and prices were reasonable. I ordered corned beef hash and eggs with a pot of bread. I've never heard of a pot of bread so I ordered it. What came was a dinner and cinnamon roll baked together served in a pot and it was served with jam and butter. Surprisingly good and I wanted more! Service was extremely friendly and attentive. Our waitress was clad in pjs and TOMS. Stylishly comfy and charitable. We left satisfied and will come back.,

Five stars due to service, presentation, and food quality! 

The place was recommended by my fiance's grandmother, and was his late grandfather's favorite place to eat. The atmosphere of the restaurant is very bright and relaxed. We loved how the servers were all in their PJs! Our waitress Halle was very sweet and energetic, and made our experience that much better.

Their fresh orange juice is definitely recommended, and their "dinnamon" rolls (a mix of cinnamon roll and dinner roll) were amazing. I personally got the smoked salmon eggs benedict which came with hashbrowns and was topped with hollandaise and capers, and was very happy with the food. My fiance got the buffalo fried chicken with eggs and hashbrowns, and couldn't finish all the chicken since there was just so much! All in all we both were happy with what we got, and definitely plan to come back next time we're in town.

Hopefully next time I won't accidentally forget my sunglasses!

I was really impressed with this breakfast spot! I don't know how they cook their pancakes but they were so delicious and the service was great. It's so cute that the servers wear pajamas and I loved the decor.

This place rocks! I'm so sad it's so far away! You walk in to see the coolest artsy/colorful umbrellas on the ceiling, the waitstaff all wear their "pajamas" & you get huge portions..everything we got was delish! I'm craving it now lol. Crispy bacon,good omelet & try their pot of bread! If I'm back in Vegas-I'll def be back-2 thumbs up! I may wear MY pjs next time lol Open one here in San Diego you'd kill it! Heck is even work there

This was such a pleasant surprise. It was a Sunday and our group included seniors down to an 18 month old. We were greeted with smiles, seated immediately with coffee. 
The breakfast menu was extensive. We placed different orders, we were all please with how delicious everything was. They handled the needs children well.
My husband's waffles were the best he'd  ever eaten and he's tried a lot of them. My red velvet pancakes were excellent and a large portion.

We will return again when we visit vegas, this hidden gem located in a quiet neighborhood off the strip.

Great hospitality.  The wife and I had our 3yr old son with, who has a lot of energy and the waitress was great.  
I had the 3 egg breakfast that I enjoyed. Hash browns a little dry but the eggs and Turkey kielbasa was great. 
Wife had the chicken and waffles that she seemed to enjoy.

Its not often I give 5 stars, but this place definitely deserves it.  Plus, I love breakfast.  If I'm paying for breakfast, it better knock my socks off.  This place does!  

Its located in my neighborhood (Southern Highlands), WHoooo hooo for me.  Sometimes this place gets really busy, so there may be a bit of a wait.  When its nice outside, you can be seated in the outside area.  

Great atmosphere &  friendly staff (dressed in PJ's).  I've been here a couple times and dishes with steak...super awesome.  I have yet to try waffles and pancakes.  But I've just been so successful with their steaks, I just order it every time. 

Recently I realized that they had my ultimate favorite combo.  Ribeye steak & Chillequiles.  Wooo woot!  I like their bread in a pot & fresh squeezed orange juice to compliment my food.  I like to pull out the whole bread and pour the cream cheese frosting all over like a cinnamon roll.  Mmmm Mmmmm

Prices are major for breakfast, but their portions are rather generous.  So, yup, split the plate and bill with your breakfast/brunch date.
Hands down the best breakfast place in Vegas. Great coffee, great eggs, and the steak and eggs are incredible.
Really liked it alot.  Lots of interesting things on the menu.  Steak chilaquiles.

First time I've been disappointed in Rise and Shine.  I usually go with the steak and eggs, with the pot of bread.   Today I went with the corned beef hash and eggs.  It's not even corned beef.  It was bacon hash and not a single piece of corned beef.  It was ok but definitely not what I expected.    Eggs ordered over medium.  Came out over hard. And the toast?   It was ok, but I will never understand sending toast out with hard butter on the side.   We asked for them to soften it, however the toast wasn't hot enough to melt it.  Seriously?   I will stick with Mary's Hash House for my hash.  And no, not the over rated Hash House a Go Go.
Awesome place!! Great food and great staff!! The place was very busy but staff still maintained a great attitude!! Will go again and again!! Coffee was great too!!
Great food, excellent service. Must have the cup of bread! Ashley S. was attentive even during a busy time.

The hubby and I had a great breakfast here but I would have to agree with Michael U., a most conscientious and loquacious Yelper, that this is probably not the best breakfast in Las Vegas. Still, it's good food and very reasonably priced. And I do think it is cute that the waitresses are all in PJs... it goes with the whimsical d√©cor.

Hubby is a huge steak and egg fan. That is his go-to breakfast order. So, it was fun for him to have some different options. He settled on the spice rubbed rib eye and he said the steak was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The chilaquiles were not that great, but I do give them props for making their own (some places just use store bought tortilla chips and enchilada sauce, bleh). Since we had about a 30 min wait for a table I had plenty of time to look at the menu and spent most of it deliberating between ordering French Toast or eggs. I am not a huge fan of eggs but we were about to get on the road back to Phoenix and I knew I needed some protein or else I would get hungry on the drive. Fortunately our waitress pointed out that if I ordered the French Toast I could add 2 eggs and a meat (sausage, bacon, or my choice turkey kielbasa) for only $3.50. So, that is what I did. It proved to be too much food for me but all of it was yummy so I didn't mind.

They were very short staffed that day but the service was still friendly and efficient. I would say the food was probably only 3 and a half stars but the cool atmosphere and staff rounded it up.

Our family came here for the first time today and seriously can't see us going anywhere else in the valley for affordable and delicious breakfast/brunch/lunch. The food was flavorful, well-made, and the pot of bread will literally melt in your mouth. We ordered:

Rib Eye Steak and Chilaquiles: I have never had chilaquiles before and I seriously feel like i have been deprived my entire life. My steak was cooked perfectly the way I liked and the tortilla chips that were bathing in refried beans, scallions, and cotija cheese were the perfect accompaniment. 

Chicken and Waffles: savory & sweet at its finest! The chicken was not dry at all, it was not overly battered and the waffles had a slight crunch on the outside but soooo soft and perfect on the inside. The maple syrup that they served with them was warm and had sticks of cinnamon in them! YUM. 

Silver Dollar Pancakes with Strawberries: Our little guy devoured these. He especially loved the sprinkling of powdered sugar over top! I had a bite, and I must say, they are some of the best pancakes I have had. Perfectly light with a little bit of crispness around the edges. 

Our food was absolutely perfect and if they only served these three things, we would STILL come back on a regular basis. Although the food was delicious, our absolute favorite part of this place was our server, RYLEY!!! She has such an amazingly genuine and kind energy about her. She complimented us on our parenting and how well behaved our four year old was. (she is a nanny herself, so knows a thing or two about kiddos) In a world where there is so much negative criticism, she is such a breath of fresh air! Our food came out in a timely manner and i LOVED that she brought out our little guy's food first, which in the parenting world is a God-send. Even our little guy liked her. He drew her little hearts on the comment card that we turned in! We left there feeling so lighthearted and truly lucky to have been helped by such an awesome person. We CANNOT wait to come back!!!

I had the ultimate steak and eggs and it was perfect!  I ordered it medium rare with my eggs over easy, everything came cooked to perfection. Our server was Riley, super nice and attentive!  The atmosphere is awesome as well. Highly recommend!

Voted the best of las vegas 2014!
Friendly staff, excellent service.. and of course.... great food! !!!!
Great place, fun staff and the food was yummy.
Love this place! Great food great service! Love the pot of bread and French press coffee!!

Love the openness of this place. Their exchange is very high for the price and their coffee (Lavazza) is delicious!!

Service is excellent and the food is a notch above due to the spices they use. At least I think that's why. I'm not a chef.

I heard about this place from a customer. And on fathers day my wife gave me a choice and I decided to try something new and I'm glad I tried rise n shine.

I ordered the chicken n waffles and my wife ordered the rib eye steak n eggs. Both were very delicious! The food alone was 5 stars. The service was exceptional. 

I love Roscoe's chicken and waffles in la but we hardly ever go there and I found a chicken n waffles place that rivals Roscoe's!
We're STILL regulars thanks to Analise. She is amazing! Always very courteous, so accommodating! Also, Desiree is amazing as always.
Just great steak and eggs in a cute lil breakfast joint. Enjoy!

We just moved to southern highlands and decided to give this place a try. The food was excellent, but two out of the three times we were there we had really slow service by the same server. If we return, we will make sure that we don't have her again. It really gives this restaurant a bad name.

The 1 star  for our waitress and our waitress ONLY. She was still training . So we had some compassion for her.

We have come here twice before but the service and food has always been mediocre. Its been about 8 months since our last visit so we decided to give it a go because of location convenience Came in this morning, ordered a kids breakfast and two adult breakfasts. My side dish of eggs and bacon, they eggs were WAY smaller than the kids eggs. Found that odd. They also forgot to put the cheese on them. Mentioned it to our server and she offered to have it fixed and I declined since we were on a time schedule because my husband was having breakfast with us on his work lunch break. I go to pick up a piece of my bacon and there is hair on it.... I also noticed the cook having a long beard and instead of them making him shave it due to health violations and cleanliness and professionalism, they made him wear a net over it ..... really?

Our waitress was very apologetic. They removed the $4.50 side plate. Hair in someone's food is disgusting and should absolutely never ever happen. The fact that the manager sent her back with a $5 coupon and our discount check, and he didn't even have not only the balls or the respect to come over and apologize to us shows their lack of care and customer service. But really, what would he say? There's no excuse for hair in someone's food because the bottom line is that is a result of the not so cleanliness of their kitchen. And as a server myself it's just unacceptable the lack of customer service as well. 1 stars for our server being sweet and professional, I feel bad that her manager had no balls and made her continuously apologize to us. We gave our coupon to the table over. I will also be notifying the health district . As well as never returning

Edit : the beard guard might be up to code with the health policy, but hair in my food is not .

My husband and I decided to go out to breakfast this morning, after reviewing several restaurant's in the area on google we choose - Rise and Shine in Southern Highlands. Our server Gelato was absolutely wonderful! She promptly came to our table and took our drink order answered any questions we had and was very attentive filling our coffee and water glasses throughout our meal. We will definitely be back and request to sit in her section! The food was excellent too.

Big parties not welcome. Don't come here if you have a big party where more than person is paying... they don't split checks more than two ways. Per the cashier this is a restaurant policy. They don't warn you verbally, but apparently it's somewhere on the menu. Hope you see this owner and change this unfriendly policy.

Edit: The waitress and the cashier played this fun game of "maybe the other can do something to split your bill."

Sad to write this, came on a Wednesday morning, we were immediately seated, 20 minutes later no one came to our table. After watching three other parties get seated, and attended to, and  have a waitress and busser walk by our table multiple times without service we decided to leave.  We love to support local places, but we will definitely tell our friends and family not to support this place.

I came here today for breakfast ..... Omg!! It was absolutely amazing. It was super busy.... Which has to tell you something!!! I mean this is the spot!!! There was a wait for 25 minutes.... I hate waiting but it was worth every minute that I waited!!!! the entire staff here was great!!! My waitress was the best!! I got the ultimate steak and eggs with a side of red velvet pancakes! I can't tell you because there are no words to describe to you how awesome the steak was.... Then the red velvet pancake ..... That was heaven in my mouth! It was just an overall great experience I was talking to the table right next to me they said that they have had a rise and shine addiction for 2 years now!!!  I totally see why! Great job rise and shine I am your new biggest fan!!!!!!!

One of the best places for steak and eggs. Depending on which server you get, the service is either real good or real slow. However, I did notice that when I went to the bathroom some peoples food was under the heat lamp and then after I came out from the bathroom it was still there waiting for someone to pick it up. I then sat at my table and the food was still under the heat lamp probably a total of 10 minutes which is long in food time to be fresh.

My panini was good... it was nothing special but my boyfriend loved the steak and eggs.  He ordered his steak medium-rare and it came out moo'ing but we were too hungry to send it back, the wait was atrocious.  They say that they are a "Steak and Egg" place so if you want variety, you're SOL.  On a good note, I loved the atmosphere, the staff wore pajamas and the decorations were so creative with the umbrellas and all.
Love love this place. The atmosphere, waiter and waitress in PJs! They are friendly.  Service is great. Food is amazing!! I highly recommend it!
This is place is soo good! Best breakfast place in town!  Their bread in a pot is to die for!

I LOVE breakfast! And Rise & Shine far exceeded my expectations that fellow yelpers have laid out for me. Thank you once again Yelp for showing me a true gem in this hot, chain ridden unforgiving desert. Now on to the details...

At first glance Rise & Shine looks to be a very small nook of a restaurant at the corner of a nice new strip mall in Southern Highlands. And that's pretty much what it is. But don't let looks deceive you! This small nook has so much to offer. 

We were greeted by a tall gentleman in a blue striped shirt who sat us promptly at a booth facing the open kitchen. It almost seemed as if he was welcoming us into his home, so I assumed it was his establishment in some form or another.
