Our server followed to take our drink order, and say hi to the little mama, and we decided on the French Press Illy coffee (do not pass this up!) and some waters. She returned very quickly with our own personal French press, two mugs, a sand timer with three strengths, and some real cream (hallelujah). She explained the timer, took our order of Steak Chilaquiles, a Spinach Swiss Avocado Omelet, and two pots of bread, and whisked away in her cute paisley pjs. 

The coffee was divine after letting steep until just after the yellow timer ran out, then pressing with much anticipation... fresh, aromatic, strong!, and ours to pour as we wished. 

The pots of bread came out first as little mama was hungy, and was getting antsy, and the three of us shared in a blissful pulling and devouring of the light fluffy just barely there cinnamon bread with fresh jam and real butter. I could have eaten five of those pots by myself!

Then came our meals. I wish I could have taken pictures, but they lasted a whole millisecond after our server set them down before we dove in like hungry hyenas. The smell of fresh ingredients was overwhelming, and we were all foaming at the mouth!

Hubby's Steak Chilaquiles were unreal. Fresh tortilla chips smothered in refried beans and a slightly spicy sauce, with cheddar and cotija cheeses, then topped with two over medium eggs and avocado, and a whole dinner sized rib eye steak that was PERFECTLY seasoned, with a side of salsa and sour cream. Heaven! 

My omelet, while simple and unassuming, was perfection. Not too overly huge as some omelets in this town can be, not too overloaded with cheese, or grease from cheap cheese (uck!), but beautifully fluffy and balanced, topped with creamy green avocado. Fabulous! The potatoes were fantastic, and again perfectly seasoned, and didn't even need ketchup or hot sauce (as I usually drench restaurant taters in). 

Each plate was accompanied by a fresh fruit stack of strawberries pineapple and oranges, which little mama enjoyed so much, the tall man in the blue striped shirt came by and offered her more of, which she gleefully took and crammed more in her sweet face. 

All in all, this place was so pleasing, it is now our favorite breakfast joint in town hands down. We will be returning (more than likely next weekend!), often! Hurray YELP!

Excellent food
Cute atmosphere
Wait staff wore pjs :-)
Laura was our waitress 
Super fast

This is one of the best places we ate at on our trip to Las Vegas. The food was fresh and recipes well thought out. My family was extremely happy with the fun ambiance and great service from Laura our awesome waitress. Try the cup-o-bread!
Loved this place!  Food was great and the service was top notch!  My favorite breakfast place in Vegas.

So I've been. To the location on flamingo and I wasn't happy with the timing of the service and the food was subpar. I figured I would give rise and shine one last chance but noooo.  I got my order to go and purchased a orange juice that they charge $5 and it was half filled in a small cup. Second purchased the pancakes.  Extremely dry . Must say they were huge but barely any syrup to go along with it.. never again

Such a great place - with such a great menu! Ashley was our waitress and she was fantastic, super friendly! Large portions and the cup of bread was a great treat. Will be coming back for sure!!! Love the coffee options too.
This is our first time here and it was great! Marie was a fantastic server and the food was delicious. I had the salmon eggs Benedict and it was out of this world!

Came here for bfast based on reviews and was somewhat disappointed by the food. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing - I went with the smoke salmon and eggs Benedict. I'm always a huge fan of eggs Benedict but I wasn't a fan of this dish. The spinach didn't come cooked and that was a bit odd because everything else was hot. My friend ordered the ham and egg Benedict, and he said that his was delicious. He ate everything and the hash brown. He also ordered a side of sausage but was not a fan of that at all. 

The customer service was great! Our waitress was very kind and checked in with us often. 

Cute place but wouldn't come here again.

This was highly recommended by some friends. Our expectations were high. Everyone lived up to it! The food was excellent! Service friendly and professional. We were a group of 11. Everyone loves bed their food. I had steak and eggs. The GoGo juice. Steak was ordered MR they nailed it. The hash browns were crispy. Make sure you get the bread in a bowl. Yummy!
My family loves this place. This is our go to place for breakfast. Best pancakes in town. I would have given this place five stars, but sometimes customer services isn't always the best.

Fantastic family owned restaurant tucked away near the South Point casino. The breakfast was great, but the service was exceptional. Many restaurants in Vegas seem to rely on their name recognition or posh environment. This place though maintains it's charm while delivering a satisfying meal. I got the Chicken & Waffles and it was delicious. The Chicken was crispy but also very tender and juicy on the inside. Couldn't get any better than that. My mom got a panini and she said all the ingredients seemed very fresh. And the waiters/waitresses are constantly moving, working, providing exceptional service. Can't thank then enough for a wonderful meal.

LOVE THIS PLACE!! It's officially our new favorite breakfast spot !!!
All the cute girls that work there run around in pj's !! Not to mention the ribeye steak and eggs were amazing !!
Fun new breakfast joint ! Great food! So fun how the staff wore pjs too! Great service and amazing food. Would definitely come again for a savory option!

I was really impressed with this place!  Walking in we were greeted immediately by very friendly employees. The decor is very cute and it kept my daughter entertained. Food was good and our server was great. We will definitely be back.

BS +++

COT DAMN! I finally found  a breakfast spot here in LV that's worth  reviewing.  Coming from NYC breakfast is important.  This place is as good as it gets.  The hostess is super nice and cool.  The waitress is super nice and very attentive.  I ordered the XTRA protein breakfast.  The  cook kills it! Everything about this place is good.  I checked out the restroom and it's clean and  it has a slimming mirror.  Pajamas! They wear pajamas! How chill is that? 

I recommend to visit this place whether you are a local, a tourist, or just hangry like I was.  I saw check out the website before you come  so you can  set your target on your food and order ASAP!  And lastly, there is a big cock by the door and I'm not talking a rude  guy either.  It's so cool!

Food is BOMB
Restrooms are CLEAN
Tables CLEAN
Table wait time NONE
Take out wait time is QUICK
Mood is CHILL AF
Customer service is GREAT (super friendly and huge  smiles)
Ambiance Super hipster like with upside down umbrella
Kitchen SUPER CLEAN

* Boomsauce scale.
BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage).  Not recommended.
BS = it's just O.K. (experience)
BS+ = Yo! I like this place.
BS++= That's Whoa! This place good.
BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

First of all, I think it's important to say I have been a customer here since the restaurant opened. I am glad it is in our neighborhood, and I think it has the potential to be a cornerstone business in our area of Southern Highlands. I typically order breakfast to go for my family...the same things each time, as we aren't to adventurous in the morning. I really enjoy the selection, location, customer service, and portion sizes, but I have had problems with the consistency in the preparation of dishes from day one.

Some times, our meals are spot on, and other times they are a complete miss. It is a mystery ever time I open the containers as to what we will get. Don't get me wrong...if I order biscuits and gravy, that's what will be in the box. I just don't know if I will have three-day-old microwaved biscuits or fresh. Also, tossing 4 slices of banger sausage into gravy does not a sausage gravy make. Southerners beware, this is pretty far from authentic. Chicken fried steak is pretty awesome every time. Good crunch and spice...huge portion!

I will continue to eat here, because let's be honest...my hangover is not going to feed itself.

First time here was a decent experience. Service was great. And food was good. I had the classic steak and eggs. Steak was pretty flavorful. Only complaint is that the steak was overcooked. I ordered medium rare and it came out well done. The rarest part of the steak looked medium well. Although it was over cooked. It was a pretty tender piece of steak. But if the steak is the main part of the meal, the cooks need to be more attentive to that. Selling point is the steak. Not the hash browns, biscuits, eggs, etc.... service wasn't too bad either. Although they could've done a bit more than walk away after I let them know about the steak.

Came here before I went to Daylight :)  
Ordered the bagel & egg sandwich, 3 Little pigs.  Bacon, Ham, and banger with American cheese on an Everything bagel.  Pretty appetizing!  I wish I had asked for a slightly undercooked egg to break the yolk and let it smother my bagel though!  The "fries" are like hash, so don't expect the type of fries you get with a burger :)

Great place for a breakfast or brunch. Their bread is delicious and freshly
baked.

The chicken and waffle is really crispy, soft and spot on. I'd go back here
for a breakfast or brunch anytime!
Been here twice.  Both times were excellent and we recommend this place to anyone in the south point area.

very good cooked and quality steaks. between the brothers our new go-to for steggs when in Vegas/Henderson, Mariah was very welcoming and attentive. great first impression for a fairly new restaurant of the popular flagship locale.

The restaurant was cute with colorful umbrellas hanging down from the ceiling.  There was a short line upon entering, but it took us an unusually long time to be seated though we could see a few tables that had been prepped and empty. 

We decided to share a full stack of pancakes plus strawberries. The sliced strawberries were served on the side and our 5 medium sized pancakes were nothing to write home about.  Overall we were underwhelmed by this dining experience.  

A rating of 2.5 would be most appropriate.

Super friendly helpful staff!  Immediately seated, quickly offered coffee or other beverage, menu items explained pleasantly, food was very good and just as we ordered. Cute theme has the staff wearing pajamas.  A little pricey but worth coming back again.  Nice to have in the neighborhood.
I love this place everyone is friendly service was fast and wonderful. Food was delicious, they have a great variety of food as well! Love their fresh squeeze juices and smoothies !!

Found a new breakfast and lunch spot on Yelp and it delivers in service and flavor! I'm all for pancakes and waffles-the usual, but sometimes I'm craving for a hearty breakfast without all the floury carbs. Rise and Shine centers their breakfast go-to with steak and eggs, but they have all the classics favorites too. Our server, Maria, was a ray of sunshine friendliness. Even the host, was cheerful when seating us.
 I ordered a coffee with cream and it was smooth and strong. I had to order their popular rib eye with eggs and potato hash. Just a note, Maria did let me know the hash brown has green onions in it, but you can request your hash plain if you like. I don't mind green onions in general, but next time I think I will have my hash plain, but if you do want it more savory, go with the green onions. The rib eye steak was tender and well seasoned with pepper and not too much salt. The poached eggs were perfectly runny inside and flavorful. The Build Your Own Burger was definitely home made and was delicious. It wasn't densely packed together like frozen patties and tasted fresh. They also serve alcohol here if you want to get your brunch on with something bubbly. I also was wowed by the bread in a cup. It's like the center of a cinnamon roll in a little cup with a cream cheese frosting dipping sauce. It was steaming when I tore into it. Sometimes a little flour carb is ok and when it's this good, it's a must try.

All in all, this place is a hit for me. The service is excellent and the food can back it up. The place is very clean and I think it has enough charm to be a local favorite. Definitely will be back and highly recommend.
First time here everything was delicious. My 10 year ate a big burrito filled with steak and chorizo. The service was also great!
Always solid. Big portions. Best restaurant in SoHi. On weekends the wait can be excessive.

Fun restaurant with waitresses dressed in pjs. They have a great smoothie and coffee bar. My eggs Benedict and kids' pancakes were slightly over cooked, but the ambiance and experience were great. Thank you.

Excellent.  Visiting from ca and found this place on Yelp.  Excellent food, service and friendly atmosphere.
Will definitely come back next time we visit Las Vegas.

This place is so cute. The staff wears pajamas and the whole inside is decorated adorably. The food is pretty good and customer service is amazing ! I have been here about 4 times now, and am excited for them to open up their new location. I will definitely be returning to this place for breakfast!

I never give 5 stars but this place is close to getting a 5 start rating soon. I have been here twice and both times the food was FANTASTIC!!

Busy!! Be prepared to stand in line. Food is worth it! 

Food: everything that I have ordered has been perfact!! Hot, fresh, better then expected. Cinnamon French toast highly recommend. Freash cornbeef in the cornbeef hash, eggs made as asked, sour dough bread toast was good, jellies was average, butter was great, diet soda a smidge flat, grilled steak & chorizo burrito was fantastic!! 

Service: is ok, servers are super friendly,  but difficult to get your water topped off or keep your beverage cup full, They were pajamas *smile*,  fast service (not including drinks service), they give great recommendations. They are always busy helping people people or cleaning something.

Parking: lots
Dinning area: inside-large, ok clean, they wipe each utensil after it's washed and dried, they clean all condiment at the end of day, a little loud, lots of talking, if you are trying do romantic, maybe sit outside (but can be windy at times). Cute flower umbrellas hanging from ceiling (some are twirling)
Outside: lots of umbrella tables, big open spaces, very clean. Outside is nice.

Highly recommended for food!! If you are a princess the service here is not for you *smile* but the food is worth the wait.

This place was recommended to me by a friend and I'm glad he did. This place is about 8 miles from the strip but we'll worth getting out of the hustle and bustle of the Vegas Strip. Once there you're greeted by servers in PJs. The stay open only until 3 so go early. I had the chilaquiles and rib eye. Amazingly good and affordable.

We had breakfast here this morning. It was difficult to choose from their large menu. I had an omelette with a side of corned beef hash and my wife had the Benedict. The food was amazing. Best hash I've ever had. Add the table side French press coffee and the kids pancakes and waffle and we have a new favorite breakfast spot in Vegas must check it out.
Nice staff. very vibrant decor to the place. My steak was cooked a good mid rare, hash brown were mighty tasty, biscuit was delectable . Good quality in steak, but I wished with was more seasoned.

Found this place on yelp. Wanted to get some breakfast on our way out of Vegas. Service was outstanding. The waitress was very sweet and always attentive. 
Food was good. I think it's a bit better then other places you'll find in Vegas. Definitely get the steak and eggs if you are really hungry. 
Pictures attached

Not sure if I already reviewed this place already not, but I stumbled across this location because my navigation system gave me the wrong directions to go pick up a friend early in the morning... And I thought it was funny how the everyone who works at this location wears pajamas and I think it's adorable! Our food came out quick and our server had so much personality... Needless to say it was a great experience as a whole. The food was mouth-watering and I'm definitely coming back next time I get the chance, and the money for it. The menu is great with SO much to choose from. I highly recommend this joint if you want to start your day out with something awesome!

The food here is really good however service is very slow. I know they just opened but wait time for a table is long and even longer for food to come out.  The first time we went our server kept disappearing and never came to check back on us. Had to ask for water multiple times.  Second time they dropped off an iced coffee in a tall glass with no straws. I had to flag down another server to get one.  The food took over 45 mins to come out and bc of that the manager (I think he was the manager) came and apologized and said he would take off our beverages for us.  We got the check and the drinks were still on there. By now we just wanted to leave so we didn't say anything and went up to the cashier. Our bill was $51ish and she said our total was $70ish.  We asked to check and told her there are some mimosas on there that wasn't ours.  She insisted it was our tab.  The manager came by and we had to tell him and he said sorry and took off the alcohol but still didn't take off our coffee he promised.  Again, beyond annoyed at this point and now running late to our soccer game bc we didn't realize breakfast for a party of 3 (2 adults and 1 child) would take 2 hours.  Like I said, both times we came to this location the food was great but service is not up to par.  Unfortunately we will not be coming back.

Best Breakfest Joint in Southern Nevada! 

The Breakfest Checklist:

Corned Beef and Hash: Check! Homemade and you can  tell! There are nice big pieces of meat and potatoes and a great helping on your plate!

Baccon: Check! Crispy and never overdone! 

Pancakes and Waffles: Check! Big and Fluffy served with warm maple surup!

Pot of Bread: Never in my life have I seen this! absolutely delish! It is a must get when you go here, and it usually comes with your meal! 

The atmosphere in a nutshell: Breakfest in Bed! The waitresses wear pj's and are so friendly! The ceiling is decorated with sunflower umbrellas, tres chic! 

There are day's when it's super busy, and there are days when you're the only table in the restaurant! But that would be the norm with all restaurants. I'm just saying don't get upset when it's jammed pack on a sunday... because it almost always is!

Came here for some brunch. There was a short wait and the service was friendly. The waitress told us our food was delayed because there were large parties before us. It took a while for the food to come out but they kept filling our coffee while we waited which was nice. I enjoyed the avocado Benedict and my boyfriend enjoyed the rise and shine burrito. The decorations were also very cute and unique. A good brunch place.
Great food and service. The coffee was excellent and offered frequently. The meals came quickly and were made to order. Very yummy! Will definitely be back!

OH LORD!!!! THIS IS THE BOMB PLACE EVER!! I was walkin with my friends to find somethin good and we ended up Rise & Shine! but it was around 2ish almost 3 but the waitress they are so nice to us, no pressure to eat we are chillin and she was so friendly to us! not just service otherwise the food! YUM same price as Ihop, Denny's but the taste and the size are way more taster way more bigger! Definitely recommend this place!!!

This place has amazing food and we are regular customers here (who isn't) 
Do not plan to bring parties larger than 4 or else expect to wait longer than one hour. The restaurant had poor table management. The employees know people are waiting but don't show sense of urgency to get the tables moving. It seems that they are expanding as well, but a better table management system would be beneficial for this business. Using a marker and paper to manage tables is not effective. It's 2015! There is still no adaptation of Apple Pay acceptance.
Amazing! First time there today and I will definitely be coming back. It's delicious, and yummy. Definitely recommend this place!

Avocado Benedict with crispy muffin probably the best I've had. Fresh OJ and decent coffee however they don't have any milk alternative, no almond milk coconut or even soy. Pancakes were pretty good not great. Pretty busy but the waiter kept his cool was friendly and considerate . The layout of the restaurant wasn't well planned and they sat a family with two newborns in two carriers on the end where the waiters all entered their orders in an iPad on the wall so it was impossible for guests or staff to get through lol. The line to check out starts getting in the way of those waiting for a table and the staff and guests sitting  The cashier was barely alive lol and the host was frazzled. Hectic though so I feel bad for them. They should model after the busiest breakfast restaurant The Egg & I to better systemize everything.

Cali our server was great. Very delightful. However, Amy set the tone for my wife and I in a very unprofessional way. My wife and I were bothered to the point to where we couldn't even enjoy ourselves. Also, the food wasn't very good for the bill. $41.23 for pancakes I could of made myself and dried steak and eggs. Here's a picture. We won't be returning. The sad thing is , we were genuinely excited to try them. Oh well.
This place is a gem! Delicious food and great service. Love the d√©cor inside. The service was perfect. Will definitely return here in the future. A+

Food was amazing! Just what we wanted, maybe better! We hate hate hate when food is greasy and tasteless but it seems that's all you get at most places.... Not this place! No greasy food! All flavor and no grease! Seriously I even looked at my hash browns which would be forgivable should there be some grease. To my surprise their wasn't even residue on the plate! In fact they were so good I ate 80%of them without ketchup and then when I finally reached for ketchup out of habit I realized I had somewhat ruined them by putting such an inferior topping on my hash browns. They even had chipotle chulula.... OMG seriously everything was amazing. Wish there was one in so cal.... Say close to Murrieta;);)

We drive down here from the strip just to eat breakfast here.  Pretty good ham and eggs with has Browns toast and coffee. Our bellies are full. Cool atmosphere.  We will be back on our next trip to Las Vegas for sure!!

This place is a must when visiting Vegas! It is a bit of a drive away from the strip but I heard there is a closer location near the strip! Just the ambiance of this restaurant is awesome! I love the interior, the cute flowers in the ceiling and the servers wearing pajamas. It really does give it a unique vibe! 

Food was DELICIOUS and  really big portions! Our family ordered the chicken and waffles, pancakes, country fried steak, steak and eggs and honestly, you cannot go wrong with any order! 

Oh and you cannot leave without trying the bread pot! It certainly is a MUST! 

I can't wait to go back to this restaurant! Great service and awesome staff! :)

This place inspired me to coin a new phrase : BESTFAST!

Worth any drive within 30 miles. Fried chicken and waffles rival the best I've had but are just one of a menu full of great choices. GO HERE only if you want the best breakfast in the Vegas area.

I have been here twice, the first time it was amazing, my husband ordered the New York steak, spinach & benedict bagel and I had the country fried steak and eggs. The pot of bread was delicious! Service was great and didn't disapoint. 
The second time was a different story, it was a beautiful morning so my husband and I decided to eat outside. Bad choice, it took the waitress at least 15 minutes to come and get our drink order, which by that time we already knew what we wanted to eat so we were ready to place our order, however she wasn't ready to take it. ummm...ok.... She came back with our drinks and then took our order. They were out of the pot of bread which was really dissapointing as that was one of the reasons why I wanted to go back there, my husband ordered the spiced rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles and I had the ham and eggs benedict. His order was ok, the steak was great however my eggs benedict was utterly dissapointing! One egg was poached perfectly and the other was basically a fried hard boiled egg! I have NEVER seen that before. The waitress was nice enough to take it back and bring me a brand new dish. By then it was a little too late. It wasn't just our table that had issues but other tables as well. We even witnessed one of the hostesses ask another customer who had been waiting for a table for 45 minutes if they would like to continue waiting or if they would like to leave. Why would a hostess even ask that? If they were still waiting wouldn't that mean they want to stay? 
Most of the staff were wearing shirts asking customers to write a review on yelp, my husband and I were thinking that they should take those shirts off. They were not having a great day!

I may give them another try only for thier pot of bread.....
The food was so fresh and delicious! The freshly squeezed juice was the best! I'll definitely go back!
The food is good and the service is good. I would recommend this place to anybody looking for a good breakfast joint.

I love this place for breakfasts. Expect a wait (20-30 minutes) on the weekend as there are only about 25 tables. 

Best breakfast food in Southern Highlands. I especially like the omelets, and banger sausage. Lots of my friends like the pot of bread, but I'm not a big fan. I'd rather they go all the way and make it a cinnamon roll. 

Coffee is excellent, they have French press along with drip. I prefer the press, but typical come with my 3 year old so I don't like the large pot of hot liquid. 

Rise and Shine also has out door seating. It's on the west side of the building so early it gets shade. Nice in the summer. Also good for the morning health nuts who finish bicycle rides or runs here.

I have been here 3 times in the last year.  All times it always seems that the waitress I get has the, "hurry up and take your order and I hate my job attitude and never smiles."  Food is great, steak and eggs and pot of gold are my fav.  Eggs benedict are delish too.  

Definitely enough food to fill you up for lunch too.
I pride myself on how great my own steaks are. It's hard for me to find anywhere that is equivalent to mine. This is the best steak I've had at a reasonable price.

Very mediocre. The prices are high and the food is just...meh. The service was terrible, our server never refilled our drinks and didn't follow up. Next time I would rather go to McDonalds. At least they have portions that match the price.

A solid, good place to have breakfast if you're in the area. I had the philly steak and egg breakfast while my mom had the chicken and waffles along with the coffee. She loved the coffee too. The food was delicious and not too salty like other breakfast places, and the all meat was tender. Maria, our waitress, was attentive and professional.

Great place for traditional breakfast before hitting the road from Las Vegas! Yummy food fast and friendly service. Waitress in Pj's, cute flowery ceilings and broken plates designed walls, superb place!

Loved it! We first went to the one off of the 215 and Flamingo but left when they said the wait was an hour.  We were hungry..so we left went to the Southern Highlands location.  Its much smaller and a lot less crowded. 
They gave us a cute cinnamon bun baked in a little tea cup..it came out hard and cold so we asked for a new and the server was very nice about it...gave a fresh one...delicious.
Everything was really good. Corned beef hash GOOD..Steak and Eggs GOOD...Eggs and Bacon (a ton.of bacon)...Great... Chicken and Waffles..Good.  
This place BEATS Eggworks anyday!
Generous prorations, great atmosphere and kid friendly. The plates where huge and delicious, recommend the cinnamon French toast or the chicken and waffles.

My husband and I were looking for a breakfast place close to our house one Sunday morning. I suggested Rise and Shine after reading other Yelp reviews. Boy am I glad we did! We have been there a few times and we haven't been disappointed! My favorite so far is the Chicken and Waffles. The fried chicken is AMAZING!!! The batter is super crunchy and the chicken breast is super juicy and tender. I highly recommend coming here for breakfast on the weekends.

Well what can I say I went to rise and shine this morning for breakfast maybe five people in the entire restaurant ordered the chicken fried steak eggs scrambled after waiting 20 minutes my order came eggs Over easy and running yolks everywhere and that grosses me out. Told the girl take it back I don't have time to remake it went to the cashier to pay for my coffee that should be free since they screwed up my order and the kid charges me nine dollars I was like nine dollars for a cup of coffee when I should be free he says oh I thought you ate the bacon seriously dude. Avoid this dump of the restaurant

Stopped by this place on the way home. Ordered the eggs benedict and a cup of Italian roast coffee. The food was good but I especially liked the coffee. Next time, I'll be ordering steak n eggs instead!

Very expensive and will not diverge from the menu at all. My sister doesn't eat meat and just wanted an egg and cheese sandwich on a bagel, they only make one with ham, sausage and bacon and wouldn't leave out the meats for her. Bizarre...
Excellent and worth the drive to southern highlands. Comfy atmosphere, friendly staff, and love the PJs the servers get to wear.
I come here every year for my birthday. You can't go wrong with the breakfast menu. The only downside about this place is that it's far from my house.
So far, this is the best restaurant we have found for breakfast. The service is excellent and the restaurant is very clean. We have been there many times in the past few months

Took the family here on a recent trip to Vegas and desperately wanted to get out of the downtown areas scene of food. Looked this place up on Yelp for favorite bfast spots and saw all the great reviews. All I can say is I am glad we stopped in. This place is tucked into a strip mall which I could care less about. The scenery inside is very eclectic and relaxing. I was more excited about the food!My only suggestion is if you come on a Sunday is come early...we had to wait about 30 mins for a table which was ok because we were not in a hurry. Once seated we ere greeted by a very friendly waitress who suggested a hot pot of french press coffee for the table which was delicious! The menu is packed full of great selections, but they specialize in steak so I decided to get the steak house omelet. It was pretty good, but not the best steak I have had so not judging it off the Ruth's Chris steak quality. My daughter ordered this 2 fisted bagel sandwich filled full of eggs, bacon, ham and homemade sausage and it was killer! I was overall very impressed by this restaurant and most importantly the exceptional service. All the waitresses wear pajamas which my daughters thought were fun. I will definitely be back to this place when in Vegas time permitting....
The place is yummy! Only bad thing is that it was so cold it made our food cold instantly. Try the watermelon and strawberry juice. :)

Good food and service. Portions are huge. I have a SUGGESTION.  Put a half omelet with half the potatoes and single slice of toast on the senior menu.  Charge $7.99 for it. I would come in a LOT more often.  Way too much food for us older folks eating alone.
The food was good but not the server! Yes she refilled our coffee, My husband and I were waiting if she will give us a glass of water! She didn't even bother to asked us! Poor service!

I've seen this place, but just never had the time to try it out until today. I strongly regret not coming here earlier. I ordered the fried chicken and biscuits and it was amazing. The breading on the chicken was amazing and seasoned perfectly. Our server Maria helped make it a positive experience. I highly recommend coming and checking this place out.
Really great place! The staff is pretty cool, very genuine, fast and efficient. A new fav among so many great breakfast joints around here.

Looking for an unstuffy, fairly priced, delicious brunch off the strip on our way back to L.A. and found this kooky gem.  

Decor is weird.  

Sunflower umbrellas hang upside down, mosaic tiles of birds and stuff, generic diner style upholstered booths.  Waitresses in pajamas.  Weird, weird, weird but there's a line out the door at 11:30 a.m. on a Sunday, so I'm in.  

We put our name on the list and proceed to wait.  

There's chaos everywhere.  

A waitress shouts, "Son of a bitch" from the beverage station, and then looks up, realizing everyone is staring at her, and then it's back to business as usual.  One patron complains to the girl at the register and there seems to be a lot of high tension.  

We opt for two seats at the counter and I can't help but think of Anthony Bourdain and Kitchen Confidential as I watch these swarthy, kitchen pirates, working as fast as they can with large, sizzling grills full of pancakes, a mountain of hash browns, seared steaks and a deep fryer.  The smells are intoxicating.  

We start with "Pot of Bread."  This is a soft, warm, cinnamon roll baked in a demitasse cup.  Delicious!

On to the main event...it took 40 minutes to get our food and we drooled anxiously as we watched every plate come up.  I had the biscuits and gravy.  Eggs were cooked perfectly and served over an obscene pile of some of the best, chopped, hash browns I've ever eaten.  Gravy was salty and chunky and homemade.  Biscuits were soft and dense, just perfect.  

Husband had the basic bacon and eggs and the generous portion of bacon was so fresh, tasty and perfectly cooked.  

Then came the pancakes. Oh my goodnight nurse, this was pancake heaven!  

We were just talking about some disappointing pancakes we ate at the Aria cafe the morning before.  I mean, they were fine. They were warm and sweet and sort of fluffy.  But what was missing was that extra depth of flavor and a crisp exterior.  

These pancakes at Rise and Shine are almost like a donut, with a thin, crisp crunch on a perfectly golden cake.  The flavor has texture and depth from buttermilk and the syrup has a cinnamon stick in it, which just adds another nice layer of taste.  We could not get through half of our entrees but we for sure took it all home in boxes to enjoy the next day.  

Next time you're heading out of Vegas, try this place. You will not be sorry!

Maria was our server and did an excellent job on filling our drinks. She recommended the steak and eggs ( which we had heard about from yelp). My husband had it medium rare and it came out perfect. The steak was very flavorful. I had the smoked salmon eggs benedict which was very good with plenty of salmon. We will be back.

They really need to step their game up in the server department. The girl who was eventually my server was kind and had great energy do not get me wrong. Others seemed less thrilled to be there, mentioning to the host that there are other open sections in front of guests creates tension, and when waiting for a long time to be greeted, this really doesn't help. I am thankful the busser grabbed our orange juices, but it was disheartening to see so many walk by and see us still sitting without drinks without checking up on us. I eventually grabbed the busser and asked for drinks. I know we can get tunnel vision in this industry, especially toward the end of the day, but servers are what make or break repeat customers. I really hope that next time this will not be a problem. It really should not take ten minutes to be greeted.
Unfortunately we won't be returning until their health grade improves from a C, if at all. We love this place but their cleanliness and food handling demerits are a deal breaker.

I normally don't eat breakfast and have never really cared for breakfast spots... But now I know it's because I haven't had good breakfast until now! I am so impressed with this place for not being afraid to actually season their food! Each bite was bursting with flavor! And not super greasy like a lot of breakfast places tend to be . The ribeye steak is as good as it looks in the pictures! Biscuits were good but the gravy is some of the best gravy I have ever had! And those hashbrowns, so flavorful! The Ambiance is casual but inviting with lots of natural light with lots of windows. I am so excited to go back and try more things on the menu! Thanks for making me a fan of breakfast!  Luckily I live just a few minutes away so I plan on coming often

Was visiting Vegas this weekend from LA. On the way home we decided to stop by and try this place out. The inside of the store is so unique. They have different flower umbrellas hanging across the ceiling. Also all the waiters are wearing pajamas haha. 

Our waiter, Vanessa (purple hair), was amazing. She was energetic and so helpful. We were unable to get our cup of bread because of complications but she made up for it by offering something else and taking some things off of our bill. That to me is the definition of customer service. 

The food was delicious. I ordered the steak and eggs and that steak was magical. So tender and juicy. I haven't had a good steak like that in a while. I also ordered the caramel iced coffee, that was amazing as well. 

All in all this place is definitely a 5 star. If you have the time to wait about 30 mins for a table then this is the place to dine at. Next time I am in Vegas I will definitely make a stop here.

I would have given this place a 4 1/2 star if possible, but gave it the bump to 5 stars based on location. The menu had enough options, but was not overwhelming like some breakfast places. I went with a basic 2 egg meal and was not disappointed. The sausage was great quality, eggs cooked perfect, and hash browns very tasty. The bread bowl was a nice touch and service excellent. I will be returning to this location frequently...

Food was great, for the price it should be. The place is waaaay to busy for me, as I'm a night owl normally. There were at least 20 or more people waiting to be seated while I waited for my to go order. With at least 5-6 tables & a small breakfast bar to sit at open & cleaned. All of the waitresses were dressed in pajamas, & stayed attentive to their tables. Everyone was very polite including the waiting customers. Who all seemed to be accustomed to waiting 20-30 minutes for a table for breakfast. I ordered 2 custom omelets with a side of pancakes & turkey sausage. The turkey sausage was forgotten. But they were way to busy to go back or call. As the phone was ringing off the hook while I was waiting & the line stayed busy when I called from home. 
If you don't mind the wait it's a great breakfast place. If you want a little peace I suggest Denny's.

We typically don't like to go off of our beaten path for our food. But husband had an insane craving for steak and eggs. He googled, "Best steak and eggs in Henderson" and he came across Rise and Shine. Let's just say HOT DAMN! The ribeye and eggs were delectable. The ribeye is rubbed in coffee grounds and it was sooo juicy and flavorful. I had the Lox and Cream cheese omelet. I never thought I would enjoy capers in my eggs but wow! This location is the first that serves alcohol and I had the pleasure of trying their sake Bloody Mary. It was light and full of flavor. 
Our server, Dane, was informative and super friendly. He kept up on all of our needs and made us feel comfortable. 
We will definitely be coming back. Maybe even tomorrow. :)
All I got to say is the red velvet pancakes are the best pancakes I ever had. Heavenly is the one word i would use to describe them. I rarely write reviews and just wanted share.

Another good Yelp find! Lox and cream cheese omelette was fantastic. Coffee rubbed rib-eye & chiliquilles were so good they brought us back 2 days later. Ham steak was less salty and more smoky which was a great surprise and one of the best breakfast hams I've ever had. Fresh squeezed juice were so refreshing. Nice vibe to the restaurant with the wait staff in pajamas.

My most favorite place for brunch.   Great & quick service.   Great food that is original.  Great prices.   What more could you ask for?  

I prefer this place over Cracked Egg.

This place gets packed with a wait line of 20 to 25 minutes but soo worth it.  

This is our spot for brunch and I love that it is soo close to my house.  

Keep up the great everything!

I was a little intrigued when I saw the sign go up on the old Annie's Italian space down the street from the house. OK, I love breakfast,  will have to try it. I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to chicken/country fried steak and will judge a restaurant based solely on their execution of my favorite dish. I figure that a place with steak in their name had better nail it so I order it and anxiously await. Service time was a bit slow but I'll give it a pass as place was pretty swamped. Plate arrived and presentation was nice with country gravy on the side. I was very pleased with my choice, perfectly cooked with a nice batter and high quality piece of steak. Nothing worse than paying top dollar for some frozen disc of questionable meat from a bulk pack bought at Costco. Wife enjoyed her avocado veggie whatever.. Will be back to try the corned beef hash.
Delicious!  Steak an Eggs were the best we ever had.  Our  picky 9 year old son ate his whole plate and half of mine.

This is my new favorite breakfast place! I've been here several times, and the food is consistently amazing. The biscuits and sausage gravy is excellent; finally, a place that serves country gravy properly! The hash browns are slightly spicy and super savory. There is a side of "pot of bread", which is a miniature cinnamon roll-like piece of amazingness served in a tiny mug with whipped butter on the side. Their pancakes are perfectly fluffy, and the syrup their place on the table has cinnamon barks floating inside. The steak eggs benedict is a feast for at least two people, and well worth the wait; the hollandaise sauce is creamy and rich, and the steak is tender and juicy. The atmosphere is also lovely. Flowery umbrellas are hung upside down, spinning above you as you dine. All is the servers are in pajamas, aiding to the comfortable, easy-going ambiance. You *need* to eat here!

Friendly and courteous staff. Nice simple atmosphere. Good table spacing. Coffee was excellent, the kind you don't need to sweeten. I ordered The Ultimate Ribeye and Eggs. Did not disappoint, although steak was a little overdone. Hash was nice snd crunchy. My wife had the Country Fried Steak, awesome breading, light and crunchy, with good gravy. Good place to start a busy Saturday.

I have wanted to try this place since I saw it in the Review of the Day.  My wife and I decided to head over this past Saturday and we were not disappointed.  The Pot of Bread was delicious along with the jam and butter.  I ordered Chicken Fried Steak and my wife ordered Eggs Benedict.  The Chicken Fried Steak was big and very fried but as I told my wife, you gotta know what you're getting into when you order something called 'Chicken Fried'.  It was very good and for once my over-easy eggs were actually over-easy at a restaurant and not over-runny-raw-and-gross!  I have never been a fan of Eggs Benedict but I did my usual 'cleaning of my wife's plate' after she couldn't eat anymore.  Wow, was it good!  There was tons of ham and it was sliced perfectly!  The Hollandaise (which is the reason I don't like Eggs Benedict) was actually very good and I would even considering ordering it if I went here again.  Service was great!  Very friendly waitress/staff who seemed happy to be working.  Even though this place is a ways from our house I can say with confidence that we will go back for more!

My favorite breakfast place! Not because it's close by but the service has always been wonderful and the servers very friendly. My daughters order was messed up one time and they immediately apologized and provided a corrected order promptly. Mistakes happen - but they will not argue with you and instead aim to get it right. Kudos!

YES THE SERVERS WEAR PAJAMAS! Next time I may too! 

Great spot for breakfast. Usually a wait but worth it. Service great. Food good. Had the steak and eggs (what else in a place called "a steak & egg place?). 

Wasn't planning on getting the best steak in the world. I knew I wasn't at Wolfgang Pucks, Chop, nor was I paying $75 either!

The steak, which the menu said was ribeye, was decent, thin but decent. Diner level. And this place feels like should be in a small diner but it's a large area in a typical strip mall. 

Food was good and the service was friendly and efficient. I left happy.

We arrived at Rise and Shine around 10:00 on Sunday morning.  It was already full.  I'm glad we arrived when we did, because within 5 minutes (no exaggeration) there was a 25-30 minute wait.  And, people stayed.  So, given that the regulars were willing to wait a half hour, I figured we were going to enjoy a solid breakfast.

I had the chicken fried steak and eggs.  I chose the pot of bread, which was brought out early as an appetizer of sorts.  It was warm, and the butter served alongside was room temperature, so spreading was easy.  l liked the cinnamon flavor in the bread, but I think I would have preferred some toast or a biscuit with my meal rather than this bread prior.  The steak itself is a good size, and thick for a chicken fried steak.  This was an issue, as some of the areas were not as tender as I prefer.  I think the meat needed more tenderizing prior to preparation.  Also, it did not appear to be seasoned.  If the meat had seasoning prior to breading, even just some salt and pepper, it would really elevate this dish.  That being said, it was very good, particularly with the tasty sausage gravy.  

The accompanying scrambled eggs were very fluffy.  They were fluffy to the point that they stand out among just about every other place I've ordered eggs in this town.  You get a substantial order of potatoes, which were above average.  I ordered them well done, and was glad I did.  My wife's order had barely any color on them, and I prefer them crunchy.

Servers wear pajamas and were very friendly, which was great.  My tea glass got close to empty once, but she was right there with a refill.  Excellent service overall.  Will we return?  It's not likely given the distance from our house.  But, if I was in the area again I absolutely would eat here and recommend you do the same.

This place is amazing! The food is outstanding and beyond flavorful! They have a wide variety on their menu to even include fresh made smoothies. No matter what you're craving I guarantee this place will have it. It's a weekly visit each day my husband and I have off together.

Another great meal! Never disappoints! Was craving some Biscuits and gravy and it totally hit the spot! Cooks behind the glass were nice to talk to especially since I was dining solo. Cannot wait for their second location to open so I don't have to drive quite so far!

Rise & Shine has become our go-to breakfast/brunch spot for birthday celebrations.  The Husband celebrated his birthday last weekend and they brought out a chocolatey fudgey pancake topped with whipped cream and sprinkles and of course, a candle.  The Little Gal ended up eating just about the whole thing, which we were super pleased about.  And the Little Guy proclaimed we should celebrate all birthdays here! (This was actually the third time we've eaten here, but the second time we celebrated a birthday.)

On my last two visits, I ordered the Homemade Corned Beef Hash & Eggs.  It comes with three eggs your way and a pot of bread, toast or biscuit.  Their corned beef hash has quite a bit of potato in it, and it's pretty yummy.  I'm glad I ordered it again and ate it all up. I chose the pot of bread this time and it reminded me of a cinnamon roll with the frosting dip on the side.

The Husband ordered the Lox & Cream Cheese Omelette.  He was a bit surprised to see the lox just sitting on the top of the omelette when he expected it to be folded in somehow.  He liked the dijon-cream cheese that was on there and needed to request more though.

Service was good the last two times we went, especially when we had Christine.  I just remember her being an awesome waitress who was super attentive, personable and energetic.  She was also quite efficient too!   

I will admit that our very first visit was years and years ago.  I don't remember how the service was then, but did remember (I started a review a long time ago.) what we ate then. We ordered the New York Steak, Spinach & Benedict-Bagel, Spice Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles, and Southern Style Chicken Fried Steak. The eggs were more medium when we ordered them over easy.  The steak wasn't very flavorful despite it being spice rubbed.  I realized I was looking for some kind of sauce to dip the steak in.  The chicken fried steak was also huge.  The pot of bread was good then, but a bit under baked since it was still doughy.

Our last two visits this year was a better experience than our very first time.  It wasn't necessarily bad then, it was just okay.  They are obviously doing well since it's busy and they have a second location.  There's usually a wait on the weekends, but we arrive later than most so it's not too long.  The decor is adorable inside.  I do tend to notice there are quite a few tables that need to be cleared and I think if they were cleaned up more efficiently, the wait could even be less.

This place is amazing! It feels cozy right when you walk in and all the servers are in their PJ's which is so unique. My husband and I ordered the steak and eggs and no joke, it was the best steak and eggs either of us had ever had! The steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned so nicely. If you're looking for a great restaurant, check this place out, it's delicious!

NOTE: This is a long review but they deserve all the attention. BELIEVE ME. If you are in Vegas, it is worth the drive off the strip to eat here. You will probably be stuck in line at those buffets anyways so use that time to drive here. 

First of all I want to thank, April, our waitress. She was great! Also, I wanted to thank Yelp for helping me find this place. It is a hidden Gem outside the Vegas Strip. This place IS the BEST breakfast place in Vegas. 

Customer Service: 5 stars - everyone is super friendly with big smiles. The manager does come around and sees how everyone is doing.

Atmosphere/decor: cute and very clean. Also in the back of everyone's T-shirts except the waitresses, its say, "help us by Yelping us" or something like that. I thought that was really cute and they found out I was a Yelp Elite. LOL

Food: 1000 STARS!! 

I really love this place. We called ahead to see if they take reservations but they don't. But I understood when I got there. Luckily when we went on Sunday morning, it wasn't packed and we got seated right away. The prices is decent for what you get. It was $50 for a group of 4. If you went to IHOP you would have paid MORE and got crappy food. I saw some reviews saying how it is a bit expensive, when you think about it, Denny's and IHOP is about the same if not more. For steak at those places it would be MINIMUM $20 per place. Here - LESS then $15! that is a STEAL! 

Okay, since I got all that out of my way, here is what we ordered:

-Chicken and Waffles with Pot of Bread - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/C9ImzBi5fn742ZcAYDww2A?select=4aw7W0owSbC7V9Zxa8T96w
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/C9ImzBi5fn742ZcAYDww2A?select=AR6qplqPO_OJC4aye5xbTQ
The Pot of Bread was AMAZING! MUST ORDER!! Honestly, it was the best bread I ever had. It came out piping hot and just perfect. It wasn't too sweet but wasn't plain. The bread was very fresh and soft. 
The chicken and Waffles was very yummy! The portion was REALLY big and enough to share. I was very impressed with the chicken. It wasn't dry at all and was perfectly crispy. It had a small kick of spice in it and it was perfect. The Waffles was nice and fluffy. I am not a Waffle fan but I LOVED IT! honestly fell in love with this place. 
-The ULTIMATE Steak and Egg Breakfast: the steak came out perfectly well seasoned and very tender. I loved it. It was just delicious. The Hash browns potatoes that came with it was a bit soggy. We thought it would come out more crispy then soft.
-New York Steak, Spinach & Benedict-Bagel - I didn't order it but I had a piece. It was delicious also! The Spinach went really well with the steak. 

Thank you Rise and Shine for the great experience. I will be back every time I go to Vegas. I just wished you opened up another one over here in Southern California. That would be a GREAT investment.
Food was great. Service was great. Only complaint is there is not one in Los Angeles. Take care of Amber she is a gem.
Love that they have French press coffee! I use this place for business meetings in the afternoon on weekdays and it's perfect! I love their decor too.

Not the best place. Nothing authentic or original, the cup of bread is microwaved dough that stiffens almost instantly after hitting the table. I'm a huge foodie and do my best in trying new breakfast/brunch places and sadly, this one left a sour taste in my mouth. The staff is great and attentive but the food didn't measure up. Sorry Rise & Shine.... I tried.

This place is awesome! There menu is full of options & the food is really good & love there smoothies & fresh squeezed orange juice. Our server Maria was amazing too. Everyone should definitely stop by and check this breakfast spot out

This is my 3rd time here.  The food is always good.  This time the service seems slow.  It took about 20 minutes before we even got water on the table.  By the time our waitress came to our table we placed our drink me good order.  She even forgot that I ordered water.  Maybe just a bit too busy.  This is a popular place.  The food was good tho - had corned beef hash and eggs.
Great food and service! Everyone is super friendly and the place is cute and clean. First time here but won't be our last. We were looking for a great breakfast place and found one!
This was by far one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas.  I own a concierge business in Henderson and went there with one of my clients.  It was excellent!  Try it out, you will be pleased.  C Hubel

Unbeknownst to us, we walked in 15 min before closing.  I asked when they were shutting down because it was late afternoon and was informed that the doors closed at 3 BUT they were insistent that we please come in and enjoy ourselves.  We even heard shouts from the kitchen for us to come in and sit down.

Our server told us to take all the time we need and we never once felt like we were keeping anyone from going home.  Our experience was super relaxed.  The management was incredibly accommodating and pleasant.

The food we delicious and very much to our liking.  The only reason I didn't not give a 5 out of 5 stars was because I thought the portion for my corned beef hash and eggs was a little light for the price.  Other than that we were extremely happy with the food and will be coming back again!

I'm gunna give my first visit to this place 3 stars. Then again, we went on the most craziest day which was Mother's Day so it was complete chaos. We sat near where they toasted the bread. Here's my complaint... some of the girls that handled the toast did not use gloves, tongs or even paper while handling the bread. This visit I watched all the waitresses and waiter make their toast, there was 3 girls in particular that used their bare hands the entire time and served the bread straight to their tables that way.... uh... GROSS! But kudos to the ones that did use the tongs and didn't use their bare hands. I have been in the food industry for a while and cross contamination this is a big no no for me. 

Here's my experience on the 2nd visit. Thank God It wasn't busy, we were seated right away. Our server was ON POINT this visit. Very friendly and thorough with our order, used tongs with our toast (5 stars for him!) and he checked on us every now and then if we needed anything without being annoying. Lol Before he served us our plates, he had gloves on putting all the finishing touches to our plate. He made this visit worth coming back. Thank you Gilbert for the excellent service!!! Hopefully we can ask for him all the time. 

I love how the staff is dressed in their pajamas. It really does fit the name for Rise and Shine. Love the flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling too! In my opinion, the price is a lil high for the food BUT.... you are paying for the experience and someone is cooking you a great meal. 5 stars to the Chefs for making me the steak, avocado and mushroom/spinach omelette. My food was cooked to perfection. The food actually tasted better since they weren't crazy busy. I don't even eat hash browns but man.... it was seasoned well and had the crisp to it, I ate it and that's rare! On yelp, I kept seeing everyone post the Cup of Bread and of course.... it was delicious! I think everyone should order that when they come to visit this place.

I will be back for sure! So glad it's close to my place too! Thank you Rise and Shine!

Once again, they never disappoint. Vanessa, the manager, stopped by our table and we chatted about our love (maybe obsession is a better word) for this place. This is our first stop here of two for our trip this time around. Thank you Rise & Shine for making us wonderful food again. You've got costumers for life

I loved the hash browns here. They were some of the best hash browns I've had. The rest of my breakfast was perfect as well. I missed the pot of bread and accidentally asked for toast instead. I then tried some of my husband's and it was so good. The staff was really friendly and so helpful. If I ever drive through Vegas again, I will try my hardest to stop here. Mmmmmm.

Great food, amazing service!  Our waitress, Kris, was attentive to every detail, friendly and outgoing.  And the food was awesome!  Kris recommended the Hazelnutnutella cappuccino--soooo yummy!

It's a bit of a drive from home, but well worth the trip.

Who said size doesn't matter?! 

Even if I don't finish it, I still like em big! 

Frosted banana pancakes full order is immense! Too much pancake for my tummy. But nothing that I couldn't wrap up for later. Super fluffy and moist! I probably put down one piece and became wayyy too full! Haha

Decided to try something out of my usual brunch order also and went for the biscuits and gravy! Boy was I stoked on this! The Gravy was muy delicioso. I didn't hold back on the carb intake this morning at all. The more the merrier. 

On  to other means, service was great, price was a bIt pricey but worth it. The servers wear pajamas to work. I thought it was a joke at first. But super cool touch! It makes me want to work here. 

Extra bonus Points for being a really well kept, and clean restaurant. Would return and would recommend
Location was on the noisy side. The food was ok nothing to rave about. The servers were nice and pleasant... but a bit slow.

Pot of bread.... nothing else has to be said. 
Yes, good food, nice servers in cute pj's, order the pot of bread and it will make you smile. I don't even eat bread and I order it.

This weekend was crazy!  Last night was a night full of libations and great friends.  This morning I woke up on my best friend's couch with an appetite.  I was told a little gem was right around the corner and that I really needed to try it out.  Why not?  It's time to grub!

The strip mall in Southern Highlands is such a wonderful mall with a lot of different businesses.  Restaurants, hair salons, gyms, you name it.  Very delightful.  Rise & Shine was located in the southwest corner of the strip mall next to Tropical Smoothie Caf√©.  When we got out of the car, we saw a few families waiting outside, so I knew it was going to be good.  We ended up waiting about 20 minutes for our table.  When you walk into this place, you are instantly taken to a whimsical story book.  The exposed air ducts are distracted by hanging umbrellas shaped and pictured like spring flowers.  The subtle orange and lime green walls are decorated with huge cow pictures.  The floor to almost ceiling windows are bordered by decorated clay mosaic-type arrangement.  This place is cute!  Our server's name was Lisa.  From the moment she greeted us, she was nothing but amazing!  Such an inviting personality and she really took the time to make sure our experience was top notch.  I LOVED HER!!

For starters, I got the fresh squeezed orange juice for $3.25 and the cup of coffee for $2.85.  Coffee was standard, however the OJ was out of this world!  Fresh squeezed is the only way to go!  You could tell it was authentic.  Not only was there pulp, there were also seeds in my drink!  LOVED IT!  For my meal, it was such a hard decision, but I decided with the New York Steak, Spinach & Benedict-Bagel for $13.50.  NY steak done the way you like it, over butter toasted bagel, topped with two eggs any-style, fresh spinach between the steak and bagel, hollandaise all over the place and hash brown potatoes.  OH-EM-GEE!!  I got the steak medium rare (the ONLY way to get it) and the eggs poached (duh, it's a Benedict!).  The steak was cooked perfectly with nice char marks.  The bagel served multiple purposes.  Not only did it create the Benedict, it soaked up any juices from the steak and hollandaise.  The spinach offered a light, crisp texture to the dish.  The hash browns were cut in big strips and cooked amazingly.  Browned with a crunch, but not dark enough to be considered burnt.  You break the yolk from the egg and mix it with the hollandaise sauce and it completely ties the dish together.  Hollandaise is not too lemony and not to runny.  On the top, they drizzle a little balsamic glaze which offered a slightly sweet and tangy element.  This dish was AH-MAZE-ING and I will highly recommend it to anyone!  

You guys, this place was out of this world!  So worth the wait, so worth the future drives (I live close to Boulder City).  I kept telling my best friends that this place was the perfect end to an epic weekend.  I truly believe it and think you need to stop reading this already and get your butt to Rise & Shine!

WORTH THE TRIP. My favorite breakfast place, awesome ambiance, AMAZING food, always amazing service. If you're thinking IHOP, spend the same amount of money for an experience and meal that's 10x better! 10/10 would eat again, recommend to everyone I know, always

I love this place! Everyone here is always so friendly and open to assisting me. I think it's great that they have happy workers who love their job! They get to wear their pajamas to work and they are literally never in a bad mood or crabby no matter how early it is. 

The interior is SOOOO cute! They have twirling flower umbrellas on the ceiling that instantly put you in an amazing mood.

My favorite is their eggs Benedict with spinach instead of ham! You can also substitute shaved turkey as a option. Their food always comes out in time, and my water is literally refilled every 10 minutes. I can't complain. I will definitely try to come here as much as I can since I live about 35 minutes away from here :(

We had a great experience at this restaurant on July 4th.  The food was fabulous.   We loved the bread in a cup and the creamy  sauce that came with it.  I had the Eggs Benedict which was outstanding.   The crunchy waffle was also very good.   Our waitress Ashley was very attentive.  We had some questions for the Manager Vanessa  and she was so nice!  Great customer service from the waitress and the Manager!   There was four of us and the bill was very reasonable at just under $40.   Everybody liked what they ordered.  I do definitely recommend this restaurant!!

maybe i was expecting too much with all the great reviews, but we could have passed on this place. came for sunday brunch. waited about 20 minutes before being seated at the booths. What bugged was that they were sooooo slow with cleaning the tables! the booth area that we sat at could have been readily available the moment we walked in if someone just had moved the dirty dishes! our waitress was nice but didn't pay attention to the fact that we had no silverware. the press coffee is strong but i guess i'm not a fan of illy's (not very aromatic). the steak definitely needed more flavoring (very bland), the hollindaise sauce runny and sour. hubby didn't think the chilaquiles was extrodinary either. overall, it's one of them "we came, we tried, we're.never coming back" places.
Great food & great customer service! Desire is very nice and attentive! Definitely coming back to try the cup of bread!

I love it when locally owned and operated restaurants survive in LV.   The place is absolutely cute with their huge flowers spinning from the ceiling and the servers in their pajamas.  This is one of my favorite spots to do breakfast on the weekends.   Everyone I bring here raves about the place too. 
 
The food is really good.  Some of the notable things I've had here include:
 
- Chicken Fried Steak (Thick and delicious gravy.  Steak might be a little too thickly battered.  Feel a little guilty eating it =)  Tasty hash browns on the side)

- Two Egg Breakfast (Think grand slam, but much tastier!  Not crazy about the kielbasa, so I'll stick with the sausage or bacon next time)

- Corned Beef Hash (Not like the smushy corned beef - its "real"!)

- Southwest Turkey Panini (Panini's here seem like a good option for lunch!)

- And always get their cute little pot of bread! (A light and fluffy Cinnamon roll - Yum!)
 
Like everyone else says, the service here is good.  Always kind with a smile.  I wouldn't say the food is OMG, but its solid.  Prices might be a tiny bit on the more expensive side, but I think it's worth it for the lovely experience

This is THE BEST kept secret in Las Vegas. Almost debated on reviewing, so I could be selfish and KEEP it a secret, but it was so good, I have to give the owners props. 

Here are all the reasons this place deserves MORE than 5 stars.

- Came at 10am on a Saturday and everyone was friendly. We actually had no wait, but I think that was more luck :) But it's still a positive in my book.
- Bread in a Pot. Delicious cinnamon swirled bread that was soft and buttery. Almost like a croissant... warm and came with whipped butter and strawberry jam. TO DIE FOR!!!
- My Man got the filet wrapped in bacon with eggs - cooked perfectly. The meat was tender, and you could tell it wasn't just cooked properly but that this place orders high quality ingredients.
- I got the chicken fried steak and eggs, and WHOA, the outside was cooked so crispy, and flavorful. Had a little spice kick to it which made it even better. Eggs cooked perfectly. 
- The side of potatoes were seasoned like an expect would. Not too salty, full of flavor. I don't like ketchup, and at other places I always end up with bland hash browns that need flavor and ketchup is the obvious choice but these tasted excellent plain. TWO thumbs up!!
- They serve illy coffee, and it is so good. Much better than typical diner coffee. It was refilled without me asking - another thumbs up!
- The server was friendly and cheery but not TOO cheery if you know what I mean 
- 3/4 through our meal, the owner stopped by. I think this is what tipped the review. He was friendly, and I LOOOOOOVE when someone in charge stops by your table. They should come by when things are good and bad, and not just when there is a customer complaint. He truly wanted to see how everything was, and it was very personable. Obviously we raved about the place to him, and I can't say enough what a great first impression it gave us.
- My man is an executive chef, and even he said this is the best place we have EVER had breakfast (totally exceeds Hash House, Egg & I, Cracked Egg, or ANY OTHER PLACE)


We will be back for sure. Our favorite thing on the weekends is to go out for breakfast, and this is definitely our new spot.

Man this place has gone downhill fast! Last three experiences here were awful. I don't eat meat but found bacon in my omelette twice. Today I ordered my omelette to go.  When I get there she tells me it's $17+ for an omelette and ice tea???? This better be amazing! She brings me my tea and food and thankfully I checked it and oopps no toast. Then she hands me my shot of tea that cost $3 !!! It was tiny! So tiny i sent it back for a refund. I work hard for my money and that was simply a rip off! Too top it off When I get home to eat my food I find a hair in it! Yes a gross  tiny hair! Some $17 omelette ! Needless to say they have officially lost me, and anyone I can tell not to go there, as a customer! It's too bad I thought Vegas actually had an awesome breakfast place finally.

Definitely a fan! Wasn't busy at all on a hot Friday morning in June. We were seated right away. The decor is very cute, with the colorful flower umbrellas, and it must be nice to work in your PJs! Our waiter suggested the green smoothie, which was indeed just a teeny bit sweet from the honeydew melon. The cup of bread was amazing! Like a cinnamon roll with the cream cheese frosting on the side for dipping. We ended up ordering two of them! I got the avocado eggs Benedict with hash browns. The balsamic vinegar drizzled on top was a little different, but it worked! We would definitely return next time we're in Vegas!

Cute breakfast joint just outside of the Las Vegas strip. The servers wear pajamas in the restaurant so hey, you can really wear whatever you want and not look crazy! 

The servers were friendly and quick to serve. The menu has a variety of food ranging from fresh juices to waffles, breakfast burritos, pancakes, and omelettes. It's a wide variety that can really meet the needs of anyone visiting the restaurant. We ordered the breakfast burrito, which we split. It was delicious and flavorful.

Eggcellent Breakfast 

Great little breakfast spot of the strip.
Friends recommended this spot to us for a delicious breakfast. 
The decor was extraordinary it was like a page out of Alice in Wonderland. Colourful  upside down flower umbrellas decorated the ceiling, some walls were decorated with broken tile mosaic and the walls were painted in bright vibrant colors. Great and friendly service. All wait staff were in pajamas adding to the relaxed ambience. 

With coffee we had a creative cinnamon roll called Bread in a Cup. It was served in a small coffee mug with a side of cream cheese frosting to dip the roll in. Lots of fun to eat.
I stepped out of my comfort breakfast zone and tried the house specialty it was the Spice Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles. It was tasty!! My steak was well prepared, the ranchero flavored chips were a perfect crispy texture. It was layered with refried beans, cheddar and cojita cheese, eggs, green onions, sour cream and a excellent homemade salsa! 

We will be back!
This is a great breakfast or lunch place. Food is great along with the service. It is always very busy which is always a good sign. Just have to go before or after those busy times.

First time visiting this place for breakfast. We live down the street and did not want to drive to the other side of town to enjoy breakfast. So we came here. We were not disappointed! The food was delicious and the staff was very nice. Laura was the sweetest woman! Since it was our first visit, she treated us to two pots of bread which was sweet and savory! The wait staff wear pajamas and the atmosphere is extremely cozy! We will be going there again because the food was amazing!!!

We were staying off strip and this was the closest breakfast joint to our hotel so we stopped in. The waitresses were super nice and provided great service. They also wear pajamas. Get your mind out of the gutter though, nothing naughty to see here. The decor is really unique and colorful. I had the Chorizo burrito and it was outstanding. We'll definitely hit this joint again if we're even south of the strip again.
Probably the best breakfast we've had in Vegas! Peanut butter and blueberry French toast and pot of bread were amazing!! Service was friendly and great

It's my dad's first time in Vegas after at least 14years. I wanted to take him to M resort studio buffet but found out they no longer have breakfast. Oh no!!!

I quickly yelp'd around the nearest breakfast places and found these guys. The pot of bread seemed like a unique idea and the photos looked great! 

Arrived at around 830am. Quaint little place in a shopping plaza. Loved how the servers wear Jammies (must be the best work uniform ever).

Decor: simple. I honestly do not remember anything that stuck out besides the turning floral umbrellas on the ceiling and the "cow and egg" advertisement on the wall. 

Orange juice: to my surprise, freshly squeezed.

Dads steak and eggs: steak was very tender and eggs cooked to a perfectly requested sunny side up. 

The hash: very unique. They look like flat pasta noodles cut in smaller segments. It tasted very fresh with a perfect crunch. 

My chicken fried steak: my steak was also very flavorful and tender. It was paired with a delicious gravy. I am not a big chicken fried steak fan but damn, this was good. 

Husband's chicken and waffle: the portion size was good. Nicely breaded chicken breast with a waffle. Chicken was tender and juicy despite being fried. 

Their pot of bread became 'tea cup bread' when we visited. It did not look too appealing since the shape was funky and some overfilled the cup. However, they were nice and warm out of the oven and very, very delicious. Dad and I are not fans of sweet bread but this was perfectly flavored with cinnamon and a bit of sweetness. Butter and tea cup bread for the win!

Pricing: a bit higher than your normal breakfast restaurant but hey, you're paying for fresh food. Totally worth it!

I am very glad our hotel decided to cancel their breakfast buffet because we got to experience something new and not your usual Vegas meal :)

I would definitely recommend and return at my next trip!!

I finally found a reputable breakfast place that I can be happy about in my neighborhood!!!  

The quality of the food is fantastic!!! 
It's very well prepared and done the right way usually I have to go to the Strip to find something like this.

It gets busy but not packed so you shouldn't have to wait long for seats. 
The staff are super friendly and provide great customer service.

Here are the items that are my favorite!!!

The Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes.
Southern Style Chicken Fried Steak.
Buttermilk Biscuits and Gravy 
Rise and Shine Chilaquiles 
Ham & Eggs Benedict
I live close by so had to try it. The food is average at best and the prices are outrageous. I would rather go to Hash House A Go Go or Metro Diner for better food and more reasonable prices

Delicious! First of all ...We went here on Mother's Day and there was only a 10 min wait at the location in Southern Highlands. I was amazed to see there were tables to sit and wait (a rare thing here) , the staff were so polite and inviting , the service was excellent and the food OMG ... came out hot and so delicious! I will definitely come back ... and we live all the way out in Centennial Hills !

Food was great! I ordered Old Fashioned Pancakes. They come in 2 or 4, I got 2 and it was more than enough! My husband got Extra Protuen Egg White Omlette...yummo!
Our server, Maria was attentive and made sure that we were happy with our food. Coffee regularly came around the room. 
We love it and will be back again!
Excellent chicken & waffles.  Absolutely the worst coffee I've ever tasted.  Bitter swill.  Two sugars and 50% Creamer and its still unpalatable.  Impressively bad coffee
The place is cute,like the umbrellas on ceiling,but the omelette was cold and hardly had any mushrooms,even they charge you 95c for them!

I really want to love this place because it's within walking distance of my house. It would be so nice to walk to weekend brunch but can't say I'll do that because this place isn't that good. I'd rather drive somewhere with better prices and better food. The chilaqules were the best thing that we had. I ordered the chicken and waffles. The waffle was horrible. Cold, dry, thin and stale texture. The chicken was good but not great. I didn't like their maple syrup, it had cinnamon in it and with chicken? Yuck. I ended up pulling it off and eating it alone. I asked for blue cheese dressing so I could salvage my meal and dip the chicken in it and all they had was cheap bottles ranch style dressing. The service was the worst part of the whole experience. The server treated us like we were bothering her and she was missing half the time...like seriously missing like not in the room or the kitchen.

This place is something special. My family and I had breakfast here on our way back home from Las Vegas and the food was absolutely incredible. I even told my wife that I would drive here from the Inland Empire in California just to have breakfast and drive back. The food is that good! I ordered scrambled eggs, bacon and waffles with hash browns on the side. The eggs were perfect, bacon was crispy, waffle was melt in your mouth and the hash browns were the best tasting I've had the pleasure to eat anywhere. My oldest son had the red velvet pancakes and the order was extremely generous. The cream cheese syrup that came with it was exquisite. The wife and my youngest son shared corned beef hash, eggs and bacon and the order was so big, the both of them could not finish it. My wife also had the french press coffee with her meal and that was incredible as well. The decor is original and the wait staff all wear pajamas as their uniforms which I thought was really cool.  Speaking of the wait staff, our server Riley was awesome, very attentive and made sure our beverages were never empty. The place was clean and you can tell the staff go the extra mile to make your meal very pleasurable. I can't wait to go back to this place when I get a chance.
Great place for breakfast!  First time here trying this place. I had a Avo-Veggie Benedict with a hollandaise, burgundy sauce. Excellent! Definitely recommend it!

This place is so good. The customer service is amazing. The orange juice is fresh squeezed and tastes like you're drinking it straight from the fruit. The Steakhouse omelette is the best thing to get! By far my favorite place to eat breakfast!!

We went here because Yelp told us it was the breakfast place closest to where we were staying.  Truth be told, I'd be willing to drive for hours to eat here. We came around 10 a.m. We waited about 30 minutes to be seated, but once we were seated, the service and fast and attentive. I ordered the chicken and waffles and oh my goodness.
