I've never had a better breakfast in my life. The breading on the chicken was light, crispy, and perfectly seasoned. The chicken was tender and juicy and a great contrast to the warm and fluffy waffle. The maple syrup was just buttery enough to tie it all together. I already want to go back for more. We will be back.

my gf and i come here pretty often since we live down the street. normally love it here. the young man in the black and red pj outfit has amazing customer service each time we come. but today we got served by the older lady in pink pjs and she just wasn't as friendly, don't know if she got annoyed because we switched up our orders a few times but sheesh that's just how it is when you work in the food industry. anyways, i think you guys should fix your policy on how if we don't get meat/protein you should substitute it for something else. Ex: we got the salmon and bacon bagel, we don't eat meat so we asked to substitute more salmon if we don't get bacon. She said we couldn't do that. I asked if we could sub for avocado instead and she said that's not an option either, we would have to get it on the side for an extra cost. Most food places offer substitutes if you don't eat meat. I work in the food industry and we don't charge extra for replacing meat with avocado? :-)

Pot of Bread. 
Italian roast coffee
Flower parasol chandeliers 
This is a great breakfast spot 
I have never had anything less than a fantastic meal with friendly, cordial staff. This is how every day should start

KIRA KIRA KIRA! This review is for her because she totally put on her A game com for our table! She was so pleasant and so hospitable! She made sure everything was going well with our food. I accidentally dropped my glass and it broke on the table and she came by in a heartbeat to clean it all up! So glad we got her as a server :)  can't wait to come back!

The waitstaff was incredible. Our waitress, Lisa, had a sweet and positive energy that made our experience truly phenomenal. The food was also amazing. I definitely recommend the bread in the pot and the steak and chilaquiles. Great coffee, too! This place is a breakfast gem!

My husband and I have been going here for many years, basically since it opened.  Although a little pricey, it was always worth it b/c the quality.
As of late, the quality of food isn't the same.  I've always replaced hashbrowns with fruit (strawberries, blueberries, and bananas), and the serving has always been generous.  The past 2 times they've put the fruit in the smallest dish, almost like a dish that you usually get syrup in.  It's been about 1/4 of what I used to get.  Then today, first thing this morning, they ran out of bananas.  
I don't believe their eggs are organic anymore, they're just different!  I don't mind spending the extra money for quality, but it's just not quality.  Also, they recently changed the coffee, and my husband doesn't care for it at all.
The service is still awesome, we love Riley!  Please stop cutting corners, we will go elsewhere if things don't improve

I have some odd, unexplained affinity for brunch. Something about eating eggs yet not having to wake so early for them gets me excited. As much as I love brunch, my brother outshines me in this respect tenfold. Every time I leave the house for it or come home from it, he seems to always criticize my choice in restaurant - usually exclaiming "What about Rise & Shine? They're so much better". Well David S., I finally tried them, and jesus! Why didn't I listen to you before?

A coworker and I decided to catch up over some brunch (she, too, shares my love for breakfast foods at normal people hours). After wavering in between this place and another establishment, we finally just took my brother's advice. The service was a bit slow at first, but was amazing once it picked up. Our waitress, Nicole (I believe that's her name) was so sweet and very attentive. Usually, I always gulp four glasses of water prior to the start of any meal. She was on top of her game - making conversation and filling our waters promptly.

To the food, we had both ordered the Baked Blueberry Croissant French Toast. When it came out, I think we were both about to die. This dish is not for the faint of heart or those struck with blueberry indifference. Literally, the dish was unrecognizable underneath the mound of blueberries. What croissant are you talking about? If that wasn't enough, there's a ramekin of the same blueberry sauce on the side! Jesus. One bite in, and I was in love. The blueberry sauce, candied walnuts, and croissant were euphoric. Not overtly sweet, just tart enough, with the perfect crunch and nuttiness of the walnuts. The portion is perfect for the price. I ended up taking half of it home in order to both save my waistline and taunt my brother by affecting his.

We had meandered a bit afterwards, inflicted with the pains of a food coma. Multiple people, other than our waitress, had stopped by for lively banter and to check up on the meal. Management was positively delightful - so genuinely sweet without any schmooze. 

Weeks later, I still feel somewhat guilty. Indulgence at its best is definitely what you'll find here. Unfortunately for me, the only occasion I can bring myself to come back here for will be my birthday - my waistline will thank me.

4 stars for the egg Benedicts, but everything else we've tried so far hasn't been very good- my mom got an omelet that was dry, I ordered chiquitos which came out as version of an ugly nacho- not edible.... while the hash browns are very good they are just hash browns. The customer service is great but another disappointing thing that happened was we order the ABC breakfast for my 16
Month old baby, instead of meat we wanted a little pinch of fried mushrooms considering a he's a baby and we don't mix dairy and meat together, this was something they wouldn't do unless we wanted to pay extra,.... which we did- but then left me thinking value wise if the mushrooms are more than the meat then what quality of meat are they using here?  
Anyway this place is really great in some ways but if the food isn't that good then I don't know if we'll be coming back a third time.

What a gem of a place we stumbled upon by accident. From our (very little) experience in Vegas, there are so many dining options and many places you can go wrong.
It was a Thursday morning, and we were seated immediately. The whole staff was chipper, and helpful. My husband and I both ordered build your own omelettes with hash browns and a side of toast or pot of bread. 
Order the pot of bread!! It sounds strange and we almost didn't try it but it was delicious! It is half cinnamon roll, half bread roll, all baked and served in a petite mug with cream cheese frosting. 
Our omelettes were cooked perfectly, the hash browns were thick and hearty and weren't too greasy, and although we didn't get any this trip they have a full juice bar running in the corner! We will be back again!

Steak and eggs were amazing. So were the chicken and waffles my boyfriend had. The French Press was cool. Good food. Waited about an hour for just my bf and I, I believe it was a weekday morning. But it was so worth it! The waitresses are dressed in cute pajamas. You could obviously tell they are running around like crazy because of how busy and packed the restaurant gets. I know how it is because I'm a waitress too. They are fast though. The service was great. We could tell our waitress was busy but she took the time to ask us how we were doing and showed us how to work the French press without talking to us in a rushed tone. Look up, they have awesome twirling umbrellas as ceiling fans. Come early to avoid the long wait. I would recommend this place.

Hello, and welcome to Rise & Shine (Henderson). We are big fans of the original, so we knew we had to check this one out. We arrived and expected a wait but were sat right away. Soon after drink orders were taken and we were given a few minuted to browse the menu. The menu was mostly like the original with a few exceptions, so we had a good idea what we wanted. I ordered the chicken fried steak and Josie had the french toast. My Chicken fried steak was of course quite good. However, it did have a different flavor than what I remember and it may be the batter. Either way i was quite delicious and I ordered more gravy because I can never have too much. The french toast was as usually quite delicious and seasoned and cooked well. The staff as usual was attentive and on top of our beverages. I might add that Josie had the hot chocolate and it was visually stunning as well as tasty.
Thank you for eating at Rise & Shine (Henderson). Yes, we will return and I am sure it will be as great as it always is. So, go and get some good breakfast. you won't regret it.

First time here but we loved the breakfast. This restaurant is just a little cheaper than eating on the Vegas  strip but the food quality was better than some of the strip options so it was worth the 3 mile drive out on our way back to LA. There wasn't a long wait for a party of two but the place did look a little busy but this was okay for a Saturday morning.

This place is so over-rated. The only reason we went there is for convenience three times since living in Southern Highlands. 

It's amazing this place runs like it does considering its owner was a big strip vp of f and b with Caesars corp. There is zero leadership in this place. Absent owner. 

Arrive. Dirty tables everywhere; but have to wait 15 minutes for a table. It's Sunday folks staff accordingly. Finally seated. Menus are laminated; all of the laminated corners are peeling back and dirty. 

Server shows up after we sit for 10 minutes and says sorry I will be back. 5 minutes later takes a drink order. Cloudy old iced tea. Gross. No sweet and low on table. Had to ask for it. 

We order our food. Takes 15 minutes. We watch as dirty tables around us sit dirty for up to 20 minutes as they have a wait list. What a shame. 

Ordered chicken sandwiches. Comes out with what looks like a 3-4oz half chicken breast on a big bun. Hardly sized properly to fill the bun. Plate smoking hot with the lettuce and tomato sitting directly on the hot plate. Now cooked and wilted. Comes with nothing? No mayo? Nothing?? Fries cold and a very small portion. Embarrassing. Asked for mayo to put on the sandwich. Also ordered a French onion soup. Came out with our sandwiches rather than before. Soup had so much thyme in it......tasted like a beef broth thyme soup. Gross. Went to get ketchup from the condiment caddy and it was empty. 

This place is dirty. Lacks the basics. Server was scatter-brained. No management presence. Bussers moving at a snails pace. Cooks eating behind the line. We rode our bikes to lunch. When leaving we saw two servers out back smoking. One was our server. Now I know why she was not around and why we waited so long. Wonder if she washed her hands. 

I guess three times is a charm. We want this place to be great because it's so close. Not again. Shame on you owner; you know better.

3 stars with the potential of 5 stars.  Rise and shine lacks service but makes up for it with there food.   I personally think they were overwhelmed with the amount of business they are receiving.  But there breakfast was awesome.  One the best steaks I've ever had!  And this is a breakfast joint...good stuff!  I'll be back to re-evaluate.

I'm obsessed with this place. Everything is so good. Their fresh squeeze orange juice is just amazing. My sister doesn't even like OJ and this she loved! Their coffee is good. Their cup-o-bread is BOMB!! Even their fruit plate sets them apart from other breakfast places. Pineapple, strawberries, bananas, blueberries, and melon! I mean YUM!! I haven't had something I didn't enjoy. I also love the atmosphere in here!
Great food & servers but I'm only giving 3 stars because EVERYTIME we come there is a long wait only because they don't have a bus boy & the hostess just stands around looking around

Great food, great atmosphere, great service! I had the Texas Toast Style French Toast and it was delicious! I can't wait to go back and try something new next time. Their menu had anything you could ever want for breakfast and SO much more! I would definitely recommend Rise & Shine!

Love this place. We live in Henderson and make the drive over to Southern Highlands to have breakfast here on Sunday's. I love the Cinnamon French Toast.  Be ready to wait a few minutes when you come if it's on the weekend -- it's very popular.

First time here and it was awesome. Laurel, our server, is a doll. She was sweet and kind. She made me and my friend feel right at home. My friend had an omelet and a side of pancakes. He ate everything. I ordered fried steak, egg whites, and hash browns. This is my first time having red meat in about three years. The steak was the best I've ever had in Las Vegas. Everything was fresh. Will definitely come back.

I've been here a couple of times. It is good and service is great. I love that they are in their pajamas as a uniform. ( almost like me when I cook breakfast for my family) It is a typical breakfast place for family. A lot of people come here but the waiting time when the place is busy is not bad either. Yes, I will be back here and I do recommend this place . :)

This place is the best breakfast spot in Las Vegas! They are known for their steak and eggs and chicken and waffles with cinnamon syrup. Delicious! 

On the weekends expect a short wait to get in as this place is always jamming with locals and visitors. Usually 25-30 minutes. 

The service is some of the best in Las Vegas with an extremely friendly and accommodating staff. 

Make sure to check this place out when having a craving for breakfast. May be the best breakfast spot in town!

I am visiting Las Vegas from California and I decided to eat breakfast at a restaurant that was not in a casino. I Yelped and found this restaurant that had 4 stars with over a thousand reviews. I decided to check it. I didn't expect for the staff to be dressed in pajamas. That made me giggle a bit, but great concept. The umbrellas on the ceiling were funny as well.  The extra protein omelette was excellent. The staff was great and the restaurant was very clean. I would come back and recommend this place to anyone.

The chicken fried NY steak and eggs sounded amazing. Not as great as it sounded. Overall, meal was ok. Not worth the 18 bucks I paid for it. Sadly I've had better chicken fried steak for far less. The quality of the steak did not shine like I assumed it would. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the hash browns were well seasoned, but not enough to make it 4 stars.

This just became my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas! I sat at the counter and ordered poached eggs with avocado and hash browns. 
The best hash browns! You'd think hash browns are hash browns?! Not after you try them at Rise & Shine! Busting with flavor! No extra seasoning needed! Just the perfect texture! 
Every server and host was beyond friendly and accommodating. They all had a smile on their face and were fast and attentive. And coffee kept coming! 
This is definitely a must!

Best breakfast food I have tasted in a long time and we didn't have to wait to be seated. I guess you can call it timing. If you are not a big eater I strongly suggest sharing meals because the servings are big.

This place seems pretty great. By the name I expected a diner experience, but I am pleasantly surprised. We were in Vegas for a convention and needed breakfast before driving back to California. 

The wait staff are really nice and efficient. The place is clean and decorated very colorfully. 

They serve Lavazza coffee, which is my favorite! You can even get a French press of coffee if you so desire. 

They have a "Pot of bread" which is a dinner roll mixed with cinnamon and sugar baked in a small pot. Not too sweet and quite delicious. 

The portions of everything that I've seen come out are quite large. No way you can leave hungry. More likely you'll want to share. 

They have non GMO organic hot sauce on the table, not sure if anything else on the menu is. 

I had steak and eggs and it was very yummy. The steak tasted grilled, not chewy or anything. The eggs were perfectly cooked. I like my hash browns crispy and these were not but the were still good. 

My husband had corned beef hash and really liked his too. Overall a great experience!
Perfect hangover breakfast, like a warm hug.

I came in for breakfast around 9am and the place was already busy! However, I had a party of 4 people and we didn't wait for long at all to be seated. As we got seated we were greeted by a nice sever who gave us as much time as we needed and since it was our first time there I have to admit we took about 15-20 minutes before deciding what we wanted. I ordered the Ultimate Steak and Eggs w/ the "bread-o-cup." After waiting for about 15-20 minutes our food came out and their portioning was big! My favorite part was the bread-o-cup, it's a bread with cinnamon and they give you a side of glaze to dip your bread. The total for my plate alone was $18 including tax. Our server was amazing she always checked up on us and always had a positive attitude, she recommended the bread-o-cup to me and she was excited for me to try it. Also, their employee's here wear pajamas, it's so cute! This breakfast restaurant's work attire is so unique and creative, the environment is filled with families and happy morning people in my opinion haha. I recommend you come in to this place right when they open or between 7am and 9am because anytime after that they have a long wait. When we were done eating there were people waiting inside to be seated as well as groups outside to be seated. This is a great breakfast spot.

I picked up take-out to go and the food was pretty good I had the steak and eggs while I was waiting for my food the staff was very friendly and helpful offered me a free refill on my drink without even asking. It was a surprisingly short wait time and the food was just as delicious when I took it home.
Absolutely perfect brunch, along with great service. Be sure to try their pot of bread!

I've been here many times I feel as if the quality wasn't there this time. I wasn't satisfied all the way with the dish. (Chilaquiles) it wasn't bad either. Not sure how to really explain everything else was good.

Very mediocre and overpriced. Super slow service. Waitress was totally overwhelmed and it wasn't even that busy. 

It's a shame because this is the closest breakfast spot near me and I really wanted to love it.

We came out on Saturday morning for breakfast. 

This was my first time eating here, although I had popped in once about 5 years ago and had a bite of a friend's steak:  it was delicious.

They were busy, but not packed, and we were seated right away.
Our server was very sweet, and very patient, as it took us a while to decide on what we wanted to try.  

I had the New York Steak, Spinach, and Benedict Bagel which came with potted bread, and my fella had the Spice rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles, also with potted bread. We both had a tea and a coffee as well. 

So. 
Potted bread.  This was like a sweet, warm cinnamon bun in a little mug served with butter.  You really don't *need* the butter, its that good on its own, but the butter was tasty too.  I'd go back and order just this...a few of them.  They were awesome. 

When our breakfasts arrived, I was thrilled with mine.  It looked amazing, and tasted even better!  The steak was cooked to perfection: mid-rare, and seasoned beautifully.  The poached eggs had a lovely runny yolk, and the hollandaise was not too rich.  The spinach gave it a nice touch, and while I didn't really eat all of the bagel, it was delicious, and perfect for sopping up the yolk and juices from the steak. 

My fella's Spice rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles LOOKED amazing.  I, unfortunately, was unable to try any, due to an avocado allergy.  We had asked for them to make it without avocado, but it came out with it on top.  My fella doesn't like avocado, but isn't allergic, so he just scraped it off, and our server apologized about it.  I was bummed that I didn't get to try it, but maybe next time. He really enjoyed it a lot, and the steak was great.  (that was on the side, no avocado!)

Really, the only reasons for the missing star is the avocado, and the fact that for a plain cup of coffee, and a plain bag of Earl Grey tea, it is $2.85 a piece.  That's a little steep for just brewed coffee and a tea bag, if you ask me, especially when we were never offered refills.  Honestly though, its not a huge deal, or a deal breaker, because the food was so delicious, and there was SO much of it!  

I have every intention to come back to Rise and Shine for breakfast again.  They have a good sized menu that I look forward to testing out!

New breakfast spots are cropping up everywhere and I'm loving it ! Apparently the word is out - around 10 AM on a Saturday we had a 20 minute wait for two. 

The decor is absolutely adorable - hanging flowers are all over the place and the wait staff wears really cute pajamas - love it! 

The food we tried was all very good. My husband had the blueberry french toast strudel . It was like a slice of a delicious casserole. If you're in the mood  for sweet but not disgustingly so, I recommend this! We also tried the chicken and waffles which was good, especially if you haven't had Roscoe's. It was much, much better than the one at HHAGG, and at this point the best I've had in Vegas. It was a big chicken breast instead of fried chicken which did make it much easier to eat. The waffle was pretty boring, but well executed. The chicken was a touch spicy, and the whole thing was served with cinnamon syrup. I would get it again, but I can't say it's crave-worthy. 

Biggest bummer about this place was service was a disaster. Drinks were late and forgotten, the pot of bread supposed to be served prior to the meal was brought after, etc, etc. They all seemed very rushed and stressed out. Given how brand new this place is, they get a pass, but I would hope the service improves in the future! 

It's no Babycakes, but it does hold its' own. In a sea of breakfast spots at every corner, this place deserves a spot in anyone's short list .

OMG!!!  Found my fav breakfast place in LV.  Their breakfast is so good you'll want to slap yo.... Someone. Bacon wrapped steak with eggs and truly home made tasting hush browns. Mmmmm good. Than I dug into my wife's order: velvet chocolate pancakes... One bite and I couldn't stop smiling, I forgot 5 bills I lost earlier gambling. World seemed brighter, there was childhood music playing somewhere in a background all of a sudden. It took me whole 5 minutes to come back to reality. Yes, this place will be our regular stop from now on!!
So good! Waitress was awesome! Food was out fast and eggs, steak and everything was cooked to perfection! Best breakfast I've had in a while too bad we're not from Vegas or else we'd be a regulars!!!
Really f***in' good steaks!!! Recommend like leave your house now to come eat here!!!

Early morning breakfasts spot with great food and you can wear your pajamas to the restaurant?!??!  Yes, here at Rise and Shine you can wear your pajamas and have delicious food.  I stopped into rise and shine while completing  an early pick up and and this place is absolutely amazing. During my visit I ordered the parfait which was really good, I had the clover honey, strawberry and granola parfait.   It comes in a milkshake size glass with the granola on the bottom of the glass, then the next layer is fruit and then the next layer is the vanilla yogurt with the clover honey on top of the yogurt.    

I also ordered the chicken and waffle.  The waffle came out hot, fresh and flakey.   You could cut the waffle with a fork.  The chicken (one breast) that came with the waffle had a little kick of heat to it.  The chicken was cooked chicken fried steak style, because it did not have the bone in.  Overall, this is a great brunch spot.

Update: I think yhey gave me day old pot of bread? It was stale, dry, and cold. NOT FRESH. What a damn insult.

This is a highly popular item for it's freshness, taste, and oven hot delivery. Not today!
Everything was so yummy!!!! French toast was to die for!!!! I also had the Lox and Cream cheese omelette omg I was in heaven. This place was so good we went twice during our Las Vegas 5 day trip.

Great food! Super friendly staff! A great place to start your morning off right with the most important meal of the day.

I am looking forward to having breakfast here again soon!

ill be honest this wasnt my first pick. the line at Southpoint breakfast buffet was ridiculously long.  and after eating here im glad it was. this place is off the hook. google drove me through some weird residential area so i was skeptical coming in. coming in the ambience is stylish and contemporary but not enough to snob me off because all the waitresses are dressed in their pajamas! our waitress was very friendly even though my son had a tantrum attack she was very helpful and didn't really give me any dirty looks like most people would. we ordered the country fried steak and the banana crunch pancakes and also create my own omelet with all veggies it was all super yummy. Even the hash browns which I'm really not normally a fan of....was so delicious that I almost finish the whole thing!  I have a rule of generally not visiting the same place twice in a trip I would stop here again and have order the same exact items again and stuff my face! love this place but it gets busy.

We stopped here on our way back from the Strip. Needless to say, we needed healthy food. The juices and the smoothies are absolutely delicious and made with real ingredients. The food came out hot and the service was amazing. Maria is very attentive and quick with whatever you need. Just avoid the waitress with the pink hair. She was loudly yelling at multiple coworkers for not seating her, all at the host stand. Not the best thing to walk into. But other than her, it was a great breakfast shop.

Excellent food and huge servings...worth every penny. The waitresses wear their PJ's. Very original great neighborhood restaurant. Much bigger on the inside than it looks from outside. I would recommend the Eggs Benedict.

This is a popular breakfast spot in a suburban part of las vegas. I was excited to try this place because my boyfriend has been raving about the red velvet pancakes ever since he came here with a group of friends a while back. We finally made it to Vegas together and made this one of our foodie destination. My boyfriend got the steak and eggs which were very salty. I got the biscuits and gravy which were good but not the best I've ever had. We also got a stack of the red velvet pancakes. Now those were great especially with the cream cheese icing. The service however was very subpar. We only got our drinks refilled one time as we were leaving and our plates had already been cleared away. Additionally many of the staff were complaining about job related issues within earshot of the customers.
Amazing food. Steak & Chilliques is the best! Very good coffee. Friendly relaxed atmosphere.

Items selected:

Pot of Bread - Cinnamon
Chicken and Waffles
Peanut Butter and Jelly French Toast
Illy Coffee with refills

Always on the lookout for a great local breakfast spot and already in Henderson for business reasons I decided to make my way over to "Rise & Shine, a Steak & Egg Place" largely based on the fact that anyone willing to go out on a limb and sport the website www.bestbreakfastvegas.com clearly warrants judgment; my verdict suggesting blatant false advertising.  Featuring a kitschy design with floral umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and servers in their pajamas plus a menu of breakfast and lunch classics ranging from classic egg dishes to more novel options such as red velvet pancakes service was spot on despite the early morning rush and with my order placed within moments of seating coffee and water remained filled to the brim at all times.  With good service and fun d√©cor it was my hope that the food at Rise & Shine would indeed shine but perhaps because I didn't order "Steak & Eggs" the selections I tasted were average at best, the sort of place where big portions trump high quality ingredients - the chicken crispy but largely flavorless over a hotel lobby quality waffle and the pot of bread tasting mostly like yeast, something that Log Cabin 'syrup' and butter did not remedy.  Better in quality but still marred by low quality ingredients the French Toast would fare the best of the morning's options but given the location and the cost I can name no less than a dozen restaurants more deserving of the 'best breakfast vegas' title.

It was our first time at this place and we were greatly impressed with the food and the ambience. 
Our server Maria was at the top of her game - she made it very easy for us. She's a gem!! 
We will definitely be back!

Okay let me start off with my first visit at Rise and Shine was amazing. But I'm guessing it was because this was around the time they first opened up and they gotta shoot for the moon on great breakfast ya know.

But my last recent visit here, my pancakes were undercooked. Like I'm talking I cut it open and batter would seep out with my blueberries. Eggs were great, cooked perfectly. Was just disappointed to receive my favorite breakfast item and it being undercooked. 

Customer service has been, and still is very warm and friendly.

A bit conflicted about this place...not far from my house...every time I go there is some thing just a tad off...perhaps it is I who is a tad off...lol...reasonable prices and food is decent...more three stars than four

Popular neighbor Resturant that is tucked into the corner of this everyday strip mall. The Steak n Eggs were far from everyday standards. The decor & the staff are all a little quirky, but in a good way. The steak & eggs were cooked perfectly. The steak had a correctly cooked  juicy medium inside, but the outside had a awesome texture, very similar to a nice high heat steak char. I believe they use a coffee ground rub on the steak. The eggs were scrambled & fluffy & the hash browns were plentiful & cooked properly. Bread in a cup choice was a nice added sweet enhancement to the breakfast. I would definitely visit again & try other delicious look items that were coming out of the kitchen.
Amazing service, tried the avocado Benedict and it was one of the best breakfasts I may have ever had! Definitely recommend if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and relax.
Yummy! The food was absolutely delicious,  the service was fantastic (and I love how all of the waitresses wore pajamas ), and the actually restaurant was very cute and quaint.

Soooo good! The hype everyone is making about their chicken and waffles and pot of bread is definitely valid. Their chicken and waffles is nowhere near Roscoe's quality, but it's a close second. Definitely the best in Vegas. Can't complain about the portion size either. The pot of bread is definitely not what I expected. I thought it'd just be a roll type of bread but I was wrong. To my surprise, it was more like a Cinnabon! And it looks small but it's still pretty filling. 

The servers and hostesses were extremely friendly as well. Our server was sweet and gladly answered any questions I had about the menu. Not to mention, they're all dressed in pajamas which makes the place even better lol.

The reason why I have this place 4 out of 5 starts is because of the steak and eggs I ordered, which were also talked highly about on Yelp reviews. Personally I didn't see what the big deal was. I've had better tasting steak and eggs at Southpoint during their late night specials. The size of the steak was decent but the flavor was eh. 

Other than that, I'd highly recommend this place for a staple breakfast spot.

Do i have words to describe how fabulous it was ? I don't think so. But i'll give it a try .
Our last meal in Vegas before going back to L.A..bored of hotels and wanted to try something else,somewhere else. I search for a breakfast place and this one got my attention as we were in the mood for steak and eggs.

Looked at the menu and with so many steak&eggs options,didn't really knew what to go for. Luis(our server) was knowledgeable and recommend us the Ryb eye . Also explained what cup-a-bread was and at first i said meh..maybe not. But he was so excited about it that i went for it. Great choice ! (They warm it up too)

The meat was flavorful and ,the hasbrown had green onions in it . Best steak ever ! I promise you. I ate at fancy steakhouses but this place make the other ones look like a joke.

Luis,you are great and your recommendations amazing ! Thank you !

This place is cute and the staff are friendly! 

The food is fine but nothing special really. My husband and I went in yesterday and ordered 2 french press coffees, one orange juice, and 2 omelets. $38 dollars. This place is way over priced. Also it would be great if they had some more healthy options too. 

Ive been here about 4 times before and will probably end up here again at some point. The things is for the area they really have no competition. 

I want this place to do well but it needs some improving. Either up portions or lower prices. Also sat down at 11:15am and food got to us at 11:55, seriously!! 40 min for an omelette. They also used to have fresh jam but yesterday it was regular plastic containers.

This is one of the places I recommend to everyone. We are here at least once a week and if for some reason we don't get out there that often - we crave it like crazy.

The french press coffee is awesome and I am a big fan of the bacon wrapped filet bacon sandwich. The hubby loves the chicken & waffles. We both love the country fried steak BUT sometimes it has too much fat on it for our liking.
 I love the ambiance and great service.

We try to get there early enough to beat the rush and when the weather's right, we love eating on the patio with our dogs.

Highly Highly HIGHLY recommend
Delicious!!! Found this gem on yelp and it did not disappoint! Excellent locals spot. Great customer service.  We will be back! Yum yum yum!

Spectacular!  Everything we ordered was incredible and the service was outstanding!

We went on a Friday late morning had no wait at all.  But it was pretty full at that hour so I would imagine weekends would have a wait.  There was very little space to sit and wait inside, so I'm glad we didn't get stuck waiting out in the heat :)

First of all, you HAVE to get the pot of bread as your accompanying starch.  Holy crap, it is freaking awesome!  It's a biscuit and a cinnamon roll smashed together and then baked in a coffee cup.  Slather it with some butter and you're in heaven.

I ordered the chicken fried steak, which was a gamble since I'm from Texas and have a pretty high bar.  It was SO good!  Really tender with a delicious coating!  Only complaint is that the coating didn't adhere very well to the steak but that's really just a quibble :)  It came with eggs and cream pepper gravy, yum yum!  I also got one of their smoothies which took forever to come out, but it was really delicious.

My husband order the rib eye chilaquiles and it was just as good as some of the ones we've gotten in Mexico.  We were super impressed!

The decor was a bit hokey but cute.  They have flower umbrellas inverted and hanging from the ceiling.  It helped transform the location from a strip mall to something more inviting.  

Finally, the service was super attentive and prompt.  

Overall, we loved it and highly recommend it!  We definitely will be hitting this up next time we're in Vegas!

Came here on a Sunday around 1pm and it as packkkkked. 

They served fresh squeezed orange juice.. but for $3.25 for a 6oz cup, I'll pass haha. 

The food here is pretty pricey. The least expensive thing you'll find is the burger that is about $8 or $9. The rest, is $10 and up.

I think I speak for Bun and I, the hash browns were amazing. Thinly sliced potatoes with just the right amount of taste to it. The pot of bread, nomz, cinnamon bread rolled up into a cup -- it's popular and around 1pm, they were also gone!

However, the food, it was meh. And combined paying about $30 for just a brunch, we'll be back but not too frequently. My chicken fried steak, I've had better and would say Egg Works makes it more nomz.

Definitely worth a try if you're in the area but wouldn't be worth going out of your way for.

Been to both locations several times and have never had a bad experience here. Ultimate steak and eggs breakfast is a timeless masterpiece. Cup of bread even more delicious than it looks. Wait staff is always polite, and the whole pajama thing is a cute feature that makes me smile everytime I come here. These people know how to have fun and I love having breakfast here whenever I'm in the area. Rise & Shine for life~

I really came into this restaurant with an open mind. Considering the name of the place (steak and eggs) and being mostly vegetarian/vegan - I already had my doubts... 

However, I gave it a chance because they had promising menu items that just sounded perfect for a late Tuesday morning. 

I'd say Rise N' Shine is average and places itself along side known restaurants like Cracked Egg, IHOP, Original Pancake House or Egg Works in good options. For the price, the plate size accommodates well. 

That being said, value isn't always in the enormous helpings because it should still look and taste great. Rise N Shine fell short here due to the poorly seasoned and lack of flavors, random arrangements of portions on the plate, as well as how underwhelmed you'll feel at nearly $15.00 average per person pricing.  

Let me elaborate... 

The poached eggs for the Benedict was very under cooked which is very unappealing. The red onions were stacked and kept in a ring formation giving you overwhelming bites of red onion which completely takes away from the harmonious flavors of hollandaise, capers and lox. :( 

The oatmeal is served in a deep large white ramekin which to the average adult may be great, because it keeps the bottom lava hot - but for us parents - this is a disaster as you'll spend several minutes cooling off every bite for even the most advanced toddlers. 

The french press in all of its glory was very basic in flavor and could use a better selection of roast to complete the experience. 

Overall this place is so-so for kids and really comes across as your sub-par Saturday or Sunday morning and lunch place - which I'm sure has astronomical wait times, as they usually do. Oh and the wait staff is definitely new and needs some practice with sense of urgency and ability to recall orders and average requests from one table to the next. 

Largest negative takeaways from that $$ classification will be the lack of parking in this ALWAYS busy location as well as price over value over satisfaction ratio that just isn't hitting high numbers right now. 

For the heavy meat eaters or 1200+ calorie seekers, might be most suitable. But for those consciously healthy folks, or parents with large families, you'll find challenges. Solid 3 at best.

Stopped here on my way back to Phoenix. This place was delicious!! I ordered the avo everything bagel with hash browns. Yum!! It was so big and filling and tasted amazing. I will stop here every time I'm in town now

I had the chicken and waffles....chicken beast without the bone, juicy lightly crisp.
Waffle hot off the griddle, served with chicken on top of the waffle and sprinkles 
Of powdered sugar. I liked the way the syrup is served......warm in a bottle of cinnamon sticks:)

I've been wanting to go eat at this place for a long time, so I was ecstatic when my sister took me to brunch one morning. After waiting 20 minutes to get our order taken we finally went ahead and got the steak, seemed fitting. 

There were many things wrong with our plate, the steak looked burned but they tasted fine so we didn't send it back. After finishing our meals we headed out and we ended up getting food poisoning!!! It was horrendous. The place let me down. Even after I was told not to go I gave it a chance but was disappointed. I will never go back.

The service was poor we Dist get coffee refill until we asked.
It is on the expensive side. We had pancakes with bacon eggs and a bun in a pit one coffee and it was 19.62.  That is a lot the bun in a pot was small and 1 star to me I saw on yelp the rave and it was a disappointment both in size and taste. 
They use Mott apple juice and pour it in a carafe. The syrup is log cabin I sat in the way back and saw the guy pouring this am.  They do make fresh squeeze orange juice though. 
See my photos.
We won't be back here.

The management is the best advertisement because he is friendly, humorous, and attentive. Another place were listening to someone speak about food with excitement. I love a place that does that, then genuinely seeks out customers opinion. I admire when people refuse to allow themselves to become complacent with a good menu. Besides the gentleman that greeted and seated us, the rest of the staff were also pleasant. 

Today was my birthday and it was a fitting place to celebrate. Although most of the festivities will be tomorrow, this relaxing brunch made my day. When I think of festive eats, I go all out. I had ordered the chicken and waffle. When I first cut into the waffle, I was a bit disappointed. It lacked the crunch that I normally love, but after thinking it over, I can understand why they lean towards this style. The chicken is moist, crispy and seasoned to perfection. Having a more cake like waffle gives contrast in texture and soaks up the maple syrup better. You will be dousing your dish in this warm condiment. It is outstanding. The maple syrup alone deserves five stars. The steak and eggs are also delectable. The 8oz cut is marbled well with just enough fat to keep the meat moist and tender. The eggs have a clean flavor that does not need any salt. The potatoes were soft like mashed potatoes on the inside, but had a crunchy outer layer that was nice. Nothing on this plate needed ketchup or steak sauce. We ordered the pot of bread with this meal and it was gone just as soon as it hit the table. The jam was filled with huge chunks of strawberries, but was quite sweet.

Rise and Shine would be perfect if only it offered some lighter fares. On special occasions, like today, I am willing to go crazy on my caloric intake.  Yet a part of my subconscious will not let this go without guilt. I am not even Catholic, so what's with this overbearing feeling? It might be some time before I visit again.

We came here today for breakfast. It was pretty busy. We waited about 25 minute before we got seated. I got the ham and eggs Benedict. I liked everything except the ham it was pretty salty. Our server was nice but slow. Would come back if in the area.
Get the pot of bread, it's delicious!  Chicken and waffles are amazing.  My son loves the pancakes.   Come early or there will be a long wait.

What a CUTE little breakfast spot in a suburban area right outside of the Strip. 

Here are some fun things to know about Rise & Shine:
1. All the waiters/waitresses are dressed in their PJ's (lucky them!).
2. Their menu is quite extensive but not to the point where it's an encyclopedia.
3. Order the chicken and waffles (it's what they're known for).
4. The Red Velvet Chocolate Chip pancakes were the best I've had and their maple syrup is legit, and legit meaning it's not some cheapy syrup straight out of a plastic bottle.
5. Service is friendly and efficient here. They are very accommodating.
6. While you're enjoying your meal, look up at the ceiling and admire the fun umbrellas turned into flowers just spinning about. Felt like I was Alice in Wonderland. :)

Came here on a Thursday morning and we were seated right away. We ordered plain bagel and their ribeye steak and eggs. My steak was perfectly cooked! I ordered medium rare and as much as the meat is not that thick, it was still cooked how I wanted  will be coming back to this place and will be trying their chicken and waffles!
Really cute place but it's a little small. We waited about 25 minutes for a table. The waiters wear pajamas which is kinda cool. I will come back when I'm in the neighborhood.
Great steak eggs  combo with egg whites nice decor friendly staff as well I'll be back soon !! The spot!!
This place is amazing! Everything I expected and more the service is fabulous and the food is better! Definitely recommended

After my last review where I gave them 3 stars based on my experience NOT FOOD which was so yummy, I felt compelled to update my review on this place. A manager from the restaurant contacted me via email and they were truly concerned and apologetic about the service I received. That to me says a lot about the integrity of a business. They truly care not only about delivering a superb product, but making sure that every customers experience is equally as superb! They definitely deserve 5 stars!! The food is excellent and there customer service is top notch and genuine. Anyone who has not eaten there definitely should, they are awesome and deserve your business and it is the best breakfast place in Las Vegas!!

One of our absolute favorite places to get breakfast. We always split the French toast with the eggs and bacon on the inside. And with the fresh squeezed orange juice? Hands down a place you have to check out.

This place has such great options for everyone. I love the decor since it's not your regular breakfast spot and the service is excellent. We have been here twice and have both tried different things and everything has tasted great. Their cup o bread is a must try it's so good it'll leave you asking for seconds. Try this place you will not be disappointed.

By far and away my favorite breakfast place. We eat at the one in Southern Highlands. Today they weren't up to their normal standards. They were out of tortillas, a bit frustrating but ok. The pot of bread was way over cooked, to the point it was rock hard on the top. The eggs were under cooked. We had to ask for silverware and syrup. They were just a little off with everything, not sure if the owner is focusing on his other restaurant, or just an off day. We won't give up on this location. Yet:)

I don't even want to write a long review for this place. They made us wait a pretty damn long time just to "create" a wait time when clearly, there were many open tables.

Food is eh. Bacon wrapped sirloin? Sounds good right? WAY overcooked and disappointing.

This place was great. I ordered their steak and eggs breakfast combo. Their steak alone was 5 stars for sure. However the eggs didn't really have a taste and the hash browns were good...not great. I do recommend this place for their steak, it was incredibly delicious. Staff was great as well.

We had steak chilaquiles, medallion bacon wrapped steak with eggs, 1+2+3 kids breakfast and a side of sour dough toast = $41.00.....wait time was about 10 min on a Sunday afternoon (no bad).  Pretty good breakfast place...clean and decent service.  Ample parking available -- will be back to try something else (prob lunch items and the crock of French onion soup)!
The ribeye is great. We ate there this morning right when they opened and everything is fresh. The waitress was pleasant and I will definitely be coming back!

Seated immediately but you could tell they had been busy up until we got there.  Three of us, coming back from a hike in Red Rock Canyon, hungry as... One ordered simple scrambled eggs and side of hash browns.  One got the Burrito Ol√© with chicken and an iced mocha.  I got the egg white and chicken omelet with cup o bread!  The cup o bread was served piping hot immediately.  The iced mocha came with more whipped cream than mocha and was not well received.  Scrambled eggs served dead last, almost as an afterthought and they were stone cold.  We did send them back and quickly got a really hot plate of scrambled eggs!  The omelet was delicious, the burrito's chorizo had a different flavor than we expected but was nice and spicy.  Overall, we'd come back, maybe just to see the servers in their pjs.  The food was actually very good except the tiny missteps of eggs and mocha and that didn't really have anything to do with taste in the long run.
Went on Halloween and the place was very decorated!  Liked the service we received from mini mouse lol. Very nice area, and nice service..

I've been a regular customer since they opened.  GREAT food and GREAT service.  Up until last week they had great coffee, but sadly changed supplier and brand of coffee. No more coffee for me but it's a personal taste thing... I'm sure people will like the new coffee.   Still a great place to eat.

We are always on the look out for a good breakfast spot. This is located in a very busy strip mall but we had no problem finding parking close. When you walk in your eyes instantly go to the ceiling where they have brightly colored umbrellas with flowers on them opened up and facing downward. Some of them are on spinners. Very cute idea.
The waiters and waitresses are dressed in their pj's. Yet another cute concept!
The menu seemed very healthy. Some gluten-free options, fresh squeezed juices, etc.
They are supposed to be known for their steak and eggs.  I am not a huge fan of steak and eggs so I ordered the Banana Foster flake pancakes with 2 eggs and a banger sausage. Banger sausage...interesting just one came with the meal. It isn't your normal greasy sausage..interesting.. it is actually kind of hard to describe but it was really tasty. Now for the pancakes...delicious. I am not a syrup eater so for me the pancakes were just right. Enough sweetness and the crunch from the corn flakes was perfect...a griddled  banana was on top along with whipped cream and nuts.
My man loves country fried steak and eggs...he said it was really good. It is made with a NY strip steak. He ordered a side of a biscuit and gravy and he said the gravy they used on the biscuit was different than on the steak...it did look different, not as much sausage and thinner. He preferred the gravy on the biscuit. But he said all in all it was a good meal. I had the fresh squeezed watermelon and strawberry juice. Mmmm mmmm mmmm. I am a sucker for anything watermelon though! :)  We hit the restaurant at the perfect time because after we sat the place filled up!!! 
We will definitely be going back.

I got a breakfast burrito.  They used hash browns, and I prefer saut√©ed or roasted potatoes. The refried beans tasted like the ones from the grocery store that you get out of a can.  They were extremely busy when I ordered to go, and it took a very long time to get my order.

Pot of bread is yummy could have eaten 3 or 4. Lol
Corned beef hash good. Eggs done perfect. French press coffee highly recommended. Bacon is thick sliced and smoked. Hash brown cut like flat noodles.  Hefty serving of pancakes. Love the casual attire-pjs.  Will come back want to try more.

Such a cute spot for a nice breakfast/brunch! The servers are dressed in jammies and the ceiling is full of upside down umbrellas...I mean come on, how awesome is that? I can't even begin to suggest to you what to order since the menu is full of scrumptious bites. The one thing I do think you should order is the bread in a cup---YES.

I love this place. It's easily my favorite breakfast place in town.

The service is always good. The fact that everyone is wearing pajamas gives the place a nice feel. A man who I believe is the owner interacts with customers on a regular basis in a very friendly way.

Now, the food. Admittedly, I haven't had a huge sampling of the menu. The reason for this is that once I tried the fried chicken and waffles, there was really no reason to do much in the way of exploring. The chicken is pounded before it's fried so it fits perfectly on top of the waffle. It also has a nice peppery thing going on. Not only is it delicious but it's more "convenient" to eat than chicken and waffles where the chicken still has the bone in it.

Also, they have some kind of English sausages there. Those things are also awesome.

Food was ok but not the best.  I haven't gone there in almost a year and when I paid the bill I realized why I haven't. Almost $2.50 for a glass of OJ and they don't give free refills. Again, food was ok but there is definitely better.

The breakfast was pretty good and the service was good but the bad part was you can see the cooks and one of the cooks went from playing on his phone at the cash register to going to prepare someone's food and touching a waffle with his bare hands without washing them. That was very unappealing. Later he went back to playing on his phone again I never saw him once wash his hands after he handled people's food.. Won't be coming back to this place just because of that..
love the food here and happy Henderson has a Rise and shine . I used to live in Southern highlands and went to the one there. Maria is our server and she is very pleasant

I love this place! My boyfriend isn't as big of a breakfast food fan as I am, but when I told him this place is known for their steak and eggs, we knew we had to come.

There was a wait when we came on a Sunday morning. They said it would take approximately 45-50 minutes. It was 100+ degrees that day, so we killed some time at the smoothie shop next door.

When we sat down, I realized that the servers were all wearing pajamas. I love that concept!

In terms of the food we went crazy tried:
1. Crispy fried chicken breast and waffle
Dark meat is generally better than white meat. However, this fried chicken breast was the best I have ever tried. The breast is absolutely moist, and the outside is super crispy. The waffle was amazing, too. It's perfectly crispy on the outside, and it's the perfect medium between sweet and savory. I love the cinnamon maple syrup, which also comes with the pot of bread, and is served heated.
2. Bacon wrapped tender steak
My boyfriend got this with hash browns. It was good, but not the best. The bacon was overwhelmed the steak. I think next time he'll probably just order the ultimate steak and egg breakfast or the chicken fried NY steak.
3. Pot of bread
For both of our entrees we ordered the pot of bread. It came with jam, butter, and a warm cinnamon maple syrup. It was basically a cinnamon roll, but I loved how they came freshly baked.
4. Side of corned beef hash
The hash browns, while good, are 100 times better with the corned beef hash, which is one of the best corned beef hash breakfasts I have tried. It's salty, but not too much. 
5. Side of country sausage gravy
I typically order gravy with my chicken and waffles, so I had to try their country sausage gravy. It's good, but not necessary because the chicken and waffles is so amazing themselves.

It's my favorite breakfast place in Vegas, and probably better than most of the places I go to in the South Bay.

So happy that we have a breakfast place walking distance from home!  I have to say that I was a bit taken aback by the prices.  Almost $20 for a simple omelette meal, coffee and 20% tip.  However,  the omelette was tasty as well as the hash browns.   I ordered the cup of bread and my server noticed that it looked a bit overcooked.   She had me try it and then brought me a much better one after agreeing it was not good.  Very attentive service and quick to get my meal.
Great food. I ordered the chicken egg white omelette and had it delivered through uber eats.They included a cinnamon roll with a sweet sauce which was really good.

We've lived down the street from here for three years now and finally decided to have breakfast here. I don't know why we waited so long! We came early enough, so there was no large crowd. We were greeted by our server Krys who was nice enough to go over the menu with us and she recommended the Country fried steak and the Red Velvet pancakes. First off, the pancakes were so good. Light and super savory. It was like eating cake. Cake that had an awesome cream cheese syrup! 

Krys also mentioned that the Country Fried Steak was life changing, she was right! The Country Fried Steak is the best I've ever had hands down! I'm a big fan of Cracker Barrel and Rise and Shine just blew it out of the water! The steak was so tender with a light coat of breading that has a hint of spice. My wife had order envy and vowed to get it next time. Next time may be coming up very soon! Excellent breakfast spot in Southern Highlands that has a nice warming atmosphere with a great staff that truly love being there. Highly recommended!
Perfect spot for breakfast! Had the cinnamon toast french toast.. To die for! Idk why it has taken someone this long to create that! Can't wait to go try some more!

Service was great, food was great! 
We enjoyed all of our dishes we ordered. Great Nieghbor hood spot. We will be back!

Oh my! This is my new go to weekend breakfast spot. Staff are all so friendly and I love that the servers wear pajamas for their uniform! So cute. I've noticed some reviews say that service is slow but I haven't noticed that at all. Indoor and outdoor seating. Lots of options on the menu. All of their juices are made fresh.I usually start with the green go juice. Portion sizes are big, at least for me. So far I've had veggie eggs benny, chilaquiles, veggie bagel sandwich (huge!) and good ole steak and eggs. Loved them all. Just writing this review has me craving the place.

This is a little hole in the wall in a shopping center.  My expectations were well exceeded.  I am picky about my omelettes, but theirs was perfect.  And the hash browns did not taste like the frozen stuff out of the bag either.  The coffee was great quality, strong.  Loved the bread pot..tasted like a cinnamon roll...and we couldn't help try the red velvet pancakes with cream cheese butter!!  

The ambiance of the place was fun with the waitresses serving food with their pajamas on.  And the umbrellas on the cieling were fun too.  Apparently the owner or manager here is also in charge of the restaurants in Caesar's Palace.  The place is mostly no frills, but they certainly get it right where it counts.

What a cute place!!
I came in during my lunch break. I had looked through the reviews before hand and the chilaquiles (I totally had to google spell check that) looked delicious! So I tried those, they were a little more like nachos but with the overeasy eggs on top, holy cow that was good! I need to go back and try the steak soon.

My new favorite breakfast spot.  No joke, it literally blows all others that even attempt to serve breakfast out of the water.  The best part is, I don't have to wait forever to get a table like those dumb suckers that wait for an hour at Babycakes for crappy food.  Every time I have been there, on a weekend, I have always gotten a table very quickly.

The reason why I love this spot is that they have totally focused only on breakfast, and with a carefully crafted menu, in executing it flawlessly.  You can tell with every dish, that much thought went into how to prepare it.  And the waitresses in pajamas, how awesome is that?     I really appreciate the love that went into this place, so much that I want to give the owner a hug.

The first time we went, my husband ordered the steak and eggs.  While this is not kobe beef steak, it is cooked extraordinarily well, especially for a breakfast joint.  The steak is juicy and flavorful and contrasts perfectly with the eggs.  He has also ordered the chicken fried steak and while that was extremely heavy, he loved it and said it was the best he's had since he was a kid in Montana, where apparently that type of dish is extremely common.

I have tried the chicken and waffles and a veggie omelet.  The chicken, just like the steak, was cooked perfectly.  And even more impressive than the steak, they managed to keep the chicken completely juicy, warm, and flavorful.  But the waffles were even better.  They were completely soft and almost pancake-like, and extremely fluffy.  I normally don't like waffles because they tend to be so heavy, but they managed to capture the flavor of waffles in a way that did not make me want to sleep for the next 10 days.  They also were topped with a cinnamon maple syrup which was totally memorable.

So if you are looking for the best breakfast in Las Vegas, look no further than Rise & Shine.  They may not be open the entire day, and their menu may be limited in scope, but what they do they do extremely well, and every time I go I am even more impressed with their consistent quality of food and service.

Came here for brunch after visiting the strip, however the good ratings does not match up to my experience. We waited for 30 minutes and there were many empty seats outside we could have sat to eat but we didn't get called in until 15-20 more minutes. I ordered the chilaquiles and the sunny-side egg white was uncooked. They said they would bring me another one but they brought a fried egg on top of the plate I was eating from. Really?? The manager comes and says "Oh it might have been the special butter we use that makes the egg look clear.." So he finally brings me a new one when we have to leave and the chilaquiles this time was so salty. 

The waiter shirts also beg for more yelp reviews.

I was surprised that there wasn't a waiting list to get in today... They usually do... Guess it was my my lucky day because my brother and I got seated right away.  Our server was Chris and she was really awesome and attentive.... We got our freshly squeezed orange juice, hot chocolate and water within minutes... The menu is huge! So many great breakfast choices to choose from. I felt like I wanted to order a few dishes just for myself but I opted for the bone in ham steak with hash browns, scrambled eggs and a pot of bread (which is my favorite)! My brother got fried chicken and waffles...  Every thing was delicious! I couldn't eat the rest of my ham so I took it home.

Customer Service at Rise n Shine was AWESOME!!! Thank you to our server Chris who was very sweet! I always enjoy coming to this place!

This was literally one of the best breakfast places I've had in a long time!! My brother took met for my birthday and wow..We went HAM!! Had the crunchy cinnamon french toast, which was ridiculous!! Then the chicken and waffles, Spectacular!! Then the burrito, I don't even know what it was called, but it was super tasty!! I think that was a good 15lbs of greatness added to my buns hahaha!

Food was great had the steak, eggs, hash brown, and cup of bread (cinnamon roll in a cup), with a glass of the green juice. I enjoyed my food, however my server was slow and kept forgetting stuff like how I wanted my steak and my cinnamon roll which is included in the meal. The place was not even packed.. My friend ordered the chicken and waffles which he felt wasn't that great.

Rise and Shine people....there is a new breakfast place in town!

We arrived late for breakfast here a couple weeks back and had such a great time! The place itself is very family friendly looking, giggets on the walls and waitresses dressed in pjs. MY FAVORITE!

They had really nice outdoor seating which is where we sat. Our group had already ordered but our waitress took our order promptly and was able to bring it out with our friends. AWESOME!

We shared the corn beef hash and scrambled eggs but shared everyone elses food too. The food was good....not amazing...not to die for....but definitively worth our drive. Everything tasted good. I particularly liked the pancakes. Yum!

Overall a great sunrise stop to fill your bellies before starting your day. Good service, good food and good prices. You should not leave unsatisfied. 

Rise and Shine....I sure did after eating my breakfast. YUM!
This place used to be good with fair prices. I refuse to pay dinner prices for breakfast food.

Bring your appetite.... because they're passing out Big portions! 

The setup is nice, quiet (during early hours), and cozy.  The waitresses are wearing pajamas which goes perfectly with the atmosphere.  Definitely will be back.

We really like this place and are super impressed with the service and have always had good food! The prices are a little bit high in my opinion for breakfast but the service and the quality of food makes up for the difference.

Updated 
It will definitely be a season before we try this place again. I went in today on Mother's Day and we knew it would be crowded and we allotted for that we're sitting at a table right next to the cashier and got bumped and pushed by workers and customers the entire time.

The music was so incredibly loud that made it feel like chaos no matter what 

Pancakes where not done , eggs Benedict were practically hard boiled, kids waffle tiny for price and had whip cream which in my opinion should be asked for kids menu items, coffee taste like water ... I know what you're thinking why didn't we talk to a manager... it was so loud and busy and that I didn't even feel like it was worth it to try.

I always love trying new places for breakfast in Vegas before the ride back to Cali and I definitely made the right choice in stopping by here. Very friendly staff and super cute that they wear pjs as their work attire.

I ordered the Rise & Shine Chilaquiles and by the pics on Yelp, it seriously did not look like it'd be such a large serving. It could probably feed at least 2 adults in my opinion and for only 10 bucks. I loved how much cheddar cheese it had. I wish it had a bit more beans though. The flavor of the chili was very different from what I'm used to. Sorta had a Tex Mex type flavor.

This is a really good place for breakfast brunch. It gets busy in the morning and they don't take reservations so make sure to get there early. 

We went around 9:40am and waited twenty minutes for a table. 

I came for steak and eggs so that is what I ordered. They have a little spin to it. They put steak and poached egg on a bagel like an eggs Benedict. This was creative and so delicious. It was called NY steak, spinach and Benedict bagel. This also comes with a pot of bread that everyone on yelp was raving about. Unfortunately, they were already out of this pot of bread so they gave a choice of bread for toast instead. I still would like to see what this pot of bread tastes like. :( 

My sister got the red velvet pancakes. She stated that they were really rich. 

Another one of my sisters got the Fancy Steakhouse Omelet. She claims this was delicious. 

One more of my other sisters got the Three Little Pigs Two Fisted Bagel and Egg Sandwich. She said it was good but she didn't enjoy the sausage. 

Lastly, service here was excellent. I didn't catch our servers name but she was really friendly and she seemed to really enjoy her time. All the servers wear pajamas. Maybe it's due to the comfort of the uniform or the people she works with, but either way, she seemed to have gotten up on the right side of the bed. :)

You can find Rise and Shizzle tucked in the Southwest corner of the Southern Highlands shopping center.  Other nearby eateries is Barcelona Tapas and Off the Strip.  R&S is just another addition to the ever expanding Highlands area.

You will notice the warm and friendly staff from the outset.  Its hard not to see that they are struttin' around in their PJ's, no it ain't no Loberace show, but equally thrilling..j/k.  I love theme based restaurants, Anime Ramen takes the cake though.

Anyhow, I got a kids meal steak and eggs while my patnah got the chicken fried steak.  I wasn't starvin' Marvin, but needed to get something in my stomach, pronto.  It was 10ish, so decided to keep it small.  Its still a nice portion if you ask me.

The steak was done as requested, medium rare, with fresh made hash browns served on a hot skillet.  I threw in a cup of French onion soup for good measure.  The steak was not overly seasoned which I prefer to get that true steak flavor.  The soup was piping hot and came in a stoneware cup.  Its hard to find good FOS, and this place doesn't disappoint.  Not the best I ever had like Drake kinda good, but not bad at all.

Most of the other dishes are pretty generous, unfortunately, the prices aren't.  I would suggest sharing if you are not a breakfast gorger like most of us.  The prep and way the food is served is legit though.  I like how the menu is simply one page, but it can get difficult to find certain dishes.  

The ambiance is nice and quiet and spacious as well.  The inside is decorated like most new and clean breakfast joints are, yet, the twist, literally, is the ceiling fans are fitted with decorative umbrellas that accent the ceiling along with other festive colors.  Looks like Steve Wynn designed it considering the loud colors...lol.  A nice touch nonetheless.

To me, rise and shine is a hit and if you are in the neighborhood, or don't want to venture off to far if you live close by, like me, this place is as good as it gets.  Break that fast at Rise and Shine!
Pretty darn good.  Wanted to find a place away from the strip.  Get the pot bread!

Ashley is the greatest waitress of all time! This place is pretty amazing! Since this WAS a steak and egg place my boyfriend and I ordered the country fried steak and egg. It came with hash browns, which are probably the best hash browns I have ever tasted in my life. They gravy that came with the steak also worked both as a dipping for the hash brown and steak. I also ordered the Nutella latte, which you will not go wrong with. I saw this place through my friend's Snapchat, and decided to try it out. Best decision I made.

Thank you to Laurel for taking excellent care of us again. Tried the steak omelette and it was perfectly cooked, steak seasoned great and biscuit was probably one of the best I've had. If you can, go on a weekday, when it is more mellow. Love how everything comes to the table quick and fresh. Definitely a great way to start the day!
Always on point. Food A+ Service A+. Love having an amazing breakfast place near me. My favorite meal!!

Wtf? Couldn't get through to this place for 20 minutes to order take out. Once they finally picked up Keomi picked up the phone and put me on hold for 10 minutes. I could hear the phone laying on the hostess stand as they socialized. When I called back to speak to a manager I was a denied to. Reluctantly I made my order because this place's food is still great but they get 3 stars for service. Not ordering take out again.

I'm giving this two stars because the toast is good. The only constant about this place is the inconsistency of the food. The only people giving this the rating over two stars are either too lazy to cook or don't know how to cook. 

We live in the neighborhood and have been frequenting this place for over a year now. First and foremost, I dare you to try and get an order of eggs over medium! It can't happen. Either the staff doesn't listen or the cooks just can't cook. On our last two and final visits, the steak on both occasions was cross contaminated with some sort of fish product, perhaps salmon or lox I don't know,  and tasted like a salt lick and if you're not familiar with that it's for farm animals. 

On our very last visit I order the loco moco special. The hamburger patty was so undercooked it was completely raw and I don't know that i will ever be able to eat hamburger again. The eggs were so undercooked they were runny after being asked for over medium, which has happened time after time. Eating here has turned into a bad experience. Not to mention our breakfast was over $44 for two people; steak and eggs and loco moco. It's absurd. We don't intend to ever go back.

The reality is if an IHOP or dennys opened up in the neighborhood this place would be out of business in a week.

Upon first walking in, you are greeted by an Instagram-able paradise. The decor is so cute, so naturally we all had to boomerang the spinning umbrellas on the ceiling :) We had to wait about 10 minutes even though they said 20, which was nice. 

It was really hard to decide what to get as everything sounded SO GOOD. My friend and I got the steak & eggs and it was truly one of the best breakfast joint steaks I've had. My sister got the red velvet pancakes, and they were to die for. Pretty sure I ate half of her plate!

My only complaint was the strange service we received. Example: I ordered salsa, but it somehow ended up with my sister's side of eggs. When I asked if I could get a fresh cup of salsa, they said "Oops, here you go" and took it off my sister's plate and put it on to mine. Then my friend asked for a side of butter for her waffles. The waitress looks at the cup of butter on my other friend's plate and says "but there's already butter here." So...we were supposed to share butter off each other's plates? This was a weird thing to say instead of just grabbing us a fresh cup of butter. 

I'm hoping those were isolated incidents, so I wouldn't let it deter you from going there.

You walk in and think "Old Navy Commercial meets Mrs Buttersworth" but that's not necessarily bad. So you sit down and see the waitress' in pajamas-and you can't help but smile as even they are almost apologetic about the uniforms. But seriously if I could get my entire family to dress that way for breakfast I would! The menu is large and has a wide variety of items, the pop up breads in cute little pots caught my eye, when asked about them, the waitress was shocked I hadn't tried them and rushed one over to the table! It was scrumptious-as was everything else we tried!! My friend had the chicken and waffles-as I write this from my Atlanta based home-I must say it beat Gladys Knight  with an egg beater! I stuck to the basics and had pancakes, potatoes and bacon yummy! A few days later I brought my 3 year old back-and he had the steak and eggs (yes they have steak and eggs on the children's menu) and it was heaven! I love this place! And as a new vacation home owner in Southern Highlands I will be there often.

New favorite breakfast place!! Food: amazing. From the steak & eggs to the corned beef. Do not miss the cup of bread. So good it should be illegal. Our server Maria was spot on at every turn. Will definitely ask for her next time and every time. Better hurry, this hidden gem won't be a secret for long.
This was our first time here and we absolutely enjoyed every bite!  Mikee was the best waiter and took excellent care of us. You must try the "Cup of Bread". It was amazing!!!

Our server was great! The wait was supposed to be a half hour; the wait was 15 minutes until we were seated. That was a pleasant surprise! The girls at the front were lovely as well. Unfortunately, that is where it all the positive points end for me. I was given a napkin with a fork and knife rolled inside, which is standard for most breakfast spots. When I picked the bundle up to unroll it I SEE AN OBVIOUS SMEAR OF BLOOD ACROSS THE NAPKIN!!! I quietly alert our waitress and she says "OHH!! OPPS!! WOW!! Let me take that." She brought me a new set and nothing else was said or mentioned again. No manager, shift supervisor, janitor - ZERO. Blood on a napkin served to a patron is pretty serious if I remember correctly, like a health code violation serious. I try to move on with my meal, I personally only ordered a yogurt parfait. When it arrives I notice it was made upside-down. Yes, that sounds silly and petty but when you have a slender glass making it upside-down gives you about 1 or 2 strawberries max and 3 thin slices of a banana. Then the entire thing was soaked in honey (my fault, I should have asked for that on the side.). We also ordered an egg white omelette. They didn't make it with egg whites. The pancakes were overly sweet, like they added something to the batter. BUT... The juices and little cinnamon rolls were delicious. Sadly, the negatives FAR outweighed the positives in this experience. Bummer.

Large breakfast menu so many great choices. You don't have to worry about leaving hungry the portions are very generous. The customer service is so friendly and very welcoming what a great way to start your day. Prices are very reasonable. There's no pressure to rush either like most breakfast restaurants. Look forward to coming back . Get the orange juice for sure fresh squeezed

Wow, everything was so delicious! 

We got a short stack of pancakes with eggs and sausage, biscuits & gravy, chicken and waffles, and a pot of bread. 

The yelp reviews all mention the pot of bread and honesty it was the most underwhelming thing we were served. 

The biscuits and gravy were easily the most delicious we have ever eaten! Try them. 

I have a mild allergy to eggs so breakfast places are always a hard place for me to try but when I saw the chicken & waffles on the menu I knew that I could check rise & shine out!  They were absolutely delicious. The chicken was crispy and everything you'd want in a piece of fried chicken. The waffle with the infused cinnamon syrup was out of this world yummy. 

My husband loved his pancakes. I did take a bite and they were nice and fluffy and the cinnamon syrup just adds an extra layer of flavor to make them that much more delicious. 

Service was great, wait was about 15 min on a Sunday morning at 10:30.

* The restaurant had a very friendly vibe and VERY aesthetically pleasing. It had flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. It's so cute. And the workers are dressed in their cute little pajamas. 

* This is my first time at Rise & Shine, so I've only tried the Steak and eggs. Although, for the only thing I've tried, it's given me a great first impression. I accidentally said the wrong cooking temperature for the steak, so that's my fault. But the flavor was still great and savory. The hash browns were probably my favorite. It had so much flavor and little crunchy bits that I love so much. 

* The price, I believe, was around $15. A little high on the price, but for steak, I guess it's acceptable. 

* Would I go again? Yeah sure. I think I would want to try their other options next time, but it's a great breakfast place to go to. 

* Rate: 8/10
* $$

My fianc√© and I just moved to the area and came across this place and knew he had to try it. We looked up reviews, of course and saw good ones, and the pictures looked amazing. 

Long story short, we came, we ate & i personally expected more. Customer service was on point, our waitress was absolutely amazing and they give a huge portion. The food itself was mediocre, not anything I haven't experienced already. Maybe we'll give it another shot and try something different.

Stop by on the way home from Las Vegas. Everything looked amazing and what we ordered was excellent. Our service from Gilbert was fantastic, he made sure that our experience was pleasant and enjoyable. The food was delicious and very flavorful without being overpowering.  I will definitely be stopping by my next trip through.

Cute room with a bunch of umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and pajammied waitrons.  Good breakfast joints are few and far between in Vegas.  In LA every neighborhood has a cool little local breakfast place.  Vegas has Mimi's Cafe and Hash House a NoNo (aka the worst restaurant on earth).  Blecch.
