Anways, the food was hit or miss, mostly hit.  My eggs and potatoes were great, seasoned well, fresh and not greasy.  The chicken fried steak was gnarly, however.  They've got their fryer turned up to high.  It was greasy and overcooked and the breading looked like dogfood.

Overall this place is a 3.5.  We'll round up to 4 for the good service and cool concept...

Got here around 9am on a Sunday and only had a 10 min wait. Lisa, our waitress was very nice and helpful. We had the Strawberry Belgium waffle and Create your own omelette. The portion sizes were large and the food was delicious. We will definitely be back here.
First time eating here. Good food and excellent service. I'll be coming back and try other menus. Will recommend it.

I ordered the steak "medium" and it definitely wasn't close to medium.  It was brown (no pink at all).  I can't stand well done meat.  The eggs and hash browns were delicious! The bread in a bowl was incredible as well.

Super cute place! Servers in pajamas, large booths and umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. I also really like the tile on the walls.

I was there on a Monday morning around 11AM there was no wait. This was my first time here, but my friend had been there quite often because he lives right down the street.

He had the french toast with 3 eggs and bacon (apparently he's a growing boy - don't know how he ate it all, PLUS a slice of MY bacon!). I had just the standard breakfast with 2 eggs, hash browns and bacon. We both ordered the "pot of bread," and he ordered an extra for himself (I seriously don't know where he put all this food).

Everything was really good, although I am not a big fan of their style of hash browns. The service was fast and friendly and I will definitely be back because I really want to try one of their signature steak dishes.

I have gone all around Vegas to find "the place"  to go and have not only great food but excellent service.  After having great service from the lovely Sharon,  we were blown away by how delicious the food was. We did not expect that high quality of food from a small diner. Can't I give 6 stars? You definitely won two new customers for life! Really recommend this place to everyone.

Horrible. From the price of juice and milk for kids to the moldy grapes that laid on my food and I mean white mold. Disgusting. Lost my appetite. Service is very very slow and there was only 5 tables. For a place that had steak in their name my daughter did not eat her steak and eggs as it was a horrible peace of cheap sirloin. We live a block a way and will never go back again.

We ate here on our last day of our Vegas trip.  We ordered some of the Yelp favorites- disappointments were the pot of bread and the red velvet chocolate chip pancakes.  The pot of bread was tasteless.  And the pancakes were dry.  But we did enjoy the chicken and waffles.  The chicken was crispy and moist.  Overall, cute place with hanging umbrellas and staff wearing pajamas!

I've been here before when the place was smaller and it was amazing! The service was good and the food was fast and hot.  Today I went and it being a holiday, I expected a wait even with the bigger place,  which was fine.  Once we were seated,  it took our server more than 15 minutes to take our order.  We waited an additional 30 minutes after ordering for us to receive half our food,  calling it was warm would be a stretch.  We watched our server serve multiple other tables in other sections before serving us.  We finally got our toast and it was so cold the butter wouldn't even melt.  This place is a great place if you want to waste an hour and a half of your life waiting for deplorable servers to serve you cold food. Have fun!

Steak isn't just a steak its rib eye.!
Awesome. Service excellent 
Coffee is pressed 
Pancake red velvet.
Amazing

This place used to be great.  It has really gone down hill. We waited 15 minutes to get a table and the. And hour and a half for breakfast. 2 hours for breakfast is crazy. The food finally came out and it was cold and terrible.  Won't be going back there anymore.

A friend told me about this place and raved about the chicken & waffles so I had to try it.  I was not disappointed. I ordered the chicken & waffles and had to share it with a friend.  My other friend who can ordered the ham steak and it was almost bigger than the plate.  He had to take the ham steak off to get to his potatoes.  WOW! I will definitely be returning and sharing with my friends :)
Used to have great pancake before I think but now it's way too sweet. Portions are great but I don't think anyone can finish entire plate.

Decided to come check this place out since the other location has such great reviews. 

The wait was about 15 minutes on a Saturday around 10 am. 

I decided to go with the chicken and waffle. I love the breaded chicken but the waffle was just okay. It did taste a lot better with the syrup. My hubby decided to get the steak and egg. He didn't really enjoy it too much. 

We decided to try the cup of bread. The bread was okay but the cream cheese sauce was delish. The sauce over the waffle or french toast would be super yummy. 

Overall, service and food were just okay.

Looking for a small mom and pop shop for breakfast with amazing food come here you need to try their food I come here for the steak and eggs they are so good and their red velvet chocolate chip pancakes a must try item here this is a place to go to for sure.
Skip it... it's horrible. Who puts cayenne pepper in thier chicken fried steak breading!? And then does not list it in the menu. Over priced, under delivered, not a friendly feeling atmosphere.

Chicken and waffles?  Yes, please! 
*military discount* 

TL; DR version: Delicious food, quick but spotty service.  

Long version: 
Went on Sunday 12-27-15 around 10am.  
$37.44 got us a chicken & waffle breakfast, an ultimate steak & eggs breakfast, a side of fruit for the boy, an apple juice, a coffee, and an orange juice.  I love the spinning floral umbrellas on the ceiling but they are all dusty.  It looks like they would take them down and clean them! It's quite distracting....but I liked all the servers wearing pajamas...I thought that was really cute.  

THE ULTIMATE Steak & Egg breakfast comes with a ribeye steak, two eggs however you want them, hashbrowns, and your choice of bread.  My husband ate this and complained that none of it was seasoned properly, although the bites I had were delicious and my boy enjoyed the eggs a lot.  He ordered pot o' bread as his bread choice and it didn't show up until we reminded our server.  We were done eating but it was fine because it was kind of like a dessert LOL   

Crispy Fried Chicken Breast and Waffle was really good.  I never thought I'd say this about chicken but the chicken was....fluffy....it was crispy and light and airy and wonderful although it was terribly bland.  The waffle was crispy and delicious and I loved that their syrup is served warm.  I ate every single bite of this breakfast but did not leave feeling like I hate myself, which is always a good sign that the portions are properly sized.  Pro tip....pour a little cholula on your plate and dip the chicken in it!  Give that chicken some flavor! 

I asked for a side of fruit for my boy ($1.95) and the waitress asked if I wanted the honeydew/canteloupe/pineapple mix or the blueberry/banana/strawberry mix and we picked the latter.  What was delivered was just bananas and strawberries so either they ran out or forgot the blueberries. 

Solid breakfast place!  It is 30 minutes from my house and not worth the trip back but I thoroughly enjoyed this breakfast.

Having been here before we expected a MUCH better experience: both our eggs were almost cold, my steak almost inedibly overdone despite me asking for medium, coffee lukewarm. With so many other good breakfast choices around the Vegas Valley, there's no reason to "experiment" with this place again (once you've seen the interior and that some of the staff wears pajamas, the show is over and it's just a higher priced steak and eggs restaurant...)...bummer!

Our first time here. The service was good. My husband had the Chicken and Waffle. It was delicious. I ordered a omelet with Swiss, turkey kielbasa and onions. It was also delicious. Both of our plates came with the Pot of bread. It was a very cute idea came with butter and cinnamon cream cheese. The bread had cinnamon swirled inside.  FYI, the coffee is on the strong side. They also had cute umbrella lights hanging from ceiling that were different flower designs. This place is quite pricey when you take into consideration that there are many great local spots nearby that are about $3 less per plate. Their normal eggs/meat/potatoes and bread plate was $10. Not somewhere we will frequent, but if we have a craving for Chicken and Waffles, this is the place.

My family and I were on a weekend vacation and wanted to try a good breakfast place- thank goodness for Yelp!!! This place is hands down the best breakfast place ever!!! Great service, great atmosphere, and most of all awesome food!! 
I Love the "pot of bread" and the "Chilichilles and Steak" - are you kidding me?? This dish rocked! Also, the country fried steak and gravy was so tasty- this place has something for every breakfast taste- and our server was awesome! Come early or you will wait a bit!

This place was fantastic! Great atmosphere, and lucky enough for my girlfriend and I, it is right across the street. That means we will be frequent customers. Excellent service as soon as you walk in . The parfait was amazing, perfect for 2 people to share. Chicken and waffles was to die for, and the pot of bread was just the finishing touch! Definitely recommend this place to anybody who loves a good breakfast!

Took my Mom here for breakfast about a week ago. We shared French Toast and I added eggs and bacon. The French toast was absolutely delicious, the eggs cooked perfectly (over medium) and bacon was tasty - but limp and not crispy at all. Our food came super fast, along with the food came our check and a partial refill of my coffee that was still 2/3 full. The server never came back after that, and we sat there for at least 20 more minutes. I would've liked at least one refill of my coffee, and I kept thinking she'd come back - but never did. I hate it when they bring your check with your food, how do they know you wouldn't like something else? The guy at the counter we paid the bill to was really friendly, I expected him to ask how everything was - but he didn't. Oh well. The food was good, so I'd like to give them 4 stars, but the service left a lot to be desired. It could have been a fluke, but I'm just not sure I was blown away enough to give them another chance. There are too many other great breakfast places around to choose from.

I was right!!   I had the chicken and waffle and it was delicious!   Savory chicken, with light breading.  I'm not a fan of thick breading or greasy chicken and theirs had neither of those qualities!  The potted bread was scrumptious.  Sorry I didn't take pics, but I was so hungry, I ate it all!!

Okay first off I am not a huge fan of breakfast foods in general.  My best friend loves it. So when a few of my friends wanted to go here for breakfast one day I was not looking forward to it. When we walked into the place it was fairly busy not overly packed. The first thing I noticed as the decor which was bright and fun with these cute umbrella flower rotating art hanging from the ceiling. It did make me feel a bit happy to be there. The next thing i noticed is the wait staff were in PJs. All and all the environment was welcoming and a cute experience.

Next the menu was full of options and i was told by my champions that all the food was good. I stepped out on a limb and ordered some breakfast items. I had a waffle, bacon, hash browns, and the potted bread. It was a lot of food but boy was it tasty. I couldn't finish it all but i enjoyed trying. The syrup is real maple syrup that is brought to the table hot with cinnamon sticks in side. The next good thing is i  tasted some of my friends corn beef hash, regular pancakes, and red velvet pancakes.  (another reason why i probably couldn't finish my food.)  Boy everything was a delight. Party for the taste buds.

Now i live in the area and highly recommend the place. If you really like breakfast foods you may fall in love with the place. If you are like me and you would pass on breakfast foods you will not be disappointed eating here. Its worth the trip if you are out and about and are in the mood for breakfast or lunch. (They are not open for dinner).  Make a day of it.

I've been to this place when visiting Vegas 2 or 3 times since I initially tried it and I can say I'm happy I gave them another shot. The food and service are great but depending on what time of day (and day of the week) you go, there might be a bit of a wait because it seems to have become a pretty popular place to eat breakfast and brunch!  Once you order, the food comes out in a reasonable amount of time. I really love the eggs Benedict & their orange juice is delicious as well. My biggest complaint is that I don't live in Vegas so I can't try everything on the menu :)

On your way out of Las Vegas and want a local amazing breakfast spot to frequent?? 

Look no further than Rise and Shine, I prefer the highland area local but they are both amazing. The breakfast is good and clean with a ton of options. 

Friendly and knowledgeable staff always greet you with a morning warm smile and the owner is always running around checking on things or expo'ing the line (restaurant terminology).

My morning fav is the two fisted avo-veggie sandwich, it's so yummy.

Enjoy and leave a review bc the owner definitely checks in with yelp!!!

My husband and I checked this place out for breakfast last weekend. You will immediately notice that it is super fun and cute inside. There are upside down umbrellas and flowers hanging from the ceiling and the waitresses are dressed in pajamas. The entrance is a bit awkward, as you are greeted there and it is also where you pay so it can get a bit congested. We were greeted and seated within a few minutes. 

We quickly decided on food and it was out within no time. My husband indulged in the chicken and waffles. The chicken was cooked perfectly and looked really good. I settled on the Spice Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles. I was envisioning sliced steak on top of my Chiaquiles, as that would be the easiest way to incorporate steak into the dish. Imagine my surprise when I was served an entire steak on the side. However, the steak was a bit fatty and I didn't taste much spice or seasoning. The Chilaquiles were actually pretty good, but there was nothing special or exciting about the flavors. I thought it was a little weird that they served the salsa and sour cream in tiny dishes on the side. I would have liked those to be more incorporated in the dish. But, it was a large portion and I took half of it home. I also chose the Pot of Bread as my side and it was delightful. I loved the look of it when it came to the table. It is a little Terra Cotta pot with a nice fluffy piece of bread rising from it. This was probably the highlight of the meal. The bread had a nice streak of cinnamon flowing through it and was served warm with butter. 

Rise & Shine is good and they do have some unique dishes on the menu, but there is nothing mind blowing or innovative about the flavors.

I would give the food a 5 star but our experience today wasn't the best. First, they told us there would be a 5-10 min wait but I counted at least 5 open tables plus the entire counter which was empty. Then, our waitress Cary (who obviously took her speed pill this morning) asked us for our drink order and before we even look at menu asked if we were ready to order???? (we've been sitting for maybe 1 minute) we told her we weren't ready and she said he'll give us another minute... No kidding! She came back maybe 40 seconds later... This went on through out the whole time we were there. Gave us the check when we were only half way through or meal, etc.  horrible, horrible service. She was not friendly, never asked how we were doing, just kept rushing us. I tipped anyway, only because I know the cooks and the busboy share it.
P.S. the busboy was a new kid... Must be family related because he was SLOWER THAN MOLASSES!!!! No wonder they get behind even with half the tables open. 

Been here many times before but this might just be our last :(
My hubby and I are new residents to the LV area and saw this restaurant while driving around. Glad we came in. Food was excellent and our waitress, Maria, was awesome.

This place is amazing. Very broad menu for any breakfast craving. Everything I've had on the 2 times I been there has been amazing. Customer service is amazing as well.Definitely will go there again whenever am in Vegas again.

Don't bother with Cracker Barrel, only 10 min south on Dean Martin turn right on Cactus and this place is on the left. Awesome food! Great friendly service. When you are tired of smoke filled casinos this is the place to go. Have the potted cinnamon role.

I live right around the corner, and my son and I love coming to eat for brunches. He stares at the umbrella, colors with crayons, and eats tons of eggs and bacon. Bonus, you can build your own omelette so I stuff it with veggies. I'm not a big fan of sugary breakfast items, so I can't say anything about those, sorry.

I CAN say that despite the slightly pricey entrees, I still keep coming back. Always joyful service (and their uniforms are PJs!), delicious coffee press, unique dishware, and their hash browns are my favorite. You can try the other breakfast places people usually frequent, but I LOVE Rise and Shine.

Drove all the way from Summerlin to try this place & I was pleasantly surprised. Food was excellent, great service nice clean modern interior. My baby girl loved the swirling flower umbrellas on the ceiling. I would do the drive again to eat here.

I used to love this place! But I got disappointed when I ate here last Sunday. The server was not as friendly as I remember. Seems like he didn't even want to talk to us. Then after a while, I saw him being so nice and talkative and helping the other table explaining almost everything on the menu. While he didn't even let us know that the full order is too big for 2 kids. 

Then the food. I got my usual, chicken and waffle. But got disappointed on how small it was. I would've understand if their price went up. But when the food price went up, I'd expect that it'll still be as big (the quality is still good) the chicken was just half what it used to be. So that was disappointing. I was looking forward to leftovers, but no leftovers since it was small.

I don't think we'll be back for a while.

hello LV Yelpers!
Came here last week for breakfast the morning it poured/flooded.
One of my coworkers love coming here so a group of us made our way through the rain and flooded streets to rise and shine.
I was excited to try their pot of bread from reading all of the reviews. I don't live close to R&S so I really hoped for a good experience.
It was mid morning and they already ran out of pot of bread! really?! :(
I had the corn beef hash with biscuit which was really tasty. My coworker comes here for the steak and eggs.
If you're in the area and looking for breakfast stop by here! I wouldn't drive out of the way for R&S.
Casual dining. No frills.
Love this place! Great food! They are opening a new location off 215 and flamingo closer to my house. Yaaaay!

Great spot for breakfast and brunch! This was my second weekend in a row dining at this hot spot. Our server Maria was great,  explained the menu which helped us navigate through the many different options offered. Maria also made a few suggestions that turned out to be amazing. I loved the bread in a cup, and the the kids ABC breakfast was perfect for the kids!! Can't wait to dine here again.
Way more than I have ever spent on breakfast without drinks... or any meal without drinks... But food was REALLY good... so if you have lots of money and want really good food.... here u go!
Nom. I love getting breakfast with the family there. I can always count on consistent and good. Plus the decor and uniforms are fun.

Tried the Tench Press coffee on reommendation and it was so good. The atmosphere is great with a friendly presence.

The service was slow, so don't go if you'really in a rush. Four tables sat after us and received their food before us. 

I had the Steakhouse Omelet. It was very delicious. The steak was cooked perfectly, but a bit cold. It came with a Pot of Bread. The bread, mixed with cinnamon, was cooked in a small flower pot. It was excellent but also a bit cold.

Our first time here today and we were impressed!
The waitresses were very friendly and attentive. The food was at a good temperature. Country Fried New York Steak & Eggs were delish. My husband said that the Homemade Corned Beef Hash & Eggs were the best. 
Over all we loved it and we'll be back soon :)
Hidden, almost didn't go in.  Was heading towards tropical smooth next door and gave them a chance.  What's inside is amazing compared to out.  Very friendly and open.  Amazing food.  Clean.

Found this place with my girlfriend and although we enjoyed the decor, the customer service and food sucked. As soon as we got seated the waiter seemed as if she was in a rush, but the place was no where near busy. She took our orders, but never let us finish speaking because she kept interrupting us; again feeling "rushed." She gave us our food and asked what else we needed, and she forgot our utensils, in which she basically threw them onto our table; once again, rushing! The prices were way too high for the quality. I ordered a steak and it was not juicy, it was bland when I asked for medium rare. My girlfriend ordered a southern style chicken fried steak and it did not taste like anything. The breading was horrible too. Paid almost $50 for just the two of us. Would not recommend this place.

Yup they do deserve five stars. Where to begin? 

We arrived at about 1 pm on sunday the wait was about twenty minutes. We were greeted by the hostess right away and she was pleasant. She put our names on the list. Now i want to address something some other yelpers here have mentioned and have been upset about, yes there were empty tables when we were wait listed but being in this business i know there is a reason for this and to those who dont know i shall explain. You see it is better to have customers waiting to be seated then waiting at a table for their order to be taken and waiting a long time for food because the kitchen is behind, so the hostess here doesnt over seat the room rapidly so that the servers and kitchen can stay on track. So next time you see this now you know why and can be more forgiving.
Next, we were seated and greeted right away by Cali, she was so friendly, she made great eye contact and had a great smile. We ordered the french press coffee and apple juices. The coffee was AWESOME! so smooth and not bitter so worth the money. Even though it says you get two cups we got about 3 and 1/2. 
Now the food.
My husband ordered the steak and egg breakfast, and i got the ny steak and egg benny on a bagel. Both steaks were cooked to perfection at mid rare. Only thing is my husband did send his eggs back because he likes scrambled well well done, but the cooks were awesome and got his eggs just right.
We also got a yogurt parfait to share and it was soo good! The portions here are big so we got boxes to take home our delicious left overs.
Over all i loved this place from service to food everything was spot on. i definitely recommend this place and we will be back!

Second time here, second time in heaven! Maria was so attentive and the food is DIVINE. I had the chicken and waffles, and every thing seemed to melt in my mouth! I'll definitely be back to spend a little more time in paradise.

Came here to have breakfast and relax, definitely miss living right down the road from this place but I don't live too far. Hoped there was wifi but there wasn't, but it didn't kill me. Anyways, ordered a cup of coffee, normally I love coffee in the morning but this cup was kind of old, the coffee tasted like it was sitting for awhile but I downed it anyway due to there only being one server. It wasn't too busy, but it was enough to keep one person running around. I ordered the country fried steak and it was good definitely had a zip to it, the eggs weren't over easy but fried...the hashbrowns weren't bad, and of course I'm digging the pot of bread! I hate complaining because I've worked in the food and beverage industry for a long time, so I eat what I eat unless it was raw or cold then I wouldn't. But this was mediocre. It definitely has changed since the first time I was here, so it's kind of disappointing.  They should have put at least one more person on the floor so that someone can always make sure that coffee cups were filled and water cups were filled. 

4 stars were given because besides the food and the service its a beautiful restaurant and it has potential and I hope it's worked on and not forgotten when the new restaurant is built.

This is a great place for breakfast.They have the best hash browns,made with green onions added.Very pleasant staff.This will be our new go to for breakfast.Love that they have a senior menu!Only complaint one of the staff had a T-shirt with their slogan on it,that was not for family to view.Just not a good example for a family restaurant.

This review is based on food alone. 
My fiance and I ordered to-go brunch to enjoy some weekend breakfast in bed, and honestly wished we hadn't.
The medium rare strip steak was cooked blue rare. It was cold and inedible. 
The chips in the chiliaquiles were dried out and burnt at the edges.
Lastly, thee corned beef hash had a wet/soggy texture and very little flavor. 
Essentially the best thing we ordered was toast... for $40 worth of food. Needless to say, we were frustrated.

This place would fit in nicely inside a upscale casino hotel on the Las Vegas strip. Except then, the prices would be 40% higher! Worth the trip out here, even if you are a tourist or visitor. The restaurant is actuall just a couple of minutes off the i-15 at the Silverado Ranch blvd exit.
 
An omelet with steak was almost platter sized, biscuits & gravy was yummy as well. Service was friendly, and the place is very clean. I will be back!

Amazing!
Great food
Great service!! Ham steak is biggest in the world 
Delicious delicious delicious

This place has the best breakfast I've had in Vegas so far! The orange juice is freshly squeezed, not diluted at all. There is a lot to choose from too, which I love! My family and I have been here about three times, and more to come!
Been to this place several times already. Food and service is really good. One thing that disappoints me every time is that they always run out of the "pot of bread" which is what they are known for.

This restaurant is amazingly good!  I had their steak and eggs and it was cooked to perfection!  Customer service was great and very attentive.  I highly recommend this place for breakfast!   I definitely will come back for more!

Mother's Day wait was apx 1 hr but we stayed because of the great ratings.. Waitress forgot to put in our order so we ended up waiting 1.5 for our pancakes. Manager made the entire order fresh and turned an unpleasant experience to a great one.  It was their treat for the inconvenience. Loved the pancakes and crunchy French toast. Fresh coffee & great eggs & hash browns.. Loved the food

... went there at 930 am first time there.  There was one server covering the whole restaurant she forgot my friends coffee for about 20 minutes. Which is fine I know covering a whole restaurant by yourself is not easy. Brought out the food which was bland and way overpriced! I got a bowl of cereal for my daughter it came with yogurt and fruit it was $6 which wouldn't have been so bad if they didn't charge me $3.50 for an apple juice to go with it. All in all spent $40 for 2 people and a baby :/ will not go back.
Very good hidden gem for breakfast! Nice atmosphere and in the heart of Southern Highlands!
Great service and good food. One of my favorite places to eat breakfast. Welcoming restaurant and great culture.

Our last meal before we headed home from our week long stay in Las Vegas. After a week, we were looking for something other than a buffet. My wife found this place and wow, what a gem it was. It's way south of the Strip, but it's worth the drive. 

Here's the rundown:
French Pressed Coffee - it's a long drive, so I needed a good cup of Joe. What a cup!! First off, they use Illy coffee (Italian espresso coffee bean, my favorite) It comes in a big French press container (good for at least 3+ cups of coffee, good for at least 2 persons) and a sand glass timer to determine how strong you like it (cute touch). Talk about a good start to your meal, if you're a coffee drinker, you've got to try this. Great Coffee. 

Pot of Bread - literally a bread baked in a small terre cotta pot (another cute touch). The top is brushed with cinnamon sugar and is very good. This is one of your bread choices w/ your breakfast meal (other choices are toast or biscuit) pot of bread would be my recommendation. It's unique and a good eats. 

Ultimate Steak & Eggs - 8 oz ribeye steak and two eggs (there is an option for 3 eggs)  with hash brown. My steak was cooked medium rare (as requested). It's on the thin side but was very delicious. 

Crispy Chicken Breast & Waffles - this was my wife's order. But this will be my order next time. OMG. The best chicken & waffles I've ever tasted. Yes, better than Roscoe's C & W. I prefer dark meat, but their crispy chicken breast was incredible. The chicken was indeed very crispy outside, but the breast was so moist and soft inside. Tons of flavor, delicious!!  And the waffle was so so good. Yum yum yum. The best period. A MUST ORDER. 

Service was super friendly and helpful, thanks Lisa! On this day, all the waitresses were dressed in pajamas (yes another cute touch)

Info: they are only open for breakfast & lunch. They close at 3 pm. 

If you're sick of the buffet and want something different and really good, come here. You won't regret it. 

I'm rating this a 5 star plus
I'll definitely be back.

We ate at this location last summer, loved it. We've since only eaten at the Green Valley location, which is amazing. Coming back to this location yesterday, I was disappointed. My French Toast was crunchy on the edges, soggy elsewhere. My scrambled egg whites were not great, my bacon burnt, and my husband's standard scrambled eggs were stiff. We will definitely be patronizing only Green Valley R&S from now on.

On your way back to LA from Vegas, get away from the city and head into this charmer! They truly know how to do breakfast, and even serve you in full pajamas! This restaurant had the most charm with their open kitchen and umbrella lights hanging from the ceiling. Riley was our server, who was so unbelievably kind and attentive to our half full coffees and waters. She was fast too! 

We ordered up a two egg breakfast with bacon and potatoes ($9) and the corned beef hash and eggs ($10.50) PLUS a short stack of pancakes with warm cinnamon maple syrup. I know it sounds beyond basic, but this is the ultimate American breakfast at its best!  The corned beef was hearty, more on the beef side than the potato and the pancakes were light and fluffy. The bacon was just right, a crunch with a chewy middle. 

This cute restaurant really seems to be a favorite around town and we will definitely stop by again after a weekend in sin city.

We went to this new establishment this morning and Maria was our server.  We ordered Chicken n waffles...it was awesome!  We order cup o bread for appetizers and it didn't disappoint.  Fabulous!!! We have tried several breakfast cafe spots in Henderson ( Eggs Works, Baby Stacks and Metro Diner).  We have found our spot " hands down".  The service and food is excellent!  We will be back soon

Living in the Southern Highlands area there are not many choices for breakfast. I happen to stumble across this restaurant on Yelp and the restaurant had 4 stars. My experience was far from 4 stars. We waited 20 minuets to be seated only to be served by a overwhelmed server and to top it off the restaurant was really warm. I ordered the 3 egg breakfast scrambled with American cheese and sour dough bread. My eggs were greasy and it looked like they stuck a craft single on top of my scrambled eggs (it wasn't even melted all the way when it showed up.) My sour dough bread showed up dry and cold and my bacon was cold and greasy. This was my first and last time at this restaurant. My plate was not worth the $14 I spent on it or the stomach ache I got afterwards.
Neighborhood breakfast place. It's big so we didn't have to wait for the table. Service was very friendly.

I'm not a fan of breakfast but this place has me sold on it!!  My very first time giving a breakfast place a 5 stars review! The pots of bread are THE most moist bread I've ever eaten!  The chiliquilies were absolutely delicious with just the right amount of flavor.  My husband has been on the hunt for chicken fried steak for years and he says his hunt is over!  The kids enjoyed the steak and eggs and the 123.  The service is phenomenal and I love what they are wearing!  As of today we will become regulars here!

Great place a little off the beaten path.  All of the servers are in their pajamas, which is kind of unique.  The red velvet pancakes are decadent and very rich.  I had the steak and eggs which was a nice piece of meat cooked properly.  I'd return!  Excellent coffee as well!

A few peers and I went here to get lunch in between a college test prep course. We had an hour, so ordered immediately when we got there. The menu looked good, but we ended up not even getting our food. We waited for 50 MINUTES, and finally had to leave so we weren't late to our class. The couple next to us waited 45 minutes for their food, and their order was wrong. We were extremely disappointed, especially in the service. The staff did not care to check on the progress of our order, when we asked continually. Will never go to this location again. Very disappointing.

This was a very surprising l good breakfast spot.  The Crunchy Cinmamon French Toast and the Crispy fried Chicken breast were succulent.  The place is full of good energy.  My wife is still licking her lips.  Will definitely visit again!

Best chilaquiles around!!  Don't get the steak with it though.  Ordered it twice, not cooked well.  Crunch French toast is solid!  

Been here multiple times, will continue to go.

Yummy food!! The staff was great! Portion size was big so come in starving!! I love how the staff wore pajamas everyone looked comfy and all customers seemed happy including me. Our waitress knew the answer to every question we had and her recommendations were spot on.
Breakfast not worth the money expensive I paid 16 dollars for extra gravy shame on you go somewhere else save yourself the heartache

I love finding new breakfast places and so I was really excited to try Rise & Shine. I was surprised to find how cute and well decorated the inside is!! 

However, I noticed immediately that the service was lacking. Everyone here seldom smiled and seemed like they didn't want to be there... Breakfast places are usually notorious for their overly friendly service but not this one. Our server, Christina, was very insincere and seemed impatient when we were indecisive about what we wanted to order. After our food came out, she didn't come back to check on us once!!

The food is edible. I ordered the corn beef hash which I didn't really consider to be real corned beef hash because it was just beef cut into small pieces. It was hard for me to want to finish.. Also, the bread in a pot that we ordered tasted kind of stale and not fresh like I expected. 

I really wanted to like this place but this restaurant as a whole needs improvement
The service sucks here. The girl has no personality and she looks like she came to work in her pjs. The food was awful and it sucked. Definitely would not come back or recommend to anyone.

This used to be good. Even worth the drive.

They raised the price, changed the menu, and took out items that used to be free.

During our numerous prior visits, we would always get the Country Fried Steak and Chicken & Waffles whenever we go. This most recent visit however, we noticed they changed the look of the menu and the price, it was $13 per entree (I believe it used to be around $10), it didn't come with sides anymore. I remember we would always get the side of biscuits to go with the Country Fried Steak and the famous Pot of Bread to go with the Chicken & Waffles. When I asked about it, she said said the portions are so large so you don't need the sides. If we want we could order them as extras.(what the??)

The food quality has gone downhill. We went around 2 pm on a Friday and there were only about 4 tables in there. And our food was over cooked and greasy. 
Very unfortunate. This will not be our brunch place anymore!

I went here last week for the first time. There were a couple of parties ahead of us but we were seated within 10 minutes of arrival.

The restaurant is clean and spacey. The staff is friendly and definitely acknowledges youe presence. Some of the waiters and waitresses wears pajamas to stick with the rise and shine theme. 

The decor of the place is very appealing as well. They used umbrellas as lamp covers hanging from the ceiling. They also have mosaic art along the walls, making this place very comfortable and homey. They also have an open kitchen, where you can actually see them cooking and preparing meals.

I did not get steak and eggs but I did get the a classic egg, sausage, hash brown platter. Everything was well done, the sausage was juicy. The eggs were perfectly over easy, and the hash browns were crispy and moist in the inside. 

They have a pretty intensive menu full of good food with reasonable pricing!
I will definitely come back here again.

Great job Rise & Shine and staff!

For the price, the food was just okay. I could have gone somewhere with more selection and better quality food and spent less money. The service was just okay. Waitstaff was friendly, but not good about checking in. The decor was nice--the umbrellas hanging from the ceiling is a nice touch. The a/c was blasting and ice cold. While a/c is obviously appreciated, it's not fun to eat while I'm shivering. While there was nothing terrible about this restaurant, it's too pricy and too far out of our way for us to consider returning.
Very tasty--we have now made a point of stopping here twice on our way out of Las Vegas. Their bacon, eggs, and waffles are delicious.

Went this morning for the very first time. Items ordered:  the ultimate (3 eggs and 8 oz ribeye), and the eggs Benedict. After learning what the "pot of bread" was, we ordered one of those as well. We also had the French press coffee. Love, love that they use Illy coffee. So good.

I admit to having been nervous about the eggs Benedict, because they use ham instead of Canadian bacon, and the menu also noted it had balsamic vinegar on it. Don't get me wrong, love balsamic, just never had it on eggs Benedict.

Food arrives. Yum!!  Best eggs Benedict I think I've ever eaten. The ham was very flavorful and tender, and the balsamic drizzle added just a little touch of flavor. 

My hubby's steak tasted great and his eggs were cooked perfectly. 

Hash browns were also very good. Nice potato flavor and not overly crispy. 

The pot of bread was marvelous. It's described as a cross between a cinnamon roll and dinner roll. To the previous reviewer who complained that it tasted "yeasty"....um homemade bread is supposed to have a yeasty flavor. 

Decor was nice and loved the servers wearing jammies.  They were all friendly and seemed happy to be there. Only complaint was it felt awfully warm in there, but maybe that was from all the yummy food being prepared. 

Will be back, and definitely recommend!

Came here during our recent trip to LV.  We had to wait say 15 minutes for seating but it was totally worth it.  Portion sizes were huge. If you leave this place hungry something is wrong with you.  My husband had the steak and eggs  and I had just over easy eggs and some biscuits and gravy.  Before our breakfast we had the pot of bread cinnamon yumminess!  All I can say is who ever thought of that pot of bread is some kind of genius.  We watched the diners to the right IOC us order the breakfast burrito and waffles (1 person) and he ate it all!  When we come back to LV ...and we will come back, this place is definitely on our list of places to revisit.  Staff was super friendly and in the PJ's made it so cool.  Some how we managed to eat it all. We were not leaving one bite of that goodness behind.

Have tried to order from UberEats twice and you guys rejected my order for reasons I am unaware of. If you don't deliver, why are you on the website?? 

Lost my business forever.

Sincerely, 
A very hungry, upset patron.

I love Rise & Shine -- delicious food, fast service, and quick turnaround time.

Came here on Easter Sunday so it was packed af, but the service was still attentive and friendly. As for the food, after trying it on that fateful Easter Sunday, we promptly returned the following week. I cannot praise their signature Cup-O-Bread, Chilaquiles, and orange juice enough.

The Cup-O-Bread is a warm, gooey, sweet cinnamon roll. It's perfection served up in a cute lil' cup.

The Chilaquiles is basically a plate of hearty breakfast nachos and a great vegetarian option. The serving size is so huge, it makes me cry that I can never finish it in one go since I know they won't warm up well. It feels criminal to let something so good go to waste.

Lastly, the orange juice is delicious. Even at the steep price of $4.50 per glass, I highly recommend it (and I'm not even a big fan of juice)! 

Overall, great breakfast option. The staff knows how to hustle plus breakfast is gloriously indulgent, unique, and delicious.

This place was so good we came back a second time while on our trip to Vegas. Highly recommend the French Press coffee! Also you have to get a pot of bread, delish! The atmosphere is cute and comfy. Friendly staff.

Super good chicken and waffles and ham eggs Benedict. I always love fresh squeezed OJ. 
I love the ambience, the waiters are in their PJ's. It is a relaxed, fun atmosphere. Their are flowers hanging from the ceiling and cool farm photos on the walls.

I just read that this place closes at 3. Maybe that's why my experience was Meh
Starting with the waffles there was nothing special about them. Dry and basic. I'm not a syrup junkie so taste is important when it comes to my waffles. 
The bacon was super greasy and tad bit chewy. No go on the bacon.
The country fried steak was pretty impressive. HUGE!!! 
I usually hate the gravy but to my surprise it was probably the best I've ever had for my CFS! Heck Yeah! Bring it on!
The Country fried steak was crunchy, well cook and seasoned. 
Bonus for me was that the gravy was on the side. I hate globs of gravy all over my steak. So there it is. Go eat, order CFS, get your gravy on the side and leave the bacon alone..
3 stars/ I'll try again earlier in the day...

I had never been to Rise and Shine until I went with my co-worker for lunch.... and I am now a HUGE fan! 

Since this was my first time visiting we decided to share two items so that I could try more than one thing.... so we got the Ham-N-Eggs Benedict and the Peanut Butter & Blueberry French Toast, what a great choice to split- we got the savory and sweet! And they were both great choices!

I am definitely a fan of Rise & Shine! Can't wait to go back!

We stopped by Rise & Shine for our last meal before heading back from our Vegas trip. 

The food is standard breakfast food but it's really good here. I loved the Chicken & Waffle! The chicken was moist and tender and had a really nice crispy texture on the outside. Too bad this was my sister and her husband's dish or else I'd eat the whole thing! The steak & eggs dish was good and came with toast and hash browns. I shared this dish and it was a perfect amount for the two of us. The steak had a nice char but wasn't as juicy as I'd hope. I loved the side of bacon we had. Can't go wrong with bacon!

Service was good but they forgot a couple of items and we had to remind them.
Seriously, I just had to post another review, we went Sunday for breakfast and had another great experience. Let me declare - Bacon wrapped tenderloin rules!!!
Food was awesome with a great presentation. Not to mention service was super friendly and the place is decorated cute!

This place has some amazing food! The service is great...we had Maria this last time and she was fantastic.  Cute PJ's too!! Oh yeah, the staff wears pajamas,  love it   my boyfriend and I played giant Connect Four  (I kicked butt) but that's great to have too.  Only complaint is the parking...not so bad in the early am, but when I went for lunch holy moley good luck finding a spot. I'll be coming back again and again and again
We had to wait a while for our table, yuck...  But the food was top notch.  I had the chicken fried steak and egg breakfast, then skipped lunch!  Yum

Sometimes I think I shouldn't write reviews about the places I like because I'd rather keep it a secret.  But in these hard times I'd like the places I love to stay busy enough to survive.

Finally a breakfast spot for Southern highlanders.  I'm tired of having to drive miles just for a decent breakfast.

I can't say that I am blown away by the decor or the service.  Heck, there was even a 30 minute wait to get in.  If I were rating on that alone I'd give out an average score of three stars.  The saving grace of this place live behind the counter.  Those cooks are doing a great job and I hope they get paid well.

My girlfriends french toast was the best she's had in Vegas so far.  It didn't even need any syrup on it.  It was just delicious.  

My steak looked like your average steak, but let me tell you, it is hard to find a place that can cook a steak just right.  Normally, you go into a busy restaurant and the steak comes out either over cooked or damn near raw; however, this place was jam packed with people and my steak came out cooked just how I ordered it.  It was even seasoned well.  No A1 required.  I haven't had a steak this good at a restaurant in years!

So go check this place out.  It has all the normal favorites made better then most places you'll eat at.

So I used to absolutely love this place but the last two times we have went, to include this past Saturday morning, the wait for the food was over a half hour. I mentioned it to the young lady who I paid the check with but she didn't really have a good reason as to why we had to wait so long. The waitress didn't even say sorry for the wait. The service is going down hill.

the food is good but they haven't dusted the ceiling for what looks like 2 years. seriously, look at the umbrella lights, they are furry with dust along with everything else up there. 
the pajamas idea is neat but the everything below the knee is filthy, the pants drag on the floor and look horrible. I like this place, but they need to clean it up.

Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day. All day everyday. Rise and shine offers something a little different than the typical egg joint. Most meals come with a bread in a cup, basically a delicious tiny warm cinnamon roll ! And they also offer some fresh juice choices like watermelon, which is a refreshing addition along side orange juice. I ordered some child silver dollar pancakes for my daughter and my husband and I ended up eating the majority of them, the flavor was so good. I expected a standard plain pancake but they is a flavoring I can't place in them that made them good by themselves. The portions are also a nice size, enough to eat the whole plate if you very hungry but not too much to feel like a pig (I don't really like left over breakfast food). I'd say the service made me minus a star. It was a little slow and also impersonal; know one looked very happy to be working there, or checked on us during the meal.

Everyone writes reviews of places they love. I've written plenty about how much I love Rise And Shine here in Las Vegas. Well, you learn WAY MORE when things DON'T go perfectly: This Sunday, my wife and I were seated at "that" table. Y'know, the mystical spot where ONE waiter thinks it's the other waiter's, and the other one thinks it's the OTHER waiter's. Consequently, we waited 10 minutes with no greeting at all, and watched later arrivals on both sides get attention while we were ignored. Right around the time we were thinking "Let's get outta here", the hostess (Shannon) came over, and with true concern told us that she had noticed we had been waiting, and wanted to help. She took our order herself, gave us a 2-for-1 coupon, and brought us our food herself... then she checked back TWICE during our meal to make sure everything was OK, checked us out promptly while mentioning that she recognized my wife and I as "regulars", and was extremely pleasant and made friendly conversation, introduced herself and asked our names, and again took great care to apologize for the delay. All I was thinking was "WOW". Look, I GOTTA testify, their food is good enough to treat people like dirt and still succeed - the fact that they care so much makes it a NO-BRAINER. I've  trained Customer Service for a living for over 26 years, I know what I'm looking at -  Thank you, Shannon, thank you, Rise And Shine!

From the flowers hanging from the ceiling, to the wait staff in pjs, to the cutest little pot of bread, everything here is perfect! Haven't had a bad thing on the menu yet! Once you walk in the smell alone will make you want to order everything on the menu! Great breakfast place!

as a former restaurant owner in phx. i dine out often and like to try new places. the first time i tried this restaurant i ordered the chiliquiles. upon arrival it appeared to be just a plate of slop. the flavor wasnt much better then the appearance. yesterday my friend talked me into going again. looking at the menu it showed a bagel sandwich which looked good. the waitress informed me it was just a picture and i couldnt have it. for goodness sakes it was a bagel with egg bacon and cheese...i ended up with hard eggs greasy hash browns the best part of the meal was the orange slice. wont be going back

Service is great! Our server was really cheerful and was attentive to our refills of water. My husband had the steak & Chilaquiles with eggs on top & it was on point. I had to eat some of he's Chilaquiles., I had steak & eggs & hash browns, steak was very flavorful and juicy.. Decor is inviting and the ceiling flower umbrellas was adorable!!

After a rather lackluster first visit to the other Rise & Shine location on Flamingo, it's with disappointment that I note that the original location also failed to rise to the occasion of a great breakfast.

All puns aside, I do really want to like this place. Service is spot on and incredibly friendly, but the food leaves much to be desired for me I'm afraid. I found the fried chicken flavorless and dry, the waffle was a soggy mess and the chilaquiles were as well. The only thing from my meal that I halfway enjoyed were the red velvet chocolate chip pancakes. They were good when paired with the flavorless and over-battered chicken to help make it more palatable. 

Aside from the pancakes, the service was the only other saving grace about this place. I don't see myself making any extra effort to come back when there are much breakfast spots near me that have cheaper prices and better food.

Yelp has not disappointed this Vegas Trip weekend. Heading home from the strip we came upon this place about a mile off the freeway. Usually, I detour when it points me longer than a mile or so, but learning from last time I'm glad we stayed and headed for this place. Had I not I would have ended up at a run down shack in Barstow. 

The place looked lively as we came in. After all how many places do you know where you can come to work in your pj's. We all loved this! Made us get even more into the Christmas spirit. We were seated promptly. Not that I'm a coffee connoisseur or anything, but they serve Lavazza! Smooth good ol Italian coffee. Last place I had Lavazza was in San Francisco. 

Getting into the menu they had a good variety. I had the steak omelette, and the rest had the chicken and waffles and 3 egg omelette. Overall our breakfast arrived timely, was cooked to order, and I can say their hash browns are outstanding. Only complaint was the chicken had a little too much pepper which ended up brushing off on the waffle. Other than that everything else was good. 

In the end it was a great breakfast spot on our way back to CA. I would highly recommend.
Great place friendly cozy :) staff is awesome service is awesome it's close to our house an over easy choice then McDonalds

When we're in Las Vegas, Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place is my favorite spot to have breakfast!!  It is located quite a distance from the Strip, but it is so worth the drive!!  The staff is wonderful, efficient, helpful, and friendly with everyone dressed in their pajamas.  The interior looks lovely, and what really stands out is all the colorful umbrellas hanging from the ceiling.

The food that I have tried here has been absolutely positively delicious!!  By no means, am I an expert on all their many menu options here.  There are only two meals that I have ever tried here, and I cannot get myself to try some other items.

Crispy Fried Chicken Breast Atop a Waffle is amazing!  The Belgian waffle with the warm cinnamon maple syrup is really good.  The chicken breast that sits on top of that waffle is even better cause it is so tender, moist, and full of flavor!!  Wow!!

Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes are the BOMB!!!  If you are a sweet tooth like myself, then order this decadent treat!!  It will be like a party in your mouth!!  The combination of the white and milk chocolate chips with the warm cream cheese syrup on top of those fluffy Red Velvet pancakes is like a very very sweet taste of heaven!!!  I can never finish this meal in one sitting because it is so overwhelmingly rich and SWEET!!  Fortunately, the leftovers are almost as good the next day!!  Seriously, get ready for an awesome sugar overload!!

Maybe one day, I will venture to try something else on their menu.  I hear their Steak & eggs are pretty darn incredible as well.  For now, I look forward to my next trip to Sin City so I can get my fill of Rise & Shine's yummy goodness!!

This place has gotten so much better from the first time I came here! They even have a little fresh juice and espresso machine area now! Usually nothing can compare to Babystacks but this place is giving them a run for their money! Red velvet pancakes we're so perfect, almost cake-ish and crispy ends yum!!!!

Holy cow, the chicken fried steak & eggs were huge and amazing, the pot of bread was delicious but a little soggy on the bottom, I should have went with the toast to sop up my yolk or maybe both would have been a good idea.  I needed a good steak and egg place to frequent and now I have found it. I will be back!

We have eaten here since it opened, amazing food and a super whimsical atmosphere gave it a unique bed and breakfast feel/ the other day I came in and it was an hour from closing, hardly any people in there. The service was terrible, the cashier had an attitude,  and the music was deafening and annoying. It felt like the parents had gone out to dinner and the kids had gone rogue. I'm leaving this review in hopes that the owners or management will see it and bring us the great place we were used to.  Keep an eye on these employees, they aren't doing you any favors. Food still great but the ambiance is off. I'll keep trying in hopes that you get back to the 5 star place we loved going to.

Used to love this place, then they changed from their amazing Tillys coffee to something very bitter...yuck love coffee but can't drink that! Second they change from delicious thick bacon to something that taste microwaved...disappointing Time to try somewhere new

A pretty good breakfast spot. But be warned, this is the ONLY location worth going to. Their Flamingo location really turned me off of this place because my first and only experience was literally the WORST breakfast service in Vegas. 

However, the Southern Highlands location is great! The service is fast and the staff is really kind. The food is really good, too. I'm not a lover of sweets but their cinnamon French toast is to die for. Their eggs Benedict and omelettes also hit the spot in the morning.
